text: I just love sushi so I'm biased when it comes to sushi restaurants, however, Oyshi Sushi is my new fave in town! Ambiance is beautiful - they have a big Japanese mural in their private room ~ so lovely to look at.  Service is excellent ~ food is delicious ~ price is reasonable.  Highly recommended!!
Many better sushi places downtown. Oyshi service is to be desired, food is decent but always gives me the trots afterward. I only go there if everyone else is, too many better places around.

Stumbled on this little family run sushi joint on the coldest night of the year before a leaf game. The green tea and Miso soup was some the best I've ever had. The small private booths were wonderful and cosy.  The sushi & maki was fresh and yummy. Service was friendly warm and relaxed/comfortable yet traditional.  Wouldn't hesitate to return....the leafs stunk out the rink the sushi was the highlight of the night

Starting to become fond of this place. Always treated with great service, and great food! Spicy Tuna Roll is one you cant miss out on! And there pot stickers have a unique taste, and this really mind blowing with the sauce!

It was alright. Still think YAMA sushi is the best. Too many rules here. Didn't like how there's a limit on baked mussels and desserts!!!! And how you can't order half rolls. There ahi poke salad sucked and barely had any fish in it. Most likely won't be back.
The service was very good, and fast. But I did have a problem with the menu being dirty the pages where sticky and  had some dried peaces of food and so was the table.

Loved the vibe and energy of the restaurant. Was really busy when I went but we didn't wait long for our food and drinks. Food was coming out fast and steady. The Cajun albacore is a must have. The menu is very diverse, there is something for everyone. I will go back for sure!

We came here at the recommendation of a friend who lives in Vegas after mentioning wanting to go to Nobu for dinner. (I'm from NY and like the Nobu location there). The decor is adequate, but the music was really odd for a restaurant: one of the first songs we heard was about eating pussy and there were many songs with the n word. I expect that while I'm at the club, but while I'm eating? Completely tasteless!   The service was lacking but not the worst I've seen. At one point the waitress came over to check the amount of wine left in the bottle, then set it down and walked away even though two of our glasses were empty! The food came out very slowly, but that's typical of an all-you-can-eat place, where they want you to fill up in between courses and order less.   The food itself was extremely disappointing. Most of the rolls had ingredients that are never in real sushi: cream cheese, cheddar cheese, and other odd things. They were presented attractively but were drenched in cream sauces and the ones that were fried were disgustingly greasy. The fish was fresh enough but not even close to the quality I'm used to.   I guess if you've never had really high quality sushi you might enjoy this place (judging from other reviewers) but if you appreciate only the best sushi, you'll probably want to skip Oyshi. I definitely won't go back!

"Oyshi" is Japanese for "delicious" and indeed, this place is delicious. I used to work nearby and this place would be my default dinner spot when I was too tired to really "go out" on the town. The food is fresh and the prices are reasonable. Service is excellent.   I've never had anything there that I did not enjoy. The atmosphere is nice for a date. They also have a great all-you-can-eat for a set price which includes everything on the menu except for the sashimi.   Maybe I'm sentimental, but now that I don't live in the area anymore, I sometimes find myself craving the sushi here.   If you're looking for food off the strip, away from the traffic and the tourists, this place is definitely worth checking out. It's not too far from the Strip.

Rice was undercooked. Seriously, they handle rice for a living and yet no one knew?  And the salmon was old. Disappointing. I would've went to 808 Sushi but they don't open for lunch on Sundays......next time I'll stick to 808 Sushi.

We went back! Valentine's dinner at Oyshi sounded so good, so we went. When we got there, we ran into a bunch of people we knew. Lots of our friends are regulars there.  Our server Steven (maybe spelled Stephen) was very nice and paid special attention to us and started up real conversations about UNLV and stuff.  There was only 2 of us and we had to re-order/ask about a couple of things we ordered (same as when we were there with the big group), but it wasn't a big deal because since there was only 2 of us, we got full way faster and were glad to use the digestion breaks between eating.  The creme brulee was divine as always. It's just SO SAD how they only give you 1 dessert when you order AYCE (All You Can Eat) sushi. I want AYCE creme brulee!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  And still came home smelling like food. LOL.   #foodcrew
Probably won't be coming here again. Fish and rolls just weren't that fresh or flavorful. And they don't offer 1/2 rolls.
Place was delicious! Definitely recommend it to anyone. There was a variety of selections and the Rib eye steak was amazing.

the hostess is rude and the service over all is extremely poor. It took over 1 1/2 to eat lunch. They did not have the lunch specials available nor did they have mochi ice cream. The customers next to us order gyozas and so did I. They sat down after us but still received their food before us. Also, we order their ice cream parfait and it took at least 15+ minutes to receive it. I would not recommend eating here!
Really cool vibe, our server Golden was amazing brought everything out in a timely manner. I'd definitely recommend this place for group outings!

Really bad service. We ate AYCE here, had to wait almost 10 min between orders. We had to watch verities of different sushi and rolls going to other tables while we sucked on our chop stick. Even after they apologized same thing happened. We got tired of it and asked for the check, what a surprise they forgot to bring us the check also. We ended going up to them with the money and paid for it at the register. Manager, who was doing absolutely nothing didn't even bothered to offer an apology.  Tip for people that wants to go to this restaurant, make sure you are already full.

The ambiance was very nice, but it was a little pricier than i was looking to pay especially for the all u can eat sushi. Its not a bad place to eat; it lends itself to groups well. But i will say, i've only been once and never needed to go back.

We tried Oyshi on a recommendation from a Renoite transplant that lives in Vegas now, we were expecting decent ayce sushi, much like the ones you can get in Reno....not even close.    Sushi- The sushi is just, ok.  The fish wasn't super fresh, some of the cuts of fish were thin and cut poorly, falling apart.  Most of the rolls had the same notes of lots of imitation crab meat mixture, so they all tasted the same.    Appetizers- I'm a fanatic for raw oysters, they had small Pacific oysters that were a bit on the warm side and very bland tasting, flavorless even with the siracha sauce they dotted on it.  It tasted as though it was about to go bad and they rinsed it with tap water, even the shell the oyster was served in lacked oyster liquor, which isn't a good sign.  Needless to say, I was only able to eat 1 of 4 that I ordered and it was a struggle to keep it down.  I've eaten raw oysters from a jar and the raw oysters here came pretty close to that.  I told the wait staff that the oysters were a bit off and she replied, "that's odd they're usually not like that".  The manager was attentive and came to our table to see if we wanted more oysters, stating that there wasn't enough sauce on our previous order as to why they tasted that way. If the oysters are fresh, why would you need to drown it in "sauce"?  The sweet shrimp with side of fried heads, amaebi, were not so sweet, which means they weren't so fresh.  The shrimp heads weren't prepared properly, (not fried well) and so it was tough to bite through it.  After having the oyster and amaebi, we passed on the uni, because if you can't get the other 2 right, there's no way we were going to try the uni as it needs to be super fresh.  They were pretty busy for a Tuesday night, so maybe I just have high expectations for sushi, or maybe we just got the Sushi chef in training, but if your like me and your jonesing for some great sushi, this place isn't for you.

Generally speaking, I'm not one that craves sushi. However, I DO find myself craving sushi from Oyshi.  The taste and presentation of everything I've ever ordered here is amazing. You've definitely gotta try the Japanese Lasagna Roll!    Great atmosphere. Great food. Great price.
Yummy! Get the Love Seduction (lobster roll)...wait was really long but food was good however the crunch roll was just alright

Always great service and great food. There's a wide variety of food to choose from. The love affair is one of my all time favorite rolls. The atmosphere is always friendly and clean. One of my favorite places to have sushi in Vegas! Highly recommend!

LISTEN HERE DAVID!!! I frequently frequent your fine establishment and find it to be fantastic. Among the plethora of nearby sushi restaurants, my friends and I consistently choose yours because you have the best menu, cooked by the best chefs, and served by the best service staff in town. I can't be adamant enough about this. Your restaurant is the closest thing to a perfect sushi restaurant for the price that I have ever been to. If I had one gripe however, it is with the lack of assortment provided for the mochi. Only strawberry?! In 2015? What is this North Korea? Where are the choices?? A meal as good as the ones you provide deserve a happy ending, David. You of all people should know that. Keep up the phenomenal work and PLEASE consider offering more variety in your mochi!!!

My server for tonight was Odi! She was incredibly attentive & caring with our needs. When we sat down she did an outstanding job at explaining the menu to us and checked on us consistently. If you happen to stop by Oyshi and your expecting quality service I would recommend Odi, plus she has the most contagious smile ever :)  Oyshi truly is the best deal in town for your money with unlimited kitchen/sushi included in the All You Can Eat menu. Definitely a must on my list

AYCE Sushi! Service was great.  Sushi was good for AYCE standards.  My picks if you're doing AYCE:  Seaweed Salad - pretty standard, kind of small Tempura - SO GOOD!  Agedashi Tofu - good flavor, but wasn't the best that I've had. MOCHI ICE CREAM - you only get to choose one dessert, definitely choose this!! Sunrise Roll - nice spicy flavor  Wait staff was really good at handling our large party of 16.  Kept track of most of the orders and checked on us often.

I dined here for the first time last week.  I was in town visiting some friends and family and went to this place with a large group.  i read the reviews here and thought this would be a great place to try. Especially with the $21 all-you-can-eat sushi for lunch.  The servers were prompt with taking our orders.  Our table was the second to place orders so I thought we would get great service...NOT!  I ordered a cucumber salad for an appetizer and three sushi rolls (rattlesnake roll, crunchy scallop and yellowtail trio).  Well,  it took OVER 30 minutes for my cucumber salad to arrive.  And I had to say something TWICE to the server before it came out.  By the time I got my appetizer just about everyone else in our group had already received and eaten their sushi rolls.  Why did my little cucumber salad take so long to arrive? Did they have to plant the seed and grow the cucumber?  My brother-in-law sitting next to me even got his sushi roll before I got my appetizer.  That was strike one!  Now for strike two - I had to remind the server that I hadn't received my sushi rolls.  This was after everyone else was pretty much finished their rolls.  So even after I reminded him it still took another 25 minutes to get my rolls to me (Yes I was timing everything).  Strike three - I get my sushi rolls. Luckily I wasn't dying of starvation because some others in our group were able to share their rolls so I was able to eat a few pieces while waiting for mine. One thing I noticed was that most of these specialty rolls had this stupid sweet chef's sauce drizzled all over. I don't mind this sauce as its great on dragon rolls.  But this caused everything to taste the EXACT same.  And this sauce was TOO SWEET.  It really killed the individual flavors of the fresh ingredients inside each roll.  My brother couldn't stomach it.  And when I finally got my rolls two of the rolls (crunchy scallop and rattlesnake) were DRENCHED with the sweet sauce.  And the yellowtail trio roll was nasty. It tasted sour like they marinated the fish in vinegar or something!  If you like sweet sushi rolls then this is the place for you.  However I will never set foot in this place again!
Really good food. AYCE is available. Only thing about this place is it's almost always packed and can get quite loud inside.

How can you beat AYCE sushi for $27?  Had dinner here last night. Sat at the bar and had great service. enjoyed chatting with the chefs and watching the sushi be made.  Service is great, prices are reasonable.  Couldn't ask for more.

Visited on 12/19/09,  very awesome all you can eat for $26.  We had a great time.  We visited there on the recommendation from others on Yelp.  Oyshi is now on our  "to do" list every time we're in Vegas.  Thanks Yelp!

Excellent quality sushi.  I had the garlic yellowtail, tuna and cajun Albacore.  Very very good.  Fast, accurate and attentive staff.  Recommend anyone on this side of town to come and enjoy the atmosphere and top quality sushi.  Will return for sure.

My first sushi experience was at the rainbow location in 2010. Oyshi is my favorite place and we were really excited when we saw that the Sahara location was opening nearby our home. Love your restaurant.
Sucks. Not fresh.!!.not Japanese style at all. super Slow !! Waitress are like sleeping.. chefs are playing....
Excellent food and a great value. The sushi was fresh tasting and had wonderful flavor. The all you can eat lunch was filling. About 90% of the menu is open for orders on the all you can eat lunch.

Great Sushi SUPER FRESH and excellent service. Stefan really kicked ass. He had great recommendations and it was cool of him asking for feedback of the different rolls and plates that were served.  If we lived here this would be our go to spot.

First time here, and we really enjoyed our experience. The food was delicious, and the service was great. Our server was very helpful, explained the AYCE options, and made several tasty suggestions. We look forward to our next visit!

For a sushi restaurant in the middle of the desert, they've got some pretty damn fresh fish and a huge all-you-can-eat (AYCE) menu.  Though there are appetizers and salads, I always go for the nigiri and the rolls to fill that insatiable need for fish and rice. Some of the maki come in hand rolls, while others are baked, deep-fried, full of veggies, spicy, or wrapped in soy paper. You definitely should be able to find at least one item you'll enjoy or you're just flat out doing it wrong.  Once the chopsticks are down and I'm ready to do the Slump of Defeat, the dessert conveniently reminds you that you can get only one of the green tea tiramisu, mochi ice cream, or some of the other selections. Except the ice cream scoops. You can get as many scoops as your dessert stomach can handle!  Service was pretty good, but could be a bit erratic.  They always came to refill our drinks, to check up on us, or to take additional orders.  It saddens me that the journey to Oyshi is so far, but I'm willing to travel the distance for the value and quality that they offer.

I cannot say enough about Oyshi, the sushi is excellent and the selection is never ending. I highly recommend that anyone who finds themselves in Las Vegas to make the time and enjoy some of the best sushi around.

Thought we would finally try out Oyshi since we were in the area and had heard such great reviews. Upon entering the place was fairly quiet with the exception of a screaming child, no big deal, and the normal chatter of customers. We came in around 1 on a Saturday and it wasn't very busy and we were seated right away. We put in an order for the AYCE almost immediately and began waiting. It was nearly 25 minutes before we received our first things, we were told the kitchen was backed up, yet when we got our food the calamari was cold, flavorless, and rubbery. My baked roll was cold. When I asked the server if it was supposed to be at least warm, I was given the run around and he finally said it had been sitting while waiting for the other things to finish and that he could get me a new one but it'd be another 20 minutes! I agree and when 20 minutes came it was just as cold as the first time. The manager didn't seem to care and almost everyone else was getting their food in a timely manner except for us. In total we ordered 5 rolls and 1 appetizer (3 of the rolls and the appetizer being ordered in the first 5 minutes of being there) and that was in the span of an hour and a half. even after all that we were given a half ass sorry from the manager and still paid full price. This place is completely over rated and I will stick with a different sushi restaurant that is more reliable and friendly. Too bad because the place was nicely decorated but that's about as far as it went.

Walked in at 10:20 pm since online it says they close at 11 and was turned away saying that they've already done last call. Poor service. Especially since we get off work late and was hoping for some sushi. Smh.

When it comes to "All You Can Eat Sushi" you have to be very careful. Low volume restaurants are not able to cycle through the fish making their offerings not so fresh.  The good news is Oyshi is always busy allowing them to offer fresh sushi every night of the week.  There are 2 private rooms, a large dining room and extended sushi bar with a lot of seating.  I highly recommend this sushi bar!

The food at Oyishi was amazing.  The fish was really fresh and you can tell that the sushi chefs knew what they were doing.   Everything was presented beautifully and also the taste was on point.  The food came out so quickly!   Our server was exceptionally good at her job.  We had a party of 17 and most of us all ordered all you can eat sushi but she never forgot any of our orders.   10/10, I'd go again.    Oh, and the green tea creme brûlée is AMAZING!

A pretty good AYCE sushi restaurant. Rolls are good and a lot of great options if you have anyone with you that doesn't like sushi. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait to be seated, and some waiting for rolls.  The kids meal is outstanding!!

I'm really unsure if I should write this review or not but I'm a stickler for customer serivce. We went to have dinner last night 1/9 and the place was packed. The entrance way was so busy we have swim the thru the ppl who refused to make rm, walked up to the hostess counter... a waitress was scrambling around and didn't even acknowledge us! She was walked away and continued on with her shift... next the hostess steps in, grabs menus and walks off to the sea off ppl to seat them... all the while no one has said a word to our party. Then when she finally decides to grace us with her conversation she says it's an hour plus wait... no thanks... so my take on the food is I won't be eating it
My family and I are big fans of Oyshi. We come here every time we are at Las Vegas. All you can eat offers lots of options for you to enjoy. I highly recommend here for your lunch or dinner.

I will never come back to this place again.  It takes 25 minutes to get your first plate of sushi and another 20 for the next plate. They take forever on your orders.  I felt like I had to rush and order quick so they can hurry to make it.  It was horrible and this happen like 4 hours ago and I am still mad.  Plus their sushi is not worth the wait.  The only thing I can say I really like is their egg rolls.  I don't recommend this place .

Very attentive servers. Cute little sushi spot. Be aware that they do not offer AYCE but the menu is still affordable/diverse. We had a couple of rolls that were fairly average. The spicy salmon roll did not meet our expectations at all. The sashimi, however, was quite good. Considering that there are not many sushi spots in the immediate area it is worth checking out but it's not overly memorable.

I just love it when AYCE sushi places not only serve sushi but all the different tapas style appetizers! Dinner is priced at $26.95.  Service is usually very good. Last time I went, had to wait 20 mins for a table (it was a little busy) and the waiter did not come around as much as I had hoped for. Our water and teas were never refilled without asking. But the other times I have gone prior, service was fine.  When it comes to sushi at Oyshi, ah, I've had better. Their spicy tuna for me was too mushy. I like spicy tuna when the tuna is cut into chucks then mixed with the spicy mayo. So, I was quite disappointed with that. The salmon nigiri was fresh and quite tasty though. I try to stay away from the rolls because they are huge, will become quite full from one roll.   Whenever I find myself at Oyshi, I tend to order a few nigiris then I ransack the appetizer menu! lol. I love the steak. It comes out sizziling on top cabbage and onions. They also have, shrimp/vegetable tempura, bacon wrapped asparagus, scallop poppers, oysters, agedashi tofu, etc.  Oyshi used to be a favorite of mine for AYCE sushi, but after discovering Island Sushi... I don't know if I will be back to Oyshi.
Went during the week for dinner and didn't have to wait long. I really liked the interior and the staff was very nice, we sat at the sushi bar and had great service.

I've been going to this sushi restaurant for a little over 4years. I remember this place because it was where I had my first date on Valentines Day. My opinions on this restaurant has been consistent within these several years. I love this place. I eat here few times a month because I can't get enough of the food! Some reviewers may complain about the service, with a few exceptions, their service to us has been amazing. The thing I admire most about this restaurant is that the service isn't limited to just the servers, but the owner is running around serving people as well. I've been going here for so long, the owner recognizes us each time!   Food: I am obsessed with their Ian's Special Roll. It has multiple layers of flavor goodness!   Things to Try: Snow Mountain roll, Salmon Lover, Tiger Roll, Surf and Turf (appetizer), Ahi poke, Baked Mussels, Grilled Asparagus and Shrimp, and all the sushi fish you desire. Their Vanilla Parfait for dessert is pretty amazing too.   I usually look forward to the Uni and the Oysters, but the reason why it's 4 stars and not 5 is because there have been times where it is not available. And it really puts a damper on my entire meal. Who doesn't want to get their money's worth!   Overall, great experience! When anyone comes into town, this is the first place I take them, and they all love it as much as I do! It's pretty amazing! I've tried so many sushi restaurants here and out of state, and none compares to the sushi place here in Vegas!

When my friend from Vegas recommended eating at an All-you-can-eat sushi place, first thing I thought of was Todai. NO THANK YOU!  But we went and for $21 (lunch), you can order ANYTHING except drinks. Man, we dined like kings and queens eating everything we could. The only thing was the yellowtail nigiri (usually a favorite of mine) was a pinkish color? huh? Probably wouldn't recommend that.  Rolls are AWESOME! Snow Mountain roll, all the of the baked stuff is good and tuna or salmon nigiri are really good. They don't drench sauce all over it to cover the quality, which I love.  Desserts: creme brulee (pretty good. 4 stars)                    Mochi (exactly like the mochi icecreams you get at the grocery store. 4 stars)                   Green tea icecream (didn't have it but heard it was decent too)  I think I just liked the fact that it was included in the all-u-can-eat package.  Would DEFINITELY recommend!!!!! GO NOW!!!
Lee, peter, and Daniel were the most amazing sushi chefs! I highly recommend thisnplace. My fav was the labster affair roll. All u can eat is made to order!!!!

I ate my first sushi meal in Hartsdale NY in 1995.  Since then, I have never left a grain of rice behind on any sushi plate.  I sat at the sushi bar tonight, and the chef just absolutely stuffed me full.  I lost track of how many pieces I had, but I'm sure it was over 31, and the bill was $31.  I tipped the waitress well and threw in an extra $5 to the chef tip jar as an apology for leaving sushi on my plate.  It was all worth every bit of it, including the over-stuffed feeling I'm having now.    There were several pieces where the chef's creativity really came through.  I'd write more, but it hurts to sit down.  I will be back there just as soon as I can.    Thank you, thank you, thank you!    S.

All you can eat menu is awesome! The fish is always fresh, and the environment is relaxing. Usually a wait after 6 pm, but the staff is very friendly. The wait time on fish can be quite a while at times but when it's busy I understand . My favorite is the Japanese lasagna roll! Will be returning!
At Oyshi right now and been waiting for my miso soup for easily 20 minutes. Terrible service already. Let's wait for the food and see how it taste. First time at Oyshi. Maybe last?

First time visiting this place. Was craving sushi and this was one of the first recomendations that came up when searching online and thought I should give it a try. Atmosphere is nice, music could be better. Staff are very nice, our server Marcos was very attentive towards our needs. Definitely coming back soon.

very slow only one sushi guy, i try to go per second time nobody seat me, nobody said hi,nobody ask me,me i help you,wold you like water,very poor service and unprofetional,we left to another sushi place after be seated for 10 minuts,look the sushi bar,dont look to clean,the sushi is ok,but if u like clean good profetional service DONT GO THERE worst service in town

I love this place! Must do AYCE you won't regret.  Price is good, selection is amazing. Always busy. Call ahead for a table reservation is a plus. Friendly staff all around. Only downfall is it takes a while to get the sushi on the table after you place the order. We like to make a big first order.

Gave this place a shot because my friends are always raving about it. The hostess was friendly. We sat at the only two open seats at the bar. No greeting or anything so we left after about 8 minutes of awkward waiting. To their defense it was extremely busy. Maybe I'll give it another try when it's not so slammed..

While the place is nice and close to home, I was not a huge fan of the sushi. I always start with spicy tuna before pointing to a handful of other rolls on the menu. While I of course ate the spicy tuna I thought I may have ordered "sweet tuna". Because of this I only ordered one more roll (shrimp tempura) and that didn't have a wow factor either. Reasonably priced, nice location in southwest area, but nothing to rave about.
Very nice place good sushi it was teisty and we wiil beck hear!!!! We came to people and it's was wonderful and very good sushi and misses you and other mama thank you very much for a good server

A friend of mine introduced me to this place last year. His selling point was that "real Japanese people" make the food. The funny thing is that the staff and owners are 90% Korean.  Does it matter either way? Masa or Jiro may not care much for it, but by AYCE standards, it's the best sushi in town (best a la carte goes to Naked Fish.) Service is okay but gets a little hectic when the restaurant is at full capacity. No big deal. As an added and bizarre surprise, the pint-sized creme brulee is the greatest I've ever had. If you can resist cramming your stomach with one more roll, be sure to end the meal with it.

This use to be my favorite sushi place and would have earned 5 stars. However, the last two times I've gone with my daughter I've been disappointed.  Not only did it take FOREVER to get our orders but the food was not the quality I've grown accustom to at Oyshi.  Some of the sushi tasted like it had previously been frozen -- not fresh at all.  I'm hoping it's just a blip in time as they opened a second location -- otherwise I'll have to find another place to call my "favorite sushi place".

I came at lunch. There weren't much people-- probably 3 tables besides us. Their food was coming in fast, while my sister and I waited about 30 minutes until our food started coming... Really slowly. I'm guessing it's because we look like college students, and they typically don't tip well. When the orders started to slowly come, they kept mixing our food with the table next to ours and vice versa the entire time. It took us an hour to finally get our 5 orders of salmon, eel, and yellow tail nigiri... Well, never coming back here for the super bad service we received.

I usually come here on Fridays and Saturdays and the service is great, the foods great, and waiting time may be long but hostess is pretty nice & updates when the wait time has gotten shorter. I would recommend eating here.

Great food and service. Ordered the bento combination to try a bit of everything. The sashimi and the tempura were excellent! Chicken teriyaki was only ok, but it's probably a matter of taste.  We were there with two children, and the atmosphere is great for a family.

Love affair baked roll my favorite as well as Asian skirt sizzling plate. All you can eat is $26 and it is all delish. Don't forget you can order appetizers and dessert with all you can eat! Oh and large cold saki is enormous! Good for a few people

This is one of my husbands favorite spots! We live nearby and go here every time he needs his sushi fix. I don't eat sushi but I absolutely love their house salad OMG the dressing is bomb! It started out Ricky when we first went we always had a waiter that I felt could be a tad rude then we started having Pink whom is real nice but then we met Od!! Od is AMAZING!! Best server we have to ever had--anywhere! She is such a sweet girl and ALWAYS remembers us! She knows us by name and has my difficult order memorized! She even knows the different rolls my husband likes which is crazy bc there are so many! We will be moving to the other side of town soon and the worst part about it is we will be far away from this location. My husband said we will drive way over here just to see Od!!! We love you Od!! Thank you for your awesome service and friendly conversation!! It feels like we are visiting a friend sometimes we want her to pull up a chair and eat with us lol. See you soon!!!

Had an early Father's Day dinner here tonight! We had Kenny aka Golden as a server and he was excellent!!! Really helped us out with the menu, and was funny too!! The food was great and so was the interior of the restaurant! It's decorated so beautifully!! Also the fact that pretty much the whole menu is AYCE, including appetizers is just incredible! Steak and sushi? Count me in

I found Oyshi by accident about 3 years ago an it's been my favorite Sushi spot since then. It's definitely the best sushi in Vegas - I always bring my friends so we can try a new roll or just really have a good time.  I would give them 5, 6, 10 stars a couple years ago but the last time I was there I felt the quality of their food went down! The rolls didn't look fresh, the size of the salmon cuts or anything really are half now! I got very disappointed when I left the place, It use to be my favorite must go place in Vegas.  The one good thing about them is I already complained about the service once and they took very good care of me, so I'm assuming if they figure it out the service went down considerably they will definitely take care and made it tool as good as before.

The first time I went here with a couple of friends was on New Year's Eve. The AYCE was WONDERFUL! OOOooo so good! My favorite had to be the Volcano Roll! The fish was super fresh and SO YUMMY! The service was also nice as we got to keep ordering in advance and the waitress was very helpful and courteous. HANDS DOWN A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE FOR ALL!

Thank you sweet tiny six pound infant baby Jesus! I have been on the hunt for a great sushi spot ever since a horrible experience at my previous spot. Oyshi did not disappoint today. the AYCE menu is extensive. The only bad thing I have to say about Oyshi is the music selection, you will need glow sticks to enjoy it.

A lil bit pricey but it's my favorite sushi place.  I like most of the sushi rolls but my favorites are J&B and Japanese lasagna and dynamite roll. They're like heaven in your mouth.  I also like their appetizers such as baked mussels, ahi poke, agedashi tofu, shrimp yakitori.   Nice EDM music too.
Food good, good price, good portion, good service(our server Kim) man why don't we have a restaurant like this back in the bay.
Very nice sushi place, enjoyed it with my wife very much. A fun atmosphere. Will return soon.
Great menu, and the food is fresh!  We live around the corner from this place so we hit it about once a month.  The prices are reasonable and we always end up eating too much.  HIghly recommend!

First time visit  Made a reservation  Did not wait at all  Food  Sushi :  3 Star Too much Rice Roll: Ok  Appetiser : 3 Star  ( Surf And Turf, Fresh Oyster ) Table was sticky  Staff : ok  Overrall 3 star
I am in love with this place! The green tea tiramisu is made in house and it is the best way to end a meal!
I love it when Kenny is our server !! He is honestly the best .. Food is great but he makes the experience way better .. Kevin does the best job managing ... And Chayia does the best rolls

This was my go to place for AYCE and i dont care for ayce sushi places to be honest, but this one was really good. Ive been here easily over 10x and each time its gotten a little worse i hate to say....the service mainly. There was a few waitresses that were top notch but havent seen them last couple times in, hope they are still there. The food is good place is clean, the management is retarded though. The wait time ironically can be slower when they are not busy than when they are busy (maybe they feel the urgency when they are packed). Either way ill go back until its unbearable that i can no longer stand it there....i mean all you can eat little sliced up rib eye, i usually put down about 3-4lbs of that alone!

Lets start off that oyshi sushi is one of those places in Vegas that has really good sushi and appetizers. There is alot of things to choose from and all of there sushi taste hella bomb.com lol. Due to the fact it taste pretty fresh and its tasty. And I love the fact this place is All you can eat for the price. The only downside is the deserts isn't all you can eat. But it's all good after eating a gripload of sushi, all you need is a order of one of there deserts, which they are also bomb diggity lol. I also like the fact that this place is very nice and clean  Now here's is why I did not give this place all 5 stars.  The reason is there service. It's a hit or miss with this place. Unfortunately there is like one or two servers who are freaking awesome as hell with there customer service and always brings food out really quick. I can't really say for the other staff members. It seems most of them got a attitude problem or something when you order and are hella slow. It which is kinda sad. Hope they start changing soon cause its kinda hard to go back when you have a couple of bad experiences with a place.
A friend recommended this sushi place, the server was really nice and the sushi was quite delicious.

Came here today and sat at the bar (because you can order half rolls). Exceptional service from the staff behind the bar, funny, quick witted and fun to be around. Food quality was great as usual. Ribeye steak sizzle plate and tiger rolls and you never go wrong.

I've been to Oyshi on several occasions. The restaurant has been really hit or miss. The first time I went with my fiance and we sat near the window, close to the sushi bar. The quality was good and the service was prompt and friendly.  The second time we went we were put in the far corner, probably as far away from the sushi bar as you can get. The quality was still there but the service was terrible. We felt forgotten being so far away and it took a long time to get our first order. When doing AYCE we usually do a first round then inevitably get a second round. With the amount of time it took for the first, we didn't even want to wait for a second round. We left full from the tasty sushi, but disappointed with the service.   This last time we went was for the AYCE lunch. We sat close to the sushi bar, but it didn't matter. We ordered Miso and Edamame to start. The miso was brought very quickly, but we waited easily 30 minutes for our edamame. The waitress came back during our waiting to take our order for sushi. We placed our order and also asked about or edamame. She clearly forgot judging by her reaction.  The sushi came before our edamame and the quality was poor. The albacore was mangled on the rice and didn't taste fresh. Same with the Salmon.   The worst part about the last experience is that during our time waiting for edamame and sushi, we saw our waitress through the curtain in the kitchen eating food. Restaurant no-no 101.   I don't plan on returning. It's disappointing because I like the atmosphere, their selection on their menu (AYCE even includes oysters on the half-shell and Uni!)  On to better places.

CULTURE. FOOD. ATMOSPHERE.   The sushi fad has been rising in Vegas and Oyshi has taken it even further. When I go into a sushi restaurant I look at 3 things:  1. How the restaurant looks. 2. Selection of sushi 3. How the restaurant makes me feel.  Right off the bat, you're welcomed with high end decor that depicts Japanese culture. Oyshi is nothing short of class. I'm a very limited sushi order. Ironically, I'm allergic to fish (I know, right?). However, I am able to eat shell fish, and that is good enough for me to fall in love with this new craze. They have fresh selections and a whole section of shell fish sushi.   And what I love the most about Oyshi sushi, is that it's not some hole in the wall, dirty little restaurant. It's classy, sophisticated, and it's a spot you can bring your valued company. I actually refuse to bring dates here because I don't want them to tarnish this place for me. Highly recommended. They'll remember your name because they remember mine. But it doesn't help that I'm there every week.

Had a mini reunion of friends and chose Oishi Sushi. Gave it 4 stars because of customer service!  Our little waitress was amazing & all the gals & 1 male server there, for that matter!   Food was pretty good...but customer service brought it to 4 stars & I never rate 5 stars!

I am a Las Vegas native and a big fan of sushi.  I've seen so many sushi places open and close. Oyshi...is one I would never want to see close its doors.  This is, for the affordable price it offers, the best sushi in town. The salmon sushi is just about the closest thing to edible heaven.  The venue is open and airy. The music is upbeat (don't expect some slow, romantic songs). The staff is friendly and everyone pitches in. I've seen managers roll up their sleeves and help out the servers when it gets busy ---very impressed by that.
Love this place, sushi is always so fresh! And very good, if you don't want to wait make a reservation.  The service is excellent!

One of the best sushi we ever had!! We live in Germany and ate here once. We even want to make a reason to go back to Las Vegas just to eat at Oyshi Sushi. The staffs are friendly, sushi was prepared fresh. I envy all of you who live in Las Vegas so you can come and eat here more often.

Love sushi and what a great AYCE.... Best thing on the menu is the green tea tiramisu.... My only complaint is that you can only pick one dessert!!! Please read this and change that policy.... Desert is cheaper to make then sushi..... Great presentation and flavor.... Good service.... Great atmosphere.... I do miss the sushi place that was there before,,, they had a roll I have never seen.... It was on flames literally!!!

This place is okay. We got pretty terrible service so we will not be back. I refused to let my boyfriend leave her a good tip. She forgot out dessert, then she took forever to bring and pick up our check. Even the chef and other waiter kept apologizing for her. They do not have a good appetizer selection either. Oh and too much rice on the rolls!
Good food overall. But nothing special. But it is ayce so cant be too picky. Surf & Turf is great.

I love sushi.. and this place is just okay. located very close to me so I end up going here a lot and it's always iffy. Their one manager who has been working the last couple times I've gone is amazing. He's very attentive and talks to the tables and makes sure everyone has what they need. If he is not there.. it's not the same. The service is below average. If they are the slightest bit busy.. you have to wait sometimes 20 minutes before the server will even remember she has you at her table to put another order in. This can sometimes be good because if it's AYCE, you're completely hungry after waiting 20 mins between each roll... we also paid with cash once.. 12 over.. and never got our change. and the service was terrible that time. so really? you're just gonna assume the rest is your tip? mmm no. and then she never returned to the table even though we sat there and waited for quite awhile. oh well.. the food itself though is usually amazing. I've never really ordered anything that I didn't like. Except the mochi for dessert. everywhere else I go they cut it into quarters for you and sometimes even decorate it with chocolate sauce (sushi wa on eastern.. recommend there waaay over this place) .. but not this place.. you just gotta bite right into it and man does that hurt my sensitive teeth. But again, the food is good, and if you go on a less busy night the food comes out somewhat fast.   Also, it can get pretty cramped. Last time I was there they sat a larger table next to us and put a chair on the end. I literally could have rested my head on the guys shoulder who say there. Really? I understand about wanting to accommodate every guest that comes in.. but what about the comfort ability of the other guests already there? mmmm not my favorite place yet I keep returning so it'll get 3 stars.
Everything was great, especially the service.   Our waiter was on top of it!  Will most definitely come back.
Best Sushi in Toronto. Well priced too. It's hard to find because it's tucked under a condo building and it caters mostly to the locals. But well worth it.

Just had a lunch with a friend...terrific sushi, terrific service at a great price. Everything was fresh and served promptly...a real treat to find this quality of sushi in the Southwest Valley...! Highly recommended!

This is our favorite all you can eat sushi restaurant! Sushi is always fresh and we always leave like we've over ate. :) There is however, always a wait and a line but it's because the food is great! Don't mind waiting if the food is worth it! My boyfriend does not  eat sushi but he always has something to order. He orders the mussels, the dynamite, vegas roll, sizzling skirt and asian steak. He also loves the music they play.
I'm a sushi lover and it's hard to find good perfect really sushi but this sushi place is amazing !!!!!!! Everyhting has so much flavor and very inexpensive

A more classy/upscale sushi restaurant. It is very nice inside and has a great seating arrangement. They have the best appetizer menu out of all of Las Vegas(yakitori, skewers, and rib-eye) and the sushi is very good it is well prepared and presented and the quality of fish is very good and has some of the best specialty rolls too. The servers are very fast and attend to your needs in a orderly manner.

IF I COULD GIVE THEM MINUS STARS, THEN I WOULD GIVE THEM MINUS 5 STARS. I went OYSHI SUSHI tonight. I been here few times before and I enjoyed pretty much. However, today? NOT AT ALL.   It was very normal and nice at the beginning of our dinner.  We stared with miso soup and seaweed salad and some other appetizers. Then we ordered some sushi and the first problem was started with sushi. Their sushi was too many rice with fish. I could not think about taking a picture but it seems like 'Oh you guys will have AYCE? then I will make you not to eat too much.' for me. I wasn't sure whether I order sushi or rice.    Then we ordered 2 kinds of rolls and another seaweed salad during eating it. As you can see in other people's reviews, this place's services sometimes very slow. I expected that seaweed salad can be served right a way because they do not have to cook. We called our server and he just said it will be coming so no rush. Then the seaweed salad came out when we are almost done. You know, seaweed salad is just salad and probably most people eat seaweed salad with other main dishes. That time, we were almost finished so we couldn't finish our seaweed salad.   And finally, we asked for check and told our server that we are all finished. Then he said that he has to charge for leftovers which were 2 peices of roll and seaweed salad. And it will be the normal price, $8, which is regular price for the roll and $5 for seaweed salad. I knew there are leftover charges but I didn't know that they will charge the normal prices. Isn't that means we can take out leftovers when we charge normal prices? But it was also fine. I knew I have to pay for the leftovers because it is AYCE so I said okay we will pay. And he brought check with only extra $5 for seaweed salad. Okay I appreciate with it.  We were disappointed with sushi, slow service, and leftover charge. Then we pay the tip only $1. I know it is kinda rude, but today, I didn't really want to tip them. Then we came out from OYSHI SUSHI.   THE REAL PROBLEM IS THIS. GUESS WHAT.  OUR SERVER FOLLOWED US AND STARTED TO YELL AT US AND SAID F**KING A** HOLE, F**K YOU AND KEEP SWEAR AT US  Before that, we thought today was not really good so we should come again and enjoy our meal but once we hear that the server yelling and swear at us, I thought  tip him $1 was execellent choice.   I know it is not really manner put $1 for tip. But what kind of manner is that? Even though he was upset with us that we put a dollar for tip, that does not mean that he should say FU*K YOU AT CUSTOMERS. MC.DONALD'S WILL HAVE BETTER SERVICE THAN THAT!!!!!!!!! May be he wants too, I WILL NEVER EVER GO BACK THERE WITH PAYING 26-27 DOLLARS TO GET THE WORD FU*K.

I was really looking forward to eating here the last time I was in town.  I have to agree that the decor is really savvy and modern.  I was disappointed with the quality of everything else about our dining experience here.  We'll certainly give it another try to see if the food and service are any better.
This place is favorite sushi place in vegas. You need to order the all you can eat option or else you will regret it!!
Sin City has always been my favorite sushi place and now Jessie is back even better Young, Jimbo, and everyone else ill see you soon:P

I decided that I wanted AYCE sushi last night (Saturday) so I headed over to Oyshi.  I checked in with the host at about 8:30pm and was informed that it would be about 20 minutes for a table.  It was a nice night, so I just grabbed a chair on the sidewalk in front and waited for the other half of my party to arrive.  There were probably four or five other small groups of people milling about waiting for tables too.  We were seated at the bar just after 9:00pm.  The place seemed pretty busy...  some uncleared tables, a couple large parties (one with kids) occupied the "VIP" rooms behind us.  It was on the noisy side, especially with the techno/house/electronica music pumping from the ceiling speakers above the four chef's stations.  After a few minutes we were greeted by a friendly server who confirmed our AYCE preference, took our drinks and asked if we were ready to put in our first round of orders.  We were.  I started with miso soup, an assortment of nigiri style items, an "ahi poke" and an order of four oysters (limit 1).  Note:  I thought it was interesting that even though we were seated at the bar, our sushi requests were made with the server.  I guess the server was attempting to queue the orders for the very busy chefs.  The nigiri items on first order arrived quickly and we were told be the chef in front of us that the oysters would be out in a "little while".  The nigiri items were nicely presented and of good quality.  The ahi poke was just a small clump of chopped tuna on top of a mix of seaweed salad and sprinkled with sesame seed (not exactly what I think of when I think poke, but I'm not trying to get techincal up in here son).  The oysters came out a few minutes later.  They were covered in green onion, a bit of masago and a squirt of sriracha.  I can only assume that the toppings were meant to cover up the tasteless, been sitting in a fresh-water tank, half-dollar sized oysters.  Engh, I figured I'd keep moving forward, after all this was AYCE...  Round two:  More nigiri (including surf clam, tamago, masago, quail egg, tako, and scallop), something called "oyshi scallop", and a spider roll.  We also ordered the chicken, beef and shrimp yakitori, which were all paired with asparagus and came sitting in a sweet teriyaki sauce.  Again the nigiri items were of nice quality.  I'm not sure we ever got the "oyshi scallop".  There were two items in the order that looked like a krab salad (the california roll stuff) that I was sure we didn't order.  The spider roll was basically a California roll with one meager soft-shell crab in it, and it had been covered in the same bbq sauce they put on the eel.  Since I was disappointed with the Spider roll and I love soft-shell crab, I put in an order for a Monster roll, which was also supposed to have soft-shell crab in it.  What came out was something similar to the Spider (covered in the same eel sauce) only with the addition of a few slivers of eel and a refrigerator cold tempura shrimp stuffed into it.  Slow down on that eel sauce dawg.  At this point, I was pretty full and done trying...  The sushi chef in front of us was closing down his station, giving it a quick wash down with a wet rag and mumbling something about this night being his "early out".  By this time the dining room was starting to clear out too, but the party with the kids were still in our audible vicinity.  I finished up my second pot of hot tea (which was a nice quality loose leaf green) and enjoyed a green tea ice cream mochi ball.  Both of these items were good.  After tipping out the chefs, server and taking care of the bill, I had spent about $75 for the two of us.  I'm not sure I'll be back anytime soon, but I made the best of it while I was there.
I love Oyshi Sushi! It's a fun environment with a great staff and excellent food! Love the half roll option with AYCE at the bar!

This place is 5 stars all the way. I'm honestly not an owner, a relative of the owner or a friend of the owner. I don't even live in Vegas I am from LA and here on business. But I do get to Vegas quite a bit. And now every time u do get out this way I will be eating here.   I was finishing up a business meeting about 2 miles away and looked on yelp for a sushi place with a good rating. They fit the bill so I drove over there knowing nothing other than they got a great rating on yelp.  When u drove up I was immediately impressed with the outside as it was very attractive and was obviously part of a new shopping center. Then I saw their sign that they had an all you can eat dinner and I got really excited!  Anybody that knows me knows that I can eat. And if your offering me all you can eat im going to be there for a whole. And since I hadn't eaten all day I was ready. I sat at the sushi bar where they told me everything on the menu was available on the all you can eat with the exception of the sashimi.   There were 5 people behind the counter at the sushi bar and they cranked out the food really fast. But it didn't taste rushed and it certainly didn't taste like all you can eat. In fact it might of been true bast sushi I've ever had.   There was one sushi chef that took care of me almost entirely. I'm sorry I didn't get his name because he have me great service as did everyone else I came on contact with.   So to sum it up if you live in Vegas or are visiting (it's only about 10-15 minutes from the strip) you must try it. If you line sushi you will love this place.
Great food, nice people, very busy place, plan to wait to get seated on the weekends.

Let me start of by saying that my hubby and I use to come here often until we moved closer to the other Oyshi location on Sahara (which btw is awesome). I was shocked at how much the service has changed since we last came. The hubby and I came for ayce dinner and were seated right away since we came at a good time. That was about all that was good about our time there. After being seated the waiter took our drink order and brought us our drinks. We then placed our order for 3 sushi rolls. 30 min later we left without getting any of the rolls. This is why. The table across from us who came in about 10 min received a ton of food both sushi and cooked food from the kitchen promptly after ordering while we received nothing. Our waiter kept on telling us our food was coming over and over again but NOTHING EVER CAME!! Sad really! Never coming back to this location again and DO NOT recommend this place at all!! Service is horrible and can not even tell you if the food here is still good. Really wish I could just give this location no stars!

They served good quality fish, but they used waaaay to much rice.  And the sushi man must have had a bad day because the rice was kind of dry and was hard to swallow.   I asked them to reduce the amount of rice and they said that is standard for all-you-can-eat (hardly, ive been to many and only one other serves that much rice Kobe - right up the block, read my review of that one!).

Hubby and I were craving AYCE sushi and yelp app led me to Oyshi. $21 for the amount of food we had during lunch is no problemo.   I'm so glad we went. The selection on the AYCE list FAR surpasses any AYCE places I've been to in Cali. Tons of premium rolls, tons and tons of appetizer items (seaweed salad, asparagus tips), you can customize your own sushi, hand roll list is extensive. And the sushi itself is B-O-M-B!   I go to Vegas oftne and I'm so glad my relatives live near this place. I will be going here often. I can see it already. I wanna try the private dining areas for groups one day. Oh and props to the server, Angel. She knows her stuff and was very sweet and attentive!

I did AYCE here pretty recently. The food is okay, but their selection was smaller than I expected. Also, the service here is definitely lacking. I came here midday on a weekday, and the restaurant wasn't anywhere near busy. They were pretty well staffed, but they still took forever to get anything done. I ordered appetizers and nigiri together when the waiter first came around, but I was left sitting around waiting for my food for ages. The waiter continuously delivered food to my table with no mention of my order for half an hour. I don't know if he forgot to put my order in? Anyways, the staff was far from friendly and attentive. There wasn't anything special about this place that would make me come back. I'd much rather go to Sushi Mon.

Do you want to eat at a place that has cockroaches? Well if that's your type of place come to Oyshi. They linger on the booths hidden between the seats. Beware!  This by far was the worst experience I've had dining at a Japanese restaurant. Yes, this place seems popular but is it clean? Hell to the No!  I can only imagine what they are doing when they are behind the kitchen cooking up a storm.    My fam bam was doing the famous all you can eat. Everything was going smoothly until my cousin noticed this cockroach roaming in the seats. We addressed this to the server who apologized and moved us to a different table. Obviously we lost our appetite. I asked to speak to a manager and as I was looking back the staff was heckling and laughing. They were fully aware of the cockroach issue and perhaps they thought it was funny that we actually saw one. I spoke to the manager and he was not helpful. He was like I'll comp the drinks and the kids meal. Helloooo. There was three all you can eat. He also spoke to me like he also knew about the cockroach problem and explained that summer season that can happen.   As a food venue, that is unacceptable. Do you know what type of diseases or sicknesses that can bring to a human. What if it landed in my soup and I  swallowed a cockroach? Would they blame that on the summer months? As we all know there are tons of food venues around Las Vegas and most are really clean. I would think the health district would not even let a venue like that pass with an A rating if it was infested with cockroaches. For all those who want to experience the future Oyshi dining.. make sure you bring an insect repellant spray so that way you are sure not to get that on your food. Beware of cockroaches!  They can creep up on your soup or maybe even become an appetizer if you aren't paying attention. Cockroach roll with the eel sauce, anyone?   Just to let everyone know. I paid for my meal. I am not the type to look for comps. I am the type that enjoys a clean place to eat.
This place is the tits . Absolutely 5 star mo fucking delightfulness. The server was absolutely stellar. A trip down the the peculiar into a word of gallant memories. A meal inside a giants eyeball !

I ask for all you can eat menu they took forever to bring food I got only two orders of sushi not that great. And ask for third plate they never bring it instead they bring me the check. The white boy MIRO. His name waitress. Was rude Never comeback. Here
Our go-to sushi place!! I never leave disappointed. All you can eat is the way to go. Good music, too :)

Just as I remembered it minus the suuuuper sloooow/bad service. Maybe we just had the worst server ever (Sang). Yes, I'm putting you on blast! He got flustered after taking orders from a third of our party and couldn't even get that right. Other servers had to help him as he was so overwhelmed. Our check was wrong. Luckily for Mr. Sang we were automatically charged 18% for having a large party. He wouldn't have gotten much otherwise.  The food was good when it finally arrived. Much better than most ayce places in Vegas. You really can't beat it for the price.

My family four members enjoyed All U can eat. It is fresh and good taste. However the waitress who is japanese(?) is not kind I think. Also I wish the price should be down. It's little bit expensive though It was over 140dollars

I use to love coming to this sushi restaurant, but it seems to be slowly declining. I was just there a week ago and flys surrounded our food.  The restroom was dirty with the rolls of toilet paper just sitting on the floor and this was at opening. Also I was served a glass of water with lipstick on the glass. It's too bad because I loved this restaurant but won't be back anytime soon...

All-You-Can-Eat sushi places are very hit, or miss here in Las Vegas. Most of the time the fish is dry and not very flavorful. Oyshi breaks this trend. Their rolls are delicious. The Red Rock, Lobster Fair and Yellowtail Trio are must tries. Their fish is very fresh, moist and flavorful. For an All-You-Can-Eat sushi place, Oyshi is a cut above the rest.  Service at Oyshi is very friendly. The staff are knowledgeable about the menu and the art of sushi. They are always willing to suggest and prepare something new for you to try. I go here often and sit at the sushi bar. Both the servers and the sushi chefs know exactly what I like and how I like it prepared.
Chef Pedro always makes me feel welcome and in my belief the best sushi chef in town. The fish is always fresh and at the right temperature. AYCE is the best option.

Fabulous fresh sushi, polite and efficient staff and a great menu with lots of variety. The best deal however is the AYCE (All You Can Eat) menu! $27/pp and you can get everything from appetizers to rolls and other dishes, even dessert! We polished everything off! Delicious all around and we will now be regulars!!!!

I go to Oyshi on a consistent basis, as I live just down the street. The food is always delicious and fresh, although I feel the AYCE is a tad overpriced for dinner as there are some odd restrictions (only one dessert per customer except for ice cream, etc.). The service is hit or miss; it's either excellent and quick, or exhaustingly slow.   I usually do AYCE, but order mostly appetizers. The gyoza are fresh, crispy and delicious. The Asian Skirt Steak is wonderful. The Chicken Yakitori is also on my favorites list. As far as sushi rolls are concerned, I've always ordered the Crunch Shrimp Tempura roll. No complaints about the food, except for the cut pieces are sometimes too big to eat one piece at once.

Service was good but the food is sub par at best..food prep and presentation was horrible but the real surprise was the worst shimp tempura i have ever had..this place is what happens when management chooses to not use properly trained staff to save a buck..will not be back
By far our best AYCE Sushi spot I've had. Service and atmosphere is on point!! Huge menu and the food is delicious. You won't be disappointed!!

Wow!! I love Oyshi! I'm definitely coming back and recommending it to everyone I know! I have been to a lot of AYCE sushi places in Vegas and there hasn't been a place that I really loved more than this one.  My absolute favorite was the Dragon roll, it is ell with avocado. mmm! The Nigiri is super fresh and delicious. It was great all around. TY

This place has now become my favorite! I love their all you can eat!! Unlike other places they serve u half rolls upon request & u can order as many rolls at a time that you want. Appetizers & dessert also included in the happy hour! My favorite dish was the surf & turf! Chef Ivan is pretty helpful when it comes to recommendations & his convo made the meal even more enjoyable! Thanks!!

I've been giving this place many, many, many chances hoping their food would be fresher/better but after being disappointed time and time again, I've decided to finally rate this place. I live off nigiri and their fish here is rancid, including their version of toro. Cut of the fish is also thinner than usual. The rolls are decent; the best thing on their menu is the poke bowl and sizzling platters, but both not worth the AYCE price. Better bet is to just make the drive to goyemon or sushimon. Service is ok, a hit or miss. All in all, Nothing worth warranting another visit.

Food is very good and fresh, the restaurant is very clean and open spaced. Only issue is service. Wait staff is polite and attentive only problem is the venue is under staffed. 3 servers for an entire restaurant will cause problems.
Horrible service and charged us extra on all you can eat sushi cause we didn't eat two of the rolls that we thought was just awful. Highly don't recommend

I'm a BIG fan of "All you can eat(AYCE)," when i'm extremely hungry. i've been to hikari and i've always had a BAD tummy ache when i leave that place.  i live on the SW of vegas and always driven past oyshi. "AYCE" sold me. i went online to check the reviews on yelp. i was excited and drove down to the restaurant.   the ambiance was hip and played house music. i sat at the sushi bar and it was a huge table. everyone was 'nice' when i got there.  i am a petite girl.. 105lbs less.. and i love to eat! i had a minimum of 2hrs to eat. they warned me that if i had leftover rice or sushi, i will be charged.  i was game.  i got there at 8:30pm. ordered my miso soup that they had forgotten 20mintues later.  i must admit the sushi and rolls were delicious. i think once they got the hint that i kept ordering and ordering.. no sushi chefs didn't want to serve me and it was only 1/2 hr into dinner. everytime i wanted to order something, they walked away and pretended not to hear me. i assume they want to stretch the 2hr minimum by not serving me. then i felt like i was begging for food. at this moment, i remain a big smile on face and it turned into a nightmare. everyone was sooooo mean!  they wanted me to leave! whatever i ordered in the kitchen.. the items were for smurfs! asparagus wrapped with beef were the size of chopsticks!  it was 9:30 and the 10th server gave me the check! i was not done eating and haven't gotten to my dessert. i am a polite customer, fun, and spoke to the chefs the entire time. i ask the server if my 2hrs were up and he said the manager gave him the check! WTF??? i ordered my dessert paid my check, gave them a 20% tip for the food and promise i will never come back even if it was for free.   i was hoping this was going to be a great experience because once i tasted the food, i fell in love with the freshness. nonetheless, i am loyal customer anywhere i step foot in and it would have been sooo convenient. no matter how great the food, if you don't have customer satisfaction, you will never have them coming back!

By far the best sushi we have ever had! Everything was fresh from the sea urchin, salmon belly, to tuna. The service was great to. The waiter (i wish i cpuld remember his name) was very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. We will definitely come again!

I would like to say that being turned down at 1150pm on a Saturday when they close at 1am is bs!!! I will recommend to all of my industry friends that would think about rushing to eat sushi at this place to go elsewhere. I understand it is ayce but all I wanted was a couple rolls and it was 1150!!! Completely unacceptable in my opinion.

First time I came here was last year Thanksgiving, I was like wow.. this place is a gem...Second time I came here was July 4th weekend.. I was like.... nah.......won't come here again. We came here for lunch. There were like only 7 tables and there were 3 sushi chefs but the service was extremely slow. Guess what? We only had 2 rounds of sushi in 11/2 hours! You're prolly wondering if we ordered like tons of sushi...nope not even close to  20 pcs each round. Not to mentioned that the quality went straight down.... we didn't even bother to get the third round... The bill came and guess what? They charged us 18% tips for 2 people!!  No apology and what so ever... The server said they got the wrong check for the wrong table... so does that mean that they were charging other tables 18% tip? Whatever reason it is, guys pay attention to the bill.. it's no joke! (c the photo)

Came here for bday dinner service sucked ass couldn't be bothered to even ask to refill our drinks waited forever to get our rolls when we went to order again we waited literally for 20 minutes to get our food or even see a waitress will not be back  Very disappointed. Also watch your check they like adding on items and have an 18% mandatory tip that was not deserved.
Excellent food and great service.  Ask for Thomas to be your server.  My favorite roll is the Hawaiian.

I have eaten here quite a bit and over the last 2 year the customer service and quality have gone WAAAAY down.  They need to hire more staff and get better fish suppliers.   I had to flag down a server 3 times to place an order.  Two orders were completely wrong.  My Tiger roll fell apart while trying to pick it up.  I waited 30 MINUTES for a Dynamite roll.  This was at 1:30 when I was 1 of 8 people in the place.  I will not go back.

Love this place. Great service for an all you can eat joint. It's very clean and nicely decorated inside and the sushi is always on point! This is one of the few places I have found where the service and quality of food isn't lowered because it is AYCE. There are tons of options for sushi and non sushi lovers. Oyshi is great for both small and large parties.

Had a great experience with All You Can Eat at the Sahara location!! As always oyshi pushed the limits and delivered outstanding customer service!!  The waiter was slammed and kept getting table after table and just kept the food coming!!!  Great experience!! Will be back again, just learned about their AYCE happy hour.
Its good. Not great, but good. You will find all the standard sushi stuff on the menu. Nothing too creative.  But still enjoyable. Its 3.5/5, but im rounding down. Ive had better in the gta.

Stopped in with the Wife and Daughter today for one the trully best bites in Vegas in my opinion, My Man Kenny killed it as usual with his on point service and attention to detail!!!!  Much thanks to all the skillful hands behind the line.  If you don't know ....now you know! ------oyshi-----

I walked in like a boss with my sister was immediately seated by a young waiter by the name of Kenny who was very kind and cracked jokes made us feel welcomed. We sat at the sushi bar and our Chef was Nacho and let me just say he makes some really foodgasmic rolls some are his creations others on the menu he listened intensively and made rolls to our liking which made it all the better thank you Oyshi Sushi staff! Also the music  chill.

I ate here once...FANTASTIC!!  The sushi was fresh, Uni, sweet shrimp, and all the basics were as well.  They also have a great selection of cooked foods for my non sashimi eating friends that came with me. AYCE on top of that? Yeah this place is great when you just want to eat and want to get away from the bustle of the strip!  The staff was very attentive too.  I was very impressed!!

The fish is unbelievably fresh for the desert.  The all you could eat menu is not limited to the sushi but practically every thing on their regular menu from steak appetizer to shrimp tempura and even includes dessert.  I would have given them a 5 star, but their wait staff seems to be inconsistent.    We have been away from Las Vegas for over 2 years now and we haven't found a replacement in L.A. or the Bay Area and plan to go back every time we are in Vegas.

Had lunch yesterday at Oyshi, it was the first time I'd ever been there.  I'd read some of the earlier reviews about poor service, but I have to say there was no trouble at all when I was there. The waiter (Vincent) was very attentive and friendly. He answered questions about menu items that we asked about and commented on his favorites. There were two other people that kept coming around and filling our water glasses whenever they got low. Food came out fast and was delicious!!!  I had the "Oh My Heart", the "Hawaiian" and the "Lobster Fair". All were exceptional!! I could have ordered 3 of the Oh My Hearts and been perfectly happy - it was awesome!! The last one I ate (Lobster Fair) was almost too big but very tasty!  Oh My Heart - Spicy Tuna, Crab Mix, Avocado and Shrimp Tempura rolled in Soy Paper. Eat this!!

We have just moved from California. Happened to run into the place and ordered to go the first time. Enjoyed the food and the price. Went there during dinner the second time and was disappointed at the front desk hostess. We waited for about 10 or so minutes (she was on the phone the whole time ignoring other customers) until they cleared a table for our party of five in the main dining area, BUT she immediately sat a party of 2 and another party of 5 who came in after us at the other area behind the front desk...so how come we were not seated there when we came in??? There was an empty table that we can see while waiting...When the hostess sat us, neither a smile nor a word...when she brought our bill, i had my hand up to reach for the tab and she flopped it down the table ignoring my hand out...when we left no thank yous, nothing...talk about customer service...this is the kind of attitude that makes you hate the place...people not the food.....I will go back but if i see her behind that desk i will look for another place....
Good food. Service absolutely horrible. Didn't bring refills when asked repeatedly. Forgot food.  I will no longer come to this location EVER again. The one on rainbow is amazing.
This is the 2nd time we've come early enough but the hostess didn't want to seat us so we are going elsewhere ... $300 tab .... Your loads mutha fuckas !!!!
Had a great time here.  We ordered the crazy cali roll and the volcano roll.  Excellent service,  friendly staff and good food!  We will back.
Cajun albacore was delicious! Service a little slow today but friendly staff and good apps, sushi and rolls!

I really love this place. The food is the best AYCE sushi in town, in my opinion.  But as for the service... VERY SLLLLOWWWWW. Waitresses don't come around to check up on you as often as they should, and the orders take a long time to get.  I waited 30 min for the waitress to return and another 20 min to get my order of rolls.  That would be my only complaint, which is sorta a big deal!

The worst ever. Don't recommend anyone to come here. Waiting almost 2 hours waiting for a simple table of 4. After constantly checking wait time w host they somehow forgot about us and sat others right as they walked in after having is wait for 2 hours now. Then after complaining they said they had forgotten about us, and now they will sit us so walking towards the host booth once again ... I can see about 6 open tables and they still had the nerve to say wait 10 more minutes, ofcourse we just walked out. Even bartender felt bad for us. He was the only nice one there. Horrible host service.

Came for lunch and sat at the bar. The sushi chef ( heavier set Latino man) was very disinterested and continued that way the entire time. Never did he ask what I wanted or like. It seemed as if I was inconveniencing him with my orders. As I began to eat I started noticing flies buzzing around the bar then my food. So I was constantly swatting them away.  Then Chef Ed came out and began to prep food with the other sushi chef. While prepping he started profusely rubbing his nose then wiped it onto his chef jacket without ever washing his hands. He did this 3-4 times before I finally lost my appetite and asked for my check.

If you don't like Oyshi sushi, then you're probably a Communist who hates freedom and puppies. It's just that simple.  There aren't many good ayce establishments in Las Vegas,  however Oyshi on Sahara stands out as a rarity. The fish is unusually fresh for ayce, the fusion rolls extremely creative, and the sushi chefs - starring Chefs Daniel, Pedro, and Curtis - are awesome guys that know what they're doing (they also have a sense of humor). Additonally, the servers have all been very friendly and everyone makes you feel really welcome.  This is the only ayce sushi restaurant I go to in Las Vegas. Give 'em a try. If you don't - or if you don't like it - then I hope you can rest at night, comfortable in the knowledge that you are everything that is wrong with America.
Great food and good prices. lve never had bad service even when they're jam packed, servers are attentive and prompt. Sashimi platter and Poke are my faves from here

So the beautiful girl I've been dating told me about this place being one of her favorites so of course I had to take her there.  We made sure to sit at the bar because you get excellent service when you do.  The food was amazing and the staff was super friendly and upbeat.    Tun was the chef making most of our rolls and he even introduced us to the supervisor Nye who offered us some complimentary Sake which we turned down because we were already on our second bottle.  They have a happy hour from 11pm-2am with buy one get one Sake or Beer.  They also had just launched ladies night which knocked down the price for the lovely lady on the All-You-Can-Eat to $21.  We started with the Seaweed Salad before we moved on to the fabulous rolls.  We had the Monster, Japanese Garlic Lasagna, Dragon, Vegas, and Oyshi rolls.  We wish we could have tried more but we were stuffed.  We sat around chatting with the friendly staff and drinking Sake until we had a little more room in our tummies for dessert.  I highly recommend this place for the great food, fun atmosphere, and they play House music.

I hope it is just growing pains. Only one server. Waited on refills for quite a long time. Sushi was good. BF ordered surf n turf... It was bland and not worth the money. I know it a sushi place but they should make the quality of food great throughout. We will not be returning to this location.

Very nice restaurant, usually always poppin' so you just have to be patient with their staff. I would recommend going late night if possible.   Not only does all you can eat apply to just sushi, you can basically order anything on the menu (as many times as you want).  Recommendations: Salmon Nigiri, Sweet n Spicy Pork

We went to Oyshi tonight and had the all you can eat Sushi.  If it wasn't for the Server I would give it no Stars. The food was terrible and when you ordered a roll the inside was the size of a Nickel and the roll because of all the rice was the size of a Silver dollar.  The meat had no taste on a meat dish and the and the egg roll was overcooked and tasted terrible. My wife almost got sick on the Mackerel sushi. I couldn't honestly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Saw this Sushi place and something about it caught my attention, so I decided to check it out. My boyfriend and I went there on a Friday date night. The place wasn't busy at all, but there was a larger party in the back. The sushi was amazing!! I already want to go back. I can't even recommend one dish. They were all so so good.
Love the quality, so many different flavors to chose from and their green tea ice cream it's just amazing!. The place it's always nice and clean and fancy by the way!

You guys can mark it this is my place to eat sushi it's really really tasty very good service it's very clean and very good environment go ahead and take your wife your boyfriend your girlfriend your husband and try it

Food quality is not bad but they got the worst customer service. The server i had was so rude and doesn't even know how to make recommendation. I usually give 20% tip for server but this time i only gave tips to sushi chef because the server i had doesn't deserve to get ANY tips. I am not coming back

My go to spot for weeknight sushi. The service is great if you eat in, and take out is great too (we usually go for take out). Sushi is fresh.  We usually get a large platter, and the selection and variety of fish is great.

Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice? Shame on me.  I won't be back.  Love the atmosphere of this place. Has a good bar, neat little lounge area,and the sushi is decent for the price.  But I don't know if the service can be any slower. First time,restaurant half empty, took us (4 people) 30 minutes to get our first round of sushi.
