After that the waitress disappeared and we didn't order the second round for another 20.  Last night there were two of us at the bar, again, the restaurant was 3/4th full.  First round of sushi came out fairly quickly, however our server Mono disappeared time after time as we sat there with no food, or empty glasses.  Lousy.  I guess it's my fault for thinking a second chance was needed.  Taking my business elsewhere.

Always one of my favorite places to eat.  Service is great, food is awesome, and after going there for the past year the chefs know already what I want.  Always recommend this place to family and friends.

I've the all you can eat sushi at oyshi.  This location is just as yummy as the location on Rainbow.  I recommend that you sit at the sushi bar for the best experience.  This is a great way to get good recommendations from the sushi chefs.

I guess yelp deleted my review.  Too bad im writing another one.  Came here with my niece.  Stood in line waiting to be seated.  Ignored.... then a party of 4 behind us got greeted instantly and then sat. Right away.  This was before i found out about goyemon.  Crap service.  Btw hamachi here smells like old fish.  Fresh hamachi doesnt smell.    Also ordered fresh wasabi here once.  Bought me the regular wasabi then charged me for fresh wasabi...

I love this place. First time here and it's now my "go-to" sushi spot. Our chefs were John and Curtis. We had all you can eat at the sushi bar and we had great conversations. Every Tuesday, is sushi day. Along with our favorite chefs.  Thanks for the great service!
Don't go this restraunt.They served rotten urchin. I Instantly ran to the restroom, then vomitted. No apology, no polite attitude.

Favorite sushi place in Vegas. The rolls are always on point and the staff is super helpful. Go with all you can eat and enjoy yourself, might I suggest the Japanese lasagna and the surf and turf they are the bomb diggity and also the green tea creme brulee. Heck yeah!

We just visit today 09/04/15 at lunch time  We eat AYCE Me and my husband not Gonna coming back NEVER!!! HORRIBLE SERVICE !!!! Our server is Kevin  He never check back our table for another order with all you can eat??!! All the time we have to say something the other person  So we feel so bad i dont know thats why Food also bad ,not OYSHI !!!

Ahhhhh, Oyshi, my favorite sushi place. I don't really like raw fish and I looooveee Oyshi's large selection of baked. Not too expensive so far as sushi goes, and it is very good quality. I've been coming here for years and love it!

I have been to the old Oyshi a billion times, and have been going for years, so I am definitely a loyal and loving customer. Oyshi at Rainbow gets crazy packed busy, and for good reason.  I am not a raw fish fan and like someone else said they have an excellent menu especially for those of us who like cooked fish.  I came to this location for the first time on a Monday at dinner time. There was only a few people here, but for some reason they sat us right next to everyone else?  Our waitress was very sweet and nice. Our food came out very slowly and took a very long time in between even though there was two cooks and not too many people. I saw a shrimp tempura lying on the floor, who knows how long, kinda gross.  It's pretty and new, but I'm not sure

A local recommended Oyshi and I can see why.  Place was packed when we got here.  It's off the strip in a strip mall no doubt and people were waiting to be seated.  We ordered off the all-you-can-eat menu and believe me, it was a huge menu.  Will all restuarants like this, if you leave any leftovers, they will charge you, but I have a feeling they dont follow through w that.  The price was around $25, but hello, we ordered tons of shashimi and rolls worth way more than that.  You also get dessert with your meal and alcohol is extra (of course).  You won't find tourists here, just locals and regulars who knows you don't have to be at some fancy shmancy restuarant to eat good sushi.

Doing some free lance work in this part of town and the very helpful office staff recommended lots of places for lunch. This was not one of them. Lol. To quote one assistant, "I've had better. Their fish is not fresh."   But I'm not one to be influenced by others - except you Yelpers!   Why 3 stars? Food is just okay. I'm not sure if the fish isn't fresh but the rolls and sashimi were just okay. Nothing special and the spicy tuna looked weird. Like really red. And yes, I've had better.    The music was intrusively loud. I know I sound old here, but when the music distracts from the food, there is a problem.   The service was excellent - that's what's expected and deserved in Las Vegas. Seriously. This town has the best customer service!    I don't think I'll return - too many better sushi places in Las Vegas.
Amazing lunch today!  Kenny was hands down the best server we have had here!  Very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu.  We loved the Nuclear Bomb roll and shashimi salad!

Very disappointed ! We came here with family since my brother highly recommend this place. We were a group of 12 and had to wait because the place is packed on a Saturday night. Almost an hour had passed and they said it will be ready in 10-15 mins. Then came a group of 11 who came and were seated right away. I don't know if they had reservation but we just felt ignored the whole time. So I asked the receptionist that why is it taking too long? And she said that we are a big group blah blah blah. My dad was really upset and confronted the manager and the manager "Kevin" said if you continue to complain then the more you are going to wait. That made me really furious because nobody should disrespect anyone no matter what. So I told him to cancel it and the manager said "Good!"   I don't know if this manager had restaurant etiquette but even if people had high praise about your food but the service sucks it doesn't make you of a good place! I'm not sure if he owns the place but if there is a bigger boss he should not be working in a restaurant since he doesn't respect the customers and honestly we felt discriminated.   I've never felt so bad like this because it involved my family and it was suppose to be a nice dinner to wrap up our vacation in Vegas. I just hope this would be the last time they are doing this to anyone because it's a waste since my brother said its one of the best in Vegas. And to Kevin the Manager, one of your job Is to respect your customers the food just comes second your service is more important just in case you never knew that !
This sushi restaurant is awesome ! Our server Lolli was great ! Very attentive & would always check up on us to make sure our food was right & we were satisfied. Definitely recommend!
Had sushi at Oyshi on Christmas Day! This place was very busy. Food took some time to be served, but, service and Sushi were great!
We came in an hour before you close and your host denied us seating . How does that make sense? That really made us upset. Ruined our night.

If this video is any evidence, we thoroughly enjoyed the meal and more. The all you can eat is a fantastic deal and I didn't have a single roll I didn't enjoy. Sexy Roll and the Nagiri were highlights. Great find for our trip!
Best Sushi in town and the staff are super nice! Service is always on point and the food is delicious! Can't wait to go back again for all you can eat next cheat meal!!

This is by far my favorite sushi place to go to in Vegas. The sushi is always fresh and the Asian skirt steak is to die for! The service is usually pretty quick and very efficient. I eat here like once or twice a week.

I went here the other night because I wanted to try their dessert. It looked delicious! I spent hours looking at the menu items at their other location. It appears the Sahara location will have other menu options which is odd since they are owned by the same owner, but it may that they have different nightly specials.   I really liked the quail egg sushi. It is a raw egg, but it tastes sunny side up egg which is perfect since I love egg yolk! I have heard that this place has horrible sushi, but it wasn't bad at all. I did not like their special of the day which was negotori (I'm not sure if that's correctly). When we looked it up, it said it was fatty tuna. When it did arrive, it was not solid and the rice tasted heavily of sesame oil. They did have white tuna,   I do love that they also have a other options like their steak, surf and turf, spicy pork. I usually like to order a ton of appetizers and non sushi. Their tempera batter was okay. It wasn't as crispy and crunchy as I would have liked. It was the same thing with the calamari.    I did not like the green tea tiramisu. It was very very wet. I do not like that you are only allowed to order one dessert per person.

The name Oyshi doesn't stand to the expectations of the restaurant. The food quality is poor and tasteless and the staff members don't seem to care about customer service. An order to make it unique and enjoyable is by starting with the staff members on how to provide good customer service and take pride of what they representing. I am pretty sure the owner doesn't care as well because if he does he would take ownership and control of his restaurant sence this issue is been the same for majority the time this restaurant is been opened. Very disappointed long time waiting for appetizers and extremely slow service and lack of knowledge and skills from staff members as a whole restaurant aspect.

First time @ Oyshi on Valentines day  Food was ok and Service was great Thank you Tiffany for your recommendations and helping us~ We enjoyed our dinner :)  I will be back!!~   Rolls that you must try. Rattle Snake, Love affair, Double Salmon, Nyi roll

Favorite AYCE sushi place in Vegas.  It's a 30 min drive one way and still we go.  Quality and selection is excellent.  Many AYCE places will not customize orders... these guys do.  The staff is great... food is awesome... atmosphere clean and club/trendy.....but everyone knows this...  so I recommending calling ahead... don't be suprised to wait a while for a table during peak hours.

Ok so most All You Can Eat sushi restaurants have basically the same menu but this place has a few extras that make it beat Sushi Mon and all the other places alike. The uni was fresh and buttery and I liked the fried head of the sweet shrimp with ponzu. The tuna poke app was delicious and refreshing. Dinner was $26/person and we were lucky to get put in one of the private rooms. Also, the service was EXCELLENT! They were fast and kept our table clean and well maintained.  But the thing that made this place stand out in my opinion was.....their Green Tea Tiramisu. It was HANDS DOWN the best dessert that I have ever had in my life. I will drive 4 hours from LA to Las Vegas just for that!

I went there with my wife and my daughter Friday night, we set down by the bar area and Curtis was our sushi specialist, let me tell you something all I did was, I told Curtis, I like tuna, salmon and eel and he made me the best sushi I've ever had, very professional and friendly. A1 quality, go and ask Curtis for some custom made sushi.
Sushi is great but service is bad never asked to refill my water. 30min just to find my waiter to order and another 30min to get my sushi.

I arrived at the restaurant with my party of 4 was told it would be a 15 min wait, even though 70% of the tables were empty. At this point we offered to sit at the bar  which only had more than 10 avail seats, and we were told the issue was the staff was backed up and we could not be seated there either. We waited approx 20 min before we were sat at a table that had more soy sauce on the menus than were in the soy sauce pots. We placed our order, half our party received their rolls within an acceptable 15 min (We took a soy sauce pot from another table that had been empty the entire time and that one was also empty) while the other half did not receive anything until 45 min had gone by and the other half of the table had eaten their entire order. After 1 hour the person next me and I had received 2 of the 3 rolls we initially ordered and we canceled the remaining order. The server took off our drinks and did not charge us the remaining rolls even though one of the elusive rolls showed up the min we tried to leave. Food was good/average for a sushi place in this price bracket waiter was prompt and courteous. The one star is for the food and the waiter otherwise I would select none.  Restaurant was just poorly staffed/operated. One last thing the was the restroom looked like it was hit by hurricane Sandy and the host really did not seem to care about anything. Who understaffs a restaurant on a Saturday night?

Place was kind of small but the staffs personalities and great energy made up for the lack of space. It's always refreshing to find restaurants with an enthusiastic staff! The sushi was delicious, I highly recommend the Japanese lasagna and tako salad.
great food! very fresh. Great service and very polite. Very welcoming crew. The decor is very nice and fresh. You will Love this place.

I reserved a table here for my brother's birthday and actually had to make a few last minute changes to the reservations and they didn't make a big deal out of it.   We were seated in the private room that has a big flat screen tv with sofa seating. I suggest reserving this room for a special occasion or if you have a large party.   We all had the all-you-can-eat sushi and for $26 it's a steal! There are a few catches though..only a 4 oyster limit per person and you have to eat the rice that comes with your sushi or they threaten to charge you for it .   I think we ordered everything on the menu but a few dishes that stood out were: rib eye steak teriyaki (not over cooked at all), calamari (I didn't get a chance to try this but other people at our table kept ordering more of this) J&B roll (soooo good with the baked scallops on top). I thought the baked rolls were a lot larger than the other sushi rolls so be careful not to order too much (like we did).   Our waiter was pretty attentive and even offered to take our picture for us. The owner was really nice. I think I talked to him about making the reservations and when he heard it was for a b-day he gave us the private room even though our party wasn't that big.  I'll definitely be coming back here the next time I'm Vegas.

I signed up for Yelp just to write this review and warn everyone that they have HORRIBLE service. their food is not any different from any other sushi restaurants. Trust me, Goymon or I love sushi has WAY BETTER SUSHI. so the night went like this...... I had guests all the way from KOREA. they are the ones who saw the review of this place and told me they want to go. I told them they are not that great (since I have been here several times) but regardless to my opinion, we went. We waited for 30 mins to be seated which is not a big deal. I understand sushi restaurants get busy for dinners.... We sat down and ordered a few nigiris.... THEY brounght 4 pcs every 20 minutes. Once again, I have been to other sushi restaurants and I KNOW FOR A FACT THAT NO MATTER HOW BUSY THE RESTURANT IS, nigiri never takes that long.. so as a result, within an hour... we ate 6 pcs between 3 people. I asked for a manager and told them the situation, and he said THERE IS NOTHING HE CAN DO. (NOT EVEN SORRY) so we said we want to leave and THEY CHARGED US FOR THE FULL AMOUNT OF 3ppl's ALL YOU CAN EAT. I am telling you right now, if you want to ruin our dinner with AWFUL FOOD and IRRESPONSIBLE and RUDE staffs, this is the place to be. NEVER EVER AGAIN. THE WORST DINING EXPERIENCE EVER.

I was there 2 days ago and waited 20 min. To get served with only 5 customers there. 20 min rolled by and took our order. The server never showed up since, and wait 45 mins until I asked what is the update with our order. The manger blew me off and was rude. I then told him to cancel our order and then went to Kobe Sushi down the street with better service and great food. Oyshi- you better step up your game with customer service before you guys lose business. Would not recommend this place. Go to Kobe!!!

Pretty good sushi at a fair price.  We did not do the AYCE option, but ordered 4 different rolls, a (huge) house salad, and a soft drink for around $30.  Service was slow but the food was good and it was a nice meal out.
Sushi and udon soup were awesome but there us not more than this soup and two maki rolls for vegetarians! I hope they  will put more vegetarian stuff in the menu...

Fantastic. Used to go to Kobe Sushi for all you can eat as well but they closed. Didn't think I'd find a replacement and it's even better.  It's not a buffet... simply order from alloys of options and enjoy.
We didn't know what to order, so the waitress recommended some and the food was outstanding. The tea was just different, I guess I'm used to American tea.

- VERY mediocre food quality for the price - the $10 pitiful dragon roll brought the food grade down to 4 out of 10 - Service sucks: no one said hi when we walked in and the waiters/waitresses look like they were too over-worked to want any more customers - the reluctant service is notable - Lesson learned, won't be back to pay $50 for lunch for the highly disappointed foods...won't be recommending this place to anyone either.

We have been waiting 45 for our rolls. They said the kitchen is backed up but its empty.  When I finally received one out of ten rolls it was cold when it was a baked roll   When our order finally started coming out they forgot half the rolls   This is ridiculous but we are being patient because we are sooooo hungry.    An hour later still waiting    We asked for our bill and they charged for all you can eat when we each got one roll due to the lack of service   Not sure what is going on but I hope they figure it out.  The table next to us were complaining about the same thing we were. They are so upset.

Really good food!  I have been four times for lunch now.  My daughter gets the all you can eat sushi and tells me its great.  I get the bento box which has a little of everything (really like the asian skirt steak).  The tempura is really good too.  All of the sushi chefs say hello when you enter and good bye when you leave which is a nice touch.  It is a little dark inside though but most people probably like that.

My husband and I eat out a lot and Oyshi Sushi is one of our favorite places, but our ONLY favorite sushi place. Best all you can eat. We get the Ahi Poke, Baked Mussels, Surf and Turf, Chicken Teriyaki, and Miso soup for appetizers.  The Japanese Lasagna, Atomic Bomb, and Lobster Fair are a must!    Always busy here so plan ahead. I think it's worth the wait though!  Happy eating!

I've been coming here for about 7 years... my favorite sushi spot. However,  tonight I've decided I'm going to start going elsewhere. Service has declined and the wait for food has become too long.  :(

My favorite sushi spot thus far in Las Vegas! They have this awesome VIP room that can seat 10-12 people with a plasma tv. They offer all you can eat which is my kinda sushi spot! The quality of the sushi is awesome! They offer rib eye steak with shrimp, raw oysters, fresh sweet shrimp (along with the shrimp heads deep fried upon request yummmmm!) and dessert included with the all you can eat! Some times the waiter(s) cant believe how much I order and consume but its because their sushi/food is that bomb!! A must go n enjoy if you live in or even visiting Vegas!!

Food is always amazing. Props to the chefs. The hostess here is dumb. We walked in, she brought us to a table w out asking if we wanted the bar. When we told her wanted the bar she said it'll take her a few minutes. The bar was empty!! This place was empty. Why a few minutes? After leaving us waiting at the podium she clocks out and tells her fellow employees bye. While we are just standing there. So we sat ourselves. Idiot.

Went for AYCE. Food was good, service (today) was terrible.   Our waiter was quick to take our first order but then disappeared for quite some time afterward...even the other tables in the same section began to complain. The only time he was prompt to act was in collecting his tip (which would have been less had we not been a party of 6)  Still have love for Oyshi, but it's unlikely that it'll be our first choice for AYCE in the future.

We waited an hour to get a table, after they told us it was a 30 minute wait. The table next to us arrived after us and left before us. Our table watched the next table get served diligently while we had trouble getting our waitress' attention. Note, our party was starving. When they did bring our food, the waiter's seemed as if they had some attitude. We had a problem with our absentee waitress all the way til we left. We spent about 3 hours in the restaurant. All in all, service was horrible, NOT coming back!!! AND they charged us 18% tip, which is undersrved! Had to ask for our check and walk the bill to them to pay.

Amazing Service!! Amazing Food!!! The environment is also Amazing! What more can you ask for! If you love to eat sushi and want all you can eat this is the place to go to!! My favorite is the rib eye, poke, and simply shrimp roll! Check it out and you will not be disappointed!!

AYCE Reasonably priced - stylish ambience and decent service... Huge selection of rolls and side menus so if you like non traditional Japanese sushi/food, by all means, go and stuff your face! I went there for traditional nigiri, so it was disappointing because of the selection and quality. I know they would charge me for not eating what I ordered, so I literally had to shove the last piece of mackerel: it smelled so fishy, I almost puked.

Like Soyo, I've been going to Oyshi since 2012.  Like all sushi restaurants, there is that all you can eat option.  Take it.  You'll be happy that you did.  sure there may be a few restrictions on what you can order, but when you have the ability to eat whatever the hell it is you want from the sushi and rolls sections, who cares?  Just remember, if you dine there, ask for Vincent as your server.  He's awesome.

**if you're a sushi snob please do yourself a favor and move along by picking another restaurant from your yelp search result. ;) **  if you're less critical and like a variety of sushi and rolls then this just might be your spot. this little gem is definitely located off the beaten path and was suggested to me by one of my best friends who used to live in vegas. like most restaurants in vegas the most accessible/convenient places are pretty much buffets so i was a bit hesitant when i heard this is ayce (all you can eat). okay i'm not gonna lie...my first response was a NO to the idea of ayce, but fortunately my group and i caved when our pick was closed for some reason.  i've been here three times now and they've all been enjoyable experiences. the staff there were not only friendly (a must), but ATTENTIVE. our waitress checked on us frequently, but not to the point of annoyance. lastly, oyshi is not just a good place for sushi, but you also don't feel gouged when you're done...  helpful suggestions:  -this restaurant is off the 215 freeway so plan your transportation wisely;  cabbing it over there might be a bit expensive.  -make reservations if you can as they can be extremely busy, but if you can't then go early. my group showed up around 6'ish and was seated immediately _barely_ missing the dinner rush.  -the menu selections are pretty big so try not to make multiple orders of the same item so you can try different things. this is also important because not all their items are fresh, like uni or oysters.

The noodle bento box comes with medium sized bowl noodles and mixed tempura. tempura was crispy and well done. We also had the tuna chirashi, which was interesting that it was served on a plate and came out in cubes and not slices. Not a big fan of that. Had the spicy salmona and tuna roll which was really good. overall, all dishes came out in good size and portion however, the price was quite high for what it was. The service is friendly and there are divided walls available for private dining experience.

I've been coming here since it opened a couple years ago.  It used to be my spot, but lately they just don't seem to care.  Last time I was in it took forever for someone to seat us and there were multiple open seats with no one in front of us.  The service was just plain bad.  We had multiple servers who couldn't keep my wife's order straight(not a sushi eater) but always loved their Teriyaki Chicken Skewers.  They either change their teriyaki recipe or screwed up and put something else on it because it wasn't teriyaki. Food quality declined.  The specialty rolls seems to consist of more mayo based sauces than other ingredients.  Had to go through 3 different people to find the person to give me my check.    I noticed that many of the guys who I would always see working there in the past weren't there, maybe a coincidence or maybe not.    By the way Oyshi management-having your employees sleeping one off in the V.I.P. lounge in plain sight of customers is just irresponsible and lazy.

This is my favourite place in Las Vegas to eat sushi, and I've tried a few in order to find the cheapest one a student can afford. I love coming for their AYCE, and ordering Lasagna roll, poke, baked mussels, oysters, Oyshi scallop... and for dessert their delicious green tea mochi.

The BEST sushi in town! It is a favorite spot for me and my friends. Have introduced some friends and clients to there from out of state, and it has now become a staple restauraunt whenever they come into town!   Has a VIP room and a conference room for larger parties. Plasmas on the walls to watch the games and fights!  The staff is ultra friendly and is always around to check out how you are doing. has both all you can eat for lunch and dinner as well as entree, appetizer and dessert items!

My cousin took me here before I left the country and it was delicious!  We ate so much we had a hard time walking out of the place :)  The prices were good and the selection was great.  Everything tasted fresh and they had some good flavors as well.  If you like sushi, you should give this place a try, it is better than anything else that I tried in Vegas while living there.

I love this place!  Yes the wait times can get crazy, but that's because they're in high demand.  Here are some tips: get there before 6pm if you don't want a long wait, and if you are eating AYCE, go ahead and order the next round when they drop the first (don't wait until you're done eating or you'll be waiting awhile).  Also, you can't go wrong with the Ian Special!
Love this place. Mika  took care of us,  a table of 8, and everything was spot on.  Amazing service along with amazing food.

Oyshi is not a fancy smancy sushi restaurant, but  It will definitely please your stomach if you are hungry .Plenty of sushi to choose from and side dishes as well. All time favorite side dish has to be surf and terf which consist of fried steak and shrimp handed it to you still sizzling! One of the best sushi rolls is the love affair because tt has some lobster in it ;).   Their alcohol prices are reasonable for the portions they serve you. It can be slow at times when its busy, but definitely worth the wait. Every time i go they, it seems like i'm in a club since they play house or clubbing music lol. A great place to go but not in a large group.   Great place overall :-(D
I just love this place, best Sushi place in Las Vegas. Price, food and service are the best.

Really not impressed at all. Had a group set a reservation for about 30 people. We were sat on time in a table that would accommodate us all. Wow nice. Here is the bad part. They obviously knew we were coming and had only 1 waiter for us. Yes he took 30 some orders and the just walked out of the kitchen screaming out what rolls he had asking who wanted them. Almost an hour later I got my meal. The restaurant was great but the service was severely in need. I ate 2 rolls paid my $40. For my all you can eat sushi witch I have to say forcing a gratuity I am happy to do but this was crap. Really don't recommend going there with a group of any size.
This place is the bomb!! Excellent AYCE!! I'm in love with the Catercheese roll! Great place plus they're open until 2am!!

This place used to be good with good service and atmosphere. Now, hands down the WORST thing about Oyshi is the SERVICE. We have given this place multiple chances thinking something would change, but it just keeps getting worse. Unless you speak the language there, they don't care about your service. It's so frustrating to be sitting there for 30min, with nothing but a drink, and seeing so many others (who even come in after you) get served their food. Never again is this place worth our time or money. Definitely DO NOT recommend Oyshi if you're looking for good food or even relatively descent service

The worst place ever my family and I went for sushi there and 3 out of the 5 of us got food poisoning so bad that I missed work for 2 days. It Was horrible and when I called in to let them know that something may have been wrong there food the manager told me well that's too bad and hung up on me   I would never go here again and unfortunately prob turned off sushi for a while   The service was horrible and then the food I have heard bad things from others as well and some swear by it that they would never go there again. I guess it's a hit and miss situation with this sushi place
Great, fresh food but service and timing of the food being served was not that good. Be sure you are not on a time constraint when coming here.
One of my favorite sushi places. They have a wide variety and love the surf and turf. Atmosphere is awesome. Love, love, love it!!!!

This place has wonderful sushi! You order, they make it and it comes straight to the table. They have alot of good rolls and tons to choose from. Plus their all you can eat isn't super pricy and everything on the menu is included except sashimi. The only problem with the all you can eat is it is regular sized rolls so its worth it if your a big eater. I only made it to two rolls but my husband had at least 8! The service was really freindly as well. I will be going back next time we go out for sushi.

We've gotten their various dinner/bento box/sashimi combos after our friend took us here... claiming it's the only decent place in walking distance to their condo on Queens Quay. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of food.  One trick while eating here is subbing in the Californian rolls for spicy tuna / spicy salmon in any combo that has the Californian rolls. Californian rolls are for hippies.  All in all it's a pretty good sushi place that will fill you up for $15-20. For downtown, it's pretty good!  Service - 7/10 Value - 9/10 Ambiance - 6/10 Quality - 7/10

I would give the food 5 stars but I had something strange happen to me the two times I was there and I'll never go back because of it.   Both times I was there I was picking up take-out. The first time I was picking up my food, the total was something like $19.20 and I gave the very polite man a $20 bill. He didn't bring me any change, but asked me if I wanted something to drink while I waited. I though maybe when he brought me my food, he would give me my change but he didn't. I was going to tip him but since he never even mentioned my change, I let that be his "tip".   The next and last time I went I got to go food again. It was the same guy and he took my order and the total was $43.50. I have him $45. So this is actual paper money now so I thought he would totally bring me my money back this time. Again, very polite, asked me if I wanted something to drink.....and never mentioned my change again! It's not the money that bothered me, it's the assumption that really irritates me. Now you may ask, why didn't I just ask for my change. Well it's kinda simple, why should i have to! He lost a customer and a word of mouth review for $1.50.   I was almost tempted to try this theory again and pay for something with a $100 and see what the result would be. Does he only keep a certain amount of money, would something over $20, $40 $50 be pushing his luck....  So in short, the food is pretty good, the thieving man is very polite but I don't like when someone just assumes that my change is his tip.
Good service. But the last order we had put in took a long while to get.  Lounge area was blowing cold a/c. Nice place but needs a little touches here and there.

Best. Sushi. Ever.  Hands down my favorite sushi spot. The sushi chefs are so much fun and they have the most amazing specialty rolls. Every visit is a different experience and they never disappoint. For the best experience sit down at the sushi bar and ask your sushi chef what his specialty dish is.... I promise you it won't disappoint.
Quite expensive No sweet or fruit at the end of meal Sushi and sashimi with 8 California roll but found only 2 are California roll with rest minced salmon or tuna roll
Food is good music is terrible. RAP music is terrible making it a not kid friendly resteraunt
The AYCE is amazing! It includes appetizers, sushi and desser. They have a huge variety of rolls and they are delicious!
Fair priced sushi.  Sashimi is good, not great.  The staff was on top of things and coming around to make sure we were happy.  A good joint for a quick fish fix!
Best AYCE Sushi in town. Try their berry parfait for dessert!

My rating is bias on the food, that is why I gave 3 stars.  My friends and I originally game to that side of town for Goyemon, the wait was 1.5 hour, so we decided to head down to Oyshi to check out.  All the rolls were mediocre, nothing too special to make me crave to return to that specific location anytime soon.  A couple of stuff they could lay off the yum yum sauce, Kami-Kaze had so much yum yum it looked like pasta sheets as garnish lol.  The fish to rice ratio on the nigiri sushi was really good.  Service was another story.  We waited around 45 mins or more for our first round to come out....even the oyster apps.  Go figure why thier AYCE time limit is 2hrs, not the usually 1hr.  Our server wasn't the greatest, but she did follow up on us when she could.  I noticed she was busing several tables, which is probably why she never followed up with the food and why she was tired.  I have done that, so I know the feeling.  the facility needs to either have the host bus, or have someone to.

So we walk in and see a bunch of servers walking around and eventually one of them comes up and points to our table.  Whatever... We sit down, order our drinks and our first order..all was fine till then.  After we order, a good 10 minutes pass by while I observed the chefs, servers, and tables.   There were about 4 other tables and 3 of them were finished.  The one table next to us seemed to be about midway into their meal which seemed like hours between dishes.  They get one dish, finish it, then wait for another 5 minutes for the server to bring their next order. They looked irritated. And so about 20 minutes of watching 4 or 5 chefs looking busy, we get our first order.  After we finish through our first order we order maybe 4 more orders of nigiri. (Which shouldn't take more than 3 minutes) And by then all tables were gone and about 5 people at the bar. So I expected it to come quick. Nope...20 minutes later we get our last order and by then I was fed up with everything.  There were about 6 servers(why??) and they seemed more excited about talking to each other than even looking to see if the customers were okay.   Nigiri was like 80% rice 20% fish which you can expect from a Korean run sushi restaurant.  And of course they charge you if you leave rice.  How else would they make money? Not by quality, that's for sure.   Overall, the worst experience at an AYCE sushi restaurant.   If you want quality food and service, I'd recommend xtreme sushi.  Best sushi I've had in vegas by far.
Our first time here and had the AYCE sushi and it was very good! And our waiter Andre was awsome! Very attentive,  nice and knowledgeable.  We will definitely return!

This place has the best sushi! I usually go all the way to a kona grill to eat but I have this place a chance cuz it's closer to where I live now and omg... it's amazing!!! Highly recommend! I gave 3 stars because the service sucks. They don't listen. They forget half your order and when reminding them they act like it's such an inconvenience to have it fixed. Other than that, the food is great!

First time eating here. It was a Saturday around 5pm. We had AYCE sushi which was $27 per person. We ordered the sea urchin, tiger roll, rainbow roll, spider roll, shrimp tempura, hawaiian roll and some other appetizers. He sea urchin was very good - tasted very fresh. The tiger roll was also pretty good. The spider roll was a little weird - first it was cut super thin and fell apart when I would try and pick it up. Then it had bits of hard pieces. At first I thought it was rice that was dried out then I realized it was pieces of tempura batter from the shrimp which makes me think the shrimp tempura used in the roll was not fresh.  And then the rainbow roll seemed very dry for some odd reason.   The place was clean. Service was good and I liked the fact that it wasn't super small or super crowded like many sushi places In the area.
AYCE is awesome.  Contains more items than you would usually find.    Order is simple and the food comes out super quick.  Can't go wrong with this place!

This place is AMAZING!!! During the week they do lunch specials, which is only $10 for my fav, the teriyaki chicken. It's amazing! Never had teriyaki chicken like this and so good!! It also comes with California rolls, fried vegetables, salad (I don't care for, I substitute it for white rice) AND miso soup. Way more than I can eat but I try! They also have jalapeño poppers, which are not your ordinary jalapeño poppers. They are my FAV. I could eat them everyday, all day. Also, fav sushi rolls-- spicy tuna crunch, love affair, full moon. They are all spectacular. Their ice cream parfait dessert is also fantastic. All you can eat is great but doesn't include jalapeño poppers so I don't usually get it unless I'm in the mood for a big variety. I also love their egg rolls. Before I came here I HATED sushi! And seafood. Now I LOVE sushi, mainly only there's. basically everything is amazing here. I don't like how loud the music is, but if you ask they'll turn it down. Waiters are nice & atmosphere is very japanese (which I LOVE, love Japan & their culture!)
Lousy service up front. Each and every time I come to this place, the front service person is rude and unprofessional. The sushi is great, but not worth getting snarky remarks and attitude over.

The menu doesn't list the ingredients in the rolls. It might say tuna roll but doesn't say tuna and what. Like avocado or. Maybe it's just fish and rice. I don't know. The menu also doesn't designate what is spicy. I stopped in for take out. But couldn't get anyone to help me and the menu didn't give enough information so I left.
Seriously is the best sushi place! And so affordable...and all the time fresh. My fav pace to go eat..i come here like once a month.

It was an unfortunate experience.  We wanted to order the kampachi and the chef advised that he wasn't comfortable serving it - although it was listed on their "specials"  board.  Guess what it really means is this is the fish we really wanted to get rid of.  Rest was just ok at best.  Too bad - so many other places near here so we won't be back.
Excellent service. There's nothing special with the food. Fish is not fresh. Not enough varieties with the AYCE menu.

BOMB food for all you can eat.  You don't have to lower your standards because it's  AYCE.  It takes some time for them to bring out your food, so do yourself a favor and put in a couple choices so there's a steady flow of sushi coming.  There's so many good ones, I can't pick a favorite.  Be patient, cause they do tend to get backed up.

Good & decent lunch specials! However, I had to knock a couple stars because waitress came to our table at least 3 times & did not bother to fill water glasses. And we had to remind her for our roll that comes with lunch entreè! Fish was ok, not that fresh!

Wife called ahead for pick up order of 2 rolls and was told 10-15 minutes. I arrived 18 minutes after she hung up and was asked to take a seat at the bar by the greeter after awkwardly waiting for about a minute for anyone to even acknowledge I had come into the restaurant, not a good sign.   No bartender and place wasn't busy, a waiter did ask if I wanted water as he handed my the bill when I sat down and I replied "it's going to take that long that I need water?" He said should only take 5-6 minutes. After sitting for 15 minutes my to go order of 2 simple rolls ended up taking a total of about 30 minutes to put together.   Place was not busy (it was 3 pm and they had 3 sushi chefs) and I was in a big hurry (hence calling ahead) so heads up if you plan on ordering pick up, they're slow...really slow. Worst part was nobody (girl who was the "greeter", guy who took my money, person who handed me food) apologized for the wait, that would have gone a long way.

I used to live in Green Valley and there was a great AYCE place on GVP and Pebble. It's closed now. I found that out the hard way many many moons ago. We used that place as a crutch and were afraid to try a new place (for fear it would not live up to the old place standards).   I had passed Oyshi many times running errands and after driving back to the Southwest area of town, broken hearted about the closure of our "comfort zone" sushi venue, we decided to go to Oyshi and give it a try.   I am happy to report that we were very satisfied and have been back MANY times.   Recommendations  1. Do the AYCE. We've calculated MANY times what our meal would have cost with out AYCE and we always come up winners.  2. Don't go on Friday or Saturday nights if you are starving and just can't wait. It's busy, and that should say quite a bit about the quality. I don't mind the crowd or the wait, but sometimes my stomach wishes we had gotten there a little earlier.   Likes  1. House music in the background  2. TVs behind the sushi bar for the sports fans.  3. Ample bar seating - we ALWAYS sit at the bar 4. Extensive menu 5. Chef willing to let you make up your own rolls :)  We try to hit up Oyshi once a month or more if the Sushi cravings are just to hard to resist. I highly recommend. Yum (salivating as I write this)
Always busy but awesome food. My hubby is a yelper, so read his detailed review(s) (Dan N.) . Must get the Atomic Bomb!

The all-you-can-eat is to die for!!! Be prepared to spend $40 for drinks and all you can eat but it's totally worth it. They have a wonderful selection ranging from mild to WAY spicy. It's definitely worth your time, I'm going back soon!

I came here with my family for the AYCE lunch deal. I think the food is okay. I ordered the lava roll, yakitori beef skewers, tempura, lobster fair, seaweed salad, baked mussels, and sizzling rib eye steak. Out of everything I ordered, the stand out would have to be the baked mussels. They were absolutely addicting. If I could, I would eat a whole plater of those mussels by myself. The lobster fair was indeed a great affair in my mouth. My brothers and I attacked the entire plate within seconds. The lava roll was good for a AYCE standard. However, I was pretty disappointed about the sizzling ribeye steak. It was rather dry and lackluster.  I wasn't fond of the customer service. It was pretty slow due to the lack of staff during, but I wouldn't blame them since it's Christmas Eve. The longer the wait, the more discouraged I felt to order more food. I've been to other AYCE Asian restaurants with better food and better service. Overall, a decent dining experience.

Pretty good place. We had the AYCE for lunch. You can't get some items for lunch,  only for dinner i.e. Uni. The service was very good. Our server was Jay and he was on point with placing our orders and topping of our drinks. He missed some of our orders but nothing drastic.  I suggest you eat here with 4 or more so you can split the rolls. They only do half rolls at the sushi bar.  The place is very spacious and they have private rooms.  I like this place and I will probably be back.

First time here, I am a visitor from southern California! I enjoyed the sushi very much! It was so fresh and delicious. I will definetly return when I come back to visit my best friend. All the staff was welcoming and courteous. Our waiter (can't recall his name) was very helpful and offered good choices for our party to try!

This place is great! Although I'm not allowed to eat a lot of the food there, the menu has some great sushi. They have great All-you-can-eat prices!! They also have a kid's menu and other food that is not sushi.   The place is very nice! It's clean and spacious! They have a bar as well.

I eat sushi probably two times a week and I love trying new places around my area. I have tried this place three times and each time I have gone there the service was so HORRIBLE that I will NEVER go back. It took me 15 minutes for me to even have someone come greet my table and another 15 min to order. Now I would understand the long wait if it was around lunch or dinner time but this was at 2 in the afternoon on a weekday. When I finally ordered it took about another 45 minutes to even get my salad and sushi. They forgot some of my order and at this point I was done. The second time I went I was there for dinner and the same thing happend but a longer wait! The manager came over and took off our salad which only cost us 4.00, I would assume for such bad service that they would have tried to make us a little more happy but comp'ing off one salad was no acceptable. I will never go back there and I advise you all not to either!

Really best sushi in Vegas! Sometimes when I didn't have time to wait cause the wait line  was very long , i tried other sushi bars but honestly i always regret i didn't wait for Oyshi ... Everything is just yummy!
Delicious food and incredibly fast service. Our chef Mike was awesome! Definitely knew his stuff and was quick to offer suggestions. It's no wonder we're regulars.

It's true...I have fallen hard for yet another sushi place. AYCE, super unique rolls and here's the kicker...a very cool vibe! If you've ever been eating sushi and thought to yourself, this would be so much better with some Tiesto playing, this is your spot!  First off, don't be discouraged by the wait. They're busy and you should be happy for them. It's usually no more than 15 minutes and you can occupy yourself by practicing new dance moves. We always sit at the sushi bar and the service is friendly and fast. I once saw no less than 6 sushi chefs hustling in that narrow space so you'll be well taken care of.   On to the tasty stuff. What I like most about this joint is if you like deep fried, baked, raw, hot, mild, funky they've got you covered. I hate places that are all cooked or all raw, you've gotta people please!  From the freshness of the fish, to the sauces they're paired with it's all a win. Their all you can eat knows almost no bounds so if you're not busting at the end you've done something wrong. To top it all off the strawberry ice cream they serve is surprisingly top notch, little strawberry swirl through it and everything.   They also have 2 private rooms for large parties and I know this because I spied on them when I was there like a creeper. Try this place out next time you're in the southwest. We were happy to find it on our side of town and not have to venture to Sushi Blvd aka Eastern.

Just awful sushi. Mostly tried nigiri. The rice was not seasoned correctly. The fish was dry. The uni was grey. They served the eel with eel sauce on the same plate as other sushi getting the eel sauce onto the other nigiri. Multiple orders of appetizers failed to arrive. Service was slow.

I went to return movies at Blockbuster with my younger son and had the urge for some sushi. Since Oyshi was just across the street from Blockbuster, we stopped in for a quick sushi fix. I've been to Oyshi many times in the past, but this visit will be my last. Service at Oyshi in the past sucked, but tonight's service was just plain unacceptable.  Being a server myself, I strive to be polite, easy, PATIENT, understanding, and tip well. When my son and I walked in, we waited a good 5 mins as the manager and servers walked passed us and no one even cared to seat us. I finally flagged down a server to seat us. If the establishment was busy, that's a different story, but this was at 10pm on a Thursday with only three other tables. The girl that sat us gave us menus and asked if we were doing AYCE and I responded, "No"(I didn't want to stuff myself this late at night). I ordered water and told her I was ready to order, but she said she's not my server. 5 mins passed and our server came to take our drink order, and I told her I was ready to order. I ordered two waters, a miso soup, and 2 simple rolls. The waters and soup came in a timely manner, but I had to flag down a server for a spoon, straws, settings, and soy sauce.  We waited, waited, and waited(@ least 30 mins), saw other customers get their food-while thinking...did they forget our rolls??? I lost patience and called the server over & told her if they haven't yet made our rolls, I wanted to cancel. She glared at me then went over to tell the sushi chef, and he miraculously & immediately passed her a plate with our rolls! What the heck?? While we were waiting forever for our rolls, the sushi chef had them. We never even got an apology for the delay. Not once were we asked if we were ok or needed anything or even got a refill. As soon as we got our rolls, we gulped them down, asked for the check, paid, and bounced!! The rolls were mediocre. Being a good tipper, I left absolutely nothing for such horrible service(from the beginning to the end) :-/.

This place is amazing the sushi is amazing rolls are Incredible the service is fantastic!! Loving the atmosphere and the music. We live in Los Angeles and we come here everytime were in town..I'd recommend this place and    ED THE BEST SUSHI CHEF EVER all day long!

Had a Great time here and had nice service, we got a  private room for our friends Birthday and the service was really friendly and quick ... And I know my group could be a lot to handle at times too ... They did make the stipulation that we could have the private room for 15 ppl if MOst of the group did all u can eat !!

Its been awhile sinced i yelped but i feel that this experience was had to be reviewed. The outside building was charming an the inside felt cozy with a warm atmosphere. Were we greeted with a smile and told there was a wait. Then after we were seated the illusion were off an the nightmare started. Service was less to be desired an often times i was interupted with audible weird sound?? Feeling quite awkward I proceeded to order few sushi rolls and appetizers.  The shrimp tempura was not light and flaky. It tasted more like it coated with a heavy batter an was served not pipin hot but luke warm? The pink lady sushi roll look like my nephew (5yrs old) learned how to make sushi for the first time  The Pokie has three pieces of light colored Ahi Tuna with seaweed and abundance of white onion on the bottom.   Then to make matter worse 5 piece roll, coco roll, an mango roll all over sized pieces that could even fit in your mouth. The fish quality was very poor. Also tasted either salty or extremly sweet.  So i started to look around an noticed that the staff at the sushi bar; food runner who brought the food was just not in a pleasent mood.  They all seemed to give off a tired overworked type of mood. Waiter/waitress haphazardly put the plates anywhere and not clearing the table first of any dishes. My friend ordered the desert. She being brave (lol) ordered the green tea ice cream and that was overspun.   Inconclusion i had high hopes of this place especailly how inviting it seemed on the outside. Alas very disappointed and won't be dinning here anymore. Gave it 2 stars for hostess who greeted us promplty with a smile.

I used to live right down the street from this restaurant and still wouldn't go there because of the slow service. The only time the service was good was when it was slow. Knowing this, I would just get to go orders and never had any problems with that.   Fast forward about 1 year... I was excited to eat here because I was sure they would have their sh*t together by now. Boy was I wrong... Our first round took FOREVER AND A DAY and our server forgot a couple things I had ordered so I ordered once again. I swear saw her scribbling on her notepad while I was telling her what I would like to eat next.  It is quite possible that she was just jotting things down for the grocery store after her shift. We decided to order dessert from the waitress at the next table so that we could have it right after the rest of the sushi came. So, dessert came and we decided to let the creme brûlée sit there on our table until the rest of our sushi came. To our surprise the sushi and our waitress was nowhere to be found!!! A long while later I asked another waitress if she could check on our other sushi orders and she informed is that there were none and she could take our order if we wanted more. THIS IS THE SECOND TIME THIS HAPPENED IN ONE VISIT!!! I tried to give this place another chance and I just feel silly for expecting something better from a place that can't offer anything better than horribly slow service. They deserve NO stars but the sushi that actually made it to the table was okay.  Don't waste your time going here... Drive to Goyemon, SushiMon, or Sushi Twister. I promise, even though the drive is further it'll take even longer to wait around for sushi here.

Dear "Golden Boy",  Maybe you had an off day but I was really disappointed with my AYCE dinner with you today. Upon sitting down there was rice on our chairs. 2 out of the 3 menus have some sauce and brown wet spots all over we wiped off ourselves. Water came out slow. The baked rolls came out lukewarm. The baked mussels were lukewarm. Nothing was hot. Even fried Agedashi tofu was warm. The only hot foods was the kids menu item we ordered (popcorn chicken and miso soup). The busser with the goatee was exceptional. He brought out everything I asked for right away (soysauce, the rice and soup that came with the kids meal). Our plates were not cleared and no one cared to move it when bringing it more food and our table is full of empty dishes already. I had to ask them to clear it. It wasn't a busy night. There were plenty of empty tables and maybe you were understaffed. Regardless, being over polite doesn't make up for subpar service. The tables being serviced by other servers who sat down after us got their food before us. How is that possible when theirs was fried and baked items that take time? You brought me the check even though I was still missing an order. I hope you enjoyed my eels. I came to this location because I've had multiple good experiences at the rainbow location. I should have kept driving and went to Sushi Mon like I originally intended to. Had a really disappointing time tonight. Hope you guys live up to your name so as to not mislead any more people coming for the Oyshi brand of standards.  Another food review: The caterpillar roll which has nothing to do with you had really over cooked, dry and tough eel.
Run by Koreans. Excellent food. Not the most cordial welcome although they were extremely busy which should speak volumes.
Excellent service! Excellent food! Kevin is a great server with excellent customer service skills. He engages the guests and keeps us coming back.

Good lunch spot-fast, good quality and affordable but make a reservation for lunch if you want to make sure you get in since they only have a handful of tables-gyozas and lobster tempura roll are yummy!

I've been here multiple times with my family because of it's convenience in location and the wait time is pretty minimal. The food is decent if you're not a fish snob. I don't even think sashimi is served. All the rolls are heavily seasoned/ sauced-up and majority of them are stuffed with imitation crab (basically different variations of the california roll). I tried a spicy tuna handroll and the fish was not fresh so I had to return it (since you're charged for not eating everything that's ordered from the "all you can eat").  I stick with non-sushi items such as the udon or this teriyaki beef rice bowl. I do like the ninja meal (veggie and shrimp tempura, California roll, and teriyaki chicken) but I can only order it if my nephew comes along (for kids only-and they're really strict about it).  In fact they're so strict that my nephew ordered it and he drank a bottle of milk so he was too full to eat. They wouldn't even let us bring the kids meal home. We had to pay for it but we couldn't pack to go!

Came here for lunch with my daughter... First of all, we received shitty service from the server and chef... took 10-15 minutes for her to stop by to refill our drinks, and retake our orders everytime, we were in there from 330p-530p cuz of slow service, and it wasn't even busy... Second, either the chef doesn't know the menu or he just thought that I was too stupid to know the ingredients in the rolls I ordered cuz I ordered a heart attack roll and the menu says there's yum yum soft shell crab mix inside, I watched him make it and he put regular crab mix inside, I confronted him about it and he denied it and said he did put the soft shell crab mix in it, even though it wasn't cuz there was no soft shell crab in it... Also i ordered seared mackeral nigiri and he served it to me cold, he didn't even sear it... Not to mention they give u small cuts of fish... And 3rd, the worst part about this place... They had flies in their sushi case shittin all over their fish, I didn't even notice em til my daughter showed me... They leave their sushi cases wide open even while they're just standing there with no orders, everyone knows ur supposed to close the sushi cases when ur not using em to prevent that from happening, and to keep the fish as cold as possible, but they just didn't give a shit, I can almost guarantee they're running a dirty kitchen too...Never coming back to this place again..

My boyfriend and I strolled into Oyshi on a weekend afternoon for some AYCE. From the moment we walked in the door the staff was rude and acted like we were bothering them from coming in. There were a few people helping us and not one of them were attentive. It took forever to refill waters and order more food. The staff was very standoffish and everyone from the management to servers to the sushi chefs looked miserable to be working there. I didn't like the atmosphere for an afternoon they were playing party music. Their quality of fish was low and didn't seem fresh. I was very disappointed with this place considering all of the reviews. I have to drive a little bit father for an AYCE sushi place now but it is well worth it, so everyone go to Sushi Koma instead!! Their staff is so friendly and the food is 100 times better!
Favorite sushi place  They have the best sushi in vegas  The staff are very friendly and accommodating

The downfall of our favorite AYCE place???  Since it's opening, my wife and I have patronized Oyshi on S. Rainbow.  For most of this time, the service levels have been at a minimum adequate and mostly 4-5 star.  No longer.  Last night, one of our boys asked to go to Oyshi as he has basically been going since his birth.  Over the past few visits, we noticed a decline in customer service, less knowledgeable staff, and simply less training.  The service culture gives one the sense of barely organized chaos.  The staff is no longer efficient and organized.  It almost felt that we should feel lucky that they were there to bring our food.  Service is now merely "dump and run" with no real follow-up.  Dirty dishes left on table and servers were handing us new plates of food instead of removing the old to make space for the new.  The manager on duty was obviously in over his head.  We were always accustomed to the manager coming over, checking on our food as he did with everyone, and visibly managing and directing the staff.  Unfortunately, that is no longer the case.  As the owners branch out into new concepts (our understanding is they also own Soyu - Korean Barstaurant in the same strip center as well as some other concepts), the better managers (and possibly staff) are going as well.  Problem is, they are not leaving competent (or at least not well-trained) folks behind.  Sad to see.  Oyshi had a great run for a few years.  However unless they get their act together this particular location is headed down a steep slope with no brakes.

Food was great but service was a little strange. You don't order your food from the sushi chef you have to order from the waitress. Also we ordered 3 rolls and some sushi, you would think the sushi comes out first? But they brought out all the rolls and forgot about the sushi until we mentioned we never got it. Overall they're fish quality was great, everything tasted fresh and not fishy :) will be back and they're AYCE is a great deal with a lot of selection :)

The service is horrible !  I've been here before and the sushi wasnt so good but I decided to give it another shot. Bad idea! I was on lunch break ordered two rolls and there. Were five sushi chefs. It wasn't even busy! Took thirty minutes to get my order right and the sushi was just plain messy.  I should've gone to Kobe down the street.

We moved into the neighborhood a few months ago and have been to Oyshi several times. The miso soup and the tempura veggies are delicious. overall this is some of the best sushi we've had. The only reason I didn't give a 5 star review is because the shrimp aren't fried to order for the rolls. The tiger roll is usually one of my favs but not when the shrimp are soggy.

I come here for sushi when I'm craving a solid AYCE menu with a lot of raw fish options. I find if you sit at the sushi bar and just ask the chefs for your order the menu is not very stringent and they are happy to really make you anything you ask for. I found the service of our waitress to be pretty bad. My drink was only refilled once and she was very inattentive. Quality of fish is always good and have never had a problem besides how full I leave. The other options are also very good, I always order the seaweed salad and seared ribeye steak which comes on a sizzling hot pan with cabbage and onions and is a great option on the AYCE menu for those that love a surf and turf. I say the food is great for the price, and the place is only getting 4 for the value I got which is something I look for. But the service was lacking. Still worth a trip!

I have been a regular at this location for over 5 years.  The quality of service has declined steadily over the years - especially the hostess position.  The people they hire are the absolute laziest, who seem more interested in networking than providing actual service.  After checking-in with the host and being told "about a 20 minute wait," I watched people who arrived after me be seated.  After 30 minutes, I asked how is it possible that everyone was seated before me?  The hosted blamed the manager who took my name, but never added me to the wait list.  It seems like whenever you go there, it is a '20 minute wait' even though there are plenty of empty tables.  The food is AWESOME - once you get it - and that's the ONLY reason I keep going back.

My go to spot for sushi as we live in the condo across the street. Sushi is decent, tempura udon is great but the tuna/spicy tuna/salmon/spicy salmon "domes" keep me coming back for more!  Prices are good for Toronto!

The best AYCE sushi place. Never disappoints. The nuclear bomb is amazing. The fish is so fresh. Even if you don't like sushi, you can have their ribeye steak, skirt steak, so many choices. The staff is always friendly. If you still have room, try the parfait or the cream brûlée.

My husband and I have a new favorite place in town. We live in Summerlin and still drive to the Southwest side of town for sushi.  Portions for AYCE would fool you. Sushi pieces are generous and balls of rice are not enormous. The appetizers are good, you have to try Grilled beef asparagus!  Staff is friendly and do their best on busy nights. Make sure you call for reservations on weekend nights.   Also, you can order half rolls from the sushi bar, not tables. So if we go, just the 2 of us, we will sit at the bar.

I love this place beyond love. We eat here every time we are in Vegas. I wish I could box them up and take them back with us to NC. I love all the rolls but my all time favorite roll is the Love Affair. The crunchy topping with the sauce is absolutely amazing. When we lived here we ate here almost every single week. I highly recommend everyone eat here. The all you can eat is the best deal in town by far. It's off the strip always but TRUST ME it's worth it!!!
ayce is the best. great flavor. less one star though because 3 times we did ayce, food was really sloooow to come out from the kitchen.

I usually go to oyshi often but the last time i went the service i had was extremely horrible... so ever since my last visit i never went back... dont get me wrong but the sushi there is really good but they just gotta work on the service... i could of seriously just walked out and they would not notice...

Love this place.. Decor.Nice.Clean. Great vibes from everyone Have been here three time. Great dining experience. Food is excellent. There is a charge if you dont finish your order. The hostess was nice enough to charge us one time.. We had three orders of Rolls that we didnt finish. Left a 25% because the hostess was fantastic! Will be returning.
I don't know why this place doesn't have 5 stars. I am an avid sushi eater and this place is awesome! Really great rolls, good atmosphere!

Been going to this place since it first opened.  David always takes care of us.  This place is always fresh & has high quality AYCE sushi, that rivals non-AYCE places!  Huge assortment and great appetizers too!  Awesome & friendly staff.  It can get super busy, so we usually just slip in and take a seat at the bar rather than waiting for a table.
Love it , very yummy variety and fresh made sushi!!! Havent been here in years happy to be back

Ate here 2x with the fam while visiting Vegas. 2nd time we decided to go with the All You Can Eat, and it was well worth it. If you're hungry, go for this one. They have a large menu, portion is good, price maybe $1-$2 more than what you may be used to. Service starts off slow, but once your first order comes out, everything else will follow. I know we'll be coming here whenever when in town.

I would say Oyshi is the 2nd best AYCE Sushi so far in my books!   Pros: The quality of the food is fresh and delicious. Good customer service. They can accommodate large groups if you plan to throw a get together. Some menu highlights - they have AWESOME selections of sizzling iron plates of Steak Teriyaki, Chicken Teriyaki, and Grilled Salmon. (Unlimited too!) Annnd there Calamari and Popcorn Scallops are so yummy!  Cons: NO HALF-ROLLS available except if you eat at the sushi bar. Getting your sushi orders takes a long time! We waited for over a half an hour after putting our order for sushi, so I recommend that you know what you want and putting in a large order.
This place is awesome everything is good ask the chef for special made hand rolls they're off the hook

Geez - the service has really gone to shit !  4 of us for dinner last night.  2 had AYCE, 2 didn't .  Server had attitude from the beginning - my sense is a combination of being annoyed by the questions, that we all didn't get AYCE and I was the only one drinking .  We were told the problem was the kitchen was backed up .... Really ?  More like the kitchen was fucked up and the server was backed up and someone needed to stick their foot up her ass to cleanse her of the crappy attitude.  The food ?  Gotta admit the sushi was good - sweet shrimp, garlic tuna and Cajun tuna as well as the yellowtail were the stars.  Unagi also worked for me.  The hot dishes ?  The ones we actually got ? Calamari, popcorn scallops, asparagus beef ... Very average.  There were at least 5 dishes they never brought us.  This was a very rare occasion I didn't tip much - $95 bill, $2 tip.  Get it together OYSHI !

I've been going to this place for a few years now and finally getting around to reviewing it. I have only had the all-you-can-eat here, so my 4-star rating is based on quality for an AYCE setting.   Of all the AYCE places I've been to, Oyshi is definitely the best. Their variety of rolls, sushi, and appetizers is the largest. The fish is fresh and the appetizers are quite creative. I highly recommend the Red Rock Roll and Screaming Roll. For appetizers, the Ahi Poke and Agedashi Tofu is always very good. A welcomed difference from many other AYCE sushi places is that Oyshi is a very nice restaurant. It was built to be a sushi restaurant and has the ambiance of one.   Ever since I found Oyshi a few years ago, I have not gone anywhere else in town for AYCE sushi. However, it has really caught on and their business seems to be booming, especially during the peak hours. Because of that, the last couple of time I've gone there, the service has been very, very slow. I actually tried a new place recently, because I didn't want to be there for 2+hours. Outside of that, it's definitely the best AYCE place in town.
Terrific all-you-can-eat sushi. If you're going huge, it's definitely worth the money. Service was slow when we sat at a table but very good at the bar.

Scale of 1 - 10 I give it a 5 at best. The service is adequate but food takes a very long time to get. Yes, it was a busy Friday night but you know what, Friday is busy, staff up already.  The portions of food and presentation are both sub par. The flavors were good but honestly I am not impressed.  It almost feels like they just want you to eat and get out.  The atmosphere is okay. The booth that we sat in had its upholstery all torn up.  Will I go again, NO. Not with all of the sushi joints in town.
AYCE - all you can eat SUSHI and ROLLS (half or full)!  Awesome, definitely enjoyed the spider hand rolls to lobster fair rolls.   Thanks!
Food is overall good but every roll has imitation crabmeat. I'm pretty sure this is their way of getting you full when you choose all you can eat.

This was my second time going to oyshi sushi with my friends and I was very disappointed. The first time I went set somewhat high expectations. The first time the food was excellent, the atmosphere was amazing, the servers were friendly, but speed of service died a little toward the end because it was busy (which is understandable). When my friends and I went yesterday for the second time, the service was below average. Although the servers were really friendly, they constantly forgot about our food. We had to remind them at least 5 times. I could look over it, but it wasn't really busy which irritated me. It was such a let down. Going to have to reconsider coming here again.

A nice place to eat sushi! With a large spacious dining area and a friendly staff, this makes for a good sushi spot. We ordered the Rainbow Roll and the Nuclear Bomb, both good and fun sushi rolls, but took half an hour just to get two rolls. Not impressed.
Had AYCE and everything was amazing! Servers and chefs were very friendly and informative. Will def be back again with friends!

This is one of our go to sushi places because it's close to our house, but also because their AYCE sushi is excellent.  The fish is very fresh and flavorful, except the oysters, which I thought were a little bland.  Lately we've had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated, so this place is definitely gaining in popularity.  The menu has changed somewhat in the past year and now they have more appetizers and dessert, which is definitely a plus!  However you can only order one of the special desserts but you can have all the ice cream you want.  The rolls are solid and the uni has been fresh every time we've visited.

Great selection of sushi rolls, appetizers, nigiri, and other misc. items. The service and atmosphere is the reason why we come back every time when we are craving sushi. We always ask for stefan as our server cause he always provides the best customer service.

I did the AYCE (all you can eat) dinner for $27 and I thought it was worth it. The menu is pretty big but there are a lot of items on the menu that is not included in their AYCE meal. On top of that, you are only allowed to get one dessert. One thing that I like about this place is the fact that they don't make their rolls as if it was for 3 people. This gives you room in your tummy to try more items. Service was above average. They never fail to give you the wrong order at least once while you are dining with them. If you're looking to try a new AYCE sushi spot, try this place.

Ate here with some friends before going to a Japanese taiko concert, as was fitting. A little tricky to find, especially with the road construction, but well worth it. Service was very prompt and friendly, and I LOVED the traditional-styled booths (a little cramped, though. Not much space). Privacy while you eat? AWESOME. The server let me switch out avocado for cucumber in one of my rolls, which was great, because I hate that green mush. I ordered salmon roll, miso soup, and a roll that involved tempura'd lobster, yam, and row. Mmmm. Good stuff. Miso soup was great, free edamame, delicious rolls, didn't really like the tea though, it tasted wheaty. Boyfriend ordered a seafood udon and holy crap, SO much meat in it. But you have to deshell/bone it yourself. Portion sizes were very good, and the server was frequently checking up on us. And, their after-dinner candies were one of my favorites! Those chewy chocolate milk things. Mmm. I ONLY rank it four instead of five stars because there was a very noticeable hair- two, actually, in one of my rolls.

this is one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places in vegas! i always have oyshi cravings every time i crave sushi... i love there oyster shooters in the all you can eat. Most sushi places don't offer that.  The ambiance is pretty bumpin... they play good house music that keeps you going. The rolls are phenomenal and satisfies my cravings till I'm about till I'm about to fall over. Dessert is great i always order the green tea ice cream parfait *drools* Price is $26 for dinner and lunch is about $21 before 3:30pm...

I've eaten at the other location, and liked it. But I tried this place, and I have JUST NOW recovered physically enough from the worst food poisoning I've ever heard of to write this review.  We got the all you can eat for a late dinner.  The sushi was fine, as far as I can remember.  I ordered oysters, two of them came in a little plate.  I slurped down the first one, and it tasted like a corpse soaked in brine.  Since I shoot raw oysters, it was already in, and I figured, what are the odds the second one will taste like that too?  MISTAKE.  I told my dining companions, "Wow these taste like they've been dead for a while..."  I forgot about it and moved on.  That night, my friend (who didn't have oysters) woke up around 1 or 2 am and puked.  She said she was fine the next day.  I was totally fine and figured her puny weakling stomach must've just not been able to handle the onslaught of all you can eat sushi.  I went about my day like a naive, unsuspecting fool.  Wednesday, around 4:00 pm.  In my office.  The rumblings of gastric distress started to bubble.  I had cooked my usual breakfast, and gotten a sandwich from my usual place.  I thought maybe the sandwich wasn't sitting right.  Within 20 minutes or so my vision started hazing, and my stomach started blowing up like that blueberry chick from willy wanka.  I felt nauseous.  Made it to my car and sped home, feeling sicker and sicker.  I bolted to my toilet and JUST made it in time as a violent torrent of vomit erupted from my face like a hurricane.  Violent wretching for several mintues, and then I slumped into my bed, exhausted.  However, there would be little sleep over the next 12 hours.  Every 10 to 15 minutes I would have explosive, violent, searing diaherrea like a poop volcano.  It started to feel dangerous after a full day of this, so I got myself to a hospital. I was diagnosed with a deadly food bacteria present in dirty seafood and prescribed antibiotics. As I got in my car to drive home I projectile vommitted in my car. I had to call a friend to take me home and pick up my meds. I was unable to get out of bed for a full 6 days, except to crawl on hands and knees to destroy my toilet every half hour or so.  Needless to say I will never eat here again.  I also can't see myself eating oysters ever again. Feeling thankful for modern medicine because this is the ish people die from.  NEVER FORGET. NEVER AGAIN.
Second of their restaurants. Great staff. Outstanding sushi and other fare. Really. A fun spot for dining!!

One of my favorite sushi joints, great fish every time and a great menu. Service can be iffy, as they can be very busy. Knocked off one star for that. Both nigiri and rolls were delicious, the fish is very fresh and salmon is delicious. Would keep going back.

Slow service, limit of one dessert per person, subpar rolls and nigiri fish to rice ratio is ALL rice, no actual Japanese people anywhere to be seen (customers nor staff). Should've gone to Sushimon or Sushi on Rainbow.  This place sucks!

For $26, get the all-you-can-eat menu.  The sushi is only ok and not authentic Japanese food.  The fresh oysters, ika with massago, uni, beef terriyaki, and salad are not bad.  The service and chefs are really friendly.

My family has been coming to oyshi for as long as I can remember. At least twice a month. But in the last year the service, staff and food has gone down hill drastically.  The food now takes a lot longer to come out and a lot of the rolls taste like they've been sitting and they started putting lemon juice type sauce on the sushi which makes everything taste horrible. They seem to have changed some rolls and not a change for the better.  Luckily our server tonight has been wonderful, but I she will not make up for the past year.   We now go to the one on Sahara and it seems to be a lot better. This location is so much closer to our house though...
In my eyes the best sushi in town! I recommend getting all you can eat and try the lobster rolls. They are simply amazing

First time going here and thought it was very good, sushi was fresh and the service was excellent if I'm ever on this side of town again I will definitely go back. Also there spicy mayo is really good!

My first time here , we were seated right away,  it's very noisy, so good for groups but not for romantic dinners,  it did tend to be less noisy as the night went on, the sushi was delicious and totally worth the price, in fact it was a steal , all u can eat off the menu, with exception of sashimi , I will definetly be back.
