It's perfect for a large group, and especially for those with big appetites and those who want to try everything off the menu.. They do offer teriyaki which is tasty for those who do not like sushi...

This place has all you can eat and put so much rice on each item.  Fish is not really fresh either and they use very lower quality fish. Also the server is not professional, they take away the plates we are still working on! Very rude server and very rude service! Very unpleasant experience!  A server even touched the food with his thumb when he served! Very disgusting! Obviously, the server did care about the  business! She is there to warn people about the rice left.  I just dont go back and tell people not to go here!
The services was really slow at the bar, after speaking to someone twice we still were not helped. But it's AYCE and tasty ?
Took us 10 minutes to be seated and there was nobody else ahead of us in line. Not at all a traditional sushi place at all with terrible costumer service

Recently I placed a to go order and was quite disappointed when I got home. My food had been made incorrectly and I was frustrated usually the food is excellent and delicious. However despite the mistake, I have to give rave reviews to how the manager Wong (I think that was her name) handled the situation. When I called back to ask to be refunded because I did not want to drive back to have my order fixed she without waiting a beat jumped in to refund me and even offered to give me two complimentary rolls on my next visit. The food has always been great and mistakes happen but it is how those moments are handled that decides whether a person returns or not, and I will be for sure. Definitely recommend the Spicy Maniac roll and the Chung Hua if you like really really spicy. They are fantastic.
Great sushi! So far the best I've had in Vegas!  Fresh and good quality !  The restaurant is also very clean !

My boyfriend and I live right across the street from Oyshi, and we go once a week or once every two weeks. It is soooo delicious and we crave it basically on a daily basis. Lol. I have tried other sushi places, but Oyshi is by far my favorite. I love their baked rolls and appetizers. My favorites are the hot tamale roll, the Japanese lasagna, spicy tuna crunch, potato croquette, egg rolls, Yellowstone, and quite a few others. The sushi chefs behind the bar are very nice. I rave about this place to basically everyone I know. Lol. It gets really busy during the normal dinner hours...which we typically try to avoid because it takes longer for each order to come out. The only reason I rated 4 stars instead of 5 is because the service is a hit or miss. Sometimes we get a really great server who is very attentive to us, but other times we sit there forever before a server finally notices us. Or they take forever to refill your drinks...or they take your first order and forget you're there. It is a little pricey, but so worth it! If you want to eat or try a lot of stuff, definitely go for the all you can eat!

OUR FAVORITE SUSHI SPOT SINCE 2009. We've been here a few dozen times, and are never disappointed with the food or the service! The downfall is that wait times can be extensive at times depending on when you go, but average wait is 10-20 minutes... and it's oh-so worth the wait! Lunch is 22$, dinner is $27. (For children 12 and under, lunch is 16 and dinner is $19.) They use fresh ingredients, the food presentation is beautiful, the service is always great and we always leave so full & so happy! ^___^  We like to order: APPETIZERS: - Ahi poke - Calamari  - Fresh oysters (two pieces per order, one order per person only) - Dynamite (scallop, shrimp, crab mix, mushroom & onion baked w/ yum yum sauce) - Baked mussels (5 piece limit per person)  - Asian skirt steak - Yakitori shrimp & asparagus  - Rib eye steak  SUSHI ROLLS - Love affair - Vegas roll  - Premium spider - Japanese Garlic Lasagna  - Lobster Affair  - Oyshi roll  - Salmon nigiri - Unagi nigiri  DESSERT: - Green tea berry parfait - Vanilla creme brulee  - Green tea ice cream (desserts are one order per customer except for ice cream)  PRO TIP: If you have peanut allergies, you'll be happy to know they do not use ANYTHING with peanuts, none of their dressings contain it and they do not use peanut oil.  PRO TIP II: Also, For parties of 8 or more, 18% gratuity is added to the bill (this includes children and any patrons who are seated at the table, whether eating or not).

The Oyshi on south rainbow blvd is one of our ultimate favorite sushi places in Vegas. Being closer to home, I swore this location would soon be one of my new frequent regulars. Needless to say, I have come here a handful of times but never had anything justifiable to review... on average could never give more than 3 stars, but after this sad encounter, I guess it's time since my rating for it has depleted.   I'm big on customer service & truly believe your server contributes to a large part of your dining experience. Our server's name was Junua, and I wish I could say one good thing about him. He was emotionless, unhelpful & scarce majority of our stay... to order or get refills from him was so difficult. It started with asking for more Splenda since all of the ones given were crunchy from being wet previously & dried. All downhill from there. The place wasn't even busy with only 4 other tables. No excuse honestly.  We ordered our usuals. I don't think it's bias, but the chefs here are just not as good as the rainbow Oyshi location. The ASIAN SKIRT STEAK was dry, the LOVE AFFAIR had not as much lobster & crab but excessive crunch flakes, and the AHI POKE was bland. The GREEN TEA PARFAIT had rock hard granola & was drenched with strawberry syrup. I couldn't even enjoy it. In terms of what was decent? The MONSTER ROLL, SPICY TUNA & SALMON NIGIRI were good.  Oh, they no longer have white tuna on their menu... and apparently there is a one order limit on their baked mussels and they have crossed out the "multiple orders allowed" on their ice cream? I thought this was all-you-can-eat? Lol. I think we are officially done with this place. Aside from the extremely cute decor and fun playlist, it's no wonder this place isn't busy on a Saturday.  *SIDENOTE: He had no name tag on (young black guy), but shoutout to the sweet busser who was friendly and far more accommodating than our server Junua ever was. Get that boy a raise! Our busser honestly is responsible for this being a 2 star rating instead of just 1! We appreciate you, sir.

Everything in the menu is delish!!!!!   Staff are all very nice and courteous, prompt and smile all the time.  I will recommend this restaurant anytime to everyone. Love their weekly lunch special can't beat that too.    Clean utensils and clean all around this place.  Real Japanese place.

I live right down the street from this place so I try to come in whenever I can. I usually sit at the sushi bar to interact w/ the chef's and it's quicker to get your food. I've been here numerous times, but my review stems from the last few times I have come to visit. Most recently my gf & I came in for dinner and the host was not at her station so we proceeded to head to the sushi bar where I typically sit. We sat down and the hostess came to us and asked if someone sat us. We said no due to no one being at the host stand. She said I need to seat you. I informed her, we are already seated and we would like to sit here. She told us the server who worked in that area wasn't accepting tables. We asked if the server working the whole bar? She went back to the stand to look and I followed. She went to go speak w/ another employee to ask if it was okay. I'm guessing the hostess was new since she didn't know what to do. When she came back, she took us back exactly to where we originally went to sit. Pretty frustrating to say the least. So now we are under the impression we have a server. Not really though. A woman came to our seats and provided us w/ a setup and took a drink order. After that, nothing. About 8 minutes went by and the server, our server, comes up and asks us what we wanted to eat. No apology, just took our order. Once we ordered our food, everything was business as usual.  I've had spotty service here since coming here. I come for the food and that's why I sit at the sushi bar because it cuts out the time the server has to take to grab the food and deliver it. The chef just hands it to you. The best option here is the AYCE because just about everything is up for grabs. Oh and if you don't know, which most don't since it's not on the menu, you can order pork belly. It comes in a serving of 4. Even regulars that come in don't know. You're welcome :)

No more sushi-mon for me -  ever.  This place has only decent service but very good food.  No sushi place can be great unless it is by the sea.  We are in the middle of the desert in America, so let's be real; this isn't Japan or Korea.  However, that being said: for Vegas it is pretty good. Not a lot of rool options, but the ones they have are tasty.

Dinner ordered: Spicy salmon handroll Chirashi sushi Dynamite rolls Dragon rolls  All of the above is below average in the sense that, I have had better in foodcourt sushi shops and grocery market takeout. Sushi and sashimi quality did not wow us and quality of fish is not great nor fresh. The width of the rolls were not cut evenly... We went on a Saturday night 8pm, sushi turnover might not be at peak given they probably have most customers during weekday lunch. But that should not be a customer concern. Price range is reasonable like other yelpers have raised but with this quality I would not say it lives up to its value, unfortunately.  They have great customer service, they are welcoming and kind. Every time when I say thank you, the lady would say you are very welcome to me. One thing I found quite concerning was when the bill came, it was one of those traditional handwriting bill that they filled it out themselves. I looked at it closer and I realize they built in 10% service fee in the final number and they did not even write that category out on the paper. Pretty surprised a traditional small sushi shop would go on that route, please be aware if you go and check your bill.  Sadly, would not recommend nor return.

Got picked up from the airport and came straight to a late night dinner. It wasn't too busy and the customer service was decent. I used to come here a long time ago and loved it. The quality of food decreased slightly and there were so many other sushi places that were better that I stopped coming.  Well my husband and I decided to come back since they are open later than other good sushi places close by. We were surprisingly satisfied. The quality seems to have gotten better. I'm definitely coming back! Sucks we couldn't order half rolls though. You can only do half rolls if you are seated at the bar. What's the difference?  I vote to have that changed!
Great experience. Sat at the bar and just let Nacho (sushi chef) create his own delicious rolls. Better than the menu items

I work next door and this is a popular lunch spot for us. They have a very good lunch combo which is reasonably priced and comes with a large portion of food made up of miso soup, a salad, gyoza, your choice of a sushi item and your choice of a grill item. I've had takeout from then as well, I'd rate the sushi itself as a 3.5-4/5 but the value for money solidifies a 4/5 rating for me.  It's a small place though so recommendations are a good idea or leave early to beat the lunch rush.

This isn't my first time eating at Oyshi, but my first time checking into Yelp. We don't come in everyday, but my family and I do come in often enough to know a couple of familiar server faces. Kevin is definitely an amazing server! No matter how busy he gets, he's always attentive and always has a great attitude! If you come to Oyshi on SAHARA, request for Kevin. HES THE MAN!! I'm more than 100000% sure you'll love him as much as my family and I do.   To top it all off, if you may know..the sushi buffet is the best! Super tasty and comes out quick! All seating is comfortable. Counter and tables! Love this place to death.

Now I don't know how many check-in's I have on Yelp, but I've been here a fair amount of times to know what is good and what is bad about this place. This was the first AYCE sushi place I've been to here in the valley and it's not in my top 3 places. To sum it up, Oyshi is so hit or miss that it's almost a risk to come here. Yes, you'll come here see that there's a long wait and expect it to be great but the last few times I've been here and given chance after chance, I've left disappointed.   First of all, I used to work in a restaurant. Server's know when it's busy, trust me, and as a customer I expect you to acknowledge that. The times that I've waited for a decent amount of time, I've never been apologized to about the wait or been given an explanation when the rolls I've ordered don't come out when it seems like people who just sat down are getting there's before me.   I'm not that selfish, but I just feel like the service here is poorly conducted. I've felt that it takes a group of us to look around constantly before someone comes and asks if we need anything. The rolls are always very good, but the amount of time that it takes most times I'm there is not average to the sushi places I've been to.   I will admit I do love their Salmon Nigiri and the Love Affair roll but a lot of the other rolls often feel like there is just too much going on. I don't like to complain, but the service isn't up to my standards and my standards aren't extremely high. I just expect my water to be refilled within a decent time and asked if I'd like to order more without having to ask to order more.   I am very forgiving and I will come here, I just don't have the expectations that I once did. The sushi is usually very fresh and the options aside from the sushi are great. I always order the calamari and the surf-n-turf appetizers when I come here. I would recommend this place to a friend, I think I would just advise them to be go-getters with their servers and make it known when they want something. All in all, if someone said they were coming here tomorrow, I'd probably join them. Cheers!

Always a crowd pleaser . Excellent service and foods.  Always having the Rib Eye Teriyaki appetizer and the Double Salmon.  Everyone I bring here never complain,  in fact sometimes we might eat here twice in one day !

This location has been under two different names . The quality of the sushi is not the same as the location on Rainbow . The service is OK . Improvements are needed if they want to carry the Oyshi's reputation. The only thing I liked was that they weren't packed like the Oyshi on Rainbow .

Great fresh food! The wasabi was even super fresh ! The bento lunch special was a big portion and very tasty. I ordered the 3 hand tool special. A special note the yum yum scallops are actually a mix of mostly crab meat and a few scallops. So specify if you are looking for just scallops. Everything was delicious and the service was good too!

Damn, where do I start... this place has one of the best AYCE sushi bar for a price under $30. I love Japanese food, so I'm quite critical when it comes to quality. The quality here is equal to the quality in Japan.  For starters, I'd begin with the Ahi Poke, Shrimp & Asparagus, Dynamite and Ribeye Steak Teriyaki.   When you're ready for battle, I'd suggest the Yellowtail Trio, Atomic Bomb, Red Dragon, and Bonzai Rolls!  To complete the food madness, grab some mochi green tea ice cream!  So who's down for a Vegas run?
Food was great and everyone was nice. They took back a roll that we did not order without a problem. Definitely going to come back with more people.

Horrible service. Went 20mins before getting our drinks, half of the food we ordered NEVER came out! Most of the food served for one of my guests either tasted like freezer burned sashimi & tasteless ribeye! This is the 2nd Sushi place I've tried here in Vegas & lets just say that I am far from impressed.   Kudos to our waitress Toni for picking up the slack of her coworkers & handling what could be an irate situation with patience.

Best sushi in town!!!  Great prices too.  Waitstaff is very accommodating. My wife is vegetarian and the chefs make her special rolls. We have been to many all you can eat sushi restaurants and this place is by far the best!!

I just want to say Oyshi is one of the best All-you-can-eat sushi places around Las Vegas. In fact, a year ago I would have given it a 5 star rating. The reason I only gave a 4 star is because the quality of service has dropped. Largely due to the fact that it has gotten so much busier. There are more waiters but they do not tend to the customers fast enough. The food is great, but for an all-you-can-eat spot, you will enjoy the large menu they offer. The food is always fresh because of the amount of traffic they had. You can find your favorite server and request them to serve you.. Usually requesting anyone to serve you in particular will encourage them to serve you better. I am sure everyone was expecting my 4 star rating to be all positive but I've gone to Oyshi since it opened and I understand the restaurant has grown from what it originally was. The service has dropped a little but they still offer you great food for a great price.

I love this place. The price is reasonable. Everyone pretty much summed it up. Their Oyshi rolls are the BOMB. I love their Surf and Turf too... Another thing that is awesome about this place is that they sometimes get the UFC fights and you get to eat all you can eat sushi for $26 and watch the fights for free... Like tomorrow night. Make sure you make reservations cause its pretty small and seats get filled fast!

I have been here a few times and have always loved it. This place is so clean you could eat off the floors. No but really. I would come here more often if it werent so far away from me. Love the surf and tuf.
Really good screaming O and I love the pumpkin croquette it's very good. I asked for fresh wasabi and they gave us a lot, which is nice because I use tons of it!

By far the best sushi place in Las Vegas! Ej the server is great and always there for your needs AND I know they don't like to admit this, but I know they have one of the cooks on the aux or DJing cause he's cooking the restaurant up with bangers !!

Has been a looong time since I went to Oyshi, as my first experience here was less than memorable, and pre-Yelp.    Some colleagues talked me into another visit recently, and I have to say, I was pleased with the AYCE lunch special.  I found a couple rolls that were interesting and spicy.  Enjoyed them both thoroughly.  My colleagues raved about their selections also.  The sushi chefs were very courteous, and the waitress was quick to assist with questions and recommendations.    I will definitely keep this on my lunch list, and may have to make an evening visit, when you really decide on that last star at a local sushi spot!  "Kanpai!"
So delicious !! Best place in Las vegas. I love "all can you eat" !! :)

My husband and I love this place like many locals in Las Vegas. Quality is always good. We orders All You Can eat. My favorite are sushi spicy tuna, shrimp tempura and the potato croquette. The location on Sahara is quieter than the other one. Personally, I like i better.

Love the Halloween spirit, food & excellent service by Game & Sabas.  Remarkable!  The sushi bar & whole restaurant was packed so I was surprised that they sat us so quickly on a Sunday night, 10.22.17, 6:30pm.  My first time, guess we got lucky!  We ordered many items & not one was left behind.    Sizzling Ribeye plate over cabbage, side of rice, miso soup & the salad had a tasty ginger dressing & was larger than a usual side dish.  Cooked perfectly & well seasoned  ribeye, sliced.  They offer Teriyaki Chicken, Surf & Turf, Asian Skirt Steak & Sweet & Spicy Pork also.  Salmon Lover Roll, Game's recommendation was fabulous!  Lite lemony mustard cream drizzle over tempura salmon, avocado, cream cheese rolled in rice & topped w/ fresh salmon!  Delish & I will start w/ it again!  I'm not a Spicy Tuna Roll fan, but we also ordered the Spicy Tuna Crunch which was fantastic.  Jalapeño, cream cheese deep fried & topped w/ spicy mayo & eel sauce so you can't go wrong.  Many rolls have cream cheese btw.  I usually look for the ones that are more fresh so next time will sit at the sushi bar & experiment.  I did love our servers recommendations tho!    Our Vegan friend got the Cucumber & Avocado roll which was also delish.  Overall, the menu is very appetizing w/ numerous items that I must come back for & I was happily surprised by everything at Oyshi.  Cheers!

We were just there on Sunday night and was very pleased with everything.  This was our first time there and we sat at the bar and had a blast of a time.  The guys behind the counter making the sushi were attentive to our needs and made us laugh.  When we go back to Vegas, we will make sure to go back to Oyshi Sushi again and bring friends.

Busy day and it seems like they're short handed? Bad service. We were told only 20 mins wait and it become 1 hour wait. Worst service. Didn't even get a refill for our drinks. Can't do half order and you can only order one dessert. Sushi don't taste good. Calamari was hard and cold. Employee don't know what the heck are they doing. Manager should know better that valentines day is busy people are out to have dinner. You should've schedule extra people.

Hip and trendy. Probably the most attentive service I had in a long time!  The server constantly asked us if we needed anything and made sure our glasses were filled with water.  The place is clean, aesthetically pleasing.  They have an all you can eat deal for 20 bucks for lunch..but I decided to go with a la carte. I ordered the Chirashi bowl hoping to fill my craving of when I get the Korean version called Hweh do bap.  The rice had too much vinegar flavoring, the sashimi wasn't cut thin enough and didn't taste too fresh at that.  My search is still on for THE BEST SUSHI in town.

4.30.11 I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere, it was cute for a huge restaurant. It was dim, but not to the point where you can't see anything. I really like their sushi bar it's really big. The tables in the restaurants are nicely spaced so you're not rubbing elbows with your neighbors. I'm not used to Japanese Restaurants that can accommodate several large parties. They had two private rooms and we were in another area that was semi-private. There were 9 of us and we sat comfortably. I really like the painting they had against the wall in our semi private area. It was actually the only painting I saw throughout the restaurant.   I have never eaten at an AYCE sushi in Las Vegas away from the strip so I was super excited. I ordered their Agedashi tofu and it was so Salty! Stay away, ha ha. I was disappointed but quickly got over it when I tasted their poke salad. I remember ordering the Kimono Roll, Yellow Trio and dessert. I had more than that, but I was so amazed how refreshing everything tasted I was too excited to remember to write it down. When I ordered I stayed away from tempura or anything baked. I was not going to get full off that, I wanted fish. Their sushi was fresh and I especially remember the salmon handroll, it was perfect. I really enjoyed their food, although the oyster was okay and their uni really looked like it needed a makeover.   Their Service was super duper good, although for some reason I was the last one to receive my order. That made me the last one to eat the desserts everyone was done while I was still waiting. Ha ha. Do not pass up on ordering their Mochi Ice Cream. Doesn't matter if you're full and your fly is about to pop, still order their dessert.  So overall, next time I will definitely come here for their AYCE! Their selection of rolls for their AYCE is plenty, not like other places its mainly filled with baked and tempura stuff. This one had plenty of raw fish in their rolls. Just the way I like it!   Don't be a fool and miss out on this wonderful meal..

We are big on sushi and still been looking around for the best AYCE sushi places in vegas. Been seeing Oyshi but finally decided to try it out for lunch.   Sorry to say, for the first experience, i'm probably not gonna be coming back.   Service is very slow. Our first order of Ikura, Saba and spicy tuna took nearly 20 minutes to make. non of which is cooked and the restaurant was not very busy.   When we finally got our sushi, the rice was mushy. pieces were very small.   It took a while before we could put in our next order which again took a while to get to us.   Apparently we weren't the only ones not satisfied with the service. had 2 other tables that were commenting the same thing.   On to the next sushi restaurant.
CHEF ED! ahhhhhh thank you for the absolutely amazing hand roll sushi  to die for ! Always good service at the sushi bar !

1 star?  Why?  2 Words - FOOD POISONING on the night of 11/05/2011  Totally ruined my last date night with my wife before I deploy for the military when you are praying to the porcelain gods hurling with nori blowing out of your nose...graphic I know...   To top it off, the rolls were mediocre compared to Sushi Twister and Sushi Xtreme and the service was slow for the amount of people in the restaurant.    What are my credentials to be badmouthing this "highly" rated yelp institution?  5 years living on Honolulu and knowing what sushi restaurants are supposed to taste like, but what do I know...uggh worst night ever afterwards SMH
Great quality with great price.  Their dishes are more fusion Japanese than traditional, but I enjoyed it.  Sashimi grades are excellent

Average sushi at best but considering that for $27 you can get all you can eat lunch, I'm a fan.  Pros: 1. decent selection of rolls, sashimi, appetizers for the buffet option 2. friendly service  Cons: 1. No sweet shrimp or uni (sea urchin) for lunch buffet (dinner only) 2. Dynamite roll had wayyyy too much mayo which was gross 3. No all you can eat dessert!? Wanted some more of that strawberry mochi!  Recommendations: I'd choose the skirt steak over the other steaks. Yellow halibut is awesome (don't get the baby halibut as it is bland). Any of their rolls is decent but nothing really stood out to me in particular.  Definitely worth coming back for the lunch special

Best sushi buffet! So good! We definitely ate our money's worth of food! The service was super slow, which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. They have a huge parking lot right outside. there was no wait when we went in for dinner on Thursday night. Too bad this place isn't on the strip, or it'll be packed! Should definitely drive out from the strip to try this place!
Excellent service (Anthony & Curtis) & great food. Loved it. $21.00 FROM 4-5:30, happy hour!
This place is outstanding! The sushi I fresh and they serve it to fast. 2 for 1 beer?.. doesn't get Any better!..staff is incredibly friendly and attentive

Great sushi, big selection, with reasonably priced lunch combos. The restaurant is very small but has a quaint, intimate atmosphere with traditional Japanese decor.   The maki rolls are consistently yummy, not too ricey with a decent amount of fish in them. The sashimi is also great, if you like butterfish I'd highly recommend the butterfish sashimi, very creamy tasting.   A must try for salmon lovers is the Salmon Dom (Salmon sashimi pieces over rice with avacado slices). The Salmon Dom offers a large portion of fresh delicious salmon sashimi with yummy creamy avacado at the best price point I have seen from Salmon Dom ($13.99) usually I have seen this dish priced at $15.99-$18.99 at other comparable sushi restaurants.

Love the food and service! Great spot for AYCE. Been going to this location for years and has always been great! Only complaint would be the hours. They say they're open until 2 am, but I have gone multiple times around 12 and they've been closing super early!   I work in the restaurant industry and get it that on slower nights you might close early. But when there's a line out the door of people you are turning away, doesn't seem smart for business or for customer satisfaction. I would NEVER go to a restaurant 5 minutes or even an hour before close, but closing 2 hours early? Really??   Food is great tho. Just go in 4+ hours before close to ensure you can be seated.

More than half of the time I visit Vegas, I spend the whole time off of the strip. Lately, I've really been trying to find local "Off strip" eateries and establishments. The last few times I've been to town, I've gone to Oyshi Sushi. It's conveniently close to my folks' house. Oyshi has two different set-ups. One is AYCE (All you can eat) and the other is A la carte. I've done both. The service and staff are good, the place is clean, and the prices are average. The sushi is good but not spectacular and the portions aren't as meaty as I'd prefer. Now, this isn't a reason for me not to eat at Oyshi, but yeah, it's nothing to write home about.

Initially, I found it very odd that every review on this place was 5 stars but after eating here, I couldn't agree more! We came on a Sunday for a surprise lunch for my mom for Mother's Day (I made sure it wasn't ON the actual day so she'll be genuinely surprised. Hehe) Let me start off by saying that I've never been to the other Oyshi location so I'm not here to compare or anything like that.  So, the interior is just GORGEOUS! High ceilings, beautiful decor, bold, gorgeous color. The tables, benches and chairs are comfortable and spacious. Our hostess greeted us with a smile and our server Kyle, was just as delightful. He was so sweet and nice and accommodated us very well. Always checked up on us, with a smile every time.   Now on to the food. Divine! I've had a lot of sushi and Japanese food, in general and this place is one of the best I've ever been to. Food quality is amazing. The fish was so fresh and sushi never broke apart (Sadly, I've been to a lot that does & it's not pleasant). Hot foods came to us really hot so we knew they were freshly cooked. I loved it!  Oh & the best part would have to be the price. AYCE lunch was $21.95. For the classiest, yummiest, Japanese food, that is inexpensive! Sushi items seemed endless so you'll have a variety on top of the kitchen items. And please, please, please, try the Green Tea Creme Brulee & Green Tiramisu. Eating them was.. love at first bite!
for all you can eat, you can't beat this place... service is great and the ambiance is pretty trendy, especially if they play trance during your dinner... can't beat that...
Excellent food! Great service! Reasonably priced! Our second time here and highly recommend! Told were really wonderful! One if the best sushi places in town!
The AYCE here is LOVE. So many options but the quality is there; apps are so yummy. Always a fun time here. Thanks for serving Sharon, we'll be back to see ya.

This is one of the best AYCE sushi joints out there. Their fish is fresh and the portions are right. The sushi is big enough for you to actually taste it, but at a size where you don't get full quickly. My staples at any AYCE sushi joints are eel and avocado handrolls and nigiri. I'm not a big fan of rolls and this place does it for me. They also have additional appetizers that you won't find at typical sushi restaurants. I really like their seaweed salad, which is quite the generous portion. Seaweed salad is expensive and this place does not skimp out. The albacore is especially good at this restaurant. They have these sizzling plates which comes out on fajita wooden plates. I have tried the surf and turf which is really delicious. I would recommend getting one to share with a few friends. The appetizer portions are small, but they do fill you up. Try sharing the appetizers so you can save room for the real stuff. With this said, the best part truly is the dessert. This place by far has the best tasting Creme Brulee I have ever had. The only bad thing is that dessert is not all you can eat, it's only one per person. Make sure you leave room for dessert because you do not want to miss out. I have been here twice and will definitely come back the next time I'm in town. The service has been great during both of my visits. The food is usually out at the right time and you never have to wait too long for your orders. The waiters are also really sweet. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!

whenever im in vegas i always go out of my way from my mainstay on the strip to go here because its worth the side trip.  prior to XS, i brought my group of 8 here and it definitely started the night off correctly...the staff was friendly and seated us in the private room which provided a more intimate atmosphere given out attire.  in the main room, there is the usual sushi bar and a few flat screens to get a lil more rowdy. in essence, it caters to all types of occasions which i liked.  as far as the food goes- amazing. nuff' said
Awesome all-you-can-eat sushi buffet that includes dessert and hot plates. Can get busy at times but we'll worth the quality sushi rolls!

Gonna base this review with overall experience. Honesty I didn't enjoy myself besides the company I was with. The service there is horrible... Horrible!! I would've possibly given this review a 3 based on the fresh sushi.. Wasn't so bad.. But it slightly tastes fresh even if sitting at the bar not having been served ASAP to the customer.. So sushi pretty delish.   But honestly the service there is beyond poopy because.. Sure went on a Sunday, did not wait for a seat but I did wait just to order a glass of water just about 15 minutes.. Just to order that damn water.. And behind me was a wife and kid and the server finally asked are you waiting for something? And she responded. "yes my sushi, I've been waiting for 20 minutes"  Yeah... Keep that in mind and enjoy!

By far the best all-you-can-eat sushi places I have ever been to. My cousin, who lives in the area, claimed that this place has really good sushi and an even better all-you-can-eat deal. As I'm from San Francisco, I was a bit cautious and not too optimistic about the quality and freshness of the fish, however I was quickly impressed with the large variety of rolls, fish as well as other main entrées and appetizers on the menu. I started with the simple seaweed salad and edamame, both which were well seasoned and served at the perfect temperature. Typically I am a fancy, combo roll fan but I will have to say that the quality of fish made the simple rolls one of my favorites of the night. The spicy yellowtail roll was very good as was the salmon avocado. To finish off, the all-you-can-eat menu there is a choice of dessert. I'm always a fan of the green tea ice cream and in this instant the ice cream was superb.  Will def go back the next time I am in Vegas.

Friendly but WORST SERVICE Ever!!!!!  We had to ask for our server 3 times, we only ordered twice ayce cause they were so slow.  Food is not as good as the oyshi on Rainbow.  We will never come back!!!!  Very poorly managed, not enough servers and over staffed in other positions.  On top of that manager walked by several times and saw are drinks were empty and did nothing about it.  Best part was the trio creme brûlée which there is no trio only one reg creme brûlée.  Sushi rice was very mushy.

Very bad service !!! Food was good but u wait a long time for ur food.... The only thing the servers can do so quick is when they give you ur check....not very nice is like there doing it in purpose....i dnt ussually do this review but we were there 3x & still same .....

This place was actually really great. I have not heard of it and came here on a whim thanks to Yelp. I was pleasantly surprised by what I found. This place is a nice size restaurant with a large sushi bar-, which is a super plus. The wait staff was nice and the sushi chefs were super friendly. They were super helpful as well (not to mention one that was super cute lol.) I ordered two rolls, both spicy. One had a spicy chili such and was deep friend. The other had Cajun albacore on the top - SO AMAZING. I would go there and order everything with that on top of it. The flavor was nice with a subtle kick in the back. I also had the crème brulee trio- also called the trilogy (by the cite sushi chef) The green tea wasn't good at all- way too strong but the other two, vanilla and chocolate were excellent. The chocolate was absolutely fantastic and I'm not a huge fan of chocolate crème brulee. Also the fact that they're all you can eat was only 26.95 is a super plus. They have a variety of specialty salads and appetizers you can ad onto that that looked amazing. Unfortunately I didn't have enough room for that but Ill be back! Probably next week with a friend.

My absolute favorite sushi chain here in Las Vegas! They have an All You Can Eat (AYCE) menu with many to choose from! Personal favorites: Love Affair, Vegas Roll, and Ribeye steak! For dessert I usually get vanilla creme brûlée or mochi ice cream!

The sushi was amazing and the service to match! This is the best sushi in Las Vegas! The food, service, and ambiance are phenomenal! Thank you Oyshi for a wonderful dinner and experience, I would recommend this place to anybody looking for amazing sushi and not looking to break the bank!
Fantastic Sushi spot. Delicious through and through and fast service. The All You Can Eat is a fantastic deal. The garlic albacore nigiri is off the charts!

I was coming through vegas on my move across country, and great friend said he wanted to take me out for sushi.  This was a special occasion for several occasions:  we were meeting after knowing each other online for ten years, it was a few days before my birthday and most importantly, I'd never eaten sushi before. I told him to pick somewhere really special and where I could try several different things because I wasn't sure what I'd like.  He said that Oyshi was all you can eat, which meant I could sample just about anything I wanted.  We ordered everything. This little guy put away about 18 pieces of yellowtail.  I tried it and it was ok, though the rolls were definitely the star.  The fried calimari was amazing.  We ordered fantasy roll, sexy roll, love affair, and dragon roll.  It was all amazing! if I had to pick my favorite, it was the love affair.  We also got seaweed salad, sweet shrimp, and fried scallops. The only thing I didn't care for was octopus, but it was a personal preference.  it was amazingly good, all of it, and they were so nice! Service was excellent and since 2 people in our party were almost an hour and a half late, they even let us stay longer than the two hours allowed.  It was the best first experience having sushi that I could've had!

Oyshi has been my favorite all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant for a long time.  Great food, great service.  This visit was no exception.  Went after work in a group of 7 around 10 pm.  No problems!!  We ordered a LOT of food...different rolls, sushi, appetizers, all of which were delivered quickly to our table.  Our server, Thomas, was great.  He and his staff kept our drinks filled and our table cleared of empty plates.  I've tried other places for AYCE sushi....and they've been good as well.  Oyshi always hits the mark, though, and they are open late allowing for late night dining.  Except on Sunday when they close a little earlier.  Me and my co-workers will definitely be returning!!!

It was just OK. We went based upon raves from our friends who went for the AYCE deal. We are not AYCE fans but decided to try the ala-carte option.  It's a very large place and was bustling on a Saturday night. Lots of families. Very loud booming music (not for us) When we go out we look for a relaxing experience - this isn't it.  We were greeted warmly by the hostess and our server. When we said we didn't want AYCE we were given an additional menu. So we had a large menu with the rolls and AYCE info and another with "dinner" options. They have lots of rolls with the "dynamite" mix which seems to be Krab mixed with other seafood and mayo.  The sushi is a B-. Certainly the quality isn't up to our other favs like Sen and Soho but not bad. They have a lot of rolls and cooked menu options. I had the "steak" on rice. In parens because it seemed more like chopped beef. It didn't resemble a quality steak but for $12 who could expect otherwise. The sauce was high in sugar and salt. Very tasty but we were thirsty all night.  The tempura was very greasy. Not a redo.  Service was great!  Prices are very reasonable and you get a lot with the dinner orders. If you like a lot of ok food at cheap prices this is definitely the place for you.

My friends and I went here to celebrate their 20th birthdays. It's hard to find a sushi place with a lot of room. Our party consisted of 30 people. Our server Ondree was AWESOME! Mind you gave a lot of suggestions to my friends who haven't been there before. He had a great personality and a ton of patience. He ended up printing us all separate checks without us even asking. Can't wait to go back again! Enjoyed dinner a ton, great company and great service!!! :) Thanks again Ondree!
Went with a large party this past week, more than half of us became VERY ill with food poisoning Beware!!!!!!  Never again !!!!

After years of going to crowded sushi bars with minimal arm room between me and others, I found a location with comfort as well as a great selection of sushi creations. The restaurant is an upscale environment with room for large parties.    - The restaurant offers a huge menu of both sushi and hot kitchen items (e.g., sushi, koma, Hamachi, sizzling hot plates of steak and seafood, tempura, oysters, soups/salads, and desserts).   -  There is usually a wait to be seated. The wait is sometimes as long as an hour during peek dinner times. You can drop in to be put on the list, and they will text you when they are ready to seat you. They take reservations.   - They offer an all you can eat sushi menu for about $25 that includes one desert (e.g., green tea ice cream, creme brûlée, Moche ice cream).  - My favorites are the yellowtail koma, double salmon roll, surf and turf sizzling hot plate, spicy tuna hand roll, fresh sashimi red snapper and halibut, Red Rock sushi roll, and the vanilla creme brûlée with green tea ice-cream.   I've been to this location over a dozen times in just the last four months - my most frequent visit being last week for lunch. I generally ask for my favorite sushi chef and server, and I am willing to wait for them. Vincent is the best server!  This restaurant generally wants the server to tell the sushi chef your order even as you sit at the bar. At first I wasn't fond of this process, but it works well and there isn't a lag in service. The sushi chef still hands you your order -it just prevents you from yelling out at a busy chef. Vincent offers exceptional service that includes getting your beverages, kitchen items, and sushi bar order. He is exceptional.   The sushi chefs are all awesome, but my favorite is Ivan. When the restaurant isn't too busy, he will inquiry if you want anything. If you request, he will also make creations for you based on what he notices you like. He is efficient, creative, and humorous.

Excellent fresh sushi, an all you can eat menu, and great customer service!  I rotate between the rainbow location and this one depending on who is working.  Father's Day was a busy night. Still, the restaurant reserved my seating for three in front of Chef Daniel at the Sushi Bar.   The all-you-can-eat menu is pages long and includes sizzling hot plates (e.g., surf & turf), cold salads, hot soups, tempera, sushi combinations, and one selection from their dessert section for about $25.00. Although the Hamachi Kama isn't included in the all-you-can-eat price, I usually order it. It is on of my favorites.  The atmosphere is relatively quiet and roomy. The lighting is dime in the evening. This restaurant offers a more private atmosphere with room for large parties as well. They have a full service bar. They have TV's at the bar and the sushi bar.   The restaurant often has daily sushi fresh catches that are available for the all-you-can-eat patrons. I love when they have the red snapper and fresh conch.   You won't be disappointed!

Been going here since they opened. Best all you can eat sushi in Vegas.  Prepared to order and too many favorites to list. If you want to explore a large variety of tasty items this is the spot. I make it a point to visit at least once a month and never disappointed.

Always love coming here... They always go light on the rice, a quality you can't find in too many all you can eat spots. Some of the rolls are a little saucy for me but once you have it once just ask for easy sauce next time. Great service, good food... What else can you ask for?

Amazing restaurant! One of my favorite for appearance, food, friendliness and manners in all of the Las Vegas Valley. The All You Can Eat is outstanding; I highly recommend Tako, Sake and Ebie Raw Sushi and Shrimp and Veggie Tempura. Follow by Berry Vanilla Ice Cream Parfait. This is always wonderful and I am happy when I can eat here often!!

I really wish that we had an Oyshi near my house. Their all you can eat sushi is the best. Make sure you also ask for stuff that's not on the menu, such as white tuna.  Conclusion: high quality food that makes you satisfied

AYCE sushi!! Apparently there quite a few of these places in Las Vegas, but Oyshi cannot be beat!   My cousins ordered for us since my BF and I were first timers. Some of the rolls they ordered included the Sunset, Spider, Philadelphia. And of course - lots of nigiri! The ahi belly and salmon nigiri were my faves.   Finally, dessert! we had the green tea creme brûlée, the vanilla creme brûlée and the green tea tiramisu. All were winners!!  Lunch for us was $22 per person. We went around 1pm on a weekday, which was great because it wasn't that busy. Be warned that the appetizers are not included in the AYCE, so be sure to ask your server what's included. Our server was helpful and gave us suggestions for various rolls and nigiri. However she got busy and would disappear for long periods of time... oh and the hot water machine was broken, so no miso soup or hot green tea :(  Cheers to AYCE sushi!! We'll be back!
Love it! Big menu and fresh sushi!!! Staff is always pleasant. It can get busy on the weekends but they have call ahead seating!

Was sick and was craving for hot soup and noodles. The only place open past 10pm around the Harbourfront area was Oysi Sushi  I ordered the Tempura Udon which came out to $12.95.   First the typical Japanese salad came out with a huge side order of Edamame which was a pleasant surprise.  For the main entree, the udon was chewy and the broth was tasty. It came with tempura crispies, artificial crab, slices of fish cake and some veggies. About two minutes later, a basket of tempura came out. There was around 8 pieces which is plenty for one person. I was completely satisfied with the portion size, price and service. Will be back here again, but to try their sushi plates.

Great food! So fresh. The table management is god awful. People stacked on top on each other in the lobby with open tables and at least 6 seats at the sushi bar. We literally watched money walk out of the door as customers got frustrated with waiting. Lots of choices for food in our area and more restaurants opening every month. Get it together please!

5 MF stars  ALL YOU CAN EAT for $22 my dude  Great music  Friendly staff  I cannot stress how freaking delicious this place is. My radio co-host from Cake And Sausage brought me here because she knows my heart.  We EASILY ate OVER $100 in sushi, surf n turf, tempura and poke for $22 my guy. Twenty two dollars total!!! It included dessert   Lobster rolls, BSCR iCant. Just come here
Food was good and fresh! but not really happy for the service... It's all you can eat, sometimes missing some orders and the food come out quite slow!

The AYCE sushi is great! The sushi rolls taste amazing, my personal favorite is the Nuclear Bomb and the Love Affair! Small appetizers and spicy sushi bowls are included as well as a specialty dessert. Get the green tea tiramisu, you can make all the other stuff in your kitchen and it tastes amazing.   Although the food is great, service is baddd. I'm pretty sure our server forgot the entire entree for my friend, as his food didn't come out until we were very much done with ours, and the rolls were not very difficult to make. Some servers took their sweet time just walking around the place with an FML look on their face. Overall, the food was great which keeps me coming back, but I definitely have to tolerate the service.

This place is amazing. we will never go to another all you can eat sushi restaurant .we've been there over 20 times always had consistency with the food experience . The fish is always fresh, Green mussel are amazing.The all you can eat menu is very large... Yummy yummy.
This is my favorite AYCE!  Service is good, nice environment, and good food!  Just be patient if you're going with a big group.  ;)

I'm very surprised at the high ratings of this place. I went there today while on a business trip to Toronto and didn't feel like driving so I decided to try this place out that seemed to have a SOLID 4.5 stars.  I ordered hot sake which was the best thing I had.  Then they bring me edamame as a free treat this stuff was dry as if it was sitting out for hours, I'm not making this stuff up folks.  I ordered Squid, Yellow tail, a volcano roll (I think that's what it was called) and my favorite of all Uni (Sea Urchin) All of it was terrible, very dry like it had been sitting around for a while and not very flavorful. Well I always save the best for last; I put the Uni in my mouth and started eating it and I got this nasty bitter taste. Unfortunately I had already swallowed sum before spitting it out. I really hope I don't get sick.  I tried to like this place; there is nothing better then that great feeling you get from your fellow Yelpers liking something and you enjoying it to. But I have to say I really hated this place. I have been so some really mediocre sushi bars but this one was not even something I would go to if it was the only sushi restaurant in the world.  YUCK! YUCK! YUCK!

Good clean fresh fish lots of specialized Rolls that are very good. Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is there tables setup and timeliness. Been going here for years definitely needs a remodel or revamp on the setting.

The food was great. Too bad the service was horrible. We sat waiting at the sushi bar for 20 minutes before our waitress even came to check in, we'd been done eating and just wanted the check. We even asked the sushi chef when he asked if we were doing ok. He didn't do anything about it. Bummer. We won't be rushing back here, Sumos has great food and great service.

Update: I visited the Rainbow location last night at 12:50am with some friends. (They close at 2am) We were told they were closing early because they were slow and they took last call at 12:45am. I questioned the guy and mentioned that their hours say 2am. My friends drove 45 minutes specifically to go to Oyshi! He said they decided to close early and we couldn't eat. I even mentioned that we knew exactly what we wanted, since their "last call" was 5 minutes earlier. He was not very friendly!   During the time we were standing outside deciding where to go, more people came and got very upset. That's at least 9 people they turned away! If your hours are until 2am, you should be open until 2am. From what I saw, they lost enough business to make it worth being open until the normal time. Next time we are going to eat, Oyshi will not even be an option unless it's early in the evening. When businesses aren't reliable, you're not gonna go out of your way to visit! Or tell others to visit at all! My review went from 5 stars down to 2. This isn't the first issue I've had at this location! Customer service is everything.   As far as the food...  My friend told me about this place and their All You Can Eat sushi but I wasn't too sure about going because I only like one kind of roll. When we decided to go, I asked her if they had a regular menu because I wouldn't be able to eat that much sushi to justify All You Can Eat. When we arrived I was shocked that their all you can eat menu included appetizers, sushi, and dessert! This was perfect!  My friend and I both ordered the Love Affair roll which is shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes and masago on top. (no eel sauce for me) It was delicious!!! We also ordered....  Gyoza- nothing special but yummy!  Surf & Turf Platter- all the platters are small, so you can easily order two. The steak is pretty good and the shrimp was amazing. (I am very picky when it comes to shrimp)  Ebi- the best I've ever had.   Teriyaki chicken- yummy  I absolutely love this place! I love variety without spending a fortune AND they are open late. (Well they are when they DECIDE to stay open)   Price:  $22 for lunch $27 for dinner

Had dinner here the other night and it was good ! The sushi came out super fast and was delicious. Took a little longer on the apps but overall good experience ! Biggest concern was the cleanliness ! Lots of dust in the ceiling area and food on the floor ! The ceilings are black and you could see layers of dust plus the curtain at the front is super dirty and looks horrible ! I would recommend cleaning and looking at brightening the place up a little,  especially because they are busy !!

Last few times I've went to oyshi the experience has gotten worse with each visit. Randomly I came here to read the reviews and I noticed something interesting, the favorable reviews were rarely from people in Las Vegas. Come to your own conclusion but this bugs me.  Oyshi, ditch the millenial staff, organize your kitchen and turn the stripper music off. Start acting like you used to when you were good.

After many attempts at eating sushi, I have accepted the fact I will never like it. Ever. BUT my friends still like it and I can't say no to food. I usually go for a chicken dish of some sort and was thrilled when I saw Oyshi has chicken teriyaki. My entree came with soup & salad. The salad was enormous and SO good - probably the best ginger dressing I have ever had. The chicken teriyaki came out on a skillet and a bowl of rice. It seemed to be more darker meat. The teriyaki sauce was sweet & good. My only complaint was the abundance of onions... I love onions but it was too much for me. The onion scent stayed with me the rest of the day! The amount of food I got for ~$9 was mind blowing. Would recommend this place for sure!

I absolutely love this sushi place. It's not always the cleanest and it could use a professional touch to improve the atmosphere but the food is remarkable. Since I moved I had to find a new sushi place and I like this one more than my last favorite place.  You must try the mango wasabi!

Service was good. Clean inside. Went in for AYCE sushi it was very disappointing. The rice tasted at least two days old. The fish itself was somewhat ok. Complete waste of my time and money. Will never return...

On our search for another epic place for sushi happens to fall onto this place as it drew us in for AYCE. I think a few of our friends had heard or were recommended to try this joint since they knew our group and how we can grub. The last place we went to before left a bad taste in my mouth and another a little ill from the meal, we were happy to try a completely different place.   The atmosphere, ambience, are very inviting yet dark for those intimate encounters due to the dark wood finish everywhere. TVs around for those ackward silent moments if you're on a date or deep conversation in a larger group. I do like the mural on the back wall which was really impressive.  Now, down to the food, you can order anything on the menu but just watch for any restrictions such as only 1 order of uni for example. I do like the sound of appetizers you can order such as rib-eye steak which is really less than tapas on a sizzling plate and a bed of cabbage and onions. Another beef plate was the same which tasted good but I feel like I would have to order 5 of these to really make a good size order to be called an appetizer.   The rolls are inventive and decorative which is a refreshing change from the other sushi places. My recommendation is to stick to the "designer" rolls rather than the sushi. I must strongly advise against ordering the uni which it could be me and an off night. I always try to be brave and order it knowing it could be really good or it could be really really bad. In fact, I didn't eat the second piece because the first one I ate tasted like iodine for some reason. Definitely may explain for my stomach pains on the way back to our place. Nausea may be another descriptive word for this feeling as well. The rolls taste great and presentation looks great but I may have to say no to sushi so far away from the coastline especially in the middle of the dessert. If you have reviewed or about to review this place and give it 5 stars, you may have to check yourself as your taste buds are a bit off for what great sushi really should be in quality.

I often used to come to Oyshi because it's close to my house and it was very delicious. Fish was always fresh and service was always good, but ever since they got popular, everything has down-graded.   I tried to give them second chances because I used to love this place so much! But lately, their customer service has been way too slow. I get that they're busy, which IMO they need to hire more staffs. My last visit, it took them at least 10 mins to realize that we were standing there waiting to be seated. Then, it took 30 mins for the server to bring us water and miso soup. The owner walks by and doesn't acknowledge us at all. You've got to be fast and efficient, especially a busy place like this, you've got to have more staffs. I will never come back again, even if it's a block away from my house.   Despite my horrible experience, I still love their Love Affair roll, it's the only roll that doesn't fail to satisfy me.

This is my favorite all your can eat sushi place in Vegas! You can always find a seat right off the bat (Which is a far cry from somewhere else Yama Sushi where I have waited up to 2 hours with a group of 6). The menu is much longer, and more unique than somewhere like Sushi Mon. The decor is pretty hip, staff very friendly. We go back at least once a month!
Great food, amazing service. Judy was so helpful with recommendations. Very friendly staff. Timely turn around on the r

Horrible service extremely long wait for our food all the drinks sat on the table empty with a nuclear roll burning through the skin in my mouth I'll never be back be sure to take my business down the street to Kobe or ohjah.

Ever since I can remember, Sushi-Mon (the one on silverado ranch/maryland pkwy) has been my favorite go-to spot. Words couldn't describe how good it is. But I decided to try something new. This place had 270 reviews with an average of four stars. So they must be doing something right.  After one minute of walking the wrong way..we finally got into the entrance..by Following THE ARROWS...  Decor was really nice, bigger than the usual sushi bars. Great Location too. The VIP room and Lounge room was a nice touch. It was slow mind you, during lunch when I walked in with my "friend" Karlee. We started off with, my favorite Ahi Poke and Miso Soup. Karlee had the soup as well and Gyoza. Ahi Poke was ok, but not better than sushi mon, the flavor wasn't just there. Miso was good, not fantastic. Karlee loved the Gyoza, she said it was better than the other Sushi place she goes that serves it.   I had the J&b roll, baked, with salmon and cream cheese. It was good, juicy, hand a hint of soy sauce. hats off to the sushi chef because it was awesome. I had a cucumber roll, asian strip steak and this deep fried california roll, with hot mustard and albacore tuna. All was great but the J&b roll was the highlight. karlee had 2 orders of the shrimp tempura roll, apparently it was good, I couldn't have any because I am allergic to shrimp. She tried to Force Feed it to me, knowing I was allergic, I think she tried to kill me, because I tried to make fun of her Sirarcha/Hot mayo sauce that she custom made..oh and She had chicken teriyaki and I think another order of Gyoza, apparently she loves that stuff.   The service was a little slow, especially when they weren't busy. This was all you can eat, and what I was shocked about how they did not serve Half rolls!! I was like WTF? how could I possibly try more than 3 types. Other than that The waitress seemed puzzled and brought us the wrong dishes a couple of times. No big deal. The Food was great, service was so-so, and It is a place I would come back to again. I also ate too much, because I regret not getting desert (no one really gets more than one desert, but why would they limit you to JUST one, its all you can eat!!!), being that it was one of the reasons I came here for, Green Tea Tiramisu, I'm Coming back for you!

We had so bad experience here today. As my friends and I  have lunch here, servers were not nice.. At the moment, there were no many parties of customers, that means it wasn't busy at all. At the sushi bar, there were about four sushi chefs, and there were about at least 3 servers. Yet, our orders were delayed unnecessarily, and didn't receive any customer service. They didn't come to check if foods are ok. We got foods long after we ordered, and some of foods we ordered wasn't even put in and made. But we rather got foods we didn't order, or ones we canceled. I told a server that that's what we canceled, and the foods  we ordered earlier didn't came out. We were not ok with all of them at all today. A chef just came out and asked if we are chinese or korean. And asked if we canceled orders of spicy tuna and some other order. I said we did, and he answered us to enjoy our meal, but his attitude and tone of voice seemed like he had something to complain. The head chef, looked at us and laughed at us while he's passing by our table. Obviously it wasn't smile he may normally treat to customers. We felt so uncomfortable that we asked if we can talk to manager about many things since we had not only bad customer service ,but also foods were so bad. A server said that manager is not here. We paid for our check, and left. But we were definitely not ok with all of them, so we got in the restaurant again and if we can get manager's contact. The chef, who came to our table and told if we canceled food, seemed worried with us, so asked if there were anything went wrong. We told him about things we wanted to complain. He looked like he's pretending to listen to us. Looking uncomfortable with what we said, he asked what he can compensate with(but obviously his attitude was to get out of the situation). He took out his wallet and said "I will refund for the price you paid." No one of us wanted to get refund, but his unnecessary action wasn't appropriate with the situation. He could have apologized about his and employees' faults sincerely, but he just tried to solve situation with his money. If he really wanted to compensate for bad service and was going to give us money back, he should have asked cashier to give us money back instead of taking out his wallet. There were even more things to say about foods, but I will reserve my opinion about food since it can reflect my bad feelings from bad experience.   Oh, I forgot to tell you guys. In korean culture, it's common that older people treat younger people poorly. But chef Ed, who asked our age, He didn't have to ask and talk about our age in spite of our young looking-appearence. Was that really necessary to ask our age? His attitude definitely made it worse. The attitude you have shown was not professional at all.

I would of loved to give this 5 stars but after my second visit this week my waiter was a complete idiot. He didn't have basic knowledge of sushi or the menu items available. When i asked for plum wine ice cream he stated naming off the different types of sake they offer. My sushi order NEVER came out. After we had eaten all our appetizers and put in a second AYCE order... we realized something was up because everyone around us was eating. When we ask where our food was the server accused us of getting our food and said we didnt order those things and... it was just bogus to say the least. Was excited to have a good place near by, but will seriously reconsider coming here, especially with all the AYCE in the area.

Super disappointed in this location. The restaurant itself is large, beautiful and has nice decor. The menu is the same as the other location. Promptly greeted and seated upon arrival. Decent wait staff service. The guy behind their bar did their best to completely butcher irrashaimasen .  First thing I noticed is that I ordered the poke salad and the tuna that was in it was scrap tuna. Just the low quality end pieces that wouldn't look good if used as nigiri.  Then we got a roll we didn't order.  Then we were told that we couldn't order half rolls (the rainbow locations allows this) unless we were sitting at the bar... I'm still trying to figure out how this makes even a little bit of sense. We were told " well you can order half rolls if you are sitting at the bar". The bar was 2 feet to my right. The restaurant had 3 total tables occupied, it was dead... this didn't make any sense. We likely would of consumed twice as much had we been sitting at the bar.  Our waitress was a little forgetful. Didn't bring us drinks or even wasabi when asked.  All of our sushi would just fall apart. I even received ikura where my nori  WAS BACKWARDS. Will not be going to this location ever again.  2 stars instead of 1 because of the wait staff service and fresh fish- I ate there yesterday and am not sick at least.

Got a Chirashi opposed to AYCE and the fish was super fresh, the rice is delicious, and best of all, the servers were extremely friendly. I was sitting at the bar area and Chef Ed was very nice. He showed professionalism and love for his job. We talked and he was always smiling. Very great sushi chef. He made the experience 6/5 if anything.

The fish here is VERY high quality and for AYCE, $27 dinner is very fair. It was my date and I's first time coming here and we were seated at the sushi bar by the very inviting waitstaff. The menu is full of choices and my date and I did not know what to get so, our sushi chef Jon had some really great suggestions and gave them to us to try and they were all AMAZING!!! my favorite was the Love-Affair roll. Also Jon really made our first time eating here a wonderful experience.  He was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and provided excellent service!!! Someone give this guy a raise!! Overall, this place just because my newest favorite sushi place! Will DEFINITELY be coming here from now on.

Dude, seriously. All you can eat everything. Anything on the menu except sashimi is fair game.   If you go here and don't think it's the bomb, we can't be friends anymore.  My Dad, Uncle and I came here at the recommendation of my brother-in-law. It did not disappoint. We had to wait a while to get a seat at the bar. There's also rooms around the main dining area that look like they're available to reserve.   The decor is pretty Neo-Far East trendy. Between that and the music, it comes across as a pretty hip, young place. This is not the place to go if you're looking for a quiet, traditional Japanese style sushi experience.

Surf and Turf roll, Surf and Turf sizzling plate, gyoza, and 3 order of garlic tuna with Pico. I could eat here all day. And every other Friday I did. BEST.AYCE SUSHI. EVER. The customer service is always on their A game, the food is always quick to come out, and they are pretty chill when it comes to leaving a little bit left. Not a full/half a roll. Can't wait to go back.

Extremely disappointed. I was told by a friend to try this place and it sounded like some great sushi. Wrong. Walked in and half the tables were reserved. But there was space along the sushi bar. Took them 15 minutes to seat us, then we had a horribly slow server. Took 20 minutes to order sushi, and the sushi wasn't anything amazing. I suggest trying somewhere else.

Ate here with a group of friends & were sat in one of the small rooms which was nice. Service was great. Food was good but honestly there was nothing that blew me away. All of the rolls that we had didn't seem to have a real oomph to make me really like one. Considering I live on the other side of town & there are sushi restaurants that are closer to me that I like better I probably won't be back to Oyshi. The food isn't bad here there just wasn't anything that would make me want to drive across town to dine there.
A little above the average sushi places in Vegas, if you want somewhere good to eat but don't wanna pay overpriced then I would recommend Oyshi

I'm a customer there for years. Love their appetizers. They are bomb, my favorites are shrimp on skewers, scallop popcorn, and baked mussels but don't forget tiramisu at the end of your meal. Any way, the last time I went there the tiramisu kinda changed it doesn't testy like usual.

A few weeks ago, this is the first time I visited this place after a coworker recommended this place. Friends and I got AYCE. Disappointed that we couldn't order half rolls, only full rolls. So we couldn't try a variety of sushi because we got full fast. It's ok, the sushi all seemed the same. The creme brûlée was good, most memorable part of the experience. The green tea tiramisu someone got was ok. Didn't like how you can only order one dessert but unlimited ice cream. Got too full to try the ice cream. Their rules are weak compared to sushi mon or Yama sushi. Would not come back. I didn't think it was worth it.

*UPDATE* Man this place has been on a downhill slide. All the servers that were amazing are gone. Pedro, the best sushi chef in town, is the only person I recognize. Tonight was the final straw though. Waited 20 minutes to reorder and that was on top of the 10 we waited for the first round. Decided to pay the bill and leave. The server asked if we were in a rush, I said no but I'm over waiting for 20 minutes to order. Then he brushed us off with a, oh that must of been all my fault. Uh, ya it was. You served the table next to us and we had a table with all empty plates and drinks. When the owners asked if everything was ok, we told them what happened. Their response? Next time will be better. Lol nah, I'll be at Sushi Koma from now on. Bye!   Love this spot. Everyone is super cool even if you want to hang out for a while. They play good music and it's not crazy loud or packed like the first spot. I like the steak bites and hot tamale roll. Try to Japanese garlic lasagna too. If you like a lil spiciness ask for spicy maniac sauce. I dip everything in it! Don't forget to ask for Kenny! Best server in Las Vegas!

Food was okay ...I was disappointed at the end when we received the checks she charged a 20 % tip for me and 20% for each of my girl friends it was only 3 of us ! I felt ripped off because we were not a large party! So why did the waitress charge individually that 20% tip !!! not going back !
Cool local sushi joint, shows paper view for free.  Must try the all you can eat, well worth it.

This place is GREAT! Food is awesome, I'd recommend sitting at the bar if the offer is available because this place gets pretty busy on a Saturday night.   The nice thing about the Sushi bar is the counter space is a lot wider than most sushi spots, this gives you a lot of space for all your AYCE plates ;)  My favorites, Yellowtail Trio and Love Affair roll. The Love Affair roll is full of so much flavor thanks to the mixture of the scallops and crab mix, the crispies add the texture that makes each bite easier to chew.
Pretty good sushi at a reasonable price. Better than average sushi.   The servers kept brining me food I did not order though . It was pretty funny.
My favorite sushi place in southwest. Employees are always nice and food is always consistent which is important to me. Good music and def good drinks:)

Ate today 1/10/16 at lunch with Chef Eth (sp?). AMAZING! My absolute favorite sushi spot. Clean, fresh fish and great service. Chef Eth went above and beyond and created sushi for me that was not on the menu, and everything came out beautifully, artistically, and delicious. Best sushi in Vegas. Thank you, Oyshi!!

Thank you oyshi for ruining my Valentine's Day.  We arrived and we're told 30 mins.  Waited well over an hour.  15 mins after we were seated we were finally greeted. We ordered our food and waited. Over 30 mins.  This is now almost 2 hours after we walked in the door. Our food was brought to the wrong table. No waiter to check on us. No were sorry we will fix it.  The manager must have had his ears plugged. Because he didn't even attempt to fix our problem. Just basically said there's the door. I've been here 10-15 times. Will NEVER go back. This is the second bad experience in a row. Thanks for nothing.
We usually come here but today was wonderful. My husband and I sat at the bar with our 3 and 4 year old. They treated them as customers as well and made them tiny sushi rolls. It's was awesome!

Would have given a 5 star but the service was a bit lacking. However, the food made up for it. Went to lunch there with our staff and the menu was wonderful. I ordered the lunch special sizzling plate with chicken teriyaki and it came with miso soup, salad, tempura shrimp and vegetables, and California roll with the entrée. It was a boat load of food for $10. I had to take a portion home. BTW: the green tea ice cream is also a screaming deal for two scoops $2.50. Great food but I should caution you to go early for lunch because you will wait for a good fair amount of time. I will definitely be back to give the service another chance.

Place is pretty delicious.  Food is tasty, only thing that leaves to be desired is the speed at which the food actually comes out.  Servers were awesome and very attentive.  All you can eat is quite the deal so it is much recommended.  Just prepare to wait some time for food to come out as the kitchen sure likes to take their time.

Me and my boyfriend went here for dinner. Everything was ok except for one thing, I order miso soup twice and I didnt get it. Even the chicken yakitori we didn't get it. We asked the server about it and she said she gonna check about it and still nothing happened.

I've been to this place well over 20 times and while sometimes the service is slow or sometimes there is a roll that isn't my favorite, it really is consistently great. I always do the all you can eat, and get a number of appetizers like seaweed salad and spicy sashimi salad, a couple hand rolls, and nigiri. I used to get a number of rolls, and find them great, but don't usually want that much rice and they're very filling.  Highly recommend this as a local sushi joint!

Garlic edumame to start. Bonsai roll which includes spicy tuna roll wrapped with cajun albacore and avocado topped with garlic ponzu,  spicy tuna for my lil man and tempura udon for my mom. The Lil princess enjoyed teriyaki bento box. Love my waitress Iris, she is speedy, efficient and attentive to her customers. Thank you for a good experience.

Service was good, food was good, music was terrible. Just not what I enjoy listening to over dinner...sounds like a night club. I would also like to see more rolls that do not have cream cheese and also upside down shrimp.
Our go-to place for ayce sushi!!! Best place ever...  Picture says it all so you've got to try it out. Almost all special family occasion is an oyshi ayce night for us!

Great food !!! Good service. Probably the best sushi in Vegas. I've tried quite a few spots too. Oyshi's wait list can be long but typically no longer than 30 min. I recommend making a reservation the morning of or day before. Try the sizzling skirt steak.... Yummmm

I am so shocked that this place only has 3.5 stars! I am normally not a fan of "all you can eat" anything...but Oyshi is an exception.   AYCE sushi includes their ENTIRE menu- including sushi, sashimi, dessert, hot foods, and all rolls. The real kicker...it's only $28. I live in CA but each time we go out to Vegas we stop at Oyshi before hitting The Strip.  Quick tip: If you sit at the bar they permit you to order half rolls.

Not too bad. But not my first stop if I have a craving for Japanese. The rolls aren't that great. Or it could just be ones that we ordered. The service is great though. So that's a plus. Very polite and always askin if we needed anything. I would come bavk again but order something diferrent everytime until I find the right one.
So good!! Lunch specials are amazing! So much food for such a cheap price. Love it. Will definitely be back.

I had the chicken teriyaki with sushi lunch combo. The price was reasonable.  The chicken teriyaki was a pretty mediocre stir fry with peppers and such, quite oily. Didn't look or taste remotely like chicken teriyaki. They should have just called chicken-veggie stir fry.  The sushi was alright, but I didn't like the way the sashimi was cut. It still had a lot of fat and fish scales on it! Usually, if serving raw salmon with skin, the skin part should be torched or crisped somehow. What I had was raw fat and fish scales.  Maybe I got a dud, maybe the chef was in a bad mood that day, because the pictures of other yelpers looked alright. This place is not very consistent with quality.

SBC VEGAS SERIES:9 of many reviews I want some sushi NOW!!!!  Its hard to find sushi during lunch hours on the strip. Mind you that I didn't have any fancy jeezus phone or other interwebz navigating phone on me so I had to depend on my simple, yet reliable and dependable intuition... and lifelines. ;D  As I walked the strip during lunch hour sunshine I was rudely awakened to the fact after epic fail after epic fail that sushi apparently only open during dinner hours. FML!!!!   I end up calling my cousin to yelp it... bare in mind he doesn't know how to use the ever HOLY YELP but does what he can for me off his interwebz capable cell. He forwards me a list and after several returned calls of being open hours later one of them responds that they are currently open. I tell the cabbie who then proceeds to drive my ass half an hour into the desert. Who knew????  WTF??  Well, I get there to this strip mall in the middle of no where and proceed to order and drink, drink and eat, and eat and drink some more. I dock them one star for the uni.. it wasn't as good as I would have expected but then again we are in the desert and I suppose should be grateful for anything shell fish. After ordering countless orders of sashimi and sushi I realize that they offer a all-you-can-eat sushi.   Oh well!  It appears that a lot of people come here for this. I had no idea what to order so I flagged the closest waiter for assistance. The helpful and over zealous staff suggested a number of oddly named rolls which we humored them by ordering.
