Good decent food. Few different appetizers which you don't usually see in other AYCE's (which is a nice change). Really like the green tea tiramisu.  Didn't like the service though. Was very slow. There were only 7 tables occupied. The sushi's were served first (before the appetizers) 20 minutes AFTER they got our orders !!! And there were 5 sushi chefs working. One of them was busy taking a video of the other chef making a sushi roll. We never wait that long at other sushi places where there are only 2-3 chefs. Most of our appetizers came after the sushi rolls. They forgot a couple of orders but we didn't bother telling the waiter cuz we didn't want to wait another lifetime.

Some of my friends advised me to try this place! I came at 11:30 and by 12p.m. the place was packed!!! Service is great and fast, good is good and very affodable! I took lunch special for 13$(plate of sushi+ miso+salad) + egg rolls, all came out 18$. I liked not overslted miso soup and not greasy eggrolls, sushi rolls were perfect. Not fancy place, but cute, with Circus Du Solei posters :)
Love it... Cozy and comfy... And the sushi is pretty good too...!

Compared to Oyshi Sushi in Sahara, this place is loser in taste.  We could not find any fresh fish and the appetizers are salty or poor looking.   Only one that pleased us is ice cream as a dessert.   I and my friend agreed not to come back again and not to recommend this place.  If you want to go AYCI sushi, rely on yelp review.

It's  never a miss. I love this place. The food is always great the service is always on point. I love that they have a new location its a little closer to me. There new location is really beautiful, nice an open much bigger

Normally, when you come into Japanese Sushi Restaurant they greet you even the chef. However, the host didn't bother to say hello until we came closer to the booth. I know the Oyshi off Rainbow has a lively feel than this location.  The place was nice seemed bigger than the Oyshi off Rainbow. My friends and I had to eat all you can which was $27. Plus, they have $5 cocktails on Wednesday & Thursday!! The cocktails were $10 so it would be 50%. I ordered the Moscow mule it was very refreshing not as strong as the Yoshi Mojito or the Lychee?   As far as for the sushi it was no doubt bomb dot com! Especially the high roller... I love sushis with cream cheese it makes everything so tasty in my mouth. I'd recommend to come with a party if you're planning on eating all you can eat otherwise I'd just order my fave rolls to save a few bucks.   Our waitress was also the host Chloe, I'd say she was nice when it came to taking our orders she was very patient.

Amazing beyond belief!!! My third visit here was on Valentine's Day and I can't tell you how impeccable their service was and how delicious their unique creations were!! Never thought It'd be possible to feel like a queen choosing to go solo. Oyshi chefs never disappoint and their AYCE is the best from anywhere I've been to across dozens of states and countries

One hour wait. Okay this place has to be somewhat of a decent AYCE sushi. No. Just honestly go next door to Soyo and save your $27 bucks.   We finally sat down and didn't see the waitress again for another 15 minutes. We ordered a couple random rolls, a bunch of sushi, and appetizers.   So the rolls we're just rolls. I'm not really a fan for rolls. The food runner finally gave us sushi and didn't even know what was what.   Food runner: Heres your octopus... Me: Thats not octopus.  Food runner: oh sorry, red snapper.  Me: That's not red snapper.  Food runner: Ohh.... *walks away...   It was actually surf clam. Learn your sea creatures if your going to work at a sushi place!   The sushi was not fresh. All of them were small and slightly fishy. The uni was literally orange brown and tasted so weird I couldn't eat it.   I think then only thing I enjoyed was the miso soup.   Service needs to be a lot better too. I know now the only reason why we waited a hour was because they took forever to clean the tables around us!

Rice is dry af.   The fish itself taste good but the rice is terrible. It's dry and grainy. I had to keep drinking water as I ate because their sushi would make my mouth dry and the rice would stick. The fish and rice ratio was way off. The fish is cut thin with a thick compressed dry rice underneath. All I eat is nigiri so it's sad that I didn't reorder nigiri for my second round.   The options here are a little limited compared to other AYCE sushi spots.   The inside is very clean and spacey which I really liked. The service was great. They were fast and always came by to ask if we wanted to order more.   Maybe I came on a off day but I didn't like this second visit here!

Delicious food, good atmosphere, great service - all quality stuff here at Oyshi Sushi.  And of course the name's rather amusing.  The sushi chef that helped us at the bar was very friendly and conversational.  Since we're new to Vegas, he even suggested some good places to go check out for recreational purposes.  We'd recommend this restaurant and will likely return, but will probably check out other places in town (since there are soooooo many options).  If you're nearby, I'd definitely say it's worth the stop.  Here's the rundown on food:  Things we tried that I'd recommend: Rattlesnake Roll - good stuff, great combo of flavors Oyshi Roll - the signature roll lives up to it's role - a must-have Gyoza - order it pan-friend (even though they only list deep fried & steamed) Chung Hua - Probably my favorite roll of the night Nuclear Bomb - chef made this when we requested one of his choices - not for the weak tongued.  This one's very spicy and tasty! Yellowstone - really great baked roll Ahi Poke Salad - I really enjoyed this - well rounded flavor, fresh and tasty - wife thought it was too seaweed-y Shrimp Tempura - the kiddo loves this stuff  Items you could skip: Baked Mussels - rather bland, prefer 'em creamier and with more zip Calamari - very basic, dipping sauces are okay, nothing special, needed salt Heart Attack - it's good, but have the Nuclear Bomb instead Treasure - wife said she liked it, I didn't think it really stood out much;

The all you can eat meal is by far my favorite in town, and there are a plethora of non seafood items included that appease many different tastes. Service is almost always swift and affable.  They should consider improving their wait time estimates for accuracy so guests can make informed decisions, expand for surplus business, or allow small parties to makes reservations. I waited over 1.5 hours after being quoted 45 min on a Friday evening, as I watched many parties that arrived after me get seated first. This only happened twice out of many visits, so it is a forgivable offense.
This place is so good, the chefs really took care of us and the food was fresh and delish.

Thanks Yelpers!  This place is great.  Nice clean interior (they actually have a VIP room, guess that's a normal thing in Vegas to have everywhere though, eh?), friendly staff and an amazing deal for all-you-can-eat (AYCE) sushi.    They do AYCE where you actually just order whatever you want off the regular menu and they make and deliver it to you.  My friends Andrea, Annie and James all chowed and put away an impressive amount of sushi.  Since Annie and Andrea are bodybuilders they usually can't get full but we were all about to burst as we waddled out of Oyshi.  The nigiri are pretty decently sized and the fish is quite good.  As far as AYCE, it's the best fish I've had.  They have a ton of crazy rolls and while I am not usually a roll guy for AYCE it's fun to try out so many options.  We went for lunch and it was $21 which we definitely got our money's worth.  It's also nice to get away from the Strip as we are here covering a bodybuilding show and the pace is less flashy and frenetic which is great.  Definitely make it out to Oyshi!

Originally this place could not figure out a system to seat guests in the correct order of arrival and it would drive me crazy. As of lately, this problem seems to be fixed.   Their appetizer menu is extensive and the main reason why we have AYCE. Their rolls are nothing special and their is limitation on dessert, but still not a bad deal. The restaurant is spacious and even when full, still feels fine.

When we're on West Sahara side, this place hands down gives you a reason NOT to think so hard about where you wanna have a chill but amazing dinner.  The sushi is fresh every single time and the appetizers are in good portions if you're doing AYCE. The sushi chefs are all great, but if you ever want that extra special, catch Nacho& carlos. Nacho especially.  All the waiters and waitresses are accomodating as well, BUT if you ever get the chance ask for RYAN. Funny.as.hell. great host and an asset to oyshi.   Oyishi on rainbow is good,l but if you want an overall great time-- sahara location is where it's at.

I ordered ToGo & I just wasn't very impressed. I'm paying the same price as if I was dining in but I felt that I wasn't getting the same quality. The sushi roll looked sloppy & didn't stay together. There wasn't much fish on the roll either. My other roll had no sauce so it tasted very bland. It was not worth the $13/roll. I've eaten here before but dined in & it was very good but I wouldn't recommend getting their food Togo or for delivery.

Probably my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant on the face of this planet,  and I don't even live in Las Vegas.  It's a really fun place to take your friends.. I introduced a group of my gal pals to Oyshi last December when we all came to town for my 21st birthday, and now they won't stop asking me when we'll be coming back!  (+ For sure, you'll need to try to Love Fair or Lobster Fair, those are our favorite rolls.)

Went here yesterday and it was pretty good. The quality of the sushi was good but not the best. The only complain is that they put a lot of rice in their sushi pieces. I think they do that so you fill up more and not over order on their all you can eat. The restaurant is nice and clean.  Good vibes.
I've had sushi from Japan and this is by far no where near the real deal. Blue fin is some what closer to what you could expect in a sushi restaurant in Japan.
You get a lot but that isn't always a good thing.

If I had the option of giving no stars, I would. Hands-down, worst service I've ever had. We walked in and stood in front of the hostesses for at least a good 90 seconds (90 seconds too long) before we even got EYE CONTACT. They were too busy chatting amongst themselves. Then, they didn't even ask us how we were doing. We sat down and ordered - the waitress had absolutely no knowledge of the menu - huge red flag (even your staff doesn't want to eat here?). We then noticed one of our plates was dirty and had old food on it, so of course we asked for another. They took the plate back and came back with a "new one"... which we could clearly tell was just the old one wiped off with a rag. After that, we couldn't stay in that place one more second. Bottom line: I wouldn't send my WORST ENEMY to this restaurant. You can have the best food/product in the world but if you have terrible service, your business will STILL fail. It's a good thing there are plenty of other amazing sushi places here in Vegas - this one will not last long among them.

5 stars for the interior decorations.  This place is very upscale and the ambiance is nice, great vibe for a date night.  2 stars for fish quality.  I ordered a few different nigiri: salmon, halibut, red snapper, yellowtail, and scallops.  First of all, the fish to rice ratio was 1:1.5.  I am not sure how most people like their sushi, but I tend to I like my sushi a little more meaty and less rice-y.  Everyone has their own opinion on this, which I understand.  The salmon was alright, but I didn't get the "melt-in-your-mouth" sensation.  I'm not sure if I came on an "off" night, or if the fish just wasn't fresh this time.  I guess I expected more for a nice-looking restaurant, but I will definitely try it again next time I am in the area.

I really enjoyed this place.  Honestly, this is either my new favorite sushi place or close to it.  I ate so much and still wanted more!  The rolls were tasty and never before have I seen so many appetizers that were included with the AYCE option!  The restaurant is inviting, the food is delicious, the options are almost endless, the service is quality, and as an added bonus, there were a ton of good looking women who dined here while I was present (nothing to do with the restaurant but definitely a plus).  As soon as I left I wanted to go back.  I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because it wasn't perfect.  Some of the food was just ok and not amazing like the rest.  Items such as the egg rolls, surf and turf plate, and shrimp and asparagus skewers were just alright, nothing to write home about.  That being said, I would instantly come back here.
Amazing food, amazing service, all you can eat for about $30, clean and awesome restaurant aesthetics, and private rooms. Will definitely be going back regularly.

Got EXTREMELY HORRIBLE food poisoning here as well did my bf. The service was nothing great especially seeings how when we told our waitress about the roll tasting funny she didn't even notify a manager. I will NEVER eat here again as long as I live!! After my experience I had multiple friends tell me the same thing had happened to them as well as the people in their parties!!! Obviously food is being kept wrong at this place for multiple people to have food poisoning!! I never have written a yelp review but this experience has pushed me beyond belief with the way It was handled. When I called to tell them something was wrong they might want to not serve that roll and its ingredients I was told a manager would call me back I then called the next night and said I wanted my money back I was heated from no manager contacting me which by the way the money was taken out of my account and not refunded. The girl on the phone went back and forth with the manager it pisses me off you're a manager GET ON THE PHONE AND HANDLE THE SITUATION!!!!! I shouldn't have to demand to speak to a manger!! Food poisoning isn't to be taken lightly and I absolutely feel like they don't care. Please be careful eating here it's not worth getting sick! I only put ONE star because you clearly can't post a review unless you give at least one star.

This place has definitely won it's spot as a routinely vegas visit along with earl sandwiches!   definitely one of the best ayce sushi spots i've ever encountered! Its a bit off the vegas strip about 15 mins but it's well worth it! The fish are so fresh and melts in your mouth like buttttttttter! Rice to fish ratio is 1:2...very minimal rice which is pretty rare and unheard of from any ayce sushi joints.  cant wait for my next vegas trip =)

I'm obsessed with this place. So many good options to pick from. I can eat edamame all day. You also get dessert afterwards. Parking is good. Price is decent for all the sushi you can get. I always look forward to coming here. I anticipate it all day. My favorite is the spider hand rolls without crab meat. The staff has always been friendly. Definitely recommend this place to anyone.

I would've given this place 5 stars, had I reviewed it the first time I ate there. I don't quite remember what I had the first time coming into this restaurant, but I do remember having their blueberry parfait, and that alone deserved 5 stars! My second visit to Oyshi was for dinner, and I ordered the Ahi poki salad, the Love Affair sushi roll, and a parfait of course! The salad and the sushi roll were excellent, the best part was probably the Love Affair sushi roll.. probably the best roll I had in a while, from what I remember, it had lobster and crab meat, it was awesome! So here it goes, if so excellent, why the 4 stars you ask..   Well.. the parfait. It was so much bigger and tastier the first time around.. from what I recall, it was served in a taller glass the last time, more ice cream and more toppings.. This time, it was skimped down to a smaller glass, and yes, smaller glass means smaller parfait. It also lacked the toppings I once remembered it had. Therefore, I conclude this review by saying Oyshi is an awesome restaurant, but they need to overcome this economic slump by serving MORE not less! =)

Came here last week with a friend and came to the bar wed night. Chef Ed was the one serving us food. He was entertianing us and gave a bunch of his specials. It was soo good, you have to try the salmon belly he prepares, its the BOMB!! Every time we come here he always surprises me and my friends. Recommend Chef Ed!!!

Food is good. Service is the reason I probably won't return. I'll admit the food is awesome and the selection is extensive when you order ayce. I gave this place three strikes before I decided I won't come here again. The first time I came with a group of 4 friends. Waitresses were always slow to come to our table to order more sushi leaving us with nothing to eat multiple times. At the end of the day two of us got food poisoning the next day. Second time I came with my girlfriend. Again, waitresses don't check up on our table enough. Third time I came with a group of 8 friends. We waited over 30 minutes for our server to take our second order for ayce. We complained to the manager about our server and it seemed like he didn't care or address our concern. When our server did come we already lost our appetite and just wanted to leave. The food is amazing but the service needs an overhaul.  I'll be return every once in awhile but, previous experiences has kept Oyshi from being my #1 AYCE sushi.
Best sushi in all of Las Vegas. I highly recommend sitting at the bar for AYCE because the service is better. We come come every other week

For the past several trips to Vegas, Oyshi has been our first stop we make before heading in to strip to check in to our hotel. We always order the all you can eat sushi. Our usual dishes are the raw Oysters, Ikura, Uni, Ono, Scallop, Yellowtail, Salmon, Softshell Crab... But they ran out if uni the last time we were there, so if you want uni, go there early if you can.  Everything is always fresh and service is great, even on a busy night! There could be a wait on the weekends, but it's totally worth the wait! Some say that the AYCE price is a little high, but if you could see how much we eat, you can say that we definitely ate more than our money's worth!!!

Best and my new fave AYCE place ;) get Daniel as your sushi chef. He was pleased to teach me about and sample some live and obviously raw "horse clam" or geoduck and asked if it was ok to use fresh wasabi. Are you kidding!? Ummm, yes please! He also topped the scallops with wasabi tobiko which was a nice surprise :)

The all you can eat is very well priced. I got a hand roll and one specialty roll and my bill was 21 bucks so for 6 more dollars I could have stuffed myself. Spicy tuna and avocado can be hit or miss two days ago it was perfect and beautiful. Today the spicy tuna was ridiculously hot and the avocado was brown. The specialty rolls are definitely not the combinations that I typically prefer. (But they do allow custom orders with AYCE). Kinda like they are trying to hard to be different. The baked mussels are the business. The mojito was awful. This was close to home we will be back to try more stuff.

This is by far my favorite sushi spot in Vegas! I've been coming here for over 9 years and it never disappoints. Tonight we had an awesome server (EJ) and I thought he deserved a special Yelp shout out. If you want quality sushi and great service Oyshi is your spot!

Horrible server messing up our orders.. its AYCE lunch and good thing we were not in a hurry.  It took 25 mins to get one order of roll. We were the first ones there and the last one to get our order. It took 46 mins to get an order of sashimi. Some of our orders didnt come out. I dont think I will go back again. There's a lot more places to go for Sushi. The food wasnt that good anyway.
All I gotta say CHI is the shiz net when it comes to his creations and sushi.  AYCE sushi is so bomb there.  Best appetizers in town, went to plenty of sushi joints, by far oyishi our #1 spot.
I am a big fan of sushi and this is my favorite place in Las Vegas. Very spacious and pleasant to enjoy your lunch or dinner. I will definitely come back again.
Love the surf and turf her. Call ahead for a table cause its always packed.
Just steps away from my home. My favourite place to have a quick dinner. Lover their Unagidon and Sashimi&Tempura the most.

More like three and a half, but I'll be nice. Got here on a Friday night, no reservation. It was super busy, we waited about 25 minutes. We didn't mind the wait, we were pretty excited to try somewhere new. Our waiter immediately took our drink orders, and then asked if we'd like to order. All three of us got all you can eat, so we could try a bunch of stuff together. We got edemame, chicken yakitori, muscles, raw oysters, gyoza, yellowtail nigiri, miso soup, and a few rolls. The raw oysters were outstanding. Soooo fresh and good! The chicken was tasty, the muscles were fresh and not too much sauce,  the edemame was steamed perfectly. The nigiri was a little different, but tasted okay. The tiger roll and the screaming roll were only okay. An OVERLOAD of rice, it was almost astonishing. Like holy shit, that's a lot of rice, bro. The hawiaan and whatever rolls my friend got were pretty tasty. Overall, it's worth it just for the appetizers. I'll come back to try different rolls  By the way, when my friend got a refill on her sprite, he came back and she said that the syrup was all out, it just tasted like soda water. He was confused. Did she want another one? Uhm. Yeah. So he went into the kitchen, literally stood there for a few seconds, and came back and gave her the SAME glass. Oh boy.  Other than that weird mishap, service was pretty good.

I went to their other locations a few weeks ago, so I decided to go to this one with my mom yesterday.  We walked in, and the host just kind of looked at us. He said hi, and just kind of looked away awkwardly. My mom said she wanted to sit at the sushi bar, so he led us over there and took out drink orders and said he'd be right back. We got our drinks, then the wait came. The sushi chefs literally didn't acknowledge us one time. It look maybe 20-25 minutes for the waiter to come back. Another 25 to get any of our food, then it all came out very slow. We were there for like over two hours. They kept walking past us, taking orders from other people, and serving them first without even asking us if we wanted more. Uh. Okay.  The food, however, still awesome. Muscles and oysters are sooo good, the miso pork belly, nigiri, heart attack and the "my favorite" rolls were sooo good, plus the always delish rainbow roll. The Chung hua was pretty good, but the other one we got was kinda weird and bland.   Basically, 4 for food, 2 for service. I'll go back though. Every place needs a second chance.
The All You Can Eat (AYCE) sushi and appetizers is a great deal, if you're hungry and you don't want sashimi (which isn't included).  Food is good.

Eh... that's how I feel about this place.  I will defo give this place a 4.5 star on the decor, the styling of their menu and placemats. BUT a 2 star on their food.   When I get sushi, I rarely get anything baked. Which makes sense if you're doing AYCE. You don't want to get filled up quick. I had the AYCE but I was craving for nigiris. Got my usual salmon, tuna, albacore, yellow tail and cajun albacore. OMG, I tried picking up the nigiri, and rice literally just fell out. and the fish was too thick and kinda rubbery. Yuck.  Service was alright, the waiter checked on us couple times like how they should. I was told that their service was the worst, but in this case, it's the fish.   I would come back, actually I wouldn't. Wait, I would if I got appetizers only not nigiris.

Food is not fresh.....my family and I got food poisoning after our 11/20/11,visited. We went in around 9:45pm  not many customer besides few people sitting at the sushi bar. employees were talking and hanging out by the enterance. Took them 20 mins to bring water and coke, by the way, never get the refill within 1 1/2 hour stayed. The worst dishes was the one I ordered "gyo don" it supposed to come with really thin and tender beef with stir fried onion and half cooked sukiyaki soup based eggs. But disapointedly I recieved a mexivan style beef bawl. lots of green paper and sunny side up egg. Nothing like gyo don.  Sushi was okay, until we got home, all 4 of us start feeling the stomach pain.went into quick care the next following day.  One last thing to mntion is the lady waitress, she was really not professional. We asked her to clean up our dishes before the cakes come, she picked up 2 dishes then never come back. We have to ask anoyher waiter to clean up the rest of empty dishes.  We live across st from thos restaurant, but we will nevrer come back again.

Ted, many of the girls in our group are in love with you. From your sweet smile to your jovial manner in serving a party of 15.  My friend had her birthday dinner here and we could not have asked for a better waiter than Ted. He was so attentive, happy, and energetic, especially with a mess of us indecisive girls and boys.  All you can eat sushi for $26! I ordered a la carte, but a majority of everyone did the AYCE. It is a great deal and usually, when you get such a good deal, you tend to sacrifice quality, but everything was really good. Fresh, amazing, whatever adjective you would like to use.  I really wish I could bring this place back home.  OYSHI ME!  P.S. My friend thought this place was near the strip, it was HELLA far away, so in case you plan to go, grab a lot of people and hop in a limo. It's the best way to do it.

Oyshi is like one of those Simple Pleasures in life but still has the Finesse and class of an international cruise boat sailing foreign Seas and sharing with you nautical Delicacies.  The second time I've been here and it's just as good as I remembered if not better the staff and chefs do an amazing job and a really great and attentive and ready to listen can even get fresh wasabi the desert to delicious and you really can't go wrong with just about anything on the menu if you've never been here before then I highly suggest it to anyone and everyone plus they have happy hour.
I don't understand how busy this place is. We ordered 7 rolls and they all taste the same. Baked and fried ones taste really bad. I'm sorry

What a great meal!  You can opt for all you can eat for $26 or order a la carte.  $26 for all you can eat sushi is an amazing price!  The only thing you can't order is from the sashimi menu and your limited to 1 dessert item.  The menu is abundant and creative.   We ordered...  Appetizers Oysters - so fresh and delicious! Tuna Poke - mixed with seaweed salad and oh so good. Sirloin steak teryaki - sizzling right off the hot plate, very tender. Sushi rolls Losbter Fair - scrumptious! My Favorite - scallops, variety of fish, topped in eel sauce. Yellowtail trio - fresh hamachi mixed with a ginger sauce. Dessert Green tea terimisu - to die for!  It's made with marscapone cheese, it's smooth consistency just melts in your mouth!
Food is good! Servers are slow and rode  Looking at the table but never ask if everything is ok.

This place is amazing! The fish is fresh and the service is great. I came for lunch and ordered all you can eat. Normally when I go out to eat sushi the all you can eat has a very limited menu. At Oyshi, the entire menu is all you can eat with the exception of sashimi. All you can eat is only 21$ for lunch and I left with a very full belly. I will deffinetly come back with friends!

FOOD: 2/5 I wouldn't call myself a sushi extraordinaire, but I do think that I have been to quite a few sushi spots and have a holistic view of what I do and do not like. I think that this location's sushi just didn't hit the target. The baked sushi came out cold (will elaborate on this in the section below), and they were nearly always DRENCHED (not an over-exaggeration) in sauce. I did, however, rather enjoy the sashimi, but that is because it came out plain and simple.   I ordered the following on my last visit: Kimono roll, Japanese Lasagna, Shrimp Tempura, Baked Tuna, and Tuna Sashimi. We didn't do AYCE because my stomach can't handle that much food. Anyway, the Kimono roll was pretty good--instead of nori, it was wrapped in soy rice paper, so I was digging the difference. However, when I picked it up a piece with my chopsticks, the whole thing fell apart. For $12 for five or six pieces, I was not impressed. I think this happened with nearly all of the rolls I ordered EXCEPT for the Shrimp Tempura roll. The Japanese Lasagna was drenched in sauce and topped with creamed cheese. It was cold and the flavor was too rich and too heavy. I couldn't even taste any of the other elements of it because it was overpowered by unagi sauce and cream cheese. The Baked Tuna came with poor presentation--already coming apart before any of us even attempted to grab a piece. It was cold and had too much unagi sauce. Like I said, the tuna sashimi was pretty good. Not as fresh as other places that I have been to, but it did the job.   SERVICE: 2.5/5 I am not sure why it took so long to get my food. Each roll came out one at a time with nearly five minutes between each. By the time our last roll came, we didn't want to eat anymore. Additionally, people around us who ordered similar rolls (baked, fried, etc.) got their food very quickly. When the food came out it was room temperature or cold when it was supposed to be baked. Our whole dining experience lasted nearly 2 hours because of the delay. We were never apologized to; it nearly seemed like a norm for food to come out to the tables that slowly. I had to check on each (again--not an over-exaggeration) roll to see when and if they were coming out. I would like to say, though, the server did refill my water quite a few times.   AMBIANCE: 3/5 The music was pretty loud in this place, which didn't really appeal to me. It kind of made me have an aversion to my meal and a bit of a headache. I think that is what they were going for though: a modern feel for younger folk. I appreciated the attempt. The decor was pretty nice though. I also enjoyed the wall designs.   PRICE: 2.5/5 I have to say that I am not very happy to have spent $55 for sushi that I didn't quite enjoy. The food was rather high-priced for the quality of service and food offered. I would say that compared to their competition, Oyshi is priced rather high. I am all for paying a pretty penny for pretty sushi, but I wouldn't categorize this place's sushi as such.  LOCATION: 4/5 The location is easy to find. There is ample parking here, too.
Great sushi for the money! Will recommend to a friend. I am a fan, as the stars say ;)  Yay!

hands down. this is by far the best sushi place in all of vegas. i havent been to all, but  ive been to many sushi spots. ive explored what every sushi place i've been to has to offer as their signature rolls. but ive gotta say, Oyshi's all you can eat, is worthy of my twenty something dollars. reborn and raised on the turfs of this restaurant. speaking of,  surf & turf on a sizzling platter!? part of the all you can eat menu. come on. get real. they are. their "love affair" is part of my oyshi diet. its busy at night, you may have to wait. worth the wait. they even have 3 private rooms available to reserve if you're having a big group or a special occassion. good times every single visit. i have no complaints. if i had any complaints. its far from my house. but really worth the drive. it makes me appreciate them even more.
Was here two weeks ago.  Food was so good we came back again.  Especially liked a special role made by Daniel.   We will be back!

Not the place for freshest or highest quality sushi in the city, but this place FOR SURE wins on value and convenience. I've never sat down to eat here, but I've lost count on how many times I've ordered take out. Keep in mind though the place is quite small, but they seem to have had a lot of famous people (especially sports guys) walk through their doors. Their takeout platters come with a ton of food, big slices of sashimi and the rolls are well sized too. They're open quite late every day so if you're looking for sushi after all the other places have closed, this place is a must! Also, for the people who live in the condos nearby, they do delivery!   I'm giving this a 4/5 because of its value and convenience, but the food deserves more of a mediocre rating. Without a doubt, it's still really good!

The food was ok, but the service was really slow. We were barely checked on, no drink refills, and empty plates were left on the table for a while. Service has gone down since the last time I was here but hopefully it changes soon. Other than the service, the food was pretty good.

I decided to eat here with the family because of a friend's recommendation. All their nigiri items look and tasted fresh. My brother and I usually get the Uni to further test their seafood quality. We even tried their oysters (we usually don't) and they are very good as well. They also have an extensive menu and even offer uncommon items like Natt? (fermented soybeans). The service was excellent; i think this was partly because they thought we were new to AYCE dining. Overall a solid sushi spot for AYCE.

Celebrated a birthday here the other night.  The AYCE is a definite plus especially since we are all sushi lovers. We visit this place a lot since its close to our house. We had made a reservation since we were a large party, so we were sat right away even though there were people waiting outside.  Sushi was pretty good, no complaints. Definitely love the yellowtail with ponzi, garlic tuna and uni. Tried the tiger roll this trip and loved it.   The service was the only pitfall. Like I said we have been here quite a few times and the service was never amongst the best but this night was especially unfortunate. The service was extremly slow, it took about 30 minutes to get our second round of sushi and we had to keep asking our runner/busser to find our server.  The server was super nice and polite but i think they were just understaffed and not prepared for how busy the restaurant was that night.

I absolutely love this place! Its delicious and the staff are not only sweet and kind they are very very attentive to anything you need!  I already went twice in a row last week and i cant wait for more! do the all you can eat sushi!  My favorite roll ever is the DOUBLE SCREAMING ROLL with cucumber squeeze some lemons on top of it and it tastes even better~!! YUUM  You also MUST TRY my second favorite its a tad spicy but is so good...Lava Flow &  as for plates the sizzling steak plate is delicious.

Came for lunch on a Saturday- they open AT 11:30, not one second before- we were shoo'ed back when we tried to have a seat at the bar 3 minutes beforehand. AYCE, but sitting at the sushi bar we were not allowed to order from the sushi chef, the waitress would take the order, then reach in front of us and hand the slip to the chef.  Sushi was okay, but I won't be back.  The waitress was condescending in attitude, not sure what they were going for-

So happy to write a review about this place. The All You Can Eat sushi is well worth it! A group of five ate 11 rolls and plenty of appetizers! We all had a great time trying new rolls. Our waiter Kevin was a great help when choosing from the extensive menu. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We'll definitely be back!
Great place to bring family or friends from out of town .. All you can eat appetizers as well as sushi ..!!

If you want to receive any of your rolls in under 20 minutes don't go here. Went on a Tuesday night and it took forever to get even some soup (13 minutes). I didn't know one of the rolls had mushrooms in it which I'm allergic to, and instead of being more considerate the waitress argued with me and said I should have read a different part of the menu where it have the description. I didn't know the roll was In the menu in two different places so I was a little upset. She ended up charging us for two all you can eats even though I only got miso soup because when I got the roll and took a bite I got sick. So I really paid 27$ for miso soup. She could have had the courtesy to charge him for his all you can eat and me for just my soup.   Won't be coming here again. Rude server and roll took 20 minutes to get to me anyways.
Our favorite sushi location on the west side! Open late and always very kind service. Never a bad experience with our food selections. All you can eat sushi menu has a great selection.

I am a big fan of sushi.  We were apartment hunting and one of the leasing agents told us about Oyshi Sushi.  We were glad we did.  It was a very refreshing change from our normal haunting place here in Silverado Ranch.  Oyshi is very nice.  Most of their patrons are young adults and they have pop music in the background.  We really liked the ambiance of the restaurant.  The best part was the food, for an AYCE dinner, it is somewhat on the pricey side but we wanted to try their extensive sushis.  They have hand rolls, cut sushi, baked, deep fried, fusion, vegetarian, specialty, and sashimi (this isn't included in the AYCE price though).  You can also have some appetizers and various salads, rice bowls, and dessert with the AYCE price.  For the two of us with regular drinks, we spent $61 ($71 with tip), so as you can see, it can get pricey.    Now, for the review of the food.  We ordered AYCE and we ate our fill of sushi.  My order: 1) Deep fried Philly - loved it!  It was cooked well and not dried up.  The sauce on it is enough that it doesn't require soy sauce to enjoy. 2) Rainbow Roll - so fresh and tasty. 3) Tiger Roll - it was so beautiful and enjoyed it immensely. 4)  Double Salmon - I enjoy salmon so this was a no brainer.  My partner: 1)  Supreme Vegetarian -  he liked it but it was wrapped in soy paper.  He liked the veggies that were rolled in the "sushi." 2)  Hawaiian Roll - this is a definite thing to order! 3)  California Roll - they were done well as they should be.  It is a staple in any sushi place. 4)  Japanese Lasagna - this one is baked.  He wasn't a fan of cooked sushi.  Then, the heavenly bites of dessert came.  My partner had the Strawberry Mochi and I had the Creme Brule.  I have to say, the Creme Brule was a taste of heaven.  I was so glad we got this for sure.  To end my LONGEST review(so far), this sushi place is definitely a go to place for us.  The ambiance was awesome, the food were tasty, and over all, its a definite place to try out.  Just be sure your wallet can afford the bill.

This place is amazing whenever you go here and order all you can eat tell the waitress to order you her favorite they do amazing job and if you seat on the bar chef ED does amazing rolls that are not in the menu thank you chef ED for the mucho spicy roll !!

Everything is so fresh here. One of our favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. The service is pretty good, sometimes you'll wait a bit to see your server during times. I would have done 5 stars but they don't offer any military discounts, so 4 stars is still good!

Say what?! AYCE for $26?! Yes sir it's worth your whole $26, or if you're going for lunch, it's only $21 but you don't get oysters and who doesn't love oysters?! They have a vast selection of sushi rolls, some of my favorites are the Oyshi Roll which is a baked roll with dynamite topping, spicy tuna crunch, and the atomic roll. But the one thing that is worth every penny is their super white tuna. Have you had super white tuna?! No?! Well, get your butt over here and try it! It melts in your mouth like butter, it's the champagne of fish.. Yes, ahh thinking about it just makes my mouth drool, they top it off with ponzu sauce and it couldn't get any better than that.  Their appetizer list is ongoing and you have so many choices, that's what I like about their AYCE, you have many options to choose from. The calamari is nice and crispy on the outside and a little chewy when you bite into it. The surf and turf is awesome and they just have new meats to pick from that come in a griddle plate (is that what it's called?) it comes steaming hot and on a bed of cabbage and onions YUMMMM! They have a good ahi poke bowl that comes with cucumber slices and seaweed salad underneath, amazing. I could go on, but you really just have to get your butt over there and try it for yourself! Oh yeah, did I mention the desserts? Oh, I haven't.. Well I love their vanilla parfait! They also have creme brûlée, green tea tiramisu, and green tea and vanilla ice cream. Oh goodness, I'm hungry.

OYSHI - I LOOOOOVEEEEE YOU.  HAHAHA.  No joke, the Love Affair roll = Delicious, Tiger Roll = super delicious..... nice selection of rolls and such ...   everytime I go there my server has been awesome...  all you can eat Sushi... sad that you cant have the Sashimi all you can eat... but still for the $26 all you can eat price point... I am by no means disappointed by it... if they wanted to throw some in though, I would welcome it with open arms....

Very nice place and nicely decorated.  Service is fantastic. They are on point and very accommodating.  I wish I could say the same about the sushi. We had the AYCE, and the rolls were just mediocre.  They need to improve on the rice and the quality of the fish on the nigiri was lets just say doesn't look fresh.  I would go here again, but for their lunch special.

Not as good as it used to be. But it's still so busy..! They always seem to run out of uni which is my favorite thing.  Limit one dessert with the AYCE. And my dessert of choice is the green tea tiramisu. Yum! Though the parfait is a close second.  The AYCE price is the same as most places. The items were good, but nothing too special. Service is kinda poor. Maybe because I am usually here with a larger party so we are usually in one of the private rooms. I must say though, the room on the left with the couches is nice, but not ideal for a dining area...  Not a bad sushi place food wise, but service could use improvement. But really nothing special about this place, I don't get why so many people love it here... And I AM a sushi LOVER... well.. a food lover in general. :)

This restaurant is always busy, so calling ahead will help with the long waits. They have a very large selection of sushi on the menu ranging from shashimi to baked rolls.  They have a wide variety of appetizers that come with the "All you can eat" menu.  If you like spicy rolls, go with the Nuclear Roll. It was by far my favorite of the night.  The staff was surprisingly on point with being attentive to as well, especially since it was a full house.

Las Vegas  Robbie's place High roller !  Dynamite appetizer Rock and roll (tiff would love this) No oyster appetizer- gross Oysha roll is good but a 2nd dynamite would be better Love affair is good but not amazing Surf and turf appetizer is pretty good. Asparagus and beef is good

Sushi can be so strange, and so personal, and opinions are like *ssholes - everyone's got one. But this must be said: I love Oyshi Sushi on Sahara.   IF you come here often, you learn the pace and the chefs will learn your taste and it's like chocolate and peanut butter: magic will happen.  If you come here thinking you've got the most sophisticated sushi palate on the planet, take your stuck-up self somewhere else. Because this AYCE is not about how much uni or conch or surf clam you can talk them into giving you. It's about sitting at the sushi bar and biting into creative hand rolls that are handed to you by hand - enjoying the crackle of the toasted nori cone and having a cool time with a team of what are probably the coolest sushi chef personalities in the city. It's about enjoying the game on the generously-sized HDTVs while experiencing awesome service. My water cup / green tea cup is NEVER empty here - that is a rare thing, especially at an AYCE sushi spot!  My favorite kitchen item is their deliciously tender and flavorful 'Asian Skirt Steak' served sizzling on a bed of onions and cabbage (included in AYCE), solid apps and skewers (also included) as well as appealing gyoza (steamed or fried) and other standard "Midwestern" Japanese kitchen items are all included.  Not a fan of the species of oysters they serve (and I love oysters) - weird texture - so I just don't order them anymore. There are plenty of other things I like ordering. Fresh scallop sushi (better than Sushi Koma's), the 'Monster' hand roll (soft shell crab, eel, spicy crab, avocado) and a few other secret items that I'm not going to disclose because I don't want them to be out of them the next time I go, which is currently once-a-week whenever possible.  This place is the jam. (Go and discover it for yourself.)

Enormous amount of various combinations of every kind of roll.   Lively atmosphere.  Friendly staff.  Fair prices with an AYCE choice.  Bar, lounge, and restaurant seating available.  What more could you ask for?

Oyshi used to be my favorite AYCE sushi spot.  They had a wide variety of quality rolls, great tasting food, consistent service, and a really nice atmosphere that made for a great spot to have pre-game Friday night dinner.   Although the sushi is still pretty good, the service and management has gone off the deep end and because of this, I don't think I'll ever eat at Oyshi again.  There are too many quality sushi restaurants in Las Vegas to justify returning to Oyshi where the last few visits, all I seem to get are orders that never show up, drinks that never get filled, waiters that refuse to come to our table or our spot at the bar (even though it's obvious that you've seen me flag you down), and servers/staff that are increasingly bitter and unfriendly.    This stuff matters. Oddly enough, it's also the stuff that is easiest to fix. When you've already got quality menu items, quality sushi chefs, and quality sushi rolls that people rave about - why are you letting your terrible servers and management ruin your restaurant?  If I'm sitting at the sushi bar and I'm trying to order more beer and sake, why are people refusing to help me out? If I want to give you my money in exchange for some-what overpriced alcohol, why does it take more than 20 minutes for someone to take my drink order and then another 20 to bring me a couple of beers and sake? This should never be an issue with a sushi restaurant.  Never. Sure, AYCE places get really busy and I totally understand that. But, if you can't handle the heat - hire more servers.   I shouldn't have to wait more than 45 minutes for my order. And when my order does come out, half of it shouldn't be missing. It also shouldn't take you another 30 minutes to bring out the pieces missing from my order. And you shouldn't have an attitude with customers just because they are asking for the items they originally ordered that are missing because you either forgot to put the orders in or there was a mix up in the kitchen. I am never rude to waiters or management and this last experience at Oyshi was no exception. I was pleasant and more than patient and if I still can't get someone to so much as offer an apology for missing orders/missing drinks and for treating me like I was more of a burden than a customer bringing a lot of business to the establishment, then I will happily take my business elsewhere.   Sorry, Oyshi, it was good while it lasted!

I'd give this place 6 stars if I could.   This is always our go to spot for sushi. The menu has a large selection of sushi that is made to order. So many rolls you have to go multiple times to try them all.  There is also 2 pages of just appetizers that come with the all you can eat.  Theres also an a la carte menu for the not so hungry.  Fish is always fresh!!!!   If you sit at the sushi bar you can order "half rolls" which is great for lunch. The chefs are awesome too.  Service is always impeccable. We love Kenny. Hes always attentive and making sure we are happy.   Favorite rolls are the Spicy Tuna Crunch and the Yellowstone.

I've been to Oyshi many times and have never had a bad experience. I would recommend the pink lady and coco for sushi rolls. The atmosphere is contemporary and open.   The price for all you can eat is reasonable. Out of all the AYCE sushi restaurants I travel to Oyshi even with closer alternatives.

This sushi place is my favorite! This is the newer location they have opened. It's clean, beautifully designed and decorated, and our server Kenny was amazing! Very attentive and polite. The food and drinks were also great! They didn't have a whiskey sour on the drink menu, but the bartender was kind enough to make it for me anyways! :) All in all recommend this location!

Oyshi Sushi place that I pass by few times and believe might have gone long time ago. Unfortunately nothing really stood out for me or remember wow factor so took longer time too come back. Nowadays in Vegas AYCE sushi is so competitive and dime dozen that it really hard too stand out unless really good. My opinion the sushi is good but not great or definitely no Wow factor for me. The menu has a nice diversity too it between the appetizers (oyster on the half shell by far my favorite), nigiri, and speciality rolls (i had some kind of spicy tuna roll; sorry forget the name but was really good)  too choose from sure find something like. Whenever I go AYCE more all about the nigiri style because feel that the true barometer of quality of the fish. I felt like compare too other places especially my top spot sushi house goyemon not in the same class. The irony was originally went too sushi hour goyemon but the wait was ridiculous. Me and Roy was hunger so decided too check out something new. Thankfully on this night Oyshi Sushi not packed went right in and sat down went sushi crazy!!   The restaurant is lot more open then most AYCE so usually not lot of waiting too sit down. They do have private rooms for big parties. Not sure if charge extra but nice option too know if party of eight or more. The sushi bar is decent size with two too three sushi chefs going at time. Most part even on say that night half packed we were getting our sushi in timely manner. The server was great keep up on everything and even nice enough towards the end we ordered one too many speciality rolls (thanks Roy) she like no worries no forcing not going too charge us for waste! Think that was really cool!   I like that the restaurant is open because you can have conversations without screaming with other person sitting next or across from you. Oyshi Sushi is place that come back too again but with so many other ones and not that high on my list. Not sure when next time will be but if in the area and out of options good choice.
Love their AYCE (All you can eat) menu. The wait may be long but well worth the wait!

Definitely one of the best sushi joints in Vegas. It's really far from my house, but when I happen to be in the mood to make the drive over the only thing I ever dislike is the bill. Not crazy expensive, just not the cheapest place in town. You get what you pay for in this town, it's worth what they charge on the occasions that I do go.
Used to be okay, not anymore. the amount of rice got so big, so I can't even order a lot of sushi anymore. The rice makes me full :(

Oyshi is pretty tasty. Their nigiri selection was more limited than what I am used to, but the pieces that we did order- the  hamachi (yellowtail) in particular- were good. The fish was fresh and the only items that came across as overly fishy were the oysters. Many of the rolls on the menu had cream cheese in them, and based on the ones our table ordered a lot of them are the same base roll with different sauces. This may or may not bother you depending on your roll preferences.   The nice thing about Oyshi is that their sides as well as one dessert item are included in the AYCE. My hot green tea came in it's own pot, which was also cool. Service was fine, though the servers kept bringing by items that belonged to other tables (not a big deal; just make sure you keep tabs on what you ordered). The only reason I mention this is because Oyshi charges ala carte prices for leftovers like many other AYCE places, so having extra items delivered to your table could be problematic.   AYCE dinner is $28 with an automatic 18% gratuity for parties of 8 or more. I personally won't be adding Oyshi to my sushi rotation, but I would recommend coming here  when you have a larger group due to the bigger capacity of the restaurant compared to other sushi places. They also take reservations.

This place is right next door to my house.  We came here when they first opened up and fell in love with it ever since.  Every dining experience has been excellent - the service is always friendly and attentive and food perfectly cooked/prepared.   We did a few ala cartes but most of the time it's always AYCE, both lunch and dinner.  Heck if they had breakfast I would do that too.    Most sushi places have a few items that are exceptional and a few not so great, but everything here range from good to phenomenal.    Let me talk a bit about their sashimi items.  I love sashimis and this place has some of the best sashimis i've ever eaten.  Their Seared Albacore with crispy onion in ginger sauce is oh so heavenly.  The only  problem is their sashimis are not included with the AYCE menu and that's understandable because the sashimis are pricier.  Another one is the Yellowtail sashimi with jalapeno and ponzu sauce.  OMG this melts in your mouth and it should be called screaming orgasm for your mouth!  amazing stuff!  How about this "Tuna sashimi with shaved daikon in a chef special sauce"? Everytime i finish this plate I want to lick the sauce off the plate but there's always people around me.    Now for their rolls.  They make the typical rolls like Rainbow, Dragon, Spider, Dynamite and Catepillar taste amazing.  Flavor explosion with every bite.  They have a few rolls that are wrapped in thin soy paper sheet that are not as filling as the ones with rice.  Some days I do low carb and i would order a bunch of these.  Pink Lady and Oh My Heart are my favorites.  If you like scallop make sure you order the Volcano, baked scallop with yum yum sauce.    Side dishes and appetizers are very small when you order with AYCE and that's a good thing cuz you just want to taste the variety of stuff.  Finish off with some mochi's and you can die happy.

4.5 stars  Oh sheet, it's oyshi sushi. Definitely my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. This is my go to place for sushi with my husband and his co workers  The wait can be long, so get here early. The longest we've ever waited is max 20 mins  AYCE for lunch is 21 and dinner is 26 bucks, not bad. Which includes a large amount of appetizers and desserts  Favorite rolls: spicy tuna crunch, tiger roll, snow mountains.   The desserts are delicious. The biggest hits being green tea mochi ice cream and the green tea tiramisu.    The service is excellent, the rolls take a while to come out but it's worth the wait because you can taste the freshness.   Like all sushi places, they charge you if you waste food. One bite or two isn't a big deal but don't waste an entire roll.  The restaurant looks like a high ended sushi house, that's well decorated. Very clean and open.   Can't wait to take my out of town friends here.

Sorry oyshi sushi on rainbow but it's just me and the Sahara location now. They must be doing really well to open a second location.   This location is huge compared to the other. They have both very distinct styles and decorations that coincide perfectly. In the rainbow oyshi I sometimes feel cloister phobic when I walk in and have to sit in a jamm packed restaurant. But this location is ginormous. Twice as many customers can fit inside and they have quite a few private rooms and areas. Love that there are four tvs. Two at the bar and two at the sushi bar area. The waitress told us they're trying to put up a projection tv on the wall so all customers inside can see a game, show, or whatever. When they're able to do that it'll be even more awesome.   The children's menu is pretty good and if your child wants to do the ayce sushi they can too for a discounted price.   Don't get confused about the menu. It's very different looking and organized differently from the other location. The only thing not included in it is the sashimi, which is the 5th page.   I found that this location has more of a variety of rolls and desserts too. Such as the rainbow one has creme brûlée, but this one has chocolate and green tea creme brûlée. Which I should add that green tea one looks like infant poop, in color and consistency. BUT is absolutely delicious! If baby poop was that delicious I would eat it everyday. Even my husband was a little afraid to eat it, and was pleasantly surprised at how great tasting it was. He thought it tasted like the green tea ice cream just in custard form.   The usual sushi I get. Tiger, spicy tuna crunch, lobster and screaming were just as top notch as they usually are. It came out super fast and fresh. I thought it may have tasted a little fresher.. Which our waitress says she heard a lot but doesn't know how since both locations get their delivers each morning fresh. Must Be in our minds? I also got my usual calamari, grilled asparagus and egg rolls.  Like always I left plump and happy. This will definitely be our new location since it's larger and closer to our house. Go oyshi!

This place has something for everyone good seating great ambience The food is really good away from the sushi menu this is a great place to take the first time Sushi Eater to experience different flavors and if they still don't like  Sushi there appetizers and side dishes are amazing I recommend the surf and turf and all the desserts are excellent

AYCE is definitely the way to go. We had a party of five and we placed orders every 5 or so minutes. Had about 40 salmon belly nigiri,  5 plates of rib eye, 8 specialty rolls, oysters, different appetizers, dynamites... wish I can eat there every day haha..  One star taken off because appetizers were not consistent, the same plate can taste different on the next order. Tempura Shrimp was also meh ...overall good meal for the price. Service on the other hand was excellent.

I've been to many sushi places in Vegas and Oyshi by far was the worst.  The all you can eat is for 2 hours which is fine but it took over 20 minutes to get my one simple roll and it wasn't even busy. It also took me getting up and taking my glass to a waitress to refill my glass of water and the sushi was very average, for $27 you can find much better sushi with good service.

Pros: $27 AYCE, fresh fish, dynamite app, big pieces of nigiri, multiple sake options, calamari, extra large selection of appetizers, short wait for food once ordered Cons: Only 5 baked mussels per person, oysters tasted bad, seared tuna was closer to fully cooked than just seared, surf and turf was over cooked, tables who walked in after us were seated before us Overall: The majority of food that we ordered was excellent with a few misses but the large pieces of fish that were fresh and tasty made up for the few bombs. Service was decent, not the quickest or most personable plus I had to ask for the check and plates stayed around longer than I would have preferred. One thing is for sure for me, great food outweighs decent service so we will be back soon, especially since it's 2 miles from my house.
Literally, THE BEST all you can eat sushi. Really nice workers and food is amazing. Highly recommend.

Tried this place since I'm not from Vegas but my boyfriend is , and he said it was a fav . I thought it was unique because I've never had AYCE sushi but coming to this place I thought it was worth . The place was really nice and clean , super spacious with nice decor . The staff was friendly and took their time with us when it came to ordering and making sure we were fine or if we needed stuff . The food was great , though the portions were small . Lots of rice on the rolls though , and they don't have much stuff when it comes to raw fish . Other than that , I thought this place was great and I would definitely come back when I'm in Vegas again !
minus one....the worst service i ever had!!!never going back.i love oyshi on the south rainbow ,this location sucks...i've waited for the food for over an hour...

I usually go to the one on rainbow but this one is closer so why not. And it was the same great food, the same wonderful staff. When people who have never tried sushi ask me where to go I always say here, because they never disappoint. This new one has such beautiful decoration and it has such a good vibe.

Let's just all come clean, we all cave to the All-You-Can-Eat Sushi temptress.  And Oyshi has one of the best in town.  The food is phenomenal with awesome custom rolls. The lobster roll is ridiculous!  This is our go-to sushi spot now.  The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it's kind of cold there.  Now that I think of it, every sushi place in town is.  Why is this?  It's not like Japan is in the Arctic or something!? I would give anything to have a sushi joint in a comfortable environment.  However, in the case of Oyshi, the food is good enough to wrap up and brave the winter storm.
We had the green yea cream brûlée, which was very nice! Everything came out at a very nice pace and timing was excellent! Great all you can eat sushi!

Besides this place being full of snobby ass people who have a stick up their....... u kno where .....the food and service is amaze!!! they had a roll with jalapeno ( what big help huh) but it had cream cheese and something else it was so good!!!...and their frid calamari is the BUSINEESS!!! great servive, amazing food, keep it up yall!!!

My boyfriend & all his buddies introduced me to this place, and all I can say is amazing!  I love, love, LOVE sushi and this is hands down one of the best places I have ever eaten sushi at. The employees are always super duper nice and accommodating, the food is delicious, and it's in a nice area. We always get the all you can eat, duh!! ;]  I'm from NY so whenever I visit my bf in Vegas, I always come here at least once. Don't forget to order the parfait for dessert!!

I only went once and I didn't have a great experience.  The food was fine and I enjoyed it, but it was the service that really turned me off.  They never came around, we would wait and wait til someone helped us and even when we got an order in, it took a while.  I'd visit again but it doesn't seem worth it.  Ehh.

Come here for their green tea creme brulee. That is all. No I'm only joking.  In a city where AYCE sushi is plenty of Oyshi does OK. It's in my rotation for when I'm craving AYCE sushi but not in my top favorites I do prefer others a lot more. It's All You Can Eat sushi and you can really eat all you can eat that's at least until they cut you off. It's your typical AYCE sushi, they all are sushi grade and they make your typical sushi dishes everyone is doing. Not many items wowing me but still many items satisfying.  The bad about Oyshi is their spicy tuna, imitation crab usage, and kind of little nigiri and sushi rolls which is fine if you did AYCE cause you can just order more but not cool if you weren't. They have a lot of items you want to order but aren't available with AYCE. They seem to have a lot of rules.  The good about Oyshi is just about everything else. It's a place to go people watch late nights. Did I already mention their green tea crème brulee. I've been there just for it without ordering anything else and when I do AYCE, I'll make sure there's always room for it at the end. They serve some of their entrees on a sizzling hotplate, I do like the steaks and chicken.   They have a lunch special which includes a soup, salad, and your item of choice from various plates, there's a sushi plate, tempera plate, sashimi plate, and sizzle plate. It's not bad if your not wanting AYCE during lunch.  They offer all my favorites that I must have. They have oysters and uni but they're limited. They have shrimp tempera. They have poke, which like everyone else stretched out with other items. They have a good variety of specialty, tempera, baked, and fried rolls.  Don't mine the clubbing music that's usually playing, even during lunch.

one of my favorite sushi places! The all you can eat is at a great price. they have a huge selection and always have great specials! The rolls are unique! The staff is always kind. Thought I do have to agree with previous reviews that the service can be slow - my advice is know what you want and order a lot at once! They will bring it over as its ready. Plus we always sit at the sushi bar so you don't have to wait for a waitress to bring it to you :) There is usually a short wait but I've never waited more than 15minutes even on a Saturday night. ... For the price point, you cannot beat it!! delicious! and the atmosphere is very upbeat!

My girlfriend and I have been to Oyshi Sushi a couple of times and have thought that the food was good. Nothing spectacular. We have always gone if we are craving sushi and they have an AYCE option. We've never had the problem of getting seated right away which other people have mentioned, but I don't blame them because their staff and customer service is plain out horrible.  The first time my girlfriend took my to Oyshi she had an issue with the customer service that the waitress was giving her. She did not clarify the oysters which was a part of the AYCE and after she was very rude. After taking our order we saw her twice and then thereafter other waitresses had to take our order and deliver our food.  Our second time going to Oyshi it was fine. We were seated in a timely manner and received our orders of AYCE sushi without any issues.  The third time we went to Oyshi is WHY IM WRITING THIS REVIEW and have joined YELP and is also why I'm NOT GOING BACK THERE. We were seated in a timely manner and our order was taken in a timely manner as well, but after the waitress (Pinky) took our order of AYCE we never saw her again. That's when everything fell apart. Our food took at least 20 mins to come out and it wasn't even busy. Not only that, we always order baked mussels with our order  and that never came out to the point where we order a second round. We had to call over the host or the manager or whoever the guy that was dressed up with a tie was. When Pinky never came back a young waiter started to follow up on us. This waiter was "AWESOME!" NOT!!! The guy would only look at my girlfriend and never acknowledged me at all. I had to flag the guy down to get a refill on my drink because he would just ask my GF and leave. After waiting and losing our appetites we didn't even ask for dessert which is a part of the AYCE. We were so disgusted with the service that we just asked for the bill.  Lastly, THIS IS WHY I GAVE THEM A ONE STAR...  My bill came out to be $61.62 and because of the wait and the horrible customer service I DID NOT TIP THEM. SO TELL ME WHY AFTER A COUPLE OF DAYS MY ACCOUNT WAS CHARGED $72?!?!?!?   Those ******** CHARGED MY CARD AN EXTRA $10.38 meaning they tipped themselves and FRAUDULENTLY CHARGED my card EXTRA!!!!  At what point do they think they deserve my $10.38?!?!  Never go to OYSHI SUSHI!!!! EVER!!!
Kenny Kenny Kenny!! :D   Sushi was great, Kenny was better!  Thank you so much for your amazing customer service and the laughs!   We will defiantly be coming back :D

Yet another phenomenal dinner at Oyshi. Food, service, atmosphere, everything was great.   Service was attentive, but not overbearing. Never had to wait for a refill, and we were frequently checked in on.   But the real kicker was our sushi chef, Nacho. Friendly, funny and overall just awesome. I'm always impressed when the chef offers to make me their own creation, and his was truly delicious. Not like anything else I've ever had, and so amazingly plated, I almost didn't want to eat the roll.   Plus with their drink specials Mon-Thurs, this place is definitely in my AYCE sushi rotation.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this new sushi restaurant on Sunday for dinner since it was just opened right by our apartment. The sign "All You Can Eat" really lured us in. As we walked in, we immediately noticed the decor and thought it was so modern and clean. The place looked very inviting and the hip "ultra lounge" type music was cool, too. We sat at the sushi bar and opted for the all you can eat for $26 each. The menu had several good choices and all the food items, excluding sashimi, was included on the all you can eat. The quality and portions were pretty good too. We made sure we got our money's worth..and we did!  And they serve redbean ice cream as one of the dessert options. I would totally recommend this place if you want to try a new sushi restaurant in the Southwest part of Las Vegas. Great date night place, hint..hint to all you guys wanting to impress a girl.

I used to go to Oishi Sushi frequently when I lived nearby. It's a very nice, cozy, somewhat upscale place with class and ambiance. Low noise  & dim lights make it great for dates. Best Red Dragon rolls in town (my personal favorite.)

I stopped in here alone and sat at the bar when visiting a friend in Las Vegas. Super clean, fresh and delicious sushi with creative rolls and great 2 for 1 deals. Ask for Pedro, Curtis and Mikey and you won't go wrong! I had the Alaska Roll, Ika Nigira and an off the menu spicy tiny halibut roll that they made when I asked for a roll topped with lemon. I'm super picky when it comes to fresh fish as I grew up eating some of the freshest from the California coast and Bodega Bay. Ika especially is hard to find fresh - usually I order it and am disappointed to find it mushy, but not here.  So good!

This is the second time I've been here and I have yet to be impressed.  The Oysters were UNEDIBLE, not fresh at all. And the Sushi in general just didn't seem very fresh either AND they put quite a bit of rice with the nigiri to fill your ass up with THIN ass slices of fish! Second time not impressed, not wasting anymore time, money or calories here.  Sorry!

The sushi was good and for the all u can eat price and what they include its definetly worth it.  We sat at the sushi bar and interacted with the guys rolling our sushi and had a great experience. We got there before the dinner rush and would definetly recommend getting there before the rush because they fill up quick.  I will definetly be back.

I've been here once since moving to Vegas so far and I LOVED it.  Service was great, menu is HUGE especially for all you can eat (AYCE), and the sushi chefs were very nice and welcoming.  I cannot wait to return here again and eat as much as possible.
Went there for AYCE at 5:30 and it was still happy hour pricing.  Nice fish to rice ratio and excellent service. Highly recommend!
I love the food here no doubt but I wish they learned how to make the sushi faster D; I guess they do that on purpose so we don't eat as much or something but I'll still go back [:

Wow...I didn't realize that I haven't done a review for one of my favorite AYCE sushi joints.  Anyway...here it is:  Located on the southwest side of town at the corner of Rainbow and Robindale.  Plenty of parking.  Customer service is a bit lacking compared to when they first opened but I'm sure it's cause they always have a full house.  Reasonable price for AYCE at $21.00 for lunch and $26.00 for dinner.  They have a wide range of menu options which includes appetizers, sashimi/sushi, signature rolls, entrees, kids menu, and my favorite...desserts.  They also have food options for vegetarians.    There are private dining areas for a more intimate experience with seating from 5-20+ people.  The smaller private room seats about 5+ people and has couches for seating and a tv, so while you are dining you can chillax, enjoy your food, and be entertained by the tv.  The larger room can seat about 20+ so it's ideal for larger parties but there are no couches, just regular seats, however, there is a tv.

We have always enjoy eating at the Rainbow location but we want to check the new location out.  As it happens, it's better at the Sahara location.  Since we are regulars, Pedro recognized us and has been amazing.  He made 6 different dishes for us tonight.  And they were fabulous.   The wait service needs improving as he kept asking if we were finished and then when he took away our empties, he dump sauce on my coat and purse.  Still we were a fan and will be back very soon.  Like next week.

More like 2.5 stars...  I heard good things about this place so I checked it out finally, but the food was mediocre... Not a fan of the rolls - they were overly flavored and rolled messy.  I wanted to like this place, but there wasn't anything that cried great to me.  The seaweed salad was probably my favorite appetizer...   The place is a quite overpriced for the food.  I didn't feel the fish was fresh and they used a lot of flavoring to cover-up the meh quality of its food.

My boyfriend and I got food poisoning from this place. They took forever to bring out my roll (45 min) and my boyfriend was already done when mine came. Keep in mind I'm vegetarian and I still got food poisoning. I'm pretty sure they let our rolls sit there forever. The service was also awful! The lady didn't even ask us for refill on drinks until we got a check. DO NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE NOT EVEN MY WORST ENEMY. Avoid hospital visits and costs.

Great place! While visiting my best friend who lives here, she highly recommended doing something off the strip and different. I had never heard of an all you can eat sushi place that wasn't at a disgusting buffet. This place is great because you can order sushi and small apps, including small plates and salads with the all you can eat special. Not only was the food delicious, but the music was just as good! I could have stayed in there all night. Loved it.

I don't eat rolls with that fancy mayonnaise on, just nigiri for me and the sides. I don't usually do all you can eat but this place is almost always fresh. Almost. They get deliveries every other day so that's why I dropped a star, just for the off day here and there.

The food is great! There isn't anything on the menu that I don't like. Great food and great pricing equals an awesome night. I only rated it 4 stars because of the service. I've been there about ten times and only once did I get good service. I'm sure once their staff is a little more experienced I'll change my ratings to a 5.

Worst experience ever today. Have been a customer for 5+ year aince th original location on Rainbow... the waitress forgot our order too many times and than finally no rolls ever came. So i ended over paying for a Chicken teriyaki my kids ate. Definetely coming back. Will try Rainbow. Problem with branching out, service is never the same.

We've been here multiple times, probably 5+ times with good results. My husband and I went yesterday and things just tasted off. I ordered the teriyaki beef roll and wow it was really disgusting but you know if you don't finish it you have to pay for it. I choked down two pieces, it was horribly nasty. Also at the same time I had a baked roll with shrimp w/crab and lobster on top. The crab was super fishy smelling and just didn't taste right. I should have sent it back but our waitress was never at our table. Twice we had to have one of the guys who brings out the food go get her.  I've been in and out of the bathroom since we got back last night and needless to say I think I got food poisoning. After this experience I'll never go back!

Best sushi for the best price! My recommendation is to get the all you can eat Buffett. My favorite roll are the rattlesnake and my husband's is the hot tamale. Hands down, rattlesnake is the best!   I took off one star because the service is a hit or miss.

Had lunch there toady with my hubby .the sushi rice is leftovers it's undercooked. The service was bad. Waited a long time for order even though there's only 3table customers in  . We like the other location much more.

Definitely one of the best sushi places I have ever been. You get a great deal when for the all you can eat. Great service and excellent food. About a 15 minute drive from the strip, but sooooo worth it

Where do I begin? It was a Tuesday night and the restaurant looked busy. My group of 12 had one of their private rooms. The biggest stink about this experience is the service. They took my drink order 3 times and all I asked was for some water. I asked them to bring out a birthday cake after we were finished eating. One server came in and told me that he would clear out the dirty dishes before coming out with the cake which he didn't do. I had to get up and ask for extra dishes and forks from the hostess desk. They brought out the cake without lighting the candles that were provided and the cake still in the box. The food quality was not very good. The steak teriyaki meat crumbled in my mouth which basically meant that the meat wasn't fresh but frozen. I won't be coming back since there is so many better japanese spots in town.
Sushi is always fresh always good service. Love the vibe this spot has. I love how they're open late.
Best sushi place in town, I have tried many other places and nothing compares to Oyshi!!!!

I used to love this place but after coming here last night I've lost all hope in this place!   I came with a party of 6 all hungry and ready to eat.  I ordered the lobster fair and love affair .. Which I got about 25 mins after I ordered.. Once I got that me and my friend both ordered the surf and turf (which after 40 mins we never got so we just said f**ck it) our waitress was pretty much non existent the only person we saw was Stephen the server who was a complete douche every time we asked him if we could order he gave us the biggest attitude and said what do u want? One of my friends said to him" well if u don't wanna take our order can u send our waitress" who came to our table 20 mins later at this point we all order the ayce and only got 2 rolls each after 2 hours of not eating we were fed up ordered dessert that took another 20 mins to come out so after that we asked to talk to manager... Andy came out listened to our spiel and look uninterested and walked away ..not really say shit to us.. So we got out bill they took off ONE ayce and ONE sake without an apology or even an explanation...  Management and staffing need a total re-training you guys are all unfriendly and obviously don't want anyone's business .. We won't be coming back

All you can eat sushi in Vegas for $27?    Skeptical at first, but definitely hit the spot with all the rolls with jalapenos. Average sushi, but even the Professional Fat Kid has been hit hard by the economy.    I'm just glad it wasn't Todai.  Oh...and saw Chandella Powell, UFC ring girl.  Didn't want to pull a tourist moment, so I didn't ask for a picture.

They use old menus, stating party of 8 will be 18% gratuity. In the end they charged us 18% when we were just a party of 5. Not even giving us a notice since they don't update their menus.
