I wouldn't be as mad if the service was better but they rarely came to check up on us. At the end of the meal and after paying, my first order of dishes were still on the table. No one even bother to come take it away. The service was not even good enough to be 18%, no warning whatsoever at all.

We've been coming to this place for 3 years now. We order about the same thing most of the time. We are big AYCE sushi fanatics. When we first ordered, we already gave them what we usually order all at once. Then, we were questioned if we can finish it. Of course we said yes. Then we gave them our second order which is about less than half of what we first ordered. When they came back with the albacore we ordered, they gave us a regular tuna. We asked a couple times if it was really albacore and they insisted it is. We know how an albacore looks and taste like. It's one of our favorite fish and it's a must have for us. It seems like they are trying to trick customers with a different but similar looking fish or low grade items. We've tried another sushi place that did this kind of deception before but this is a first from this place. We have plenty of good sushi places in our area but we go out of our way to go to this place. We will not be coming back here anymore and so will the rest of our  family. I'm giving it 2 stars because of the promptness of the food.

Good all you can eat sushi. We had a very nice variety of sushi and apps. The nigiri was nice and fresh and oysters were tasty. The rolls were also good, we tried my favorite, monster and yellow tail trio. We also ordered the miso soup, beef roll teriyaki and shrimp tempura. For dessert we tried the green tea cake tiramisu, berry parfait, mango mochi and some green tea and vanilla ice cream. Worth the wait and filling.

I've been here multiple times and consistently had a great experience.. up until the past few months. The service and food was always up to par, even during busy times which is most of the time. The All You Can Eat lunch and dinner specials are a nice deal and include appetizers, plenty of sushi options, and absolutely delicious desserts! The only problem I've had is with pretty bad service... or rather disappointingly horrible service. Where you're sitting wondering if your server is intentionally ignoring your empty table. Especially my last visit when I invited my family that was visiting from out of state, our server seemed incredibly distracted and had to be asked multiple times where our food was after waiting 30+ minutes in between rolls and seemingly every roll we ordered mysteriously never made it to the chefs. We ended up being in the restaurant for almost THREE HOURS. Not where I want to spend so much of my night.. I hope management can reinforce the importance of prompt/positive customer service and maybe we'll make this our regular sushi spot again. Maybe.

I just realized that I have not yet written a review for my favorite sushi spot on earth! Here it goes!! Although I have not been here in months because I moved on the opposite end of Vegas, now turning into a 30 minute drive, compared to a 5 minute drive =(  WHERE: Located on Rainbow & Robindale  WHAT:  Everything about this local sushi joint is outstanding! From the uniqueness of the special rolls to the to the great customer service, this is the place to try!  If you do get the chance to come here for your first, second, or millionth time, I suggest AYCE all the way!! Lunch is 24.95 and dinner is 27.95- so worth the time and money spent!  One of my favorite appetizers is the ahi poke! There's something about the mixture that makes you want to order 5 of them and make your own dish!  ROLLS: -Oyshi roll: The first thing you should try! It is their special roll, and the absolute best!! -Vegas & Sibuya rolls: If I can recall, these are the 2 rolls without rice! & are both full of flavor! -Japanese Lasagna roll: I always have to have my baked roll!!  There are other great rolls, but I can't remember what the names were! So, until next time! I will update soon!  *NOTE: You also get a free dessert with AYCE!! There are the fruit&yogurt parfait, creme brulee, ice cream, or mochi!
This is the 3rd time here and it still is a 2.5 star, 3 star at best. Service is terrible, food is either sweet or salty. I was hoping it would improve. Its consistently bad.

I have been here several times hands down best sushi joint in Las Vegas. Always clean & efficient with great food and service not to mention amazing happy hour specials. Don't forget dessert because the green tea ice cream is the perfect way to end the night. Also all you can eat
One of our favorite sushi places in town. Reasonable priced all you can eat and sushi chefs are always super friendly! We love the upbeat atmosphere and music! We will keep going back for more!

This place has excellent sushi and the ayce menu is very extensive. It's priced about what all other sushi restaurants charge so that is fine. It's also pretty big and open which is nice because you don't feel too packed in.   I really enjoy all their different rolls but my favorites are the Rock n Roll and the crunchy scallop roll. The scallop roll has these little popcorn scallop pieces that are just so tasty.   For dessert I always get the creme brûlée. If you get ayce, you only get one, but if you order a la carte the creme brûlée is served with three flavors (vanilla, green tea, and chocolate) but the vanilla is the best.   The downside to this restaurant is the wait to get seated which can sometimes be a good hour or more because it's popular. The second downside is the service. Sometimes they are pretty unattentive due to the fact that they are so busy.

We arrived before the crowd and had a wonderful experience.  As we were leaving, the place was filling up and service was starting to slow down so i would suggest that the ideal time for eating at Oyshi is not during the rush.  The sushi was good, the price was good and at the time we went, service was very good!  Update: We've returned several more times and the food is consistently good but the service has been hit or miss...more miss than hit.  Downgraded to 3 out of 5 for this reason.

I was there with my husband to celebrate his birthday today.  We came in and waited to be seated. There was a party ahead of us so we waited but asked a passing waiter if we could just head to the sushi bar and sit down. We were told to wait for the waitress to seat us. So we patiently stood around for about 10 minutes to be seated at the bar, at which there were four open seats. The waitress eventually came and seated the party ahead so we stood at the front desk for a bit. Behind us a couple came in, headed to the bar while indicating to that waitress, who waved back to go ahead, sitting in the two middle of the remaining available seats.  My husband and I looked at each other, then the waitress who then indicated they were a party of three and could not move a seat over to let us sit at the bar as well.   We stood there kind of shocked while the waitress then told us we could either sit at a table ( wouldn't be able to do half rolls which as just two people allows us to enjoy more different rolls) or sit at the separate alcohol bar (no bartender, away from the sushi chefs, kind of dark) or wait for one of the other couples to finish at the bar. We felt pretty slighted. We had stood there politely and waited our turn to be seated, only to have the remaining pairs of seats be taken by an INCOMPLETE party with no apology at all from the waitress. Just a kind of oh well you can wait or sit elsewhere.  It was pretty upsetting to have this happen, especially considering we came for my husbands birthday and wanted to do something nice.   We left. Had come before and enjoyed the food, which brought us back, but don't know if we will be returning for awhile. Seriously if I was able to give 0 star I could!

One of the worst experiences I've ever had. Food was good, but it took 15 minutes to be acknowledged, another 10 minutes to get our water. We finally placed our first round of AYCE sushi and it took almost an hour to not even get everything that we had ordered.  We finally had enough and decided to just figure out how much each individual order was and cover it with tax and left.  Here's the worst part, the server came out to get us as we got back to our car and told us we needed to pay the full price for the AYCE since we "got food" even though we barely got anything. Also that server who confronted us literally only talked to us once. Didn't bother to check in, and starting cussing us out saying he would have to pay for it out of his pocket. And then he turned around and said it wasn't even his table. Eventually we went back in and told the manager we weren't paying anything extra than the individual orders and she said ok.  Absolutely inexcusable. The kicker was that we went to McDonald's right after and they apologized for the wait when it would take 2 extra minutes for the fries to be ready.

We came here at 9 pm on a Sunday for dinner. The restaurant was not busy, we were sat fairly quickly. Our waiter waited until our entire party was present before checking to see if we wanted to order. By the time we ordered and food was starting to come out, we were told that it was last call at 9:45 (they close at 10:30). I fm felt rushed and pressure to order more food to make sure I got my money's worth for AYCE. The rest of our food including dessert came out and by 10:15 the staff was mopping and cleaning around us. There were still at least 6 tables still eating while employees were rushing around trying to close up for the night.   I find this extremely unprofessional and terrible for service. Even though the food was good, I felt that I didn't enjoy it because I felt rushed. It was pretty clear that the patrons were being kicked out, the closer it got to 10:30, the more unwelcome I felt.   This location gets 2 stars only because the food is good but the service is horrendous.

The food has gotten a little better since the last two years or so. The service has ranged from mediocre to excellent; it seems to be hit or miss. The people who have worked there longer seem to be comfortable, whereas those who are newer work a little harder to ensure better service. Sometimes it takes a while for a waiter or waitress to come back and check on you, and sometimes they're always there. Sometimes the food comes timely, and sometimes not so quickly, even on the slower days. Again, hit or miss.   This is a great place to bring company, as it is decently and comparably priced, clean, and modern. But we've also had better food at more hole-in-the wall places; the only thing is that it is not as presentable as Oyshi. I guess it depends on what you're looking for -- pretty decent food with a modern feel, or excellent food with a less presentable atmosphere.

Went here on a suggestion and WOW is all I can say. The sushi was fresh and delicious and the variety is awesome. The fact that it is so close to where I live helps a lot also. The Green Tea ice cream is a perfect way to cap off a great dinner. Will definitely be back
Very good, especially for an all-you-can-eat restaurant. Sat at the sushi bar and the chefs were very helpful and entertaining.

Great atmosphere.  Great service.  Reasonable price for all you can eat Sushi.  I like the fact that you can order everything from the menu.  There are many selections of sushi and more variety of Japanese food.  Their sushi is pretty fancy and fresh.  It's a great deal, only $30/person for dinner.  Love it!!!

Sunday night here is pretty packed but people here are very accommodating and friendly. Their AYCE is the bomb!! So my mom and I ordered their Monster, (a little sweet for me), Lobster Fair (omg this is one is freaking good!), Japanese Garlic Lasagna, and many more! However, their Salmon Lover was a little bit so so for us cause the salmon wasn't fresh at all, they used frozen ones. For appetizers, their Seaweed Salad, Ahi Poke, Baked mussels were pretty good. And of course, for dessert, I got some green tea ice cream and their tiramisu too! So yummy! We're definitely looking forward to eat here again besides we just live near here!
First time and Overall everything was good, but the waitress was kind of slow and didn't really pay attention to our table !

By far this is the WORST service I have ever had in ANY restaurant. To begin with I went in with my boyfriend for a nice sushi dinner date which I was super excited for. The host said that the wait would be 30 minutes for two which was okay. We were then seated and I was fine because it seemed to be under the said time. After 5  minutes of sitting our server, Ploi, comes and takes our order : 3 orders of shrimp tempura, 1 agedashi tofu, baked muscles, and poki. 5 minutes pass, 10 minutes pass, a table next to us is seated and they place their order. Our server than returns and we place our sushi order because why not? We're already waiting. Another 5 minutes pass and the table next to us gets their food. WHAT? Then we get our sushi order and finish all of that. Then after a grand total of 35 minutes we get our appetizers. They gave us one order of shrimp tempura but it was fine we just ordered me. After that we get a roll on our table that we didn't order. A rainbow roll. I am very allergic to avocado and if a roll came to our table with avocado inside instead of outside and I ate it I would've gotten extremely sick. Food was good. Service was terrible. Compared to busier places in chinatown the service here was a joke. I will not be returning.

This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants. The service here is exceptionally great. All you can eat is the normal choice. Great roll selection, lobster fair, simply shrimp, pink lady, steak plates, tempura, seaweed salad, poke, etc. The music here is always current and up to date. Toni my waitress was delightful. Her sense of urgency and service is what kept me coming back.

Had Father's Day plans this past Sunday at Oyshi with our family. We called to make a reservation at 7:00pm in one of their private rooms, but when arriving to the location, the hostess and manager told us that "unfortunately" the person we spoke to on the phone forgot to put the reservation into their system. Our family was visiting from California - but plans were ruined on a very special occasion.

All you can sushi spot. A ways away from the Vegas strip. Came here for a group lunch. The set up of this AYCE sushi is cool. You can order individually and instead of placing multiple rolls and other orders in one big plate they served em to you personally so you could easily identify which roll is which.   One of my personal favorite rolls was the "treasure roll". I'd recommend trying that especially during the AYCE menu. Also for the appetizers, get the surf and turf it's shrimp and beef. Staff was really friendly and accommodating. Thank you!
Fire!! Chef Ed killing the game...again! -Ahi Tuna wasabi and special sauce on tempura seaweed

Discovered this gem  by yelping restaurants in the area.  I was starving!  Skipped breakfast so I was extra hungry!  Decided to try this place because they had AYCE sushi and they just opened.  We were the first people there.    Lunch time AYCE is $23.  There was a good selection to choose from.  I always have to get the poke salad!  Most places I go to the seaweed salad is always fishy.  Omg!!! Perfect seaweed salad not fishy at all!  The poke was sashimi style nothing added to it.  I could it the poke and soy sauce all day, it was that good!  The sushi rolls were good.  I will definitely be back to try the dinner which was $35 and it offered sangrias!!!

My friend suggested that we check this place out.  I was pleasantly surprised that the venue was much bigger than I thought it was.  Also the All You Can Eat Menu had a lot of different things that I haven't seen on other menus around town.  The sushi was great.  The one roll I compare restaurants with is the salmon skin roll and I liked it here.

Found hair in soup and waiter lied said its something else. Service is bad and unresponsive. Food was not good. Believe me I'm a cook. Im also a well travelled asian. 2 star for decent atmosphere. Good job interior designer.

I have a love/hate relationship with this place. LOVE their AYCE menu, but I hate how I have gotten an upset stomach not once but twice after eating here. Last time we came here they had a C health department rating and we didn't notice it until we left- and these are suppose to be properly displayed not next to the door where you can only see once you are leaving.  I will probably still come back every now and then but ever since getting sick twice I just feel like I should probably find another sushi place near my house. The servers are okay, I have only had one server that was attentive the rest usually just stop by every now and then or whenever you wave them down-- which would be understandable on busy nights but I have only ever been there after dinner rushes.

I've been here so many times and yet I forgot to do a review. Me & the husband love this place. Andy the manager is always friendly and helpful. The fish is always fresh. I do like the variety of  rolls,  appetizers, and dessert.. Strangely enough, I've never really had any of their dessert because we seem to pig out of the AYCE and never have room for it at the end. The price is decent for quality and amount of food you get.  They have a large parking lot so, no worries about a parking space.
Great sushi given the location. Price and quality were in line and they are super nice.  If you are traveling and looking for a quick in/out, this is a perfect spot.
Was pleasantly surprise by this sushi place . very affordable and good food quality . SErvice was great , I really recommand this place . Salmon and avocado rolls were amazing .
Great spot of lunch. All you can eat for 27 bucks is nice. I always sit at the bar and my always come out quick and to my liking.

Lunch $ 21.00 / Person - Dinner $ 26.00 / Person for AYCE.  Rice, rice, rice and a brick of rice in my belly. This place really knows how to give the illusion of a good fish to rice ratio by giving lengthy fish slices, but underneath you meet your doom of impending rice. They compacted the rice so it was thick like a rock.  The menu selection is not great for AYCE, you have many limits on what and where you can order from. No sashimi, no soft shell crab (only in rolls), no half rolls, all the rolls are large standard size -mostly 8 pieces with the exception of some that are 5 pieces (still the same large size as the 8 pieces, just cut differently.) Not a great place if you want to try a bunch of different rolls. Even the nigiri selection was limited and overall pretty unimpressive.  Don't even think about ordering the ahi poke, seafood salad, salmon skin salad, or any of their salads for that matter. They were crazy weak in flavor/ fish/ execution. I wasn't happy with them. At all.   The only redeeming dishes were: 1. Dynamite appetizer  2. Salmon belly nigiri 3. Baked mussels  4. Green tea creme brûlée And that's it...  The service we received was below average. They weren't even busy! There were 2 other tables dining besides us. We had to ask multiple times to different servers to grab us wasabi and hot sauce. Our waitress was missing, most of our dinner.  In the end, we left feeling uncomfortably stuffed due to the dense rice expanding. To top it off, it was hot and stuffy in there, and the music made my ears bleed. I agree the interior design was new, modern, beautiful, and spacious, but the overall night club vibe of the restaurant was highly disconcerting.   In a city that loves a good AYCE sushi joint, this is not the place to go. I would recommend another Korean ran spot that does a better job: Sakana.   Now, with a belly busted from rice, I bid you good luck and good evening.

I live on this side of town and for an AYCE and high volume restaurant the service and quality is great! There is often a wait at prime dinner times but that a good sign if you ask me :-) We often do our girls nights here and I don't see that changing any time soon!
Simply amazing is all I can say!  I am a Sushi rookie but this place makes me want to eat it all the time!

When eating AYCE here, stuff your faces with everything from the appetizers, nigiri to the dessert... everything was good.  Especially the dessert.  The maki rolls are packed with a lot of rice and are portioned so large, they do not fit the mouth, and they will fill you up after 1 order.    We would go back if the service was a little warmer.  I was "reprimanded" by the host for letting my toddler walk around the dining area.  Says he's getting in the way.  Seriously?  I'm already not fully enjoying my meal coz my kid is acting up.  You're supposed to make me feel better, not worse.  I curse you host with tantrum toddlers, many of them!  Hehe.

The biggest piece of salmon I had been served so far in Toronto :-). I enjoyed my plum wine. I recommend to order it with your dessert. It is as sweet as Port.  I wouldn't go back because the place is tiny and you can hear everyone's conversation. Good place to order take out though.

I've been here too many times to not write a review.  Service has always been great. Every waiter/waitress that have waited on my party and I have been attentive and polite.  We usually come here for dinner/late night. Our orders were always correct and it comes out pretty quick...I'd say within 10-15 minutes.  We ALWAYS order the ATOMIC BOMB ($11). And yes...it's bomb dot com. We also order the usual spicy tuna roll. Here at Oyshi they make one of the best spicy tuna rolls. Some spicy tuna rolls are not even spicy...but here, there's a great kick to it.  We've also tried other rolls like Love Affair, Heart Attack ($9-13) and a few others. Didn't really leave a lasting impression.  A few days ago, we tried the JAPANESE GARLIC LASAGNA and it was yummy!!!! Soooo now I got a new roll added to my usual two.  Can't wait to be back! Never disappoints! =)

Love this place! !  Was a patron of the original one on Rainbow,  but this one is close to my house and am now a regular! !  Sushi chefs are awesome,  know us and make us original awesome things to try. The bartender knows us and automatically brings us the Nigori Sake we like.  Thank u!!
My very best sushi stop ever. The All You Can Eat items are the best variety that I've seen. The service can't be beat. The atmosphere is perfect. I absolutely love it here.

I come to this location a lot, usually i come earlier, but tonight I got off work at 11, and really wanted sushi, I called and googled to see if Oyshi is still open, it says it closes at 2am and they told me they were still open, by the time I get there it's 12am, ask I'm walking in, all the chairs were already stacked up and they told me they are completely closed, At 12am!  it's very annoying when you googled and called to make sure, and when you get all the way there, they drop the bomb on you saying that they are closed, when clearly on the window it says open until 2am, on the website it says open until 2am, and on the phone they say they are open!  So I feel very manipulated!! And very upset by this!
Very good service and selections. Steak, pork belly and oysters ( dinner only ) are available with AYCE. Nice ambiance and not much noise.     I'll continue to visit.

If you're gonna do all-you-can-eat sushi you might as well come here. The sushi is decent, the service is good and the vibe is great! It's great that you can order hot plates, appetizers and desserts in addition to sushi.  We've come in with our two young children a few times and the staff has always tried to get us comfortable (read: secluded) table which we appreciated.  Not sure if it is poor ventilation or what but I always walk out smelling a bit greasy. Keep this in mind if you plan on going out afterwards.

We can't decide if we want to call this place,  "Oyshi-No-No" or "Oy-She-Didn't"  ENVIRONMENT  Very large room divided into different areas. It seemingly looks good, but upon further inspection, it's clear that something isn't right -- dirty plates, strange Saran wrapped bottles at the bar.  FOOD The quality of fish is definitely low-brow. I believe we saw signs for all-you-can eat-options, so it's expected I suppose, but just don't get your hopes up.   SHOUT OUT The Volcano Roll comes Honey-boo-boo style.  SERVICE Horrible. The waiter always came to our table apologizing when he didn't do anything and that's when he actually came to our table. Please invest in training your staff, or continue to see these reviews about your service.   AFTERMATH It's probably best you go somewhere else if you know what I mean.

This place sucks and I never even ate a thing here. I drove past a few of my faves on Saturday evening 5/14/11 only to find myself being ignored while standing in the doorway for over 5 minutes. Four different people who are employed there including the manager behind the sushi bar saw us and 2 other groups of people behind us and still no acknowledgment. No one wanted to even tell us that they did not have tables and what the expected wait would be. Ill wait if its worth it. I bailed and will never darken their entry again. They have to learn that there are so many options that are good out there. I drove out to Summerlin and ate at a Sushi bar on Lake Mead and Rampart called" It's Sushi". It does not have AYCE available. However the superior quality of the fish makes eating anything there great. The prices are fair. They do have a Happy Hour.

First timer here and I'm SOLD!! Sushi and apps are on point! Our server was awesome! Very attentive and able to suggest roles & meat to our liking I will definitely be Coming back to this location no just for the great food but also for the fantastic service

Food was ok but overpriced for $27 AYCE, our server was slow and never checked up on us. I constantly had to ask the busser to get our server, since he wasn't allowed to take any additional orders. Very disappointed. One of our rolls had questionable fish. It definitely wasn't fresh. Won't be coming back here!
Great service, Casual atmosphere and amazing food. Best sushi in town! I recommend this place to everyone I know.

Okay but not the best.   Ate here today for the first time. The waiters were nice and they were very attentive, but the food took longer than expected, especially appetizers. All we ordered we poke bowls but it took about 15 mins to actually get it. Then we ordered 3 rolls and the restaurant wasn't even busy but it took them at least 20 mins...   Also I wouldn't drink their water. Had a very metallic and off putting taste to it. No bueno. And their nigiri is very small! I was surprised at the amount of rice they had with each piece of nigiri! The rolls did taste good, they were just smaller compared to other rolls at other sushi restaurants.

Love it love it love it!!! It's a regular sushi bar with an 'all you can eat' option. (Does not include sashimi). So delicious. You can even get 1/2 size sushi rolls to dance around the menu. The crunchy tuna was my favorite. I also loved that you can get soup, salad, tempura, poke, and all other appetizers included. Loved it so much I went 2 nights in a row.

Have had mixed experiences with service. Sushi is good but really only rolls with rice , no quality rolls without rice or other healthy options. The rolls we had were good, the spicy tuna is good no matter which roll choose

We finally checked out the new location of Oyshi at Sahara.  It's nice and roomy.  As usual sushi was good.  They had some new stuff on the menu.  I'll be sure to try them next time. We got to see Nyi again.  I think he actually remembers us although we haven't seen him in years.  This location is a little far from us but we'll be back for sure when we're in the neighborhood.  Otherwise we'll be at the Rainbow location bugging Ryan and Justin.  Ha ha!!!

The service and food is okay. Although there sushi is always gonna be same amount of fish and rice ratio. The only bad thing about this place is the sushi takes 30 to 40 minutes to come out. I ended up staying here for 2 and half hours because the food took so long to come out. I would rather go to other location which gives better service and food.   They had already did auto gratuity which I don't mind but they could at least did a better job on taking care of us.

Been coming here for about a year already and the sushi is still bomb!! Usually sushi places fall off once they become more popular but not here! Definitely recommend it, also they have a great verity of amazing appetizers.

Sushi-great ; service- great music- wtf?? Electronic dance music during dinner?? Ugh this is not Sushi Samba! Totally out of place. Annoying atmosphere to say the least. Unfortunately my wonderful dinner was accompanied by aweful club style trap music.. Very disappointing.

I've eaten here twice but I doubt there will be a third visit. As for the food, it's pretty good. Nothing extraordinary, but pretty average. I got the all you can eat, and I got my $21 worth. No complaint there. But the sushi isn't very authentic in that it's nothing a Japanese person would readily recognize. Seems to be part of this "fusion" sushi movement. I told the sushi chef it wanted an omekase selection, and he had no idea what I was talking about. BAD SIGN! I probably should have just given up and gone to Osaka, but alas I stayed. Most of the rolls were average, but the yellowtail trio had a terrible ginger sauce. I couldn't finish it.   Aside from the food, the service was non-existent. I moved to a quiet corner to avoid a very loud group and I was completely forgotten. I had to get up and ask for my check after 15 minutes of waiting.  My biggest complaint is with the music. There is rap music blaring, even on a Sunday afternoon. I guess they're trying to attact a young, hip crowd, but they're really only driving away customers. I asked them to turn down the music to no avail, and left with a pounding headache and resolved not to come here again.

We love coming to this place for sushi, but was very unhappy with our visit tonight. We always sit at the bar because we like to watch them make our food, and their sushi chef who has a blue pony tail had a major attitude. He was a complete jerk. Was swearing and yelling at his coworkers and was extremely unprofessional. Might try again sometime but will not be served by him again....

Food quality and taste 5/5  Service 2/5 If you do the AYCE (all you can eat) they take years to bring anything and forget some of your order because they take so long which forces you to constantly repeat and ask about the food you ordered.   Price 3/5  Kinda expensive  Overall experience 3/5
It was my first time here and the food was pretty great and the service was awesome definitely recommend it to anyone who is a sushi lover definitely is the spot come and have some good sushi

This was our first time coming to Oyshi and we will definitely come again! The food was delivered in a timely manner and tasted delicious! My boyfriend is allergic to avocado and cucumber (unfortunately) so finding good sushi can be a bit hard for him. Our waitress, Odi, was very cooperative and made sure that whatever he ordered was completely free of his allergies! I also noticed that she was really busy, every table in the place packed, however she remained very calm and checked on us frequently to make sure we had the food we needed and that we were doing okay. Thank you Odi for making our first experience a great one! We will be returning soon!
Great food! All the sushi is nice and fresh. Great service. Only negative is how loud it can be with everyone talking. Must be the sake kicking in. LOL
Fantastic sushi, great food! We had a great time having dinner with our friends there.The servers were super nice and helpful. We loved the new location!

Used to be great but quality and service so bad now. This neighborhood is ripe for an all you can eat sushi place.  If you sit at the bar it's the best  bet.  But maybe just drive ten more minutes out to a better place.

Had the all-you-can-eat dinner with the family tonight.  The food was fantastic and the service even better.  Our waiter Golden was outstanding, knowledgeable, attentive and gracious.  Thanks for a great evening!

We had the all-you-can-eat sushi and went a little crazy. The surf-and-turf is a delicious appetizer, and will come out to your table steaming on a cast iron plate. The peppered yellow tail was another one of my favorite appetizers, with a smokey flavor. The "Lava Flow", "Japanese Lasagna" and "Heart Attack" were three of my favorite rolls. Dessert is included in the AYCE deal, and I enjoyed the creme brûlée.

I hate saying the word "date".  I prefer meet & greet. He was already seated at a table but I preferred the bar as usual when I'm in Sashimi mode.  Cool, noisy place, lots of energy!  Spacious table setting for groups and can be romantic.  The waiter was so attentive!  The chef I think was eavesdropping at our conversation lol I ordered a big bottle of sake then seaweed salad - EXCELLENT - usually I share so I have room for the real stuff. To die for sashimi platter  - red snapper, albacore ( wished they had Blue Fin), Spanish Mackerel.  Nice almost perfect sliced pieces. Lots of interesting conversation in between...more Sake.  Finally I offered sake to the Chef which I often do when I'm seated at the bar solo. He accepted and we toasted Kampai. The Piece de resistance to top off my already overstuffed belly - Unagi w avocado hand roll - moist not drenched in sauce.  Not too sweet and seaweed wrap just perfect & crisp for biting into!   I walked away with one of the best meals & company I've had in a long time!  Go and experience it for yourself!

I thought most tasted fresh n good, though I was not a fan of the dynamite n I thought the popcorn shrimp was a bit too much for 2 ppl (I can't eat that much fried). My favs that I do recommend was the oysters, the mussels, salmon belly(off the specials board), the ahi Poké, agedashi tofu, the uni, the salmon roe with quail egg. The rest of the nigri tasted dry, the ebi ebi roll was alright, n tho I did like the taste of the nyi roll, that don't taste or look like soft shell crab like it says lol

Insane, been here plenty times before and just being seated there was still rice, sticky floors on our table and our hostess once contacted about the situation told us well that's everywhere. What kind of answer is that? I've never left a bad review on yelp before. Please look through. This had to have been the most ignorant thing anyone has ever said to me when having an issue, I'm very easy going. Hope the owner sees who / what type of people he's hiring, unbelievable.
Great as usual, can never get enough of this place!! Love the all you can eat sushi and appetizers.
Came in for lunch and the all-you-can-eat was great. They got super busy, but kept up with all their orders in a timely mannner.  The chefs were great!  Super friendly, fun to talk to at the bar.

The quality of fish was not great. Another ayce sushi failure :/ fish to rice ratio was not good either. I asked not to put too much rice but they still did. Rice was too dense, felt like they really squeezed rice hard. Nothing was impressive here, I felt like it was waste of $26.   On top of that, fish was really not fresh! I started feeling sick as returning to hotel and as soon as I got there I threw up everything. It was a bad experience. Won't return.

My wife (who surprisingly doesn't eat seafood) was introduced to this place and she's addicted.  She gets all the egg rolls and teriyaki chicken and beef she can eat, and even some rolls without fish.  The all you can eat deal it great.  I leave feeling like I will never need to eat again.  The food is great, the service is good, and the Mochi desert is interesting.  Even the kids meal is quite large for being only $6.  If you want good sushi, this is your place.  They make the rolls after you order them so be sure to be patient and order several rolls at a time so you don't have to wait for a long time between orders.

This place has awesome sushi. I recommend getting the all-you-can-eat. Quality and fresh sushi that doesn't break the bank. When we were there, the chef made us a special flamin hot Cheetos roll. I don't usually order rolls, but this was pretty darn unique and good. Service was awesome and friendly. Definitely recommend this place. Will go back soon!

This used to be our AYCE spot but not anymore!  The food is great however the service is not so appealing! This actually caused us to venture elsewhere and now there's no turning back. You shouldn't be questioned whether you can eat all you order! I am there to eat for goodness sakes don't tell me not to order too much. I do understand there's time when people do order excessively and cannot finish their food. But that's not everyone so please stop asking us if we can finish what we order, I'll pay for extra if that day comes!   My new spots, Yama sushi, Sushi Koma, and Umiya!

1) Ambiance: Modern, busy, high energy with techno/dance music playing.  2) Price: Comparable to most AYCE Sushi Joints $21 Lunch/ $26 Dinner  3) Service: Slow as far as food preparation. Spent nearly 2 hours on AYCE for 2 people. The servers & management were very nice though. Drinks were always refilled and they came around to check up on us often.  4) Food: Some of the things we ordered.  Appetizers- Baked Green Mussels were good. I could eat 100. Asian Style Skirt Steak - Came out on a sizzilin' platter & smelled terrific but I wasn't diggin' the taste. Nothing special.  Sushi- Fish was eh... just ok. Not as fresh.  Favorite Rolls- Amigo - jalapeno, combination of fish and cream cheese w/ flaming hot chili sauce. Jalepeno-licious! Love Affair - shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes. Scrumptious!  5) Overall: Satisfactory. There were a lot of things we wanted to try but were too full. I would give this place another shot.

The sushi here is so good! Ever since I left there I've been craving their sushi. I'll definitely be coming back here ASAP.  My only complaint is we had to wait a while to be seated when the waiters were just standing around, but they were pretty friendly and patient for a newcomer to sushi like myself

This restaurant used to be okay both food wise and service wise. I'm not sure what's going on these days but the service isn't as good as it used to be. The half of restaurant is empty and they are making us wait 10 min. Why? I always tell myself it s my last time here when I come here. This time, I am 100% positive, WILL be my last time here. There are SO MANY other GOOD aye sushi places. I suggest try them not here
Excellent food, great service. Overall awesome experience. Fresh fish and tasty rolls. Salmon sushi was some of the freshest I've ever had. I will be coming back.
Just superb. Vince, our waiter, did an excellent job attending us and explaining how the AYCE menu works. This will be our go to place for sushi.

Compared to other sushi joints in the Las Vegas area I would rather go somewhere else. The vibe here is ok, good spacious restaurant with loud music. But if you're into that kind of thing go ahead.   Food wise they could cut back on the rice. The rice they put is a little much. I like to judge a sushi joint by their Unagi (eel) i was not impress with the unagi here. It was a little cold.   Overall it was ok.just okay

Couldn't be happier with this restaurant.  Greeted quickly and requested a booth that they cleaned right away and were sat, ordered drinks and then the waiter, Ryan started making suggestions for food.  Since I'm veganish, I didnt want traditional sushi or the sauces containing fish and they had several items on the menu to order.   And I think I tried al of them.  The potato crustini I think it was called was incredible, like deep fired mashed potatoes! Order it without the sauce if your not a meat eater.  I also had the tempura fried veggies and tofu and a veggie "sushi" roll that seriously couldn't have been more happy with.  (See the pics within the post).  The place is clean, upscale modern decor, clean bathrooms and the food and drinks arrived quick!  Ryan repeatedly came back to make sure everything was good and if anything else was needed.  I've read some mixed reviews on here and have to say none of the things I read were my experience here.  Every place has off days and home run days, but I have to believe the way my experience went today is more the norm.  Highly recommend it and will definitely be coming back in the future.

marcos was an amazing server! he was really genuine and attentive, not to mention the food was fresh & extremely delicious! i've ate at oyshi many times but this time was especially memorable, my little girl ate sushi for the first time!!!
Pedro is the best chef! Great service and his special dishes are to die for! Ask for Pedro's specials! Thank me later..

My daughter and I make this our first stop when coming to Las Vegas.  Never disappoints.  Staff, chef's, food dynamite.  Making a reservation is suggested, because it fills up fast, but sitting at the bar you can watch chef's prepare your rolls, and sped is quality.  The all you can eat is the key.  Thanks once again; see you next year.

All you can eat sushi is what they are known for. The sushi is good, some of the best I have had in Vegas. This location seems much quicker and cleaner then the others. A bit over priced, overall good value.

Went in with my girl for lunch and had a HORRIBLE dining experience.  I have worked in the restaurant industry for over 7 years and it has been awhile since I had such horrible service/food.    When we walked in, there was no host/hostess to greet/seat us.  After waiting for 2 minutes, we decided to seat ourselves at the sushi bar.  The restaurant was not packed but had a decent lunch crowd for a sunday.  Numerous servers passed by us and pretty much ignored us.  On top of that, there were 4 sushi chefs behind the counter who did not acknowledge us at all.  Probably after 5 minutes, the manager came by and asked us if we would like something to drink.  It took him probably at least another 5 minutes to grab us our waters.  After placing our order with him, it took another 15-20 minutes to get any of the sushi we ordered.  Talking from a server perspective, how hard is it to make sushi??? There is no cooking involved!  When we finally got our order, I was very disappointed.  The quality of the fish is very subpar and the portions are very small for the price.   All in all, the restaurant itself is nice and has a nice ambiance, but the customer service quality of the servers and sushi chefs are waaaaayy below average.  I would not recommend going here!!

WOW!!! Love this place! My favorite is their salmon skin salad and they all so have all you can eat option. More bang for your buck! The staff are polite and very attentive. This place is pretty much pack so come in early.
We love this place! I do not eat raw sushi but they have a selection to satisfy everyone on their menu.

The sushi was great!  It was fresh and had great preserntation.  If you like both the traditional and contemporary sushi, this is the place to go.   I recommend getting the "all you can eat" selection.  You can order appetizers, rolls, hot food, and a dessert.  For $26.00 plus tip & tax, it's a grea value.  They also have a private room for small parties.

Omg...after all these time that passed by and I am back here again ..same problem exists, the long wait to be seated even if we came after dinner time already. It's taking sooooo long for us to be seated and it's only 2 of us...frustrating and disappointing. So if you guys are thinking of coming over here make sure you bring a lot of patience! I tell you the food is nothing extra ordinary eithet. The only reason I am back is because I thought their service has changed. Double thumbs down again so sad :((
Used to eat there a few years ago And I must to be honest them much do used to be much better Now they're okay Food is okay Service Soso

I guess it depends on what kind of Japanese food you want.  Their rolls?  Fantastic.  Their heart rolls and volcano rolls were strong in flavor with soft textures.  However... their nigiri is only so-so.  I'd come here if you just want to go wild on ROLLS.  That being said, the service here was excellent.  They really try hard to satisfy your needs here.  The atmosphere/decor was nice too.

Good sushi but recent management changes and loosing staff is hurting them.   Service is not so good at times.    Crazy. I have been posting about Oyshi since this location opened. Some very good some not good but nothing nasty. Yet Yelp took  them  down just stupid. What good is posting your opinion if you get censored and trust me I have posted stuff about other restaurants that was not nice       Well real let down tonight. Can't make my favorite rolls right. Really cold in here.  Severed wrong sushi. Wish the original sushi staff would come back      Came back after being gone for a while. Has to be the worst I have had in all the years I ate here.   Done just done.    Back on their game baby  Not sure who or what changed yet, but this is the Oyshi I raved about for
Great service and great food. First time at Oyshi's tonight! All you can eat ice cream! Hell yeah

We had an excellent dinner here tonight! We were a large party of 12 and the service was excellent. Our server/waiter Mikey was especially helpful. He was fast and thorough. We had three small cranky tired children and he made sure everything came out right away for them. For those who also have younger children also know that they usually end up setting the tone for the whole meal! Haha. They were quickly happy and content with their miso soup and rice so that the rest of us could also enjoy our meal. The sushi was fantastic as well. Absolutely loved the green tea creme brûlée!! Thank you again for a great meal. Definitely will be coming back again soon

Hmmm...I was planning to lose my AYCE sushi virginity to Ms. Goyemon but there was a two hour wait so instead I opted for the next girl available named Ms. Oyshi....I'd rather like to think we didn't go all the way and I'm still saving myself for the former.    For 26 bucks, I think it's definitely in line with Sushi Goyemon, but I happened to be in the company of some friends who had been there as well, so I was able to get some perspective as I proceeded with my first time navigating this a la carte ordering feeding frenzy.  The first few speed bumps which caught my eye were some ground rules listed in the menu:  1. No sashimi, only one order of oysters (4 pieces), uni, and sweet shrimp allowed...fair enough  2. No excess rice shall be allowed to remain uneaten on the plate, otherwise that order will be counted as extra on the final bill....have people been discarding their rice into a large pile assembling a massive sculptured mountain of rice?  The rice that was used to prepare the sushi was highly variable in quality  (too soft, too firm, or mixed) throughout the various rounds of ordering so it only motivated us to concoct creative methods for disposing the rice (hiding it in the tea jar, breaking it into tiny grains and scattering it across the plate so as to create the illusion of a clean plate, and to borrow a technique from a friend who disliked rice during her early childhood, placing said rice into mouth and going to bathroom to dispose in toilet/trash).  Of course none of this was done, but it was tempting nonetheless.  3.  Any orders which are unfinished in general will be counted as extra orders on the final bill...this was adhered yet strangely enough after receiving our final round of food (a modest 2-3 rolls) the server waited when we were rubbing our bellies and chimes in "you have two more rolls coming!" and none of us had any idea where these phantom rolls were coming from and she then replies with a snarky shrug  "I'll take them off your order" as if she was doing us a favor....pure shenanigans  4. The jalapeno poppers on the appetizer menu were not allowed to be included amongst the AYCE orders....what kind of crazy logic is this?  Wouldn't it be good strategy to fill your customers with heartburn due to fatty spicy cream cheese richness to slow down their intake of much much more expensive items?  Either these are the greatest jalapeno poppers in the history of appetizers or a missed business opportunity.   I don't even like jalapeno poppers but I almost was willing  to eat one just because this condition existed.  THE MEAL  The appetizers  (ahi poke, spicy sashimi salad, and miso soup)  The poke might as well have been unseasoned sashimi, whereas the sashimi salad was overdressed nearly drowning in the chili vinaigrette, and the miso soup was surprisingly not overly salty as I anticipated but ended up being the surprise highlight of the meal.  The "big three" (uni, raw oysters, and sweet shrimp)...not exceedingly fresh but no risk of possible food poisoning either, although the oysters had a watered down quality to them....only tasted good since they were not specifically paid for.  The nigiri:  I sampled the surfer clam, spanish mackerel, japanese yellowtail, and a few other standards....there was definitely something I couldn't put my finger on but the level of freshness just seemed 1 level below what you would expect if you ordered these same items at a regular reputable sushi bar.  I'm thinking perhaps they were precut in mass production and by the time they arrived they were partially dried out from the external surface area of each piece of fish being exposed for a prolonged period of time.  The rolls:  Perhaps I've had enough sushi experiences to have progressed beyond rolls since they are drenched in so much sauce (seriously, what is the obsession with orgasm sauce in this town?), crispy shavings of empty calories, or packed with so many types of fish that I couldn't really differentiate any of them out of a sushi roll lineup much like the Seinfeld episode where George tries to catch the Twix bar candy thief ("It's a SETUP! They're all Caterpillar rolls!!")  I would try to limit your roll intake and focus on the other items to keep your palate from being overwhelmed(and to avoid the server from pulling that phantom roll maneuver as previously discussed)  Last but not least, we figured we had successfully navigated through the labyrinth of extra charges until we received the final bill which charged us for the hot tea...are you serious???  So you're telling me I could have drank an entire gallon of miso soup instead of one measly cup of hot green tea which cost you pennies to brew?  Perhaps these were some tea leaves taken from the Emperor's garden, but I would appreciate a warning next time.    3 stars only because we definitely still got our money's worth, but I'm leaving a few more stars to be earned since my friends reassured me Goyemon is better.
I love sushi and I love this place. It's nice little noisy but it has some beauty in it . good place . yummyyyy

tldr  I'm partial to the Rainbow location but this is closer to me. Service was surprisingly slow i think we had a waiter in training; drink refills and orders took a long time. The busser actually did a great job filling in and taking order while cleaning up. Very limiting on the baked green mussels.  Get: -Asian skirt steak -love affair -spider roll -monster roll

I'm giving this place 4 stars. The rolls are really good and they have a variety of different ones to choose from. I think I'm a third done with trying all the different rolls.  Last time I went they were very pleasant and attentive to our drinks and our rolls came out in a timely fashion. (Which I love cause nothing sucks more than having to wait for AYCE. You get full faster.) This experience varied extremely different over my first visit where it felt like they couldn't wait for us to leave!  I can happily say that Oyshi has taken up my favorite spot on this side of town. It beat Nagoya hands down.
My husband and I have been going since opening week! I looove their sushi and you cant beat the price! The love affair and the tuna! Always fresh! Also try that green tea ice cream.
We always come in for sushi and food is always good and fresh.  Just want to say that our server Bess was super sweet, attentive and just awesome.
Bomb ass sushi and a great menu selection. The all you can eat allows you to try many different items. I enjoyed it and will be back.

Finally went to Oyshi yesterday (as it was recommended by my friend).  The atmosphere was pretty awesome.  They had a spacious seating arrangement, colorful decor, Xgames and the Laker's Game on TV, and Techno music playing in the background (not really what I had expected in a Sushi joint).  We came for the AYCE @ about $22.00 for dinner.  It's decently priced for AYCE.  The price does not include a drink.  The selection of food on the menu was pretty good.  They had a good assortment of appetizers, specialty rolls, and traditional Nigiri (not to mention hand cut Maki rolls).  I am a big fan of Sashimi, but like 99% of the time, the Sashimi is not included in the AYCE.  I did however stock up on the Sake (raw Salmon) Nigiri.  Being my favorite Nigiri, I found their Sake Nigiri to be very very fresh.  It was super bright orange and tasted incredible!  For dessert, they have a few different flavors of Mochi, but you can only get one.  If I remember correctly, the flavors are as follows: Green Tea, Mango, and Red Bean.  I opted for the Mango and wish I could have had a second since they were pretty small in size.  Anyhow, the Sake Nigiri alone would have gotten Oyshi 4 stars, but unfortunately the service was extremely slow.  On top of that, the only soup available was the Miso Soup.  How do you not have Udon on the AYCE menu?  Seriously?? They also did not have low-sodium soy sauce (I know it still has like 800mg per tbsp , but that's better than 1000mg).  Overall, I'd come here again... I just hope my server can keep my water cup filled.

Oyshi Sushi is one of the best sushi place in town! The service was fast thanks to EJ for providing us the best service every time I come here. I would definitely come back here not just because of the food quality but also for the wonderful service that is provided. The place is clean and very welcoming thanks Oyshi Sushi you served me well

I'm disappointed with the service I got tonight during my "AYCE" experience here. I understand that it can get busy here and there, but it would be nice to have your server check up on how things are going. NOT once did our server check on our table and we waited about 15 minutes per order.. Horrible! -_-  2 stars for the bus boys!
Oyshi, always a pleasure to eat at your establishment. Great service and awesome sushi.
We at the all you can eat AYCE and it was awesome!! Food was yummy and fresh and it kept coming.  We had a party of 11 so we got our money's worth ...yummy food
Very fresh sushi. All you can eat for $26 which is a steal for the quality of the sushi here. Green tea tiramasui is equally creative and delicious. A sure winner for any dinner.

Great sushi. Great service. Great atmosphere .   We've been coming here for years and won't go to any other sushi spot. The servers know us and remember our orders. We usually come on a weekday lunch and it's not too busy.  If you come before 3:30pm it's a little cheaper for lunch pricing.  With all-you-can-eat you have the freedom of ordering all appetizers, all sushi (excluding sashimi) and dessert to finish.  Their fish is extremely fresh and the sushi chef's will make special requested rolls if you ask. They have a great selection on their menu of specialty rolls and descriptions. If you sit at the sushi bar you have the option to order 1/2 rolls if you want to try something new but aren't sure if you'll like it.  Make sure you eat what you order. Don't be that person! If you are completely stuffed they won't nickel and dime you if you don't eat one or two pieces but don't put your server in that awkward spot to charge you. The restaurant is a big open venue and they have private dining rooms too for special events. They play great music all day and it's  not too loud during lunch. Dinner however is more trendy, music is louder, the crowds are bigger and the lights are turned low. Expect to wait on Friday and Saturday nights! I've been quoted up to a 90 minute wait!

I love this place! Great all you can eat option,  but often times I just sit at the bar and get some hand rolls. The spicy tuna with avocado is my favorite.  There's alot of sushi choices in Vegas but this is asking my favorites. The service is always excellent.  Very focused on your satisfaction.

I still love this place. When we want sushi we want Oyshi!  With that said, here's my rant....no matter what night you go here it's ALWAYS packed. That's not my gripe. Upon our recent visit I noticed that they took out some of the tables to put in a rather large hostess stand. This place is already small and crowded, why would you take away seating???  Ok end rant.....

I've been to Oyshi several times now and I absolutely love the sizzling rib eye, beef yakitori and vegetable tempura appetizers. My favorite rolls are the oh my heart, to die for! And the Philly roll   The food is great, the reason I'm only rating 3 stars is because the last 2 times I went the service was awful. Our server was super busy with a large private party and forgot to submit our order, of course it felt like forever to get food. I truly hope the service improves, if not there are plenty of other great restaurants to choose from.

Oyshi Sushi- My go to! I love this place, and im there at least three times a month. I go for the AYCE option. It is like $23 for lunch and $27 for dinner. Try to go for lunch, there isn't a lot different in dinner except for a higher price. Service could be improved! 8/10 times I visit, I get wonderful servers! But then theres a few times I get a server who never refills drinks, slow on taking orders, not being very attentive. Other than that I love this place! The rolls are delicious! I reccomend the Love Affair (crab and crunchy flakes) or the Crunchy Roll (popcorn shrimp and yum yum sauce) or basically everything else on the menu. You get delicious food for a reasonable price, only wish servers were a little more welcoming but other than that, this is the place!!

4/8/2018:  This is our first visit here. Hubby took the AYCE lunch @ $23.00 and I had the Dinner Sushi @ $18.00.  For my meal, miso soup was served first and it was nothing to write home about. Bland and watered down. Certainly not full-bodied and there was no real "miso" taste to it. It's like they were holding out on the miso - too expensive to put more in the soup? To their credit, though, they did put a generous amount of wakame (seaweed) but only a small amount of tiny, tiny cubes of tofu. Dang. Tofu isn't THAT expensive! Eating their miso soup was like drinking lightly-flavored miso water mixed in with wakame and a diminutive amount of tofu bits.  Then came the tossed salad, which was a good-size salad but the dressing was minuscule. So stingy on the dressing, OMG.   The tempura dish was very good! Hot (temperature-wise) and flavorful and I thoroughly enjoyed THIS dish!  Now the main dish came out, which was a variety of sashimi on top of shredded daikon (radish) and shiso leaves (very delish...LOVE these leaves!). No rice. After a long while, I finally inquired about having rice and the gal looked on our table, noting no rice there and retrieved a bowl of round-top rice.   Now back in the day when I was growing up, you NEVER served rice with a rounded top. This way of serving rice was reserved for dead people. Yep...DEAD people. My grandma used to serve little bowls of round-top rice to her deceased husband on a little Buddhist shrine she had in her bedroom.  As for the overall ambience, it was beautiful but the music they played was incongruous to the Japanese theme! Instead of quiet-tone, Asian-type music which would have been conducive and appropriate to dining and digestion, they blasted their nightclub-type music which was almost too loud for conversation. Management apparently thinks people enjoy having their eardrums blasted while eating sushi! Taste in music was pure hell - to us, anyway. Even if they played the same type of music but toned down the volume, that would have been tolerable. But they force patrons to listen to music of THEIR liking. Bad business! They are thoughtless to customers' taste in music. If you're going to inflict YOUR type of music on your patrons, have the decency to turn the volume down to background music.  As for the food server, first we had a female take our order and then later on, a male came to our table. He acted like we were putting him out when we asked for more water and a to-go box, which he brought. But when I asked for a plastic bag for the to-go box, he almost sarcastically asked me if there was anything ELSE I'd like??? My goodness. What an attitude! He's there for a job and it's his job to service patrons. It's also HIS fault that he didn't bring a plastic bag along with the to-go box. That's only common sense: You need a plastic bag to put your to-go box in, just in case the box leaks - which DID happen on the ride home.  Not once during our meal did ANYone come to our table to refill our water or ask if everything was alright.  Overall, we did enjoy our meal but because of the ambience, poor service, poor attitude, poor choice of music, lack of service/concern for its patrons, and food quality and amount, we will not be back. There's just too many other places from which to choose! Well you never know until you try, and we tried! Been there, done that.
Everything here is GREAT, love all the AYCE, love all the rolls. Service is good but when it gets busy  (and it does)  it  can take awhile for the food but very worth it.
Was here on a Tuesday it was kinda busy but nothing crazy. Service seems like it went downhill. I have been here before but never checked in.

My go to for AYCE sushi!! Such a great selection at a reasonable price. It's not just sushi on their AYCE menu but appetizers and dessert as well so go hungry! Beautiful location and good service. Their fish is good quality, not ridiculously fine quality of course but very good, and their rice is cooked well unlike most of the other more affordable sushi places in town.
Your average AYCE joint with mediocre fish hidden in a large selection of rolls.  It's not bad if that is your thing....no thanks for me!

Collosal sized sushi is not necessarily good and this is no exception. However, the service is polite, understanding, and genial. A serene atmosphere punctuates the experience, leaving only a gentle humming noise in the background.

Like the other Oyshi restaurnat, this one is amazing! Oyshi has the best sushi I have ever eaten anywhere in the world. That includes many countries in South East Asia. I recently went there for lunch for the first time and was reminded how good the food and service are. Whenver anyone from out of town comes to visit, I always take them to one the Oyshi restaurants. I have yet to take anyone there who didn't agree it was the best sushi they have ever eaten. Amazing place, great service, tons of roll options, and very reasonably priced.

When I visit Las Vegas, I usually come to Oyshi Sushi for sushi. There is plenty of parking around the center. I did not have to wait long for a party of three (15 minutes wait time). The restaurant is a good size and is able to accommodate large parties. I was quite hungry and decided to do the all you can eat sushi! The price for the all you can eat sushi was definitely a good price! For the all you can eat, you can order anything from the menu! The sweet shrimp and dynamite were my favorites. Also, don't forget to order dessert! There are some limitations on the menu for the quantity of sushi that can be ordered for certain items. Also, the restaurant limits only one dessert per person.    I'll definitely be coming back here when I visit Vegas again!

Went here with my girlfriends and it was a great place. The environment was great the serves was great and the sushi was great! If you don't eat sushi they have some yummy entrees! We went at 6 pm and it wasn't too busy but as the night went on it got busier ! Keep that in mind !

Horrible service and food. Came to dinner for the AYCE with a group of nine and the wait service couldn't be any worse. The food ordered either didn't come or was mixed in with another plate (with somebody who's not even seated next to you). There were long wait times before your first and your second order (that's if you actually got what you ordered). We kindly pointed it out to the manager that we weren't getting the appropriate service and all she did was rush through some of the missing orders (and yes I said some because there were still other orders never came). After a while (an hour) it became comedic that one of the first rolls we ordered finally showed up (after telling the waitress no less than 5 times that it was missing). It was the crunch shrimp tempura roll (which, judging by amount of time it took for them to prepare, is apparently a complicated roll).   Overall this was not a good experience. The waitress was disorganized and bad and the manager was ineffective. The idea of an all you can eat sushi sounded good but this place is no where near worth the money you pay to eat there ($28 per person). Oh and the worst was we had to pay 18% gratuity since we were a party of 9. Needless to say they did not earn it.   Bonus: we asked for wasabi (since you know, we are eating sushi) and they brought us two HUGE mounds of wasabis bigger than a fist size for us to share. I mean who needs that much wasabi?!?!? Lol

My boyfriend and I went to Oyshi late Sunday night. We walked up and the lady that goes by Vid (her nickname) was very rude to us. She said, "We already sat the last seating." Then my boyfriend asked her if we could just sit at the sushi bar. She said no. I asked her what time they sat the last seating and she checked the clock and said, "Oh, we're still seating for 10 more minutes." She didn't apologize and kind of laughed it off like it was funny. It was a terrible start. We should have turned around then but we walked over and sat at the bar because we were starving! We put in our order with the waiter which was a large Saki, miso soup, edamame, and chicken terriaki. Then we ordered a couple of rolls with the chefs. What was odd is that our rolls came out before our drink order, which actually never came :(. I also had to ask a total of 3 times for my miso soup. The waiter clearly didn't care about us. For a place that has a pretty decent star rating on yelp I did not see any customer service what so ever. I was so disappointed. Do yourselves a favor and save the trip.

I've been coming here since the place opened back years ago. Never have I ever had a bad experience until today. Staff was lacking in actually paying attention to the few people that were in the place. With all these new AYCE sushi spots opening up I'd figure they would've changed the menu just a little but it's been the same ever since ever since. Maybe a few changes, and different rules. I'm all about loyalty and I'll continue to keep coming to this place. Get John and Kevin back in there before this place continues their downward spiral.

All you care to eat lunch $23.   Dinner $28.   The drinks are pretty pricey.  Sushi is always great and the service has greatly improved over the last year.  Wear your parka, they keep it ice cold in here with ceiling fans going full blast. Nice menu selections.

The sushi was okay. The service was very slow, it took 40 minutes to receive 2 rolls despite the 6 sushi chefs behind the bar & the dining area not being full. The servers were unfriendly and we always needed to wave them down to order food. Seemed like they didn't want to serve us. I gave it 3 stars instead of 1 or 2 because of the All You Can Eat option for dinner at $28. Fairly priced and would recommend coming on an empty stomach. I probably wouldn't return though because the service was junk.

Plenty of sauce and plenty of rice.  You're better off going to a real buffet that doesn't add tons of sauce to everything you order so that it makes you gag.  Gagging will prevent you from eating more food.  In this case, the "quality" is not even up to par with Todai or any other buffet that serves mediocre sushi.  For $5 you can get a jar of mayonnaise or thousand island dressing to eat with your rice so that you can meet your 3000 calorie intake of carbs.  Avoid this place if you are a true sushi connoisseur, or simply like to eat good quality food.

We go here when their competitor gets crowded. When we got there we were seated  promptly. The food here have alway been fresh and consistent but this time it wasn't so. Most buffets start out strong then lose its luster over time. This place is getting there.  I noticed my sushi was packed with a lot of rice. I was kinda full upon ordering the second round but that didn't stop me.  Also the sweet shrimp was a little fishy but it didn't cause any havoc to my tummy.  I hope the owner reads this because we really like this place.

Grocery store quality sushi. Very mediocre and add to it a very slow and sloppy service. I've been to other all you can eat sushi in Vegas and this was really terrible compared to the others I've been to.

Great food!  Yes there is a wait, but that is because the food is cooked FRESH!  My wife was not a Sushi fan...but she is now because if Oyshi.   Grew up eating Japanese food in San Francisco & this tops the list!!

The sushi was good and fresh....the service was not great at all! They forgot about 4 rolls that we ordered and never brought it to our table. It took about 20 mins to receive our rolls every time we ordered. Definitely not the best experience.

My cousin brought me here while I was visiting Vegas. Currently, I live in the midwest in small-town USA with no real sushi in sight (unless you think imi-crab, mayo and a cucumber wrapped up in rice & seaweed is the bomb.com). After being deprived of fresh sushi for a year, this place was *heaven* (read that again in a sing-songy voice). So at first I wanted to rate this 5 stars but then I had to remember that I was raised in California and Hawaii, so I know a thing or two about quality sushi and quality fish. We both got the AYCE for dinner! Size-wise, the rolls were kinda small. However, the filling to rice ratio was spot on. Some of the rolls were packed full of fish with no crazy veggie fillers so that was pretty great. My favorites were the Lobster Fair (not spicy) and the Dragon Roll (a little spicy). I also got the "Maniac" one but that was way hotter than expected. The oysters were SO good. The shrimp tempura was okay. It was nice and hot, but the batter was really thick and heavy, not light like I'm used to. I love love loved the ocean salad they serve before your main courses come.  My only disappointment was that when we ordered a second Lobster Fair towards the end of our meal, we could only eat 1/4 of it and I couldn't take the rest home. =(  [It's probably a rule with the AYCE, which makes sense, but still, it was almost a whole roll!!!]  We finished our meal with the creme brulee dessert. It's almost an amuse-bouche. You can finish it in about 2-3 bites. It doesn't really taste like like creme brulee though, it tastes more like a thick vanilla pudding with a carmelized sugar top that has a beautiful crack when you hit it with a spoon.

This was, by far, the worst dining experience that I've ever had. My girlfriend and I met here for lunch. Our server was apathetic, so say the least. My girlfriend inquired about a lunch special, which was called "Sizzling Plate". Our server stood their staring at his notebook and kind of shrugged his shoulders in response. My friend asked him if he was new there, and he mumbled "kinda new" while still staring at his notebook. She pulled out the menu and pointed to the plate that she was asking about and went ahead and ordered it. Five minutes later, he came back with a different menu in which the Sizzling Plate was crossed out with a black sharpie. He told us that they no longer offer that special. We asked for a manager, and out came Peter. Peter seems like a very nice person; however, he is by no means management material. It is clear that he has not had any training in diffusing situations or handling customer complaints. He reiterated that they no longer offered that special, even though the special was still listed in the menu that we had received. We went back and forth until I proposed that they honor the special for us until they update all of their menus, to which he obliged. I decided to mention to him that our server was very rude and dismissive, only to hear from Peter that our server was sick and not feeling well. (IMO, our server seemed hungover...) As Peter walked away without apologizing for a rocky start, I saw our "sick" server making our drinks, which involved cutting fruit and gathering mint leaves to be muddled. There was no bartender on duty, which was abundantly apparent when we took a sip of our drinks- my drink was supposed to be a strawberry and mint infused lemonade, but it tasted like strawberries and rum... I sent it back. My girlfriend also sent hers back, as it tasted terrible as well. We waited 40 minutes for our food. We had to ask three times for our checks. Once we finally received them, Peter still had not offered an apology for the terrible, apathetic, slow, uniformed service that we received. To no surprise, they had not discounted our checks for the inconvenient and mess of a meal.

Regardless of what the others have been rating this place, I can honestly rate it a good 5 stars! Our first time going because the other place we usually go to; Sumo Sushi 2, which now closes earlier than usual. Tonight, we have ordered the Spicy Tuna, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, and the Vegas Lasagna, let me tell you it was AWESOME ... Absolutely enjoyed ourselves, great customer service, just real nice. It is more of a social sushi spot rather than the one we are used to; which is a more private one, but it was good! It is small, but very comfortable! Highly recommended and enjoyable ..

This is probably one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places in town. We have been going here for years and its nice that it is by us. They have a variety of rolls and as well as appetizers on their menu. The only thing I am disappoint about is that they did not carry white tuna anymore the last time they went.

This place is one of the best ayce sushi places in vegas. In the past I would go to Yama, but I recently moved to south vegas and wanted something closer. My friend and I tried Oyshi and I think this place gives Yama a run for the money. Things that stood out is the raw oysters and surf n turf.  All the sushi was good for ayce style, and the rice was in the nigiri wasn't hard and didn't fall apart like other ayce places. The negative aspects was that the service was a little slow for me, and they brought me one piece of yellow tail that looked like it had been sun bathing out back for the afternoon. Otherwise this place is great, and I'll be returning soon.

The last few times I've been here, the sushi has been solid. I don't understand the subpar reviews considering that this is a very solid venue for ayce sushi.  The prices are slightly higher at about $26 per person during dinner but they have all the amenities you can expect from an ayce joint: Good selection of sushi, shrimp tempura, fried chicken and much more. If you come during 330-530pm they offer 20% on ayce all weekday, which is pretty nice!  The thing that impresses me the most about this place is that the interior is very nice. You will find murals across the room and in one corner of the room there are what seems to be upside down umbrellas for the lighting. There is also a small bar on the corner of the restaurant which is also pretty awesome. I personally always prefer to sit on the stalls by the sushi chef but at this place I don't mind sitting at one of the tables.  Service is on point and friendly. Definitely recommend this place!

We have been to this sushi place twice. Both times we have had a great meal, and it has been a lot of fun!!  The first time was for lunch, we did not partake in the All-You-Can-Eat option, rather just ordered a few rolls and apps. The waiter was so friendly and enthusiastic we decided to bring a few people who were visiting back for Dinner.  Now for dinner, hell yes we all did the All-You-Can-Eat! It was $27 bucks each, awesome. We were committed to taking them down! One roll at a time! OK, so we did not end of doing that, but we has a super fun night with lots of great food!  Our waiter Kenny was a rock star! We were goofing and laughing with him all night! And we had a lot to laugh at, because apparently the new food runners had not quite figured out the table numbers and kept delivering our food to other tables, and vice-a-versa. I know this sounds annoying, but oddly enough it became part of the entertainment of the night. Kenny kept checking in to see what we were still waiting for, and making sure it came. We were never missing sushi on the table or going hungry, he just had to order a couple specific rolls 2-3 times before they finally made there way to us. We had a blast!  Insider tips.... -They do take reservations, but the only way to make them is to actually speak to a hostess. The girl at the front desk admitted to me they never check the answering machine.   -They have an awesome large room if you want to have an AYCE shushi party! It is separated from the Dining Room and looks super cozy!  -Last tip, AYCE is less during lunch. Only $22, as opposed to dinner time when it is $27

AYCE sushi for the win! This is a must go to spot when I hit Vegas. The customer service is straight and the rolls are delicious! The price is reasonable and a it's a great way to enjoy sushi and apps amongst friends!

The rolls were delicious. Their appetizers such as ribeye steak, chicken teriyaki, shrimp and vegetable tempura, oysters, and green mussels are a must try especially when you're doing all you can eat. The service was superb. The ambiance ok.

On a Friday night passing by the area... we found this place.. wow.. the AYCE is excellent!! Boy was I stuffed.  Told the waitress keep bringing the rolls to me.  Haha.. One Word:  "Your unbelievable... "  I keep laughing and eating.. The special rolls are tasty, the sushi are fresh, and the chefs are awesome.  Service - 5 Stars Food - 5 Stars Cleanliness - 5 Stars  Overall, if your in the area and dig the AYCE got to try it out!!  $26 (Dinner) can't go wrong..

Love this place! Been here over a dozen times. Staff is wonderful & attentive. Sushi is fresh. GREAT AYCE !!!! Great atmosphere with private rooms for party's. Expect to wait for a table during peak times. I'm not the only person who will go out of my way to eat here. The Mochi Ice Cream & the nuclear bomb roll are my FAVS... Num num.
Best AYCE Sushi in Las Vegas!  Great prices for AYCE includes sushi, sashimi, and sides plus dessert.  The service is wonderful, the fish is fresh and tasty, and they have a wide variety of rolls.
