*Review on specialty rolls, not nigiri  Came here twice in the last month so I guess it's review time! Both times I've recently come I've been lucky and never really had to wait for a table but by the time I'm done, it's filled up and there's a bit of a wait so I would definitely call ahead for larger parties. I'm no sushi expert & I totally understand that you're not getting some award winning fish for ayce but hey I love the rolls and variety of them here; plus almost everything tastes good with mango sauce lol.  PRICES: Lunch ayce: $21 Dinner ayce: $26  Few of my favorites:  Sexy (my #1 fave!): yum-yum scallop, cream cheese, crunch flakes, topped with eel tempura, wasabi mango sauce and eel sauce  Love Affair: shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes and masago on top  Atomic Bomb: shrimp tempura with spicy crab, and jalapeno on top inflaming hot chili sauce  Hawaiian Roll: Albacore shrimp, cucumber and avocado wrapped seared albacore with garlic ponzu  Seaweed salad: not too oily here & a lot of seaweed so an "A" in my book  & last but not least, THE CREME BRULEE TRIO!!!! This is what keeps me coming back to this place.The chocolate flavor is my favorite because it tastes basically like a creamy brownie but their traditional and green tea flavors are awesome as well.  Service has been good everytime I've came, water is always kept filled, and servers are pretty friendly. Also, this location is really pretty on the inside, definitely a good choice for date night.
So first I will say that the food is good here, but they need to be clear on the time that they close. There yelp time says open until 11:00 and they are only open until 10:00. Super inconvenient!!

Usually, when I walk into a Japanese restaurant, I get the boisterous greeting from the sushi chefs and wait staff. None here. No biggie. Nice, clean-looking restaurant.  The fish tasted fresh. Ordered the tuna and super white tuna. Both were tasty. The rolls, however, I found a little disappointing. The atomic bomb was the only roll I thought was pretty good, but it was nothing out of the ordinary. The Sunrise roll I did not care for at all. It tasted like it was soaked in a garlic soy sauce. The Iris Special roll was very difficult to eat. The sauce tasted very similar to the sauce in the Sunrise roll, but it was a completely different sauce. There was a pasty, yet grainy texture to it and the flavor was pretty gross.   All in all, I don't think i'd go there again.

I remember why I choose other places over this one because their service is inconsistent sometimes fast sometimes slow n it doesn't matter how busy their are and the biggest one for me is I never feel gratitude from the employees there. Sushi is good I do have to say

Best sushi that I ate so far since I moved here from Maui. Cool atmosphere and service are excellent. I give this place a 10... I will be back soon with wifey when she get here..Mahalo Oyshi!! You make me feel that I'm home in Maui :)

I love this place. 2 blocks from my house. I would give 5 stars, but the waitress must have been new cause I have to keep asking for stuff.  Can I get a lunch menu? Can I get wasabi with my sushi? Lol. How u forget that?  I still love the food. This was the first time the severs was ok, not great.

My boyfriend and I go to the Rainbow location pretty often but we saw there was another location and wanted to try it out. When we got there we were seated pretty quickly, but it took a while for the waitress to acknowledge us and take our order after that point. The food was delicious as always, but the service could have been better. We will stick to the Rainbow location in the future.

The best All You Can Eat sushi restaurant I've ever been to by far.   At first when I came here, I wasn't expecting any thing to be that great since it's all you can eat, the food will be soso.  Was I wrong or what.  Plenty to choose from the menu! From sushi rolls to chef specialties to chocolate mochi, each dish brought out a different and wonderful flavor that automatically send me to the roof. Every single dish that was brought out were delicious and off the hooooooook. Especially the raw oysters, mmmmmm! (That's my favorite!)  One thing to keep in mind: Each time you order, be sure to order alot since the dishes come out fairly slow. Otherwise you'll finish a dish before the next one comes out.
Went back in October, still outstanding food and service, and  you can not beat the all you can eat price or wide variety of ordering options.
The only place I go to get sushi. Such high quality for ayce. They play good music and have excellent service every time I come here.

Great AYCE. More of a sushi fusion restaurant. Great place to take friends new to sushi. Their rolls are unique and the menu is very easy to read. The atmosphere is modern. Service is great 75% of the time. We have had a few servers that are slow and inattentive, but if you let management know they are very nice. I love the green tea tiramisu! Delicious.

I highly recommend this place!  I did not think that an AYCE Sushi buffet would be that great since it's buffet food but they proved me wrong.  The sushi is very fresh and delicious.  The all you can eat menu has tons of food to pick from including sushi rolls, appetizers, salad, soup, uni, sweet shrimp, oysters and dessert.  You have 2 hours to eat your food which is plenty of time to enjoy and savor your meal.  The service is great and the restaurant is pretty spacious.  This is a must-visit restaurant almost every time I go to Vegas.

Oyshi has all you can eat. A bit pricey compared to the other places I've been and not as big of a selection in terms of food outside of sushi. The creme brûlée desert was delicious, but the tiramisu did not come across as tiramisu; instead more like cheesecake.

Best all you can eat sushi I've had! I was SO surprised at their huge selection for all you can eat! Not only are their rolls all you can eat... so are their appetizers :D Although they limit desserts to 1 per customer, I left completely satisfied!   The restaurant is very clean, and the environment was enjoyable. When I went, we came in a large group so they put us in the side room, so it was a little more difficult to get a hold of the waiter, but they came by often enough to keep taking our orders.   DEFINITELY will be going back when I'm in vegas!
very clean.  Good food.  too bad it's so crowded now.  Worth the wait though.
Awesome sushi at an amazing price. Everything here is good and service is quick. The surf and turf roll is probably my favorite.  All you can eat sushi for the win!!!!

This was my second visit. After reading those frightening November reviews of food poisoning I was very leery about returning. I think Alice W was more angry about the service and used the F.P. card. I've never heard of a whole family getting food poisoning so take that review with a grain of salt.    My first time was good, I just did not write about it. Today I went for lunch and had a great experience. They have a few new rolls and I tried 3 of them. They were all beautifully executed and tasted great.   I'm usually not a fan of ponzu sauce but the Iris roll**** off the new menu was so good I had 2 of them. It had  Spicy albacore with cucumber, wrapped with avocado, and seared tuna. My eating partner in crime loved it.   Screaming Roll****shrimp tempura roll wrapped with yum-yum cajun albacore and avocado with garlic ponzu sauce. Flavor of cajun albacore was awesome.   Love Affair roll ***shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes and masago on top. This was good, but came in last of all the other rolls.   Asian skirt steak*** is served teriaki style on a sizzling mini skillet. It was a nice addition to sushi.  Service was better than average. I always sit at the sushi bar. Here you order from a waiter instead of directly from sushi chefs. My waiter was attentive, I had enough H2O to drink and never had to wait on food or ordering more of it.   The AYCE is $21.00 per person and well worth it. I wish they offered fried rice but there are lots of items offered on their menu.  I will return to Oyshi as it is the best sushi that is close to my house.
My favorite sushi place in Vegas so far. Love the Yellow Tail Trio roll, the poke appetizer, and the creme brûlée.

This place gets five stars simply from being a non-buffet all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant! I tend to have slow moments so it wasn't until the end of the meal that realized that, with the exception of a few items, the whole darn menu (appetizers, soups, rolls, nigiri, tapas, and dessert) was included in one price! Lunch was less than $20 per adult, which I felt was a steal. The restaurant isn't on the strip but it's worth it for anyone visiting to venture off the beaten path for this great dining experience. Plus, it gives you the opportunity to see the residential side of things. This is now, without a doubt, one of my "must-visit" places when I come to Vegas.

Pretty amazing. I feel like we got special treatment because we said we had never been - which was true. But they really take the time to make sure you're happy. Green tiramisu is amazing. The green tea ice cream was fabulous! The prices were even better! Would definitely recommend

I was in Vegas on vacation recently and went to this restaurant based on it's Yelp ratings.  BIG MISTAKE!!! The service was slow and the sushi was awful.  It seemed like a good deal.. $21 for all you can eat sushi.  The trick, however, is that all their rolls have some sort of cream cheese or mayonnaise in it and make them so heavy and sweet tasting that you can't eat more than a few rolls.  If you like an extra helping of creamy toppings on your sushi than this place is for you.  If you prefer fresh sushi rolls the way they are supposed to be made than stay away!

I wanted to like Oyshi Sushi as it was recommended to us by a couple of people. We are fans of I Love Sushi and Sushi Avenue. Unfortunately we had an experience I have never had before ... A live bug (not a roach but a lettuce Beatle) climbed out of our salad. To add insult to injury the manager did not really apologize but blamed on the people who delivered the lettuce. He said he had a similar problem with the edemame.  And as if this is not all bad enough he did not even offer to comp the one item we had eaten before the bug appeared. No class!! No sense of the customer. We will stick to I Love Sushi.

This place sucks now! Apparently there is a new owner which is very noticeable since the service is so bad now. I have been coming here for a few years but today was my last time since this is my second bad experience in a row. The last time I came it took over 2 hours for the first round of orders to come out for a table of 4 of us. This time the manager/owner lied to us about not having certain items and it took forever for everything to come out for our table of 8. The only good experience was our waiter-Jay
AMAZING I have been going here for close to six years and it is still my favorite place in Las Vegas

Never thought sushi could be so good in Vegas, and it's even better with all-you-can eat!!  for $21 all-you-can eat at lunch (sashimi excluded), it's like winning the jackpot!  This place about 15 mins from the strip but worth the drive if you are craving sushi and can eat endless amts of it within 2 hours of ordering time.  The service can be a bit slow and the waiter was forgetful in some of our orders so keep ordering lots each time you see the waiter - just as long as you can eat it all.  favorites: Rattle Snakeroll, Tiger Roll, Rainbow Roll, Eel/avocado Sushi, Salmon Sushi

Tonight we had dinner for the first time at Oyshi and we had an amazing time!!!!! We started at the bar with Princess while we waited for our table and she was funny and quick with service. Once sat at the sushi bar we met Chef Daniel who sent out a started that was an amazing chicken platter. The night only got better when we gave him control and he made specialty rolls all night we enjoyed every second! All of the chefs were great entertainment and very engaging. Thank you to Chefs Daniel (son), Nacho, Pedro, Jose, and Chino for a great night!!!! Can't wait to go back!

This place is truly a hidden gem.  The AYCE is not skimpy and reasonably priced.  Hawaiian rolls are my thing and theirs requires a re-order. Very nice atmosphere and decent service. I'm looking forward to going back soon!

So sad Sushi Factory closed down!! My group of 6 was looking for a buffet to eat after a fun, but exhausting day at Daylight and with it being July 4th weekend, we knew all the good buffets on the strip would have crazy waits. So, after finding out that Sushi Factory was closed, we got a recommendation from a friend to go here -- around $20 for AYCE sushi dinner, which included appetizers, rolls, nigiri, and dessert (only thing excluded was sashimi). Pretty good deal, especially for how extensive their menu is.  I wasn't really feeling like rolls, so I ordered and ate mostly nigiri -- so my 3 stars is based mostly on that. The pieces of fish were on the smaller side, and (obviously) the fish isn't the freshest you're going to find at a sushi joint (some of the uni looked a tad bit iffy, but I'm also on the paranoid side when eating raw stuff). But, if you're there more for the rolls and other items, I would probably give this place 4 stars.  Service was good, and it was easy to flag down our server whenever we wanted to order more food (which was often!).
Place is really nice. Friendly staff. Very helpful! Would recommend for anyone, from kids to elders. You will not regret! -Aloha

Asked if they could use a clean knife to make my wife's veggie rolls so it wouldn't be contaminated with fish. She is pregnant and her doctor said we should ask for this. Talked to two hosts and they were both rude as possible. Said they had no idea if they could use clean knifes and didn't know if they ever cleaned the knifes. Manager couldnt be bothered to help. How dumb do you have to be!! Never going here again.

I am very disappointed with the ayce we had last night . I've been coming to oyshi since 08 and then ventured out since there was always a wait.  We decided to go last night and the fish was NOT fresh at all . The Uni being the worst - was very brown and I had to send it back . The waitress even made a comment about it.... The tuna and salmon on our rolls were off colored - not the normal vibrant red and orange fresh versions should be.   The nigiri pieces came out better - super white tuna was the best, salmon belly, and garlic tuna.  Yellowtail was off perhaps I should've asked for a different cut . Oh and they put double rice to fish ratio which is annoying and takes away from the enjoyment of the fish   All in all I was very disappointed in Oyshi's decline in quality and I won't be returning . The server was very attentive and quick . She's the reason for extra star .   LESSON: walk up to the bar and check fish quality/freshness before committing to ayce or even eating there at all !

Hands down. One of my favorite sushi spots in town. This is mine and my best friend's go-to sushi spots. Sushi quality is amazing. We usually do All You Can Eat. Service is great. Sushi comes out quickly. Hands down, no complaints.  1 suggestion would be better discounts on alcohol for AYCE guests.

We use to come here all the time, but I will never go back. The place use to be a packed house, and now there's no wait on a Friday night and I can see why. The waiters are snobbish and rude and the manager has no backbone to stand up to them. On top of that, they super pack the rolls and sushi with rice and if you can't eat it all, they'll charge you for it. Our waiter was a fat dick (not the good kind, fat and an a$$hole) from the start of the night. He barely acknowledged us the whole night. Anytime we signaled him to order, he looked annoyed and wouldn't come over until ten minutes later. Again with the rice, the douche bag wanted to charge us $14 for not eating all the rice. WTF man, all the rice we didn't eat didn't even equal a bowl of rice they normally charge you $1 for. When we asked the manager about it, he was useless and just said, "You don't have to tip the waiter. He doesn't expect a tip." After arguing about fairness and how the establishment has gone to crap, we walked out of there paying $4 extra for rice... You can have your $4 worth of rice along with the out of business sign Oyshi. Rude, snobby employees coupled with declining quality of food ain't keeping you in business much longer.

By far the best all you can eat sushi in town. The staff is amazing and the food is even better definitely worth the 15 minute wait. When they say it's going to be a half hour it's always sooner. We come here at least once a week.
Best place for all you can eat sushi! The service was great and our food was delicious. The best roll I had was the dynamite roll. Ask for Ed, he's an awesome sushi chef!

We expected better for the price.  Portions were relatively small and frankly not overly filling.  But the food quality was good and fresh.  I think they are still in this "captive market" mindset since they are the only sushi place that is walking distance from many large condo buildings.  I would rather drive to eat sushi that is much better value elsewhere.  This issue here is not the food but how I perceive value (If the cost was less or the portions larger, I would rate it a 3-4 stars).

True rating is probably 3.5 but I bump up to 4 because they are always friendly.  Oyshi is a solid place to grab a quick sushi lunch or dinner. They also do take out which is a big plus given the sort of cramped seating in the restaurant (unless you're in one of the booths).  My go-to roll is the Dynamite...I know I know, so standard, but at Oyshi they put yam in it which I really enjoy and I think it goes well with the spicy salmon.  The udon is also another recommended favourite. Great for the winter months when you just want something warm!  I find portions here to be generous. One roll is enough for me - it's quite big! The udon is also very filling.  When you dine in (and maybe also when you do take out above a certain $ amount), they give you a free order of edamame.

My wife loves to take me to eat sushi but she hates sea food, so it's really hard to find a place that serves all you can eat sushi and a good non sushi menu.    The menu was so large, I would definitely  have to come back to try their other signature rolls. Our server Sharon  Shen was very nice she made sure to check our tables for more orders or refills and even though she was busy with other tables she still had time to make small talk.   My wife got grilled beef asparagus she wasn't sure if this place had anything she might like so she ate before we came.  That's what we usually do and then she just gets appetizers but to our surprise Oyshi  Sushi  had a decent variety of things for her to choose from.  (Good to know for Next time)
Came in yesterday evening .. tried something new and it was a blast in my mouth ! Super nice servers as well

Simply spectacular. First time here and I was very happy when I left. The white tuna was perfect. Vince was our server and he was so pleasant. We was so friendly and not overly present, but there before we even knew we needed him. Plates were constantly cleared from the table and the orders were brought out in a timely manner. I am definitely recommending this place to people I know. Especilally for their AYCE sushi. Two thumbs up, Oyshi!

I'm sorry but it bothers me that this restaurant is highly reviewed. Everyone has different idea about sushi but this place disappointed me, who is not so picky about sushi.   Wish I had the picture of the sushi that I ordered but it's been a while and unfotunately it's hard to find from thousands of pictuers I have.   This restaurant is great for people who loves "rolls". I enjoy rolls too but I enjoy regular nigiri sushi, which, I think, is the best way to enjoy the quality of fish. When I order Tuna nigiri, the sushi came out WET & SOGGY like the fish was just microwaved and defrosted. I do not know what caused it to be wet & soggy but I've never seen such thing in my life. Sea Urchin is not edible if they are not decent quality and this restaurant's sea urchin was not good at all.  Again, rolls are enjoyable but I don't know if  I can call this restaurant a "good sushi restaurant".
Always good! Friendly staff and outstanding food. Go hungry & get the "all you can eat" special. Parking is a premium so be prepared to look for a spot.

Oyshi's AYCE sushi experience is kind of, well, meh.  It is neither exciting nor disappointing.  I felt that the fish to rice ratio on the nigiri was a little rice-happy.  The rolls were not too exciting.  I would go back, but only if someone else insisted.

I was in Vegas on March 3 and 4th and the friend I was visiting recommended this place for AYCE Sushi. I'm from Los Angeles and we have AYCE here so I couldn't imagine what the big deal was.  Well first off the price was incredible, it's a steal for what you get. There were 3 of us and we let my friend do all the ordering because she frequents here all the time. Of my memory serves me correctly we started with a Poke salad followed by 9 different sushi choices and ended with dessert. I couldn't tell you everything we ordered but the Japanese Lasagna sticks out, never had anything like it and it was so good. I don't know any place in Los Angeles that has anything close to it.  My friend is very outgoing and the waiter was great. He definitely earned his tip as often as she was calling him back for more about every 10-15 minutes.  The food here is fresh and packed full of flavor. I can't wait to come back to Vegas JUST for the sushi here. I wish your establishment much success and I will definitely be back

This place is very special. It's the only Sushi restaurant I've been to where the chefs eat while making your food. Not a clean operation. The taste of the sushi was average, but it's distracting to have to watch cooks wiping their faces and eating food with the plastic gloves they're using to prepare your food/end rant. The server was polite and I left a tip, but I wont be coming back to this place at all. This is Vegas, there's just too many choices out there.

I was regular here but, probably won't be back again :( my waiter kept forgetting to bring things and i didn't have anything in order for me to eat sushi like chop sticks and wasabi and little stuff...food wasn't that great this time either I've had fresher sushi here before and it's right next to my house so it sucks but, service was bad & food was bad so, good-bye Oyshi!
Just my favorite-est Sushi  spot in Vegas... Have literally brought dozens of people here over the years! Having a lot of fun  with Mikey  tonight

Food is just as great as the Rainbow location and of course it would be,  I see the same sushi chefs behind the bar at this location.  More spacious than the Rainbow location definitely more tables at this location for obvious reasons. Service and food quality is always superb and at its finest. Oh and they close at midnight.

If I lived in Vegas I'd eat here at least 3 times a week! Big portions! The food is so good! Service was super fast! It's  cheap!! $23 all you can eat lunch! I left here full and happy! Highly recommend! Don't over order like we did' we were stuffing our face!
Here is my review:  HMMMMMMM HMM HMMM HMM WHEEEE

Excellent service, great and friendly team of servers! Did the AYCE and what a bargain...7 different rolls, eel, and beers! Some of these AYCE sushi places fill in the rolls with extra rice but not here...These were well done, creative combinations of flavor, texture, and presentation as well! Love it...Happy New Years!!!

My new favorite sushi bar.  The fish has always been good so far and the variety of what is included for all you can eat can't be beat.  Find me another place that includes green tea tiramisu and chocolate creme brule in their all you can eat menu and I'll think about changing my alliegence.

I'm so lucky to have such an amazing sushi place so close to home. They have an all you can eat that is very reasonable and I always over do it. I just can't help myself, the food is so good!! Nice casual atmosphere.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and ever since then we love coming here. The staff is friendly and fast service! I love how it looks inside very modern. We can't find a place that's better then this place. They have quality fish for a great price!

From someone that hated sushi, I've learned that's it's all in how it's prepared....Oyshi Sushi converted me into someone that can't get enough now!  The place is always busy, and the crowd is very diverse.    Waiters are good at suggesting items if you're not too sure, and the menu offerings are plentiful.  Only once did I attempt AYCE....but my stomach wouldn't allow any more after the 3rd dish. But if you can, go for it...very affordable.

I've had the worst experience. The service was quite slow and our dishes were not removed. We came for the AYCE and the dishes from our first order were still on the menu. We were charged 18% gratuity as a party of 5, despite the menu said that that only parties of 8 or more would be charged the 18% gratuity. The service was not worth this, and I didn't not want to pay for the gratuity, and instead of feeling concerned the waitress just said "oh sorry about that" with such a lack of emotion. Worst service, average food. Definitely better sushi spots in Vegas.

I come for lunch special. 12 bucks gets you soup,salad,cal roll, tempura plate, and stir fried meat dish (chicken,beef,or shrimp ) with veggies. All freshly prepared. Nicely decorated.  A good deal!  American pop music too loud, would like something a bit more ethnic and softer.  The food and service is 5 star though, so that's what I'll give them.

Probably one of the best sushi places in town and I have sampled many places. The spicy tuna crunch had the perfect amount of crunch and spice.  The service was prompt and very friendly! Thinking of making this place a weekly stop!

came in last night with my boyfriend and one of our friends they had all you can eat and I just had some of the tapas. The food was amazing as usual but the server was extremely rude she took so long to come back for our orders and rarely checked up on us. I've always had very good experiences here but last night was not one of them. we shouldn't have had to wait so long for our server to come back and check on us. Several times other servers were the ones to take the orders.

Came in pretty late and was sat right away! We tend to sit at the bar because my boyfriend likes to order half rolls. The chefs were very attentive as was our server. This is my go to spot and I recommend both locations to everyone! Very clean and super fast!

servers should know what their guests order. my table only had 5 people. it's not like I'm asking you to remember what belongs to who because it's reasonable to not be able to remember that. I ordered the most simple order out of all my friends, which was 3 orders of masago and 1 order of uni with quail egg. My friends ordered actual rolls(such as volcano roll) that take forever to make and they finished all their food they ordered which was more than 15 different full sushi rolls. I had to tell the server to check on my food twice to actually get acknowledged. I then asked do you even know what we are missing ? and he was about to walk off not even knowing what order he's going to go check on. I will never come back or recommend this place again. I used to be a regular here and now it's ridiculously bad customer service. I already didn't want to come here but I was content with the service last time. it was neither good or too bad. you need to hire new servers.

The sushi is awesome but this update is mostly for the service:  unfortunately, i did not catch our servers names but.... everytime I go, he's usually there.  Both servers were incredibly nice and despite it being close to closing time, they were very upbeat! We didn't finish all the sushi for all you can eat but they allowed us to take it home. We just had to pay for another roll. Not a bad deal!

I went there last night with my family and a friend for my wife's birthday. Ryan, our waiter, was very honest and friendly. He did everything he could to make sure our experience was as pleasant as possible and did a great job. We would definitely be coming back  The food quality was excellent, especially the shrimp tempura Yum!

Wow this place was definitely the best AYCE sushi I've ever had. First of all, the selection is AMAZING and overwhelming. It is a great deal for 21 dollars. Trust me and order the following items and you will be one satisfied customer with your belly about to explode.   I will start off with the non-rolls food: Must get the surf and turf, ahi poke, sashimi salad, skirt steak, grilled asparagus and beef. There were a few other items that I would like to try next time. There were simpy so freaking many. For rolls, try the Nuclear Bomb Roll, Lobster Fair, Paradise Roll, and oh what the heck, just try everything! For desert, you definitely have to try the green tea tiramisu.   The service was also great and very attentive. They will make great recommendations based off of your tastes. So trust me, if you're in Vegas, give this place a try.

I am still in love with this place!! Since it was just me and a friend, we opted for first available seating Nd that ended up being at the bar. It's a while new environment when you sit at the bar! If it's just you and a friend, I recommend sitting at the bar. If it's you and your family or a large group, stick to a table. But I do recommend experiencing the bar when you can.   By sitting at the bar, you are face to face with the sushi chefs. You may order your rolls directly from them and if you are daring, you can just have them make rolls for you without necessarily going off the menu (AYCE guests only, I'm guessing). Since it was the first time sitting at the bar for both of us, we didn't know that was possible until we had already ordered the world and we were just about bursting at the seams. We did try a fatty tuna sushi though which was basically made with tuna belly. It was sooooooo good!!   We also had a bottle of lychee sake. It came in a wine sized bottle, but we decided to take shots of it. It was so yum and it basically tasted like juice. Which is dangerous because it had the same alc vol as wine, and my friend and I finished the bottle like it was nothing!   Here are a few things that I think would be great to keep in mind while you're here:  -if you and a friend are looking to hang out, enjoy great food, and be social, definitely sit at the bar and have the chefs make you whatever your heart desires  -it's all you can eat, so definitely come here with an empty stomach and be prepared to eat the world! BUT...on busy nights, the wait can be awhile and if you come here super hungry, once you're seated, you'll want to order everything at once! This may not be a good thing, cuz if you're anything like us, you'll stuff your face and be done within 30 minutes.  -if you're paying with multiple cards, make sure the person taking your payment knows what exactly is going on what card. Although  we thought that we were clear in our instructions, she still managed to charge the wrong amount! (I'm not sure if this girl just wasn't paying attention or just wasn't having it because it was so busy, but I remember she was also being a bit rude when she was calling people for their tables)
Slow service. I'll also call up to 10 times literally and no answer for to go orders. Not the first time they don't answer their phone.

I've been waiting for this location to open because I live a lot closer to this location. I always sit at the head chef NYI side. NYI and the manager always comes by and always makes us feel welcome. The food is always good!

I've been coming here for years... tonight we drove out of our way after checking your hours on google. We arrive at 10:05 PM and your server told us last call was five minutes prior.  If we knew you didn't honor your hours shown on yelp and Google(11PM) we wouldn't have drove all the way up there. Teach your employees manners, you shouldn't turn away paying customers 55 minutes before you close

Best sushi in Las Vegas!! Great atmosphere, and fresh quality food! I'm very picky when it comes to sushi restaurants and finally found the one! OYSHI is the spot for the best sushi!!! I went to the Sahara location.

One of my fave sushi restaurants! I love the service, quality food and its very fresh. The menu is on point. I really have nothing bad to say. I've been a few times, and both times were on point. Its worth the trip.

I went to oyshi for lunch on a Friday and was immediately seated. The ambiance was beautiful.  The food was really good with a wide selection of rolls . I love how the customize what goes on the rolls if you ask . The nigiri was really fresh but I've had better. What really stood out for me was the desserts   Our server Julia was the bomb ! She was really friendly and answered all of the questions I had . Although she was quite busy , she still kept tabs on us and made sure our drinks were always full and our tables were cleared .   Oyshi is definately a place you want to check out , from the food to the amazing service.

Oyshi has AYCE appetizers you can't find at any other AYCE sushi place. The beef asparagus, skirt steak, rib eye, and a few other things are unique to oyshi. Beef asparagus is especially tasty. The rolls are similar to what to get anywhere else. So is are the nigiri. I think the bonsai roll is very good. Spicy tuna inside with Cajun albacore outside. Probably the best roll we had. The biggest thing is the green tea creme brûlée. No other AYCE sushi place has this. It is so good!!!! Without it I'd probably give 3 stars. But the green tea creme brûlée alone is worth 1 stat!!!

Food is good.. but the staff seems not so happy on their job.. the whole time that we were eating we didn't see a single smile.. place is good a little pricey but it fine.. i don't think we'll come back here..
The AYCE sushi here is unbelievable!! It's the best I've had in the city and I'm an avid sushi goer! The fish are fresh and miso soup is unbelievable!

Awesome! Great all you can eat price. Tons of fresh fish with as fast as they are going through it.  Amazing selection of rolls. I had to take a picture of the menu to give to my sushi chef back home so he can recreate them.  The Japanese Lasagna with Garlic if fantastic! Definitely come back here on my next trip through Vegas!
Been here twice & have loved it ! The service is awesome & so is the food. Waitress are helpful in ordering different kind of rolls.

Honestly if this review was based solely on the taste of the food it would probably get 5 starts but the service was sooooooo bad both times I was there. First of all they sat us at a dirty table and said they would have someone come clean it. Took 5 mins for someone to get there. Another 5 minutes for someone to take our drink orders. Now this is beyond me 5 minutes went by before my friends sprite hit the table and another 5 minutes for my coke. Why on earth they didnt come at the same time is beyond me and why it would 10 ten minutes pisses me off even more. We ordered a couple roles and some salads. The salads came and we ate them and then sat there and sat there for about 15 minutes before we could even get someones attention to say hey whats happened??  They must have known how shitty they were with out me even complaining becase when the rolls finally did come they told us the salads would be complimentary due to the lack of service. That is only reason they get 2 stars instead of one. Regardless after two shitty service experiences I have no interest in returning.

I've been here three times now because of how close it is to the house. Food is definitely decent here but the service is so slow that Oyshi is almost painful for me to dine at. One time it took almost 15 minutes for me just to get the check and it wasn't even that busy. Service is important to me, but if you have 2 hours to kill on a 1 hour dinner, by all means.

I love Oyshi Sushi! Some All You Can Eat sushi places have a separate menu for what you can and cannot order- not here. you can order right off the menu (with the exception of sashimi, that is not included). They have a large variety of rolls and sushi. I have tried many of them and they are all delish! There is usually a wait, but its never outrageous and the staff is always super friendly whenever I go.

Is it cool that I like the interior design and art better than the food?  Just kidding.  I started out with miso soup and popcorn scallops.  The scallops were okay and it came with two sauces; some kinda mustard and I believe ranch.  Otherwise the fried scallops alone didn't have too much flavor or spice like wasabi batter or something.  Didn't meet my expectations but I dealt with it.  Eating it took me a while, but it gave me enough time to chat with Kat and her hubs about the restaurant ambience :P  This is the 3rd restaurant that I've found to have AYCE.  Nice foldable menu and good basic selections.  Salmon belly nigiri was good.  I found their fish to be on the dry side for the other nigiris as served.  Cool thing is their portions are bite size.  For my main roll I ordered the Love Affair... oooouuuu SO NOT sexyyyy either.  It looked like a mound of imitation crab mixed with crispies and lobster bits dumped on top of the cut rolls, hiding beneath the chaos.  But the flavor was good.  Nice that the restaurant has space for larger groups and separate dining areas.  The tall ceilings, creative wood designs, lighting, and paint art captured my attention the most.  Just to note too, walking into any Japanese restaurant I'm used to being greeted by the chefs or workers.  Here they have it modernly designed on the entrance wall - no joyous welcoming shouts...  Our waiter had a tiny misunderstanding with our separate tabs.  Also took a couple reminders for drink refills.  I shall end my review with a fair nod.  I might come back however it will not be my first choice for AYCE.  I wanted to have a taste of their green tea creme brulee.  Mission accomplished and I will say that their green tea creme brulee by itself is deserving of 5 stars.

This place's not bad. I just feel like their food taste like any other place. The price is good for the amount you eat. I'd ordered the spider roll, crunchy scallop, seaweed salad and green tea. Those aren't good cooked dishes.

Ok here come the Vegas reviews...yes, it's down the street from my house. Yes, it gets crowded. If you bring more than 4 friends, go off-time, meaning AFTER THE LUNCH CROWD or BEFORE THE DINNER CROWD, especially on weekends.   Or split your party up but sit near each other. Trust me this is how you won't have to wait and salivate while others are dining and taking their time. (Just kidding) But seriously, like every other Yelper, it is a good deal.   Highly popular with everybody. Highly.

The best AYCE sushi in Vegas at an affordable cost! They have every roll you can possibly think of and their selection of sushi is pretty good. They always provide quick and friendly service. Beware: if you go on the weekends, expect a wait. Rest assure, they work hard on turning tables quickly so your wait is not painfully long.

Ordered take out. Restaurant never got my order from the app apparently. Even when shown the receipt for the exact order with the order number on it and still being charged, they wouldn't give me my food. They then tried telling me that it might have been ordered to a different restaurant when it was be exact same address.  I can assure you there's a lot better sushi spots in town if you're not restricted to the more SW side of town. Be cautious of Oyshi.
My first time in this sushi place. It was great atmosphere. We ordered all of the spacial sushi, it was good except there salmon that I feel it was't sweet. Service was good.

This place has ALL-U-CAN-EAT sushi!!!! And the menu for that option is pretty sweet! It's been awhile since I've been here, but every roll i tasted was delish!  The portions are good and two rolls filled me up fast (so no I did not do the all-u-can-eat option! LoL) I think here and Kaizen have the best rolls in Vegas....for now atleast! And the decor is pretty modern and stylish so I especially enjoyed eating here! ;)

When I arrived to this place, I noticed how awesome it looked! It was pretty and spacious. I ordered the baked salmon, baked tuna, and sexy roll. The egg rolls were so delicious! Our server really liked to hustle- she asked if we wanted anything else multiple times, haha! There were 5 of us and we ended up paying $30 each not too bad for sushi!

I like this location better than than rainbow location. Customer service is excellent, and the waiters are so nice! The wait is never long and the food is amazing! I drive from across town to eat at this location!

Use to be my favorite spot in town for sushi but over the last two years I had twice food poisonining from the raw sushi.3 stars because I am sure they can bring it back to what it was a very nice clean place to get your sushi.
Horrible dining experience.  Service was extremely slow. Ayce sushi but I got full with hot tea waiting for the slow food. Never coming back.

I love the original location. Today's service sucked.   We came in a few months ago to try the new location again. Looking forward to uni with quail egg, we were disappointed they were out. It was incredibly cold (I know this has nothing to do with the service).   Driving by today we decided to stop again. Got seated right away which was nice. Our server asked our drink order but by that time we were ready to order. She did not want to take our order since another customer was waiting for something. So we got our waters and waited. She came back to take our order and things already went wrong. We ordered beef tataki but got beef wrapped asparagus. Ordered another beef wrapped asparagus but got nothing. Ordered uni but they were out... again. Ordered three orders of gyoza but got two. Ordered three seaweed salads but got two. Ordered a dynamite roll and a lobster affair roll but got two lobster affair rolls. Ordered three pork belly and got one. Ordered a red dragon roll and got a regular dragon roll. The salmon nigiri was warm and did not taste fresh. We ordered the Oyshi scallops which had crab also, but when we got the order there was no scallop. I called over a food runner and sent it back. The server came back and aggressively asked us if we had ordered cooked scallops. It's like she couldn't remember anything even though she wrote it down. We said there were no scallops and she said they were chopped and mixed with the crab. It was a lie. I looked through it. Besides, no one minces scallops.   It is unreasonable to pay more for dinner prices when they are out of items only offered for dinner, like uni. This is the third time we have been to this location and all three times they did not have uni. I will never come back.

This place is always top notch! Typical to have a short wait.  Have had multiple rolls and all are delicious. Hardest debate is whether to order by the roll or go all you can eat. In the end, best deal is the all you can eat just prepare to leave stuffed.  My wife isn't a big fan of sushi and she always orders the ribeye. She loves it (I've tried it and it is glorious as well)!!!  Recently saw they have other locations in town which is always a plus! Try here...you won't be disappointed!

I love love love Oyishi!   The atmosphere is modern, clean, and always plays the best Pandora Stations! I have been going here for years and have seen it change over time physically, however the food is consistent - and that's why I go back!   It's located on Rainbow and Windmill which is literally less than a two minute drive from where I live. It's super convenient - the southwest area is developing like crazy so make sure to call ahead and make sure there's a table for you if you have a big group. Sometimes you have a wait a bit to get seated even for 2 people on a high volume day, but if call ahead it shouldn't be a problem. They've been improving seating people right away I have noticed the past few times. Prices are affordable and they also offer all you can eat. They have a private parking lot too.   Also, during the weekdays they have an awesome lunch special. I ordered their chicken teriyaki which was a generous serving with a California roll, miso soup, vegetable/shrimp tempura, and a house salad all for $12!!!! Who wouldn't be stoked about that?   Overall, this place is great. I recommend to anyon

Keep coming back and this last time was back to the Oyshi we knew before. The food was great and staff was outstanding. My only concern is their choice of music if you're bringing family or children. That's minor.

LATE NIGHT SUSHI AT ITS BEST (At least, from what I've tried so far)  I usually don't get off until 11:15 at night, and by that time, most sushi bars in Vegas have already packed it in and called it a night, or are shortly about to. Not Oyshi! Thankfully, this place stays open until 2AM (last call at 1:30 AM) and is perfect for folks working in the entertainment industry in Vegas.  The All-You-Can-Eat option is $27 at this place, and it is worth it! Though not as great as other AYCE places I have dined in, it still boasts a wide selection of rolls and hot food.   I think my favorite roll was the Yellowstone Roll, which was an interesting Spicy Tune and Whitefish concoction that was topped with yum-yum sauce, jalapeno and CHEDDAR CHEESE. I haven't ever been to a place with cheddar cheese as a sushi topping.  I do wish that the dessert was all you can eat as well, because I would have like two mochi balls instead of 1, but that's a small gripe.  The alcohol did seem relatively expensive. My buddy had a Sapporo and it was $7 or $8. That almost seems obscene.  On a positive note, Dad is not a huge sushi fan, so he opted for the Teriyaki Chicken Dinner. For $11, hhe had a Miso Soup, a Salad, a bowl of white rice and a HUGE steaming hot plate FULL of chicken teriyaki with hardly any vegetables. It was a fantastic deal!

This rather nondescript sushi restaurant would've never caught my eye had it not been a friend's recommendation. Oyshi's sign looks like any other Japanese restaurant but once you step inside and sit yourself in a warmly-lit booth, it's quite a lovely experience. Great for long catch-up sessions! Plus, I love that they provide clothing hangars!  Oyshi Sushi's unagi don is delicious. It is served in a black lacquered bento box with pickled radish ("oshinko") on the side. The unagi meat was tender and the sushi rice ("shari") was of good quality. Very solid dish worthy of a repeat-order. Healthy rice/unagi ratio priced in-line with most restaurants (~$20.00 incl tax).   This restaurant gives you complimentary roasted tea and edamame beans to munch on as you wait for your food. I also had an order of their yellowtail sashimi ("hamachi"). Fresh and tasty.  This restaurant seems to have its share of regular customers that drop-by to dine in-house or to pick-up their orders. If you're in the area and want decently priced Japanese food, try Oyshi.

The food was fine, but I just don't get all the hype.  The food is far from complain-worthy, but, why would I eat here when i can go to Kobe Bistro and pay half as much for the exact same fish!?  Kobe is great and is almost always 50% off (they also have ayce).     Oyshi is good, but quite expensive.

Best Sushi in Las Vegas. Best Service in Las Vegas. Best Atmosphere in Las Vegas. Best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas. Best friendly staff in Las Vegas. Best Sake in Las Vegas. Best beer in Las Vegas. Best Salmon in Las Vegas - my favorite dish. Best appetizers in Las Vegas. Best music while eating Sushi. Will I go anywhere else for Sushi in Las Vegas? No. I drive to Oyshi from all corners of Vegas because why? It's simply the best. Best of Las Vegas. Best of Las Vegas. Best of Las Vegas.

Came here on a Sunday night. It was busy so that just about all the tables were taken, but there wasn't a ridiculous wait. We had a really large party here, so we reserved a separate dining room to accommodate for all of us. Their service was really great. Food came out pretty fast and the waiters are friendly and are very attentive to your needs.   The quality of the nigiri was just OK. It wasn't horrible, but it didn't particular stand out. The proportion or rice to fish is average. They give you more rice than some better places I've been to, which tends to fill you up. Also the quality of the fish wasn't great either. It was fresh, but with certain cuts of fish, you can generally taste a difference in quality from the texture. The rolls were pretty good, but they generally are at any AYCE place. None of it seems to stand out, but I rarely see that anyways.   One of things I got that usually well judges the quality of a place was the uni and a salmon skin roll. The uni was ok. Usually a good piece of uni will have that buttery texture, which this one didn't. This one also had more of a soapy taste, which is generally from uni that isn't as fresh or good quality. The salmon skin hand roll: a good one will have nice, crispy, crunchy pieces of salmon skin. But the ones I ordered here were crunchy and moist, meaning that they didn't toast it long enough to get that right texture.  Overall, it was ok. It was about $26 a person for dinner, which is pretty typical. I've already found some other better AYCE sushi places in Vegas, so I probably wouldn't come back here unless someone really wanted to.

Oyshi is right around the corner from where I reside so of course I'm gonna try it! Well this place rocks! Great service and and an always friendly staff. We always ask for Stacy if she is working and she has never let us down! I recommend the J&B roll as well as any of the tempura rolls...the baked mussels are amazing too! I highly recommend AYCE...worth every penny ;)

We would love to give a detailed review of our experience however we never even made it to our seats. We walked in at 9pm and asked for a table for 2 and we were informed they decided to close early today..... 90 minutes early. WHO DOES THAT?????  Good menu or not, there's zero tolerance in this town for subpar service like this.   Scratching this place off our book of great places to go! #serviceisking

I gave this place 5 stars, because i honestly believe this is the best buffet/Ayce for the price in Vegas. I have gone to this place for almost 3 years now. The best part about this place are the appetizers. I love the Shrimp on skewers, Rib Eye, Asian Skirt Steak, Ahi Poke, Gyoza, and many more....Over the years their portions have gotten smaller, but i understand because it prevents from wasting food..BTW you can always get more....Their fresh sushi is amazing as well, big pieces of fish with small rice, and their Baked Rolls are very tasty. my favorites is the Lobster Fair and the Paradise rolls. Word of advice try to get there early around 5 for dinner, or you can expect a long wait. Service is really good, and ambiance is great with a younger japanese themed feel....Oyshi is the only reason my wife wants to go to Vegas...

I'm laying down in my bed right now and moaning. I'm alone, laying here, moaning. Get that visual out of your head.  As good as it gets for AYCE. Really good quality, really good price, incredible service, good ambiance. Basically just like The Ka over in Henderson, but closer to the area I'm in.  Excellent white tuna sashimi, really really good eel.   Unghhhhhhhhhh.

If you are a sushi snob, hit back on your browser and get a plane ticket to LA at least if not Tokyo. Las Vegas as far as I have seen as two sushi options... Buffet and the type of place you are subsidizing comped high rollers.   Oyshi is the buffet type. $21 for lunch. $26 for dinner. I did not notice anything different between the two menus. The $5 vig is likely pure the night vig.   Your options include sushi, rolls and hot dishes. Each is worth a paragraph.   Sushi. Most AYCE places save $$$ by not offering albacore, ikura, scallops, uni and other such high end items. This is not the case for Oyshi, which makes me wonder where they cut corners. That being said, I believe the sushi is the highlight of the menu. Though the rice is not prepared to sushi standards, the rice portion is fairly small compared to the fish, so this does not take away too much from the bite. The actual fish itself is pretty good considering it is AYCE. Note that each order is a fairly small two pieces, so don't be shy about ordering a lot. Do eat the rice as well, though, as you will be penalized for going no-carbs.   Rolls. Of the spider, bonsai, ebi ebi and volcano, I only liked the last two. I think the issue here is the sauces are pretty hit and miss. I think that AYCE places try to make their rolls filling, salty and sweet to induce satiation or in the case of bonsai nausea. That roll actually made me heave a little. Don't order too many rolls. It is sort of like how most of the menu is rolls like casinos mostly place slot machines on the casino floor. It's the most profitable.   Last and definitely least is the appetizer menu. All the meat items suck. The beefs are stringy and sweet sauced up to disguise their cheapness and the chicken is dry. Don't waste gut space. If you wanted a nice surf and turf combo, you should be at a fine steakhouse. I was disappointed, but having a good appetizer menu at an AYCE sushi place would just be a bonus. I think some of the non-meat stuff is fairly safe, such as the miso soup (though don't expect the world).   Drinks. Didn't sample the alcohol, but you have your usual assortment of sake and beer. Since I was there for lunch and was still tired from the previous night's drive, I passed. Tea is $2.50 in case you wanted to know and is pretty good to share since it is a flat fee for one pot with free hot water refills.   Though Oyshi is in a strip mall on a nondescript corner of the Vegas suburbs, it wants you to think that you are in Caesar's Palace. Not necessarily a bad thing.   There are two back rooms to accommodate large groups. Lunch is fairly quiet. I would expect dinner to be loud with the drinking and the karaoke.   Services is good during lunch. Attentive and even proactive about making sure you order a lot. Nice.   Overall, it is a good value at $21. This continually justifies my urge to stay away from the Strip for dining. Just don't expect tsukiji quality or anything and enjoy the relatively cheap eats.

This place is owned by the same oyshi on rainbow and robin dale in the southwest, so naturally I thought it would be pretty good. Unfortunately like my carnal lust for orgasmic sushi I was left disappointed and a bit unsatisfied. Having said that it wasn't all that bad. The fantasy roll, heart attack roll and a classic remix a crazy Cali roll were great. The one roll that was a huge disappointment was the Ian special. As for sides the ginger didn't taste fresh at all or the wasabi. The service was very spotty, the server forgot to refill my water quite a few times and the Resturant wasn't even that busy. The ambience is decent and nice. Not to ostentatious or to subtle but a nice complement to setting the mood right for a memorable night out.   All in all the place is average at best in terms of price and service. The plus point and a huge reason to return is the roll have a new fresh take on them and many of sound good to try, there is too many to try by yourself. Bring 7 people with you on your quest for something new and exciting. Some rolls will be forgettable kind of like their service but others will leave you lost in a sea mind numbing, thought altering perception. Definite place to try if you are up for something new.

Great atmosphere and place for AYCE. I've been to both locations many times and was never disappointed. I'm reviewing the one on Rainbow. Parking is pretty full most of the time because Oyshi shares it's location with other restaurants. If you plan on going on peak hours, good luck finding parking! There's a big selection of rolls to pick from and you get a lot, so come hungry!  I ordered the sukiyaki once and it was super good. Hit the spot. :)

Sashimi is not included in the AYCE. Honestly I'd rather pay $8 more somewhere else that includes it. Not very many options for AYCE in my opinion. No smoke salmon :(. Service was pretty good around lunch time!

Became violently ill after eating here, barely enough time to make it home. Friendly, efficient service. Lots of young people in trucker hats and beanies. Not a lot of asian dinners. Sashimi/rolls tasted odd. Just kind of shrugged it off. Win some lose some when it comes to AYCE sushi.

Good service whenever my family of six go we always get seated quickly and served right away. Most of the servers are nice there was this one time when one of them was rude but besides that its always calm ,friendly ,and yummy place.
Amazing food, great price for all you cat eat!!! Good customer service! All around a great place to eat out!

Used to be one of my favorite spots. Really disappointed in the service. Our food came before we even had a place setting or utensils etc, ordered all you can eat and our waitress only came around that first time to take our order. They are incapable of handling a busy crowd, I would highly recommend going to the rainbow location. I have given this particular location 3 tries hoping it would be better and they prove me wrong each time.

We have been here many times and each time has been more epic and delicious then the last but on this visit Stefan was the man anticipation, suggestions, The small convo breakers to comment and joke were just amazing he suggest certan items we never knew about like the takisoba and pork belly both good suggestion. Keep working Stefan up he would be amazing and Suggestion add a long sliver of lemon across the squid with shiso leaf it makes that little peace over the top. Stefan your experience and charisma have shown this 10+ year waiter that te trade isnt dead

Food was delicious, but the service....the service is terrible!!!!! The hostess was a complete bitch and laughed when we asked to sit at a preferred table. She said they are reserved for larger parties (we are a party of 3)....it made us upset because a party of 3 was at the exact table. Ordered a rainbow roll at 6:30pm and at 7:50pm we asked where is was. They had no clue so 15 minutes later we received the roll. It took 30 minutes to even get a water!!! Everyone around us was complaining and the whole atmosphere was a downer. Food was good, but I would rather get sushi from the grocery store then deal with this bs. P.s...they leave a pitcher of water on the table...not to be nice...it's because it's too difficult for them to even refill a water

Been coming to Oyshi for years... food is great and as usual with sushi places- if you don't eat at the bar, service can be slow during busy times. This place has one of the best ranges of foods to eat on their AYCE menu, so it's a good place to go if you have someone in your part who doesn't prefer raw fish.

This is a must place to dine when in Vegas. I've been coming here for years and it's never let me down. Bring your appetite because everything is delicious.  My favorites include; sizzling plates-rib eye, poke salad, salmon skin roll (handroll), baked mussels and the Monster roll.  The staff are always great and attentive. The wait can be long but it's well worth it.  Did I mention that dessert is included in the All You Can Eat (AYCE)? Also delicious. I recommend the Creme Brûlée.
My wife and i have eaten at several sushi places around vegas and we keep coming back here. There is a reason. Creative chefs, great atmosphere, and we have never had bad service.. It's awesome

Highly recommended from a fellow Yelper and also a dear friend who is a Vegas resident and an expert on ayce sushi bars who even made rotd on such, what can go wrong.  He was right.  This place is awesome.    The locals know where to eat.  And its not on the strip with over priced and under flavored eats.  Its far away from it HA!  The place is well decorated.  Very modern.  Very clean.  However, you don't get the true, authentic feel of a real japanese sushi bar.  But their ways was cool too :)  Anyway,  their fish was above average as far as freshness.  Their rice was tastey but couldve been a little bit more warmer.    I love the fact that they didn't make their nigiri with so much rice like other places would.  That was a plus:)  I'm not a fan of rolls.  However, my company tonight ordered a few rolls.  I prefer strictly nigiri.  But the ones my friend chose was actually ok.  My friend always takes us out to his spots.  He is totally my go to guy for good eats here in sin city.  He hasn't disappoint:)

This place is a really nice spot to go for a nice  lunch with friends or  for a dinner for two. They are usually playing the top 50 charts over the radio and their staff has the young, hip, friendly vibe  They have an all you can eat menu that's $22 for lunch and $27 for dinner (I think that's for weekends). I usually stick with that because 2 specialty rolls alone would equal to the price of AYCE.   I went for a friend's birthday and we shared all kinds of yummy appetizers, this really tasty sake and of course all of our rolls.  Everything was fresh and tasted pretty good. I would suggest the atomic bomb, pretty spicy but really good. I couldn't take a picture fast enough because it was devoured in seconds.   My only wish is that they had more options with spicy mayo or ponzu sauce. They had a lot of rolls topped with eel sauce which  is not my go to but it's doable.

Worst service ever.  Just because we had a big party and gratuity is automatically on the bill, doesn't mean you treat the customers with the worst service. Where shall I begin. First it took us 30 minutes just to get water for a party of 15.  Second, when they bring out the orders they just place it on the corner of the table nearest to their entry and expect us to sort it out to whoever ordered it. Third, they just keep doing that and expect us to make room on the table instead of cleaning out our table which was a total mess because of all the empty plates on the table.  Did runners were rude. Just the worst I have ever seen compared to our other parties we had at sushi spots.  I feel our gratuity shouldn't have been automatically added after that service. Stay away from this place is you got a party.
My go to spot for AYCE sushi. Staff is friendly and really good at making rounds to see if there's anything else you'd like to order. Drinks are never empty. Food comes out quick and always on point.
Flavorless Gyoza, overcooked beef wrapped asparagus, and slow service. That about sums up my visit here.

"I'm STARVING! waited 34 mins AFTER gettin seated just to flag a different waiter to take our All You Can Eat sushi order. This place used to be my favorite sushi spot but the service sticks out the most (above the food) and this place really went to the gutter."

This is for the all-you-can-eat lunch for $21. They make it fresh as you order and is not premade, nor is it buffet-style, which I love. A plethora of selections from hand rolls, sushi, appetizers- hot and cold, and cooked sushi ( didn't order any, personal Preference ). Uni is not included during lunch. Quality is great. I dined at the newer location which is nicely decorated with modern touches, semi-private rooms are also available. Service is good. Not a lot of people for lunch on a weekday but maybe because it's at the new location. Would come back here!

A perfectly good sushi place if you happen to work in the area. I probably wouldn't head out of my way but given the fact that I'm a vegetarian and pretty limited in what I can have sushi wise, that's sort of a given.  I've dined in a couple of times and grab it for takeout on occasion when I feel like something different.   Sit down service is about the same as most places, service is attentive and they'll usually give you some edamame beans or something (on the house) to munch on while you wait. The place is a little cozy but nice.  My take out choice (basically my only option) is their vegetarian futomaki lunch special ($8.95). You get 8 generously sized pieces along with a particularly good miso soup and one of those little Japanese salads they always give you. Pretty standard for downtown and again, the quality of the ingredients is good and the roll well done.  Friendly, fast and tasty. Win, win, win.

For the $2X price of lunch or dinner AYCE sushi this place is really not too shabby!  Basically everything on the menu minus the sashimi's on the menu are obtainable for the AYCE deal just make sure you can finish everything you order, or pay the price. I liked the fact that the fish was actually cold to the touch when I was eating the rolls and what not...it gives me the false sense that it's fresher. Like most AYCE if you have a big appetite it becomes a better deal for you but if you can only stomach two rolls max, might be better off ordering off the menu and skipping on the deal.

Generally, I wouldn't recommend a place if I wanted to keep it a secret. I would say something like, the place sucks and not to go there. I thought about it, but then then it might backfire and the place closes down. Therefore...  Yes, I am a big fan. I'm not the biggest sushi lover as some people are, but when it's good, it's good. I do believe I've had a wide enough sample of restaurants to know the difference. This place is definitely a place I would recommend.   The place is cool, kind of a drive from the strip, middle of nowhere strip mall with tumble weed crossings, inside is not TOO fancy, and not TOO much the other kind. But really you don't need to care much, as long as it's clean.  The place is all you can eat, not all you can pay for. More like... You can eat all, for one set price (within two hours). Three of the four pages of the menu are all included for that price. And let me tell you, they had every roll I've ever seen or heard of along with many many more that I haven't. But there are also all the wonderful appetizers like the Rib Eye and Shrimp called "Surf and Turf" tucked all the way on the last page at the very end. Ya we ordered about 8 of those. That alone, would probably be worth the price.   Between the seven of us we ordered more sushi than I could ever imagine. But it wasn't so much about the quantity but the quality was just as impressive. Of the different rolls I did try. I had, not one complaint. They were as good as I've had at any other Sushi restaurant. I'd go into the names and ingredients of the rolls but if you love sushi, and even if you don't just imagine the ones you like and it's probably on the menu.  Service was pretty good considering how many people were eating all you can eat sushi in the restaurant. I really did expect the sushi to come out one every half hour. But I didn't even notice any wait between drinks, appetizers, sushi, more sushi, more appetizers and finally dessert. In fact, upon ordering an extra Miso soup, It seemed like it got to the table before I finished ordering it. They were that fast.  Eating good food releases endorphins in your brain. A good sign that you just had a good meal with good friends is how much everyone is laughing at the end. And there was plenty of that to be had for everyone. The only reason Its not 5 stars, is because I've had some really good Sushi, but I can't order it here because it's usually a Chef Special at the other places.  By the way, this place sucks.

Not the first time being at Oyishi but after today this will be my last.  We were seated within five minutes of our arrival; however we had to ask for service after waiting 25 minutes. The waitress who was assigned to our table was very pleasant and apologetic.  We placed our orders but people  from  our party did not receive their complete  sushi order for 2hrs. The waitress again was apologetic and placed it  on rush.  The one star is for this waitress if it wasn't for her we would have walked out.

My mom & I eat at Oyshi every now & then, when we go there we order the same thing every time. Just recently my mom & I decided to eat there and the service was unbelievably slow, the restaurant was not full at all so my mom & I couldn't understand why there was a one hour delay with our order. By the time the server delivered our food we had lost our appetite to eat so we just bagged the food to go. It doesn't matter to me how good the food is if the service isn't as excellent as the food, it ruins the whole dining experience for me. I would also like to mention that the Oyshi servers do not take initiative to bring you the things you'll need to eat such as utensils, napkins, chopsticks, etc.... I had to ask for everything & that was a pain in the a**. Overall, I was disappointed with the service at Oyshi & I hope to see improvement in the future.

I can't believe I've never written a review for this..I've been going to Oyshi for years!  Oyshi is the best place to go for AYCE mainly because of their appetizer and dessert selections.    What I love to get are baked mussels and sizzling plates: asian skirt steak and surf and turf.  If you're hungry, these plates aren't shareable, but most of the time they are.  The asian skirt steak has a hint of sweetness to it.  It comes on a bed of lettuce and onions that the cast iron plate cooks.    The surf and turf is just a few pieces of tenderloin steak with 2 pieces of shrimp also on a bed of lettuce and onions that the cast iron plates cooks.  Very tender steak, and the shrimp was grilled to perfection.    I like to get nigiris: salmon, garlic tuna, and yellowtail.  All the fish tastes fresh.  The salmon was orange and marbleized as it should be.  You can get your tuna 3 different ways, but garlic is my favorite.  Yellowtail I got plain.  Always a good tasting fish.    Rolls:  Had a few and they were good, but none of them really caught my attention to be honest.     Dessert: Vanilla creme brulee.  I had a bite of the green tea creme brulee, and that was good as well.    Appetizers, soups, nigiris, and desserts are well worth the AYCE.

A couple of dollars more expensive than some other ayce sushi places, but it's worth it! They're busy a lot so be prepared to wait a little but. Again, it's worth it though! Really great tasting sushi and good customer service.

I am a huge fan of sushi and usually always go for the AYCE option if one is available so I can try many different option. This is the first place I have gone where I was really disappointed. There were flies everywhere and the food just did not have that fresh flavor I am used to. All the items I tried were pretty bland and almost tasted stale. There are better sushi places around so I don't think I will be returning :(

My oh my what can I say. It was definitely Oishi, even if they did spell it wrong. I came to vegas to quell the beckoning of the seven deadly sins. And I can safely say I left knowing full well that Gluttony is very satisfied (there's got to be some sort of ironic word play here, but goodness I can never figure it out). Oyshi Sushi has definitely raised the bar for the SoCal AYCE sushi restaurants. I might even say it is comparable to the delicious and the very-missed Kami (RIP)  The SKINNY: I came with a group of 12. I was one of the last to show up, and I was very surprised at the fact that it could seat 12 people. The usual AYCE sushi ordering paradigm (...i barreled through 4 seasons of The Big Bang Theory) is a check list that is given to the waitress, which will be dropped off at the chef, and eventually you'll be nom-noming your way through delectable bite size raw fish goodness. But here, there is no checklist, you order directly to the waitress. But amazingly almost all orders made by the 12 people were satisfied! This place has amazing service with a very patient staff, and a variety of Nigiri and Rolls that i so deeply yearn for here in california. It's 26 dollars well spent my friends.   The Food: Okay so originally we were suppose to go to Sushi Mon, but one thing led to another and we ended up at Oyshi. "they have a better variety of rolls, and most of our group prefers rolls...." Hearing it breaks my heart, but the need of the many outweighs the need of the few, so I had to comply. But! hot dam, this place got some unique selections for just the simple nigiri. Spanish Mackerel? Garlic Tuna? Halibut? Seriously, the Koreans owning our local southern california ayce sushi joints needs to take a page of the koreans owning Nevada's ayce sushi joints. I have to say, they were all amazing (with the exception of the cajun albacore. that was just good. But it's still better than bad) I have to point out the fact that they offer a free order of Amaebi and Uni, AND 4 pcs of raw oysters per customer. Being that most of the people I went with was apprehensive to raw food, I ate more than enough free orders. My goodness, my raw oyster cravings won't start up for at least another month (seriously, it's like a menstrual cycle. I know, i'm disgusting).  Everybody speaks of how great their rolls are, and sure they are pretty good. But honestly, I can't remember them for the life of me. So maybe they were more forgettable than spectacular. But who cares, give me another 4 pieces of raw oysters dammit! That's what's important here.  The Service:  Oh poor poor waitress. She had to go through so much...good thing we tipped her generously (and this is coming from a Chiense man). The service is actually spot on, given that there were some dead times where our food arrived a bit slow, but its a minor issue. Afterall, there were probably 5 sushi chefs taking care of a whole restaurant, INCLUDING a party of 12.   This place is a bit off the Vegas Strip, but who cares, it's all you can eat SUSHI. and It's good! The only reason why you wouldnt come out here is if you said "Oh i ate too much at the Wynn Buffet already." And that's barely an excuse.

Great place for business lunch! I was there with my team and had the sashimi lunch. They were able to pack in 14 pieces of sashimi in the bento box and the quality was ok. The place is small so be there early!
Nasty, smushy abacore, not my favorite place. Just had it for lunch today and now im in the toilet w diarrhea every hour. My mouth is so dry now.

Since someone reached out and responded to my post, I decided to update my review. My one star was an accumulation between the food and the service I received. If I subtract your server's hesitation, then I'll give it three stars.

I cant believe its taken me this long to find this place! stumbled upon this sushi restaurant while out doing some errands today and what a hidden treasure! Usually sushi bars have a very boring decor and bland music but this place was playing Trance music.. that is awesome! with beautiful decor to the wall art and the exposed pipes it has a very stylish/modern feel to it. I almost felt like I was in San Francisco.  I ordered the seaweed salad. It was a very generous portion but my only gripe was it was completely covered in sesame seeds which i am not a fan but know next time to request them to be left out. The seaweed itself was very fresh and the right amount of dressing was used. Then i ordered the Hawaiian roll with soy paper. It had albacore, shrimp, and cucumber inside wrapped in a Cajun albacore and avocado tossed with some ponzu sauce... heaven. Seriously one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had and I consider myself a sushi connoisseur.  The popcorn scallops are amazing as well. they're little scallops deep fried and served with a wasabi ranch and honey mustard sauce.  I had the all you can eat which was only $25 and that even included 2 oysters! Amazing deal especially for the quality. Ive already been 3 times in the past 3 days and Ill probably end up here at least 3-4 times a week. LOVE LOVE LOVE!  Oh! and the sushi chefs are awesome. :)

I really don't know how this restaurant is getting 5 stars? Is this friends and family? The fish was fresh enough, but when the rice is twice the size of any AYCE sushi out there, it seems to not be worth it. I ate mainly nigiri. The waiter was apologetic enough, though he forgot many orders. Service was painfully slow, and I started to think it was a tactic strategy so i will eat less since there were 15 minute gaps. Plus only one dessert? I normally have 2, which I always eat since portions are usually small. Needless to say, I will not be coming back even if it is 2 blocks away.

Came in with a smile .. Left with a disappointment ...  I don't really know where to start ... It's that bAd .. We felt like our server failed  in customer service. She took our order and we dint get some of it .. She was blaming the kitchen about it .. Second we got left out in-between 1st and second order for ayce sushi  ... So we're waiting for her to come back .. I have to call the hostess to place my second order while she went to look for the server .... Argh what a waste of time and we pretty much lost our appetite I told the Busser or food runner name osmar  bout the issue .. He was very nice and tried to deliver a good service to make up for the bad service from our server.He told the manager about the issue & he kept coming back to our table to check on us .. The manager gave us 1 comp for lunch but it definitely didn't change the fact the we had a bad experience and we are Never coming back :(

We've had lunch here for the second time in the last few weeks and it's true the place is rock solid as far as I can tell by our last two visits. I waited to post a review after our second visit because often the first time may not be enough of an experience to grade a restaurant properly. Excellent quality all around, good atmosphere and most importantly the food is prepared consistently which is the main flaw with most restaurants, not just sushi places. Service is very good and everyone seems to help each other deliver orders to the tables. We really like the fact that the fish inside the rolls are actually cool in temperature and not warm like most places we've tried. The sauces are light in flavor and not over powering, which can overwhelm and kill the fish flavor of good quality sushi rolls. My only negative remark would be that for some reason, after our initial order the second order (often our final order) which is probably 1 or 2 rolls it seems to take a while to come out. Also today my wife wore white pants and it seems there was some soy sauce spilled on the seat of the booth and it stained her pants which I noticed when we went shopping afterwards, but no big deal since it would be hard to see that soy sauce was spilled on a black booth cushion. "We ain't mad at ya", we will be back for more. We hardly tried the extensive offerings this menu features. The best All You Can Eat sushi in town!

Still one of my favorite place to grab sushi!! Never been to this location and hoping quality is just as good as their sahara location.   Ordered my usual favorites, Oyshi and tiger roll!
