Glad the flavors were consistent just like their other location. Plus I get my money worth here because they don't over load their sushi with rice.   Good food and a great waiter, Stefan makes my first experience at this location great!!
Friends took me here while visiting. Came hungry and left over stuffed, this AYCE did not disappoint. All my favorites, nothing fancy just good sushi. Service was quick and friendly.

Second time coming to this location after a fairly good experience the last time we came when we were in Las Vegas. The website and Yelp both say this location closes at 11pm so we went in for a late dinner at about 9pm. The restaurant was noticeably less crowded than the last time we were there but we were seated right away. Our waitress was good and quickly came by and took our orders. The first round of food came out quickly, everything was good except the uni which was definitely bad.   The restaurant started to thin out and eventually we were the only table left. I have worked restaurants for a long time so I get it, I know what it is like to be over it and want to go home. However, there is a level of professionalism that is expected when you have any customers around. My parents ordered a couple of hand rolls, etc for their last round and was definitely falling apart and literally thrown on the plate.   The biggest issue for me was one of the other employees (not our server). Before 10pm the rest of the workers were already cleaning up and talking to the other employees, no big deal I get it. However, one of the employees was incredibly unprofessional. Literally yelling (again we were the only table in the restaurant), cussing every other word, I literally heard him at one point YELL "Oh fuck ya, when her fucking titties were hanging out!" I am far from a prude but I was literally there with my parents who are obviously older and do not tolerate that kind of stuff. My mom was mortified, that employee did  come by our table with a half-ass "sorry for being loud, it's been a long day" while literally laughing. We were all over it and just wanted to get out of there. When we left not a single employee said thank you, good night, anything.   I would definitely recommend going to their other location or just trying another AYCE sushi spot.

Man, I am so glad I came back to try this place again. It must have been a fluke day when I went before with my previous review because I have been back a few times and it's been awesome ever since. This has become one of my favorite places to go for sushi! Their sushi was fresh and every roll was delicious. My favorite is the salmon belly! As for the rolls, you can never go wrong with the Love Affair!   My friends and I came here late one night and it felt like we were there forever! Our server was friendly and got us our orders in a timely manner. We never had a lull where we didn't have any sushi on the table. Such great customer service throughout our night!
Loved this location! Food was tasty and service was on point. I liked this location better than the original.

I love this place. I really do... I just wish it was three times the size. But at the same time, that's part of the charm. It's small, cozy, and full of funky/kitschy Japanese decor and a hundred framed autographs from all the famous people who have eaten here.   Went for dinner with Daddio & D last week. It was D's first time, but Dad and I have come here together a few times before. It's our go-to place before seeing something at Harbourfront Centre. Now that I work there, it's dangerous!  Some of the freshest sushi I've had, and I appreciate the rice-to-other-stuff ratio here, which is not a lot of rice and a LOT of other stuff. YUMYUMYUM!  The miso soup is incredible here - for those who think all miso soup is the same, come here and discover your folly. It's one of my favourites in the city (Toronto proper).  D got the Chicken Teriyaki Bento Box, and loved it. Tempura deserves a particular mention - I tried it. I'm a sucker for yam tempura though!!!  Dad got a bunch of assorted sushi & sashimi and adored it all, as per usual. We love this place. I don't eat fish, but I hear the "ahhh"s and the "mmmm"s all over the place.  We also got the butter mushroom app.... drool. As for me, I ordered the cucumber rolls and the avocado rolls. Lovely, lovely, lovely.  Our dinner for three (and we ordered 4 appetizers as well as three entrees, sake and beer) came to under $100 without tip.  The service is INSANELY fast. Even when they are full, it's unbelievably rapid. If you're looking for a leisurely sushi experience, you won't find it here, though we didn't really feel rushed, either.  As others have said, it's a little hard to find, but don't second guess yourself. Keep following the food store around the corner and you'll see it.  I have to say, I am so disappointed when an unsalted, cold edamame app arrives at the table. Is that the/a regional or traditional way of serving it or something? I don't know. I've never heard of that. I like my edamame hot and salty.  Preferably with flakes of salt. Not the case here...   It loses the rest of the edamame-drained star because there's no standard bar. Just beer, wine and sake. BOOOO! This girl needs cocktails as part of just about ANY occasion.

I start eating there for few weeks because I love sushi .Sushi is good but serves  the waiters are very rude. They have no respect. Second time I came with my kid . They didn't like that .Specially during the lunch . I had restaurants for many years. I never go back again. I rather spend my money elsewhere.

So, after doing much research, hoping to find a great alternative to my usual spot for AYCE sushi, I decided on Oyshi, solely because of the great reviews I saw here on Yelp.   I looked up the website, called and asked about prices, and finally my boyfriend and I decided to make the trip out.   We arrived at about 8:30pm, and it was a Friday night, so I expected it to be bustling. During our wait to be seated,  I scoped out the crowd, and noticed the usual. Mostly those under the age of 30, large groups of them in fact, and figured this must be their spot before they hit the clubs, considering their attire. Well, it was either that or the fact that the music in the restaurant sounded as if you were already in a night club. It must be set on Pandora or something. Anyway, it was only about a 15 minute wait, which wasn't bad at all.   So, besides my observations of the restaurant ambiance and demographic, we finally were able to look at the menu. My boyfriend usually orders the nigiri, so we got the usual garlic tuna, albacore, cajun albacore, and decided to try the Oyshi scallops. As for the rolls, I decided on the Sibuya No Rice, Coco, and a Bonsai. I also decided to get the agedashi tofu, grilled beef asparagus, baked mussels and seaweed salad. This was only the first round after all.  We were excited to eat until the food arrived on our table. First the nigiri, the presentation was obviously not of any importance, but you can't judge a book by its cover, so we took a few bites anyway.   Verdict,   the garlic tuna was DISGUSTING. It smelled and tasted like spoiled blood. I've had garlic tuna many times at many other restaurants, and this one had to be the worst. It even looked slimy, not because of the sauce, just itself.  the albacore was seared, and also tasted old. It had the same garlic sauce poured over it as the garlic tuna, and it was mushy.  the Oyshi scallops I thought were going to be "OISHI" but, definitely not. They mixed it with crab meat, and very light mayo, and it fell apart immediately as I tried to pick it up.   the cajun albacore had TOO MUCH cajun seasoning! I usually love cajun albacore, and this was too much for my palate, on top of that it was DRY.  my boyfriend got his usual spicy tuna hand rolls as well, and the spicy tuna looked a little spoiled.   on to the rolls,  the Bonsai, had the cajun albacore on it as well, but I had to bear it to see if the spicy tuna in the center was at least average. The roll as a whole was not to my liking.  the Coco, was probably the most decent roll on table, probably because each of the ingredients in it were fully cooked.  the Sibuya No Rice, again with the spicy tuna... eh.  the appetizers,  the agedashi tofu is usually my favorite appetizer!!! It came out looking as if it were just fried up, and I commend the presentation on this one, but the center was cold, the sauce was not tasty, and I hate that it is not "bite-size" as most Japanese cuisine is known to be.   the seaweed salad was not a bright green and although it was crispy, it had an ugly after taste, I've had better, let's just leave it at that.  the grilled beef asparagus was drizzled in teriyaki sauce. The asparagus was perfect, but the beef wrapped around it was dry somehow.  the baked mussels were not baked enough, and the yumyum sauce was pretty tasteless.   I was disappointed already, but decided to take another round of appetizers, since I knew the sushi wasn't going to be very enjoyable. I settled for calamari, shrimp/veg tempura, edamame, asian style skirt steak, and some other things that were just not memorable enough.  I knew it was bad when I was scarfing down edamame and tempura. The calamari looked good, but the dipping sauces  (ranch and a mayo/mustard mix) could have been more "asian" I guess? My boyfriend ate the skirt steak (aka Korean bulgogi, in my opinion). He even commented "I'm eating beef, which is probably the last thing I would expect to eat at a Sushi restaurant."  With that said, it smelled as if something was burning the entire night we were there!   Hm, it was overall a disappointing experience.  We have both gone to many sushi restaurants, with my list including restaurants in Hawaii and San Francisco, California, and I wanted to seriously give this place a chance. Unfortunately, Oyshi just did not live up to the hype!  On a side note though, my waitress was very helpful, and service was mediocre, but that's about it.

Frequent patron of this establishment .. It is one of the few sushi restaurants I highly recommend. The wait to get seated can be gruesome depending on the time of arrival and time of the day. Once seated though service has always been great. Their rolls are fully stuffed so be careful, you can easily get stuffed with just a few. Start out light with a few Appetizers then go in on a roll or two. They do half orders also so that's always the best way to gonif you just want to taste a new roll. Sushi has always been fresh here and I hope it remains that way. I've been coming to this place for about 7yrs now. My first sushi restaurant experience and I'm glad its still around! Try this place out, you won't leave unsatisfied

Excellent food and atmosphere!  Hidden treasure on a street with other sushi restaurants that deserve less attention! Some of the wait staff need a little more training. ( we had the Asian version of Debbie Downer) but overall outstanding!! He the Udon!!

Chef Ivan is our favorite! Always a great time when we come for dinner. The food is always delicious and he is always attentive no matter how busy it is. Tried the quail with ikura and it was pretty good. I didn't even have to order it because he heard me asking the waiter about it.   Mono is always great too! Best waiter! He is always giving excellent service and even recommend the quail with ikura.   I gave a 4 because there is always a waiting time when we come. Usually the waiting estimates around 30 min or more but it is understandable as the food makes up for it!

Hangry!!! I only give it one star because the one roll I had was good and because the waiter was some what attentive. After waiting almost a full hour and receiving only one roll, I was basically was ignored at the bar. Hello right in front of you!!!! Not one person asking me if I received my rolls. The look on the sushi chefs faces was " I thought you made them," "no I thought you made it." "Where did they go?" No real apologies or even a "sorry next time we'll be better, so the roll you did receive is free." Nope I waited while I paid for the only roll I had. Next time it's busy, do yourself a favor and get the lunch special at a table and avoid leaving hungry and angry!!'

Where do I start with this place? First of all, we have been visiting Oyshi for 3-4 years now and have had ours ups and downs. When the owner is not around, the place goes haywire. I will say the quality of food is usually pretty good and when the heavier gentleman is behind the sushi bar, we are treated phenomenally. This is where it ends. There is zero consistency. This evening we arrived around 11:30 PM. There were 6-8 tables seated as well as about 6 people at the sushi bar. We opted to sit at the bar. There were 2 sushi chefs for the entire restaurant so we already assumed the wait time on food would be a bit slow but being that it was so late at night this wasn't a problem. What was a problem was the HORRIBLE service we received. There was a group of what seemed to be off duty employees sitting in the back portion of the bar drinking. The chefs were going over to that side at least every 5 minutes, taking shots and conversing, as tickets sat in front of them. At one point one of the servers had to go through the kitchen and behind the bar to ask a chef for extra sauce. The woman who took our order came back once after 10 minutes and once more after about 25. We placed our order with another server who did not write anything down and alas, forgot 3 of the 4 items we ordered. At this point, visibly bothered, one of the chefs told us to order any sushi through him, which we did. That too was forgotten. We could not even enjoy the $60 dinner we paid for and rushed out of there as to flee a very uncomfortable situation. Unfortunately I think it is time to find a new neighborhood sushi spot as this place clearly allows their employees to run the show which shows in their service.
We are very disappointed with Love affairs.It's a little cold.Told the server but nothing she can do.She said she will tell the chef!That's it.

Went here the other day and was the only patron on the right side of the sushi bar. Had already ordered and asked if they could switch the TV from ESPN to World Cup and was told they wouldn't switch it because they don't like soccer. Thought he was joking and asked again and he confirmed they wouldn't change TV due to not liking soccer. Spoke to the "manager" and told her that was the worst customer service I've ever heard and barely got an apology. Got a 10% discount lol. Never going there again.

Oyshi Sushi Bar Restaurant is definitely a must go! I've been here three times since it has been introduced to me on July 5th of 2014. It obviously hasn't been that long ago and it has already taken my interest and satisfies my cravings! I love their Ayce pricing ($21 lunch/$26 dinner) and of course the all-you-can-eat selections! I highly suggest their yellowtail with pico de gallo, seaweed salad, fresh oysters, and shrimp tempura as starters to prepare you for this sushi selection like Kami Kaze, Dragon, Rock N' Roll, Catepillar, Treasure and etc. Seriously though, this place is amazingly delicious. My only complaint as to why I gave this place a four star instead of a five because customer service can take you a long way and two out of the three times I've been here was a little below fair. It took them almost 20 mins in order to finally give us some attention and take our second order, they didn't refill our drinks unless asked and our wait for our entree was quite some time. Asides that, the food is heavenly mouth-watering and the AYCE pricing is good!

This place is close to my parents' place in Vegas.  I came here with my mom around dinner on a Monday.  Not very crowded.  We ordered the AYCE.  The quality of fish is decent, they don't give you a lot of rice on the sushi which is good because that is a total filler when it comes to AYCE sushi.  The price is pretty good, its under $30/person for dinner.  The service here was good, they check-in on us often, but were not overbearing.  The only thing that sucked was at the tables, they don't offer the half rolls.  It's only available at the sushi bar.  So, if you want half rolls, request to sit at the sushi bar.  There wasn't anything that really stood out.  They have specials written on the chalk board in the front.  When we were there, they had a pork belly appetizer, which tasty good.  Nice and fatty, but it was a little chewy for my taste.  This is good for the local area.  You don't have to wait as long as one that is closer to the Strip, but if I'm in this area and crave sushi, this is a good spot to go to.

This is not made up...  I am a patient man. My girlfriend and I work in the service industry. My girl even works at a sushi place. This is literally the worst service I have ever encountered.   Sat down for Ayce lunch at 1:30.. Our first order of Nigiri hadn't came out, it was now 1:55. We didn't order anything special, just slice the fish and send it out. We ask the server about our order. She abruptly leaves, and I can see the sushi chef and the server arguing with each other.  She then advised us that she forgot to put the order in. I thought, ok.. Cool. The world isn't a perfect place, and we all make mistakes... But when we make a mistake, a good server should hurry to correct it and make it right.   Waited 20 min... low and behold, she forgot to put the order in a second time. It has now been 45 min since I ordered the Nigiri.. No exaggeration. By this time I've lost my appetite. The restaurant isn't even busy, the place was half full.  I felt disgusted paying the $47 plus $10 tip.. I tipped 20 percent just because I'm in the tipping industry, and don't have the heart to stiff this chick. She also told me they don't do half rolls. I could have sworn they did before.  I will never come back to this establishment. Thanks server with the black sketcher shoes.

This sushi place located in a strip mall off the strip is a good find.  We went here for dinner after house hunting around the area and decided to go with the all you can eat option for about $25.  The all you can eat feature allows you to order anything off the menu (rolls, hot japanese items, soup, tofu, nigiri sushi, and a selection of a few desserts including mochi).  The only exception is sashimi.  Each of the rolls off the menu ranges from $12-15/per roll so I think the all you can eat is worth it if you've worked up an appetite.  The rolls are pretty good and made to order which is different from a typical Japanese buffet in which the rolls are sitting out there for who knows how long.  Service is pretty good and the decor of the restaurant is modern and clean.    I enjoyed coming to this sushi place and for $25, the food and service can't be beat.  Thanks Oyshi for a great meal.

There was no host to greet us to lead us to a table. My family waited for 5 minutes before we got a "hello". There was barely any people eating and all the staff was looking at us. That level of professionalism was an insult to our face. I'm giving 2 stars because at least the place inside looked nice enough to stare at for five minutes before we left.
I ate way too much. Food was awesome. We got all you can eat and we sampled everything.
this is a great place to eat. always ask for their specials. you can't just have enough of their salmon belly.
Another great AYCE experience today at Oyshi for Mother's Day!!! I made reservations for noon and was seated where we requested immediately.

Oyshi has been mine and my husband's go to sushi restaurant in Vegas for the last two years now. All their food is fresh and we have never had a bad experience here. The staff is very friendly and welcoming

Quaint little sushi place next to the Kitchen Table Grocery store. I ordered take-out (as did several other patrons), so I can't comment too much on the ambiance. But from the looks of it, the entire place probably can't hold any more than 40 people.   The yellowtail fish was pretty fresh (smooth and buttery), roll selection was okay, but the prices are pretty steep (though I'm coming from Texas, so I'm not sure that I'm the best judge of Toronto sushi prices). Service was very friendly and appreciative. As a plus (for me, at least), they all spoke Japanese, which is such a pleasant language to listen to.

This place is pretty busy during the evening, the menu has a really nice selection with variety. The service was truly excellent and our server Ploi was great. The only thing I was not a fan of was the rice, I felt like the rice was too crunchy and not what you expect for sushi. Overall recommend this place but don't expect top tier fish cuts and amazing rice. Just my two cents.

Now that the idea of all you can eat sushi doesn't creep me out I had the best experience and a new loyalty to Oyshi Sushi. The ambiance is hip and cool the demographic is everything from older couples to young Hipsters.   You don't feel like you are in the suburbs but you don't feel like you are in a Las Vegas suburb either. The service is friendly and fast. The Rolls & Appetizers are made to order. If you throw down @ the Sushi Bar you will no doubt get your money's worth. They have an all you can eat lunch & dinner special. The icing on the cake (har-har) is the desert. Yes, it's true the green tea tiramisu is as good as it sounds.   I have to thank fellow yelper Cameron G for the info on this one

Great service, fresh food. Our party ordered all you can eat. The atmosphere is great here and the restaurant is very clean. The food was better than other sushi restaurants in town. The service was quick and the staff was friendly. Will definitely be coming back soon

Oyshi is awesome. The food is amazing. Love the fact that the menu includes steaks. The waiters are fun and easy to talk to and I always have a good experience with them. They made my birthday really fun.

I just wanted to update from my last review and say that ever since Andrew came back, the place has completely turned around for the better! I love Oyshi again and the service is waaay better!! They no longer mess up or forget my orders.  Loove Oyshi! Now I can say they have one of the best AYCE sushi dinners in Las Vegas. Everyone should try it!
Hawaii friends and fam one the best sushi spots that all you can eat here . Sit at the bar and Chef Ed treats ya like family . The staff here is on point and the food is bomb .

Wow, our food took 25 minutes in between each dish.  Don't know if this is a gimmick they use for all u can eat so people can get mad n leave n don't eat lots of their food.  I'm not coming again.  Good or not, it was a waste of my time sitting and waiting for food.
AMAZING FOOD! Horrible service. The manager didn't seem to care about his poor server we complained about either.

Oh how I wanted Oyshi on Sahara to become a local fave since it's so close to my place! Strike three and they were out. Sad as the atmosphere is great. I have added a star for the friendly server our last visit, which will be the last.   It was a Saturday eve, around 6pm w four of us; two got the all you can eat, and my daughter and I, a la carte. The quality and freshness of the sushi was poor to begin with but the quality of the ayce comparatively was horrid.    It was sad but yet amusing as had a friend over from Asia and was headed to Tokyo the next day and we were watching the World Cup on their bar tv in which Japan was playing.  There are plenty of decent sushi places but this is not one of them. I had heard they're other location is good, but don't think I will even attempt as have other places on my list.

I love Oyshi, but they need to change their lighting ASAP. Every time I go there I get so dizzy, and feel so sick I always need to leave right away. I asked the waiter if other people have the same problem and he even said people have complained to him about feeling dizzy and sick. Other than that issue, try the lobster fair its amazing!
Over the top service and very cool atmosphere!    I had a Volcano Roll and Love Affair roll.  Both my wife and I absolutely loved!  Best Sushi we have ever had in Vegas.  And we live here.

One of my favorite sushi places! Went for late night happy hour and did all you can eat which is the way to go! They bring the food out as it is made and I really couldn't find anything to complain about.

The sushi is really good but it is the Hotategai sushi (raw scallop) is what keeps me coming back as a regular and I didn't give this spot five stars only because the waiters can be hit or miss for good service

AYCE lunch was only $22/person! Sushi came out fresh and delicious, service was great, and decor was industrial and beautiful. There was no wait when I arrived around noon but customers quickly trickled thereafter. I can't see this place being busier than Goyemon which is why I like it :)  Also, I would recommend the Kamikaze rolls

Literally sitting in the restaurant writing this review because I'm so upset with how slow the service is here. We ordered our food at 3:00 and all we asked for was 6 pieces of salmon, 2 pieces of Cajun albacore, and 2 pieces of escolar. It's 3:45 and we still haven't received our food. How hard is it to put some fish on top of rice? They aren't even busy right now.

Their new location is in the space formerly occupied by Go Wild Sushi. Somehow they made the space less appealing. They tore out a row of booths and replaced them with tables. Also gone is the performance stage. The rest of the decor looks half finished. Luckily, their food is much better. A sampling of tuna, albacore, halibut, and yellowtail nigiri showed that their sushi is better than your average AYCE spot. An order of pork belly was good despite drowning in sauce. Rolls were fairly well crafter with minimal rice and ample fish. Each AYCE meal comes with one dessert. I opted for the velvety smooth chocolate creme brulee with its thick sugary crust.  A kid's menu is available. My kid's order of popcorn chicken filled a large bowl. As an a la carte item, it was an inexpensive deal that easily would have fed four kids. He ended his meal with a ice cream parfait made with vanilla ice cream, granola and chocolate and strawberry syrup.  3.5 Stars

First off, it's dark in there. Like seriously, the only light that enters is through the tinted front glass doors. So you feel like you're in some cavernous spot, and when it's bright & sunny out it kinda feels weird. However, if you like that sort of thing, then have at it. Our Server, Rey, was pretty awesome! His energy & enthusiasm was the light in this cave. We ordered a few things then based off his suggestion, we ordered a different roll. Nice one too!  The Food Runner, I found myself helping him out. Like when we delivered the edamame, rather than attempting to place it in the middle of the table, he placed it off to my side, because there were a few things in the way. In my experience, yes I have worked in restaurants, when that happens, you set the dish down, make room, then place the dish in the center. However, that was his kind of thing, literally, just bring the food out. Didn't add to the experience, was just there. Oh but wait! The food! Yes, we did eat here. The sushi wasn't bad. For being our first time, and we only ordered 4 out of the tons of options! Again, I've had my share of sushi and the staple of a roll is the consistency of the rice. It has to be sticky. It has to hold it all together with the help of the seaweed. Well, flavor wise, the rolls were good. Like seriously. The rice was just meh. It wasn't terribly sticky. Some parts were a little brittle & dry. No, not the worst thing, just not the best. Now here's the AWESOME part. The have all you can sushi for $20! Yup! $20!! I can do and be experiencing this little feature for sure! Of course I'll be trying more sushi options for sure! Plus, what other way can you experience a spot with an all you can option??? It's on!

Oyshi means "delicious" in Japanese and this restaurant doesn't disappoint. For local Las Vegans, this is the spot to go for delicious sushi!  Locals drive from the North (about 30-40 minutes away) just to eat here.  Sushi is fresh and tasty. Get the Nuclear Bomb and the Heart Attack! Even the dessert is good. Get the creme brulee!  If you go for dinner, make sure to choose all you can eat, otherwise you'll be paying buckos! All You Eat menu is anything except sashimi. As of this writing, $26 for All you can eat dinner, $21 for lunch. It will be worth your money.  Waitstaff is casual and easygoing. They play EDM music in the background which keeps the atmosphere upbeat and fun.   Only reason not a 5 star is because there usually is a wait. Everytime we've gone, we have had to wait 20-30 minutes for a table.   But it's always been worth the wait!  4 stars for us!

We went here for my sons bday celebration.  It was 6:30 on a Sunday night and it was fairly busy but not terrible. We got sat right away.  And then we waited...and waited...and waited.  We finally got waters and placed our first order of the all you can eat menu.  We waited some more.....and waited.  We finally had to ask where our food was and when the hot food came out it was cold so we sent it back and waited some more.  We were not the only table this was happening to.  There seemed to be plenty of servers and bussers and everyone looked busy but there wasn't a whole lot going on.  The servers and the manager made sure to not make eye contact with anyone but glanced toward the back of the restaurant contantly.  $27.00 isn't bad for all you can eat except when you can't get the food you ordered. We will not be back here anytime soon if at all.

It all depends on the wait staff, twice before a male with glasses polite & accurate today girl terrible couldn't get me a salad with dressing on the side. 3 tries too hard for het! Order incorrect too wait for check could only make it to my table when my phone was ringing. Didn't understand how to wait for me all about her

Oh boy I wish I could give negative stars!!!!!!!!!!!! This place let me down because of lazy front girls!!! I was one of two groups that left after being told there would be a 10 to 15 minute wait...all the while watching people leave and observing two empty tables. The waiting area starts to get packed in and this girl is flipping her pen with a dumbfounded look on her face just staring at the crowd of 17 in the waiting area. Yes I counted lol...that is when I talked to the manager, told her what was going on...told her I love this place, I come here all the time...BUT I WILL NO LONGER BE RETURNING. At which point I took my family and left. Good bye OYSHI!!! I do realize there is a rotation to be fair to the servers but that should not matter when the place is busy. But I am pretty sure I may get an excuse as a rsponse. All my family and friends come here because of my recommendation...I will be sure to have them avoid OYSHI.

AYCE dinner at $27. The sushi roll menu is extensive but I didn't even look at that section closely. Our strategy is always to get the nigiri sushi/appetizers/items that are limited - totally worth it then. What I like most about this place is that the fish is fresh. We ordered A LOT of salmon. I would skip the poke - it's mostly seaweed salad. Another highlight is that you can order sizzling plates of rib eye and other meats which were nicely portioned and tasty. Also got the medium house sake for only ~$12 which actually tasted fine and you get a good amount of shots when you're sharing it btw 2 people.   Our server was funny and quick with everything. He checked on us multiple times. This location is bigger than the one on Rainbow and we didn't have to wait for a table when we came in at 9 pm on a Saturday. There were plenty of open tables as well.

I've been here a total of 3 times for the dinner AYCE. 1st time:  pretty decent, will come again 2nd time:  hmmm...not as good as I had remembered it 3rd time:  nah, won't be coming back for AYCE, but for a la carte item.  There were a few items that my friend and I ordered that did not taste right.  The raw oysters were strangely bitter.  We let the kind manager/owner know about this and he apologized and took the plate away immediately.  The uni that came out had an off yellowish-brownish color.  I've had plenty of uni to know how it supposed to look, but this was slightly different.   The star of the night was the agedashi tofu.  Yum yum yum.  Was quite tasty.  Another highlight of this AYCE meal is the fact that you can still chose a scoop of icecream along with whatever dessert you want.  I chose the green tea icecream and the creme brulee.  Was yummy.  The chefs, staff, manager/owner are all super friendly and the service is quick.  Food however...aight.

I love all of the locations but everyone is super nice in this one! Server kept on checking on us to see if we needed something. And sushi was outstanding ! Definitely recommend this place. And will be coming here more often.

Service was good. AYCE was worth the price, but they need to update the website, prices have increased.  Most everything was great, the one thing that was not perfect they acknowledged and asked if I wanted another one and they would let the chef know.    Kids AYCE is way overpriced.  Get there early on a weekend dinner, it gets busy and service gets slower.  Lots of staff to make sure your food gets out fast and freshly prepared.

We are in town for a conference and was recommended this place.  It was PHENOMENAL!! There is a generous selection of sushi to choose from.  We have been to a lot of sushi places and this is by far the best for the price especially for the all you can eat option.  This place left us with such an impression we came back the next day!

This place has easily become my favorite AYCE sushi joint after Luisa P. invited me to come for her brother's birthday dinner here. I had a bad experience here in 2011 so this was their second chance. Boy have they been delivering! We had one of the VIP rooms all to ourselves for his birthday because we were part of such a huge party. They did a great job of accommodating our big group and even brought in more tables as well as chairs so that we could all be included.  Be prepared to wait! If you plan on bringing a large group, have someone.. or a few someones come early so that you can put your name on the list. Just make sure the majority of your party is there to be seated. I want to say that all 3x I have came (during dinner time), the wait has been about 20 mins - 35 mins.  I love doing AYCE because as long as you eat about 3 rolls, you're getting your money's worth. Plus, it is fun to share delicious food! Make sure you're only sharing with those in your group that are getting AYCE or else they will get charged the AYCE price as well. They have an extensive rules/information outline on their menu.  I think that the service here is really great for them being busy ALL of the time. They were always coming back to check up on us and asked if we wanted to put in more orders. Our tables were never cluttered because different people would swing by and grab our empty plates, plus everyone was more than helpful when we needed anything.  My go-to rolls: MONSTER ROLL: ORDER IT, JUST ORDER IT! Pink Lady Roll. Spider Roll. Dragon Roll. Japanese Lasagna Roll. I need to try even more of their specialty rolls, I am guilt of sticking to my favorites! For appetizers, order the baked green mussels, they're amazing here. Only a few sushi joints can get it right, trust me.  If you know me, then you know that I LOVE white tuna nigiri/sushi. The first time I had it here, it was amazing. The second time was decent. Haha, hopefully it just keeps getting better because I order a lot of those wherever I go for sushi.   For dessert, order the Green Tea Tiramisu with vanilla ice cream on the side. Your mouth will thank me, lol.  I will definitely be back!

The best all you can eat Sushi! Customer service is excellent and the food just kept coming! Their Salmon and Ahi were fresh, and all of the rolls we ordered were just delicious! We had a 20 minute wait because it was a Saturday night (expected), but well worth the wait!

Went here for my birthday and was excited to try a new all you can eat sushi place. The rolls were delicious, the tempura was some of the best we have had. The only critique I would give is they charge too much for kids under 12. It's $27 per adult and $20 for children 12 and under. I will say the food is worth it and the ambiance is worth it. Our server, Ryan did a fantastic job so we did not hurt with full bellies!

Solid 4 stars would be appropriate if everything was like usual; least that's what I'd presume taking everyone else's rating. Unfortunately, today wasn't like any other day. It was a very special day. When we walked in, four chefs and three waitress welcomed us. We ordered a beer, two miso soup, one ahi salad, one tempura, one pork belly, one mussel, six orders of sushi, and one roll. Yes we must have ordered a lot because it took them twenty minutes to come back to the table to check on us another twenty minutes to take the second order, another twenty minutes to tell us that our order will come out in no time. ..... we gave up on waiting and asked for the check. Waitress was still nice and polite but the speed of food was no where close to four stars... more like one star. .. nice waitress made it two stars.... manager was on duty, calling and talking with someone important. I'm sure they wouldn't want me back there because I ordered a lot, but I'd never recommend this place regardless....

I went in recently for a birthday party for a work friend and loved all of the food! We were in a small room so it was hard to accommodate all of the birthday party guests. There were a lot of orders forgotten but with one server on our large party it was to be expected. The food was amazing though! If you are going in with a small party I highly recommend it, but there really isn't much space to have a big party. Other than the space issue everything was wonderful.
AYCE dinner for $26, best price! Fresh fish, which is rare in a desert environment; good portions, lots to go around the table. Smooth sake. Friendly, quick service. All around good eats!
I love the atmosphere and the friendliness of the restaurant.  Also, the promptness and service is top notched.  This sushi ayce is by far the best in Vegas.

The decor and atmosphere was nice, but there wasn't enough lighting to see the menu clearly. I was surprised that although their menu selection had a vast array, their portion is very tiny as if feeding children. Service was fair, but the overall impression for me was the size of the sushi. I was very surprised that it was only 1/3 the size of what I normally order here in Hawaii. You're eating in Vegas therefore, you'd expect their size to be at least normal, but that's what you get when they want to be cinchy, frugal, or should I say tight . Now I wonder if their fish was actually fresh or previously frozen!

FLY IN SOY   What is the first thing you do before the sushi gets to your table? You pour soy on that little plate, but the last thing you expect is a dead fly to come out of there!   Now the fly is not the big problem, the problem was the waitress, instead of apologizing for the mishap she immediately started making excuses of how the fly's get into the restaurant ... I had to interrupt her by telling her to just change the set up.   When the bill came, no attempt to apologize for that nasty surprise was made nether verbally or physically on the bill.   Their food is decent but not great, I will never go there again nor tell others to go... too bad because its in my neighborhood .
This place was amazing. The service was great - super fast. And the Sushi! So good. The All You Can Eat is totally worth it.

Hello everybody, this sushi joint was off the hook, literally. The food is amazing, the service there is nothing like it anywhere else in town. Chef Daniel and Pedro are terrific sushi rollers and they provide great entertainment if you sit at the sushi bar. Our server was Kenny who never let us down with our drinks and ginger. Thank you again guys for the amazing food and great time.
Service is Slow, I think they have 1 menu for the entire place...Sushi was mediocre at best

I love Oyshi! It's the best AYCE sushi spot I've ever been to! Love the food, love the service, love everything! I came with a party of 9, and our server was so attentive and accommodating that he came by our table a number of times to make sure if everything was ok or if we needed more food; even the host came by to check up on us, now that's good service.   Not only that but the food came out extra fast, usually at the AYCE sushi spots that I go to in the LA/OC area the food kinda lags, maybe because they want you to get full and not order more? Just an assumption :P  All the items that came out were good quality food:   - Oysters (limit one order (4 pieces) per person during dinner only) - Appetizers - Sushi - Hand Rolls - Speciality Rolls - Dessert (limit one per person)  And the selection is pretty extensive! And if you're a roll person, then you're in luck because the rolls are pretty small so that means you get to have more variety by ordering other different rolls.

Great place to go for AYCE sushi. Friendly sushi chefs and pretty nice ambiance. Luckily as I went to the wrong door first a gentleman who happened to be a regular helped me out and sure enough ended up sitting next to my date and I at the bar so I instantly became friends with the manager and staff. I suppose I could credit all the special attention and custom rolls to his presence but then again maybe that's just how they do things here.   Had a great experience and would come back again. Decent price, delicious rolls, friendly service.

Alright, I'm not an expert on AYCE sushi joints but I do feel like I can hold my own when it comes to sushi. The problem with AYCE spots is I often feel the cut and quality of the fish is usually subpar and or drenched in sauces. Or just beefed up versions of shrimp tempura rolls.   Unfortunately this place was just that. Two stars for subpar sushi. I do think they deserve an additional star for the amount of appetites they offer as part of the AYCE deal. It's fair pricing if you can house some sushi but if you're not someone with a hug appetite I think the cost is a bit overpriced for the quality of fish.
great ayce, they offer teriyaki steaks and dessert. Lunch is about 5 dollars cheaper

Typically pick up food here! Good menu options! Being from the east coast, I'm not very used to the chopped California rolls but theirs is pretty good! They are quick and accommodating! Definitely recommend it! The inside is very nice!
Sushi was pretty terrible. Service was fine but way too slow... Not a place I would recommend or go back too.
The food maybe good but the servers are rude. I wanted to sit at the end of bar and they had seats open, but Vince the server had a problem with me sitting there. Place stinks.

Oyshi has great food and I would highly recommend it if you are in the area and want AYCE sushi. The prices aren't bad and the menu has a variety of rolls and appetizers.  If you come on a Saturday like I did I would say expect a wait. This place gets busy  quick which is no surprise as it probably is one of the best AYCE places on that side of town.  After getting some delicious rolls you should try the green tea crème brûlée to end your meal!

This is my favorite sushi place and the only place I go.  We went in for lunch right when they opened at 1130.  We have never had a bad experience.  The sushi is delicious but this visit the counter was filthy.  They soy sauce was stuck to the counter and messy and you could see the glass rings and food from people who had eaten previously.  The restrooms were so gross.  They looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a few weeks.  It's the first time I've ever been nervous eating my meal.  Cleanliness and sanitation is the utmost importance in restaurants especially sushi ones.  I hope if we come back that these issues are rectified.
Shoutout to Chef Ed!   The sushi rolls and sashimi were delicious and Chef Ed had a really cool vibe

I actually like this place a lot.   Pros: they have a really large selection of specialty rolls and their menu in general is diverse. The restaurant is new and large and can accommodate large parties easily. They have all you can eat at a reasonable price.    Cons: some of the quality of the fish is questionable sometimes. Ive been here a few times and sometimes I can taste that the fish is not the freshest or the best quality.   Overall, this place is not bad. Ive been here about 5 times since this location opened and before that I would go to the one on Rainbow but the wait was just so long at that one so Im glad this one opened.

Oyshi is a block from my house so I eat here twice a week minimum .  It's an above average all you can eat sushi spot . Like all ayce sushi places in town they load on the sauces and mayo etc... I like most of the appetizers including the grilled ribeye and seaweed salad which is hard to mess up . At times they are very busy which leads to extended waits for ordered items . Not too much to complain about though . Green tea tornados is really good !

We visited the place last night. The restaurant is nice and spacious and the host greeted us well when we walked in. I was immediately disappointed though when I was told hamachi isn't part of the AYCE. Other places offer them with limit one per customer. The waiter was okay, not too friendly. He asked for our drinks and gave us time to think about our first order. We didn't get our own plates though until we asked for it after appetizers. I would think that should be automatic along with the ginger and wasabi on a japanese restaurant.

first time here & loved it!! probably one of the best all-you-can-eat sushi places I have ever ate! the only down side is its a bit pricey!! 21 for lunch & 26 for dinner. but you get what you pay for! everything is made & comes out fresh once you order it!  -miso soup delicious! wasnt salty at all! :)  -eel/avocado roll not a big fish person...but i have to admit was good! the eel overpowered the avocado for sure.  -salmon with rice  i dont eat raw fish or anything..but i had half of one piece and it wasnt bad at all!! it looked and tasted fresh! im sure all you salmon lovers would enjoy this very much.  -love affair shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster with crunch flakes & masago!! this was my favorite roll of the night! I finished the majority of the plate!!   -crunch scallop yummy!! taste had a sweetness to it and this was my second fav of the night.  -beef asparagus delicious!! loved this and i would have eaten more if i wasnt so stuffed!! one of my favorites. simple but great!  -rib eye steak teriyaki steak was tender!  -asian skirt steak steak was tender and could taste the ginger like crazy in this dish! in fact, you can taste all the ingredients they used to make this dish, but the ginger enhances a bit.  -agedashi tofu lightly fried soft tofu in green onion soy sauce! really light and it was phenomenol. I dont think you can ever ruin this dish.  -green tiramisu sucked!!! never order this.  my auntie & uncle said their creme brulee, parfait is great! their rattlesnake roll is highly recommended!

I cannot believe the amount of selection that you get from this place. 78 rolls and tons of choices for sushi, plus its not like other all you can eat places where the rolls are California Roll based; I counted only 4 that are out of the 78. They also have daily specials that's included in the all you can eat menu adding in oyster and sweet shrimp to the dinner menu.  The quality is higher than some places I know in California and this place is located in the middle of a desert. I always make it a priority to visit this place at least once when I'm in Vegas.

Pretty good atmosphere...but, service kinda sucked cuz they were SUPER busy.  Even though we did AYCE it was hard to order anything because the waitresses were never available. Like we had to flag them down for everything: water, more sake, more sushi.  Other than the service the 4 stars is for the sushi. Always heard bout this spot from other Vegas locals and it didn't fail one bit.  Oysters were yum. Hamachi was on point. And everything we ordered was pretty much scarfed down like we never ate in days.
Passable sushi and AYCE experience...a bit too pricy though.  Do Sakana or Hikari if you want better price.  Food was mediocre at best.

This place is absolutely phenomenal! When I say that I am a regular....I mean a regular! I try to go at least 1 time a week, if not twice! Its impeccable! The service from right when you walk in to when you leave is one of a kind. I've lived in Vegas for 2 years now and its still my number 1! They have AMAZING Cajun albacore! I always suggest to order that! Another thing, they are open LATE! That's pretty convenient when you are talking sushi----most times you crave it and its around 9pm, no sweat, this place is open till 1am!   I laugh when I see the dang music review on here....this place is HITTING and slapping with great music! I promise you all that!

Shame! Shame! Shame on me!   I have been here at least 4 times & have not given them some love!  Well, let me say... Oyshi is my new fav sushi place! Grrreeeattt Sushi at great prices... What can I say? I mean everything here is fabulous... I am a big raw eater - so, that is where I spend my calories & it is FRESH!  To agree with others, Yes, it is $26 for all you can eat!  However, there are also some great sides... they have these lil potato croquettes... sooo yummy... also, they have some steak wrapped asparagus :)  It is so hard to name all of the yummy eats they have there... this is def my place...  I do not mind the drive from Henderson, takes me 15 - 20min & I am in sushi heaven :)  Yes, you must go there! Go there and enjoy! You will not be sorry...  one thing though, since it has become popular a reservation is recommended on the weekends...  LOVE the Iris roll!  happy eating!  your constant companion,  ~deirdra
Ate here for my sons 15 birthday. I am not a fan of sushi. However, this place has a large variety of cooked sushi. My 10 year old also agreed that the food was delicious.
Really nice and fancy atmosphere inside. Foods are so fresh and good.  But the place is too big so servers seem hard to take care of all customers when it gets busy.

I have been here about 10 times, everytime except my last visit has been 5 stars ayce sushi with 3 star service.  The lasttime I went may be my last though.  When in the bathroom I saw a server use the toilet and NOT WASH HIS HANDS, I was beyond disgusted and just flat out left...  GROSS.  Sucks cause this was always my go to sushi spot in Vegas!  Just thought others should know what I saw.

I enjoy Oyshi! Their appetizers are the stars of their all you can eat menu. Sizzling plates are where it's at! Surf and turf has the best flavors. My husband always gets the gyoza. Their sushi is fine. There's only a few rolls to "call home about". I do enjoy their nigri! Very fresh and tasty. This is definitely a spot to check out.

This place has some specialty rolls that are way more unique than most sushi joints. Other places would get repetitive and would lack originality to they're recipe kinda makes me feel like a similar franchise concept such as McDonald's. definitely not this place though. You can go to this place and pretty much order anything and it will be good.
The costumer service always seems a tad up-tight; they never like to make conversation. Other than that, the food is Wonderful!
Excellent service we had Mono and Sia- all you can eat loved the skirt steak sizzling plate.

Updated 3/20/18 Once again Oyshi remains my number one AYCE sushi restaurant. Fresh, fast, fun and open late! They have buy one get one free Saki Monday's and Tuesday's.    Oyshi sushi is our favorite place to come!! We drive from Henderson just to hang at the bar with our favorite sushi chef Ed! Martin y Ricardo also mucho divertido! He's a lot of fun, as is the rest of the sushi chefs. They also play good hip hop music and will make custom rolls if you ask nicely!

This is a very reasonablely priced sushi place. It is small and cozy so it's great for a party of 2-4. The taste is above average, and well worth the price.   Take out is always available. I would recommend to anyone looking for fast sushi

Excellent service as well as fresh high quality fish. I've read some reviews where people say the service was horrible and it took over 30 minutes to receive their food. Here's an idea... Enjoy the company and talk with the people around you instead of staring at your watch. I did not experience bad service. Everyone asked if we needed anything often enough to keep our glasses filled and our stomachs full.   Now on to the amazing food! We had the ahi poke. Super fresh fish and delicious flavor. Ordered some hand rolls, yum yum and dragon. Once again the unagi and scallops were fresh and delicious. I have to say though that things only got better with the last two rolls. The double screaming roll and the Hawaiian roll made the meal! I used to be a huge sushi mon and wasabi fan but i think i found my new favorite. I was so impressed by the quality of food and the flavor I can't wait to go back.

I've been going to Oyshi Sushi's Rainbow location for many years (it was my favorite sushi staple), and was delighted when it's sister Sahara location opened since it was much closer to where I live.    Oyshi consistently delivers fresh tasty quality sushi to its customers.  The deep variety of choices on their menu provides both cooked and raw choices for a varied crowd of people to be able to come together and share a Japanese style menu even though some guests don't indulge in eating raw seafood.  Their traditional sushi is so skillfully prepared that their yellow tail at times seems to just melt in your mouth.  They have so many varieties of rolls that a first time visitor could spend quite a while choosing from their assortment.  After years of coming here I can recommend some of my favorites.  The Rainbow Roll is a traditional California roll topped with a variety of seafood (tuna, salmon, yellow tail) in a mouth watering colorful display.  For a spicy roll, I enjoy the Red Rock.  It's a roll filled with spicy chopped salmon, served with a spicy mayo type topping. It's not the I have to drink water type of heat, but it has just enough heat not to blow out you taste buds.  If you're a soft shell crab lover, I highly recommend the Spider Roll.  The Spider roll contains fried soft shell crab parts layered in a crab mixture, placed in a roll.  It's slightly warm, extremely tasty, and the crunch from the soft shelled crab provides a delicious mild crunch to a roll that you just cant get enough of.  The all you can eat selection also includes tempura selections as well as rib eye steak served sliced in smaller pieces, with onions on a sizzl'n hot metal based plate. If you are still able to handle dessert, they offer a sunday or moche with the all you can eat option.  Beer, Cocktails, assorted beverages and hot tea (at additional prices) are available.  Their all you can eat lunch price is slightly lower than their dinner price, so you can expect to pay approximately 25 per person for lunch and 30 per person for dinner. Of course you could purchase off the menu for lighter appetites.

We always go eat sushi here on dinner time and they always serve good but this time we Went on happy hour 3 pm to 5pm and they serve food really low quality. You can barely see fish on it. I order dragon roll and eel on top was so tiny and cucumber salad looks nasty n messy . All the sushi we order came with big chunk of rice. I guess they serve happy hrs like that coz it's 20% off from regular price. And other things i notice is once you put 2nd round sushi order they alway put more rice and less fish. Disappointed

I used to hate sushi but this place turned me into a sushi lover. Absolutely incredible food. Quality is impeccable, service is always great, there's usually a decent wait but it's because this place is incredible!! I refuse to get sushi anywhere but Oyshi! I've told all of my friends about it and they're all huge fans. Any one who's eaten here can attest to how fantastic this place is!! I wish I could remember our waiter/waitresses names but they're all awesome! Must try!!

One of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas. The food was great! I love the fact that you can get so many options at this restaurant for the all you can eat. The had a great selection of appetizers like rib eye steak, agedashi tofu, shrimp tempura, etc. all of which I thoroughly enjoyed.   The nigiri sushi was just the right size. I appreciated the smaller rice portions which allowed me to order a variety of things without getting too full too fast.   The service is a bit slow, that's the only reason I gave it a 4 and not a 5.

Well I have raved about this place before but today I was sooooo disappointed  the food as always was great so keep it up chefs but as for the waitress we had well that's heads a totally different direction...  The place is always made by the environment around and today we definitely did not feel welcomed   The hostess is greeted us and showed us to the table with a smile but that is where the courtesy ended...  We waited 15min to get asked for drinks, another 15 to order then even thought we were doing AYCE we waited 35 min to be able to add to our order at this point we felt ignored considering there were only 6 other tables occupied around us. We decided to cut it short and just go straight to dessert, we figured some ice cream could make us feel better, but upon ordering our desserts my hubby was given a creme brûlée when he told our waitress he wanted the berry parfait, it would have been fine had she just apologized when we brought it up to her but she says I pointed to the brûlée, ??? Well being that he ordered his own dessert we just looked away...at this point upset and confused we just paid our bill and left.... Sorry but no matter how great your food taste a staff with bad attitudes definitely brings your score down...  Sorry to say we won't be visiting this location anymore... Our best advice, perhaps order to go if you wanna try them out!

Oyshi has an amazing menu, top notch service, with a clean, and contemporary setting! We have been multiple times for lunch, and dinner with consistently great food! We will continue to make this a biweekly tradition!

By far the best sushi on the SW/West side of town. Thankfully I don't live to far so I frequent often. But if I didn't this place would be worth the drive. You can't beat the AYCE. I hate when you go to an AYCE sushi restaurant and almost every roll tastes the same. If that's your thing don't come here because everything you try will be different, fresh and so good!

Came here tonight just to try it out.. not worth all you can eat sushi joint. I don't even know if you can call it Japanese food, not the authentic one. Sadly the food is not good! We wasted $90 for food that we couldn't eat. If you know sushi well this is not the place for you. Very disappointed. We will never come back.  And to answer to your question. Yes, we did try a bunch of appetizers and my review will still be the same. From the sauces, to deep fried stuff, very disappointing. Sorry to say this but there's much better sushi joints out there.
Really great sushi! Very nice place & the people are great. It has become my new favorite place. Try the bonsai roll.

Second time there and both times food was great, love the environment but service is lacking big time. I thought the first time maybe just short handed on help. Nope, same bad service again. If the waiter would slow down a little and pay attention to customers, I'm positive he would get better tips.

A little more pricey than most other sushi bars, but the music and atmosphere is great! One of the more trendier sushi spots on the SW. Happy hour specials on fri and sat from 12 - 2am. Good spot to take a date!!

Oyshi sushi have the best sushi in this area .there is a big variety of sushi , sashimi and rolls . The restaurant looks very nice and  clean . The service is good ,too. I recommend this place to everyone . You will Not regret .

Oyshi Sushi is the place to go when you have that sushi craving! The service and staff is always so nice and attentive our server Johnny was amazing and always made sure we were satisfied. The food is always fresh and the presentation is phenomenal Chef Ed is awesome, definitely recommend!!!!!

I'm a HUGE sushi guy. So much so that spending over $150 isn't out of the question for some legitimately good fish.  I came here at the suggestion of my friend who had previously enjoyed it. The decor is very hip and showed a strong traditional Japanese aesthetic. An eclectic mix of hip hop was playing in the background.   So far so good....  Now here's where things went down hill. My friend and I ordered our rolls and appetizers. Soon after the waitress left our waiter arrived with our edamame. I politely asked her if I could get an extra pair of chopsticks. It technically wasn't an extra pair as I never received a pair but no biggie right? Wrong! The server was rude and asked me if I was sure. As if I had reason to lie. Dude, I don't have utensils, who cares if I got a pair or not, give me an extra pair.   Apparently though asking me if I was sure wasn't enough. She looked under my menu and all over my plates to see if I hadn't "misplaced" my chopsticks. This left a bad taste in my mouth. It would have been more polite, expedient and professional to simply give me an extra pair. I swear I'm not stealing your sticks lady!  Another point that rubbed me the wrong way was the fact that in the 30+ minutes we were there I only got a refill on my drink during the last 3 minutes of our stay. That kind of sucked.   The food was ok. The mussels were pretty good. The reason I'm not knocking this place down to a 2 star review is because the food wasn't horrible ans because our original server, who I can only imagine 'sensed' we weren't having the best experience, tried her best to save the night. Too little, too late. Although I do appreciate the effort. You rocked.  Doubt I'll be back. If you want good AYCE sushi go to Goyemon. If you want really, really good a la carte sushi go to Yummy Sushi Grill off or lake mead and the 95.  Final word: exiting the restaurant i couldn't help but notice their B health rating. Now B isn't bad but an A is the standard and pretty much expected of any restaurant. If I could I'd give this place a 2.5/5.

We love this place. We have gone to some other "must go" AYCE sushi and wondered why we ever strayed. The fish is extremely fresh...especially for being in a desert.The atmosphere is great. We recently had family from out of town and brought them here. They loved it.   You will never feel rushed or timed here,  which is a huge plus in my book. The only reason I don't give it five stars is that sometimes the service can get a little slow. But if you love sushi, then this is the spot.

We had a table of around 20 people, so the table was split between two waiters. We all got the AYCE dinner. Our waitress really sucked. It took an hour or so for our rolls and sashimi to come out. We've complained numerous times to her and she kept saying, "It's coming. The sushi chefs are working on it." The other half of the table with the other waiter had all of their rolls and sashimi out already.... we all ordered the same stuff! They were already on round 3 and we were still on round 1!!! Wth.   The Uni was not good... looked old and dark. Fresh uni is supposed to be light yellow/orange color but this was DARK orange/brown. It tasted as if it had been refrigerated for a long time. Overall bad service and the food was not good. The only good thing was the creme brulee and ice cream.

Everytime I come the Oyshi it is a pleasure..  Whether you want to do AYCE or Sashimi or just have a snack this a great place. There are not a ton of rolls to pick from but their menu is perfectly sized because the rolls they have...are all great. They also do not overload you with rice.  The customer service here is also top notch and what you shoud be used to in good establishments. This place does get very busy during peak hours so plan your trip wisely and enjoy.
They had me at all you can eat sushi! Anytime I come back to Vegas, this place will be a must go to for lunch or dinner.
This is a great place for AYCE sushi. Not only do they have a wide variety of rolls, I love their appetizers. The service is ok, not great, but not bad.

I love the food at Oyshi but the service is incredibly slow. & of course it makes it worse when they have a full house too. Luckily both times here I had nice waiters though and when the food FINALLY came after what felt like over 30 minutes, it was delicious. The warm sake was also really good!
Did the AYCE and it was so worth it everything tasted great I will definitely be back again ! 4 stars because they don't offer sushi happy hour

Oyshi Sushi is a smart kid with ADHD.  We went with a good sized party and reservations. Got placed in a side room. The decor is solid but nothing spectacular. The party, with the exception of one tactically frugal individual all went All You Can Eat (AYCE).  Two things: 1) The sushi was great. Fresh, well put together, largelly plated well and highly satisfactory. Nothing mind blowing, but great stuff.  2) They brought it out seemingly at random. We'd not get rolls we ordered and get other rolls instead, no explanation. The waitress was reading our requests back and she appeared to be writing them down, but the correlation between food requested and food delivered was .71 tops.  Bizarre Food Fail: Surf and Turf was ordered. Turf and Turf was delivered. Apparently the shrimp staged a daring escape.  I will return here, but largelly because it's five minutes away and my friends have low standards.

We get into Vegas Friday evening, checked in, and began our weekend off with a night of debauchery.  Food porn at Oyshi. Yessiree, four hungry men and a AYCE Japanese food? This is gonna get ugly fast, real fast. We get there and it's packed. A nice waiter greeted us and told us it might be a while. 20 minutes. Shit, thats it? His reaction made it seem like an hour or 2. Dude! We'll wait.   The restaurant is nicely designed with modern furnishings. Its set to look very relaxing like a lounge. Like Gerald S pointed out, it's not set up well if there's large groups. The good side is that it doesn't feel overcrowded.   The AYCE is probably the best and only way to go here. There are so many items to choose from and the quality was not as bad as I thought it would be. They do limit the expensive stuff like uni, amaebi, and raw oysters, but it was well worth it. The sushi was very well made and fresh. Their sushi cuts are very generous. They hardly give any rice, so it was perfect. Everything was awesome, from the salmon, tempura, ribeye, and unlimited green tea or vanilla ice cream!!!   Like hawks, we swooped down and attacked everything. Nothing was safe. We washed it all down with hot house sake ($7). For $25, I would do it over, and over, and over, and over, *deep breath*, and over again. The food came out slow, it was expected because they  had a full house. The service was simply awesome. If it's a Friday or Saturday, give them a call to make reservations. We left hurting and sat in our car like beached whales.   You may have defeated us Oyshi, but we'll be back. Back with bigger and hungrier guys. *waives fist*

If I could give this place 0 stars I would!  The worst sushi I've ever had. It was falling apart, it had no flavor and very low quality. Even the hot green tea they brought us was burnt.  Our waitress ignored us and we were only able to order from her twice. We didn't even have water to drink until the end of the meal and we had to ask for it twice from two different waiters.   I'm hate leaving bad reviews but this place seriously sucked, what a waste of money! NEVER AGAIN!
Great food, I'm very picky on sushi, and for an all you can eat place  this is pretty bomb!! You can pick any thing from sushi and appetizers and dessert
Sushi, Sake & Fun! This place is great! Fish is so 'ono  I've been here multiple times and the service is always great! Definitely come and check this place out if you haven't!

The ayce sushi doesn't taste bad, but I can't say the fish is really fresh. One of the uni we ordered smelt. Oysters tasteless and full of sands.   Very slow service. And somehow the waitress always seemed to want to be your enemy in anyway she could. It could be that she was having a bad day, but she seemed unwilling to separate that from work.   Was very disappointed after reading so many great reviews.

I'm not too sure I agree with the bad service comment people have mentioned, but then again maybe they've stepped up their game since then....But I experienced great service and the sushi was the best I have had since moving here from SoCal. Plus the price was pretty decent for all you can eat. Make reservations on weekends though as there may be a long wait.

This is my second time here and my last. I've been eating sushi for over 14 years and this is a small step above supermarket quality. To judge sushi I base it off of its simplest form, nigiri.  2 components, rice and fish. None of the fish here tastes fresh and the rice is so dry that it gives the nigiri a weird texture. It's almost as the rice is undercooked and underseasoned.    The rolls are weird and although imaganitive, unappetizing. The combinations don't go together and don't sound like they would.  Who wants mushroom and asparagus in their sushi????  Bottom line is if you want real sushi, don't come here.  If you're with a group of people and looking for a place that will have something for everyone then go ahead and make a mistake and come here.  If I ever have to come back with my friends I won't be eating.

I don't know why I ate here, I guess I was in the area and craving sushi at 11pm.  I was excited when I saw that the menu was slightly different than the Oyshi on Sahara.  Unfortunately the food wasnt.  The oysters and muscles were bland. The fish all tasted the same.   Let's put it this way...there was nothing I ate that made me even think "I want some more".  Instead I found myself trying to figure out where to hide the dry rice and fish  I couldn't stand eating.

Wide variety of food choices. Sushi was delicious and beautifully plated. Ver nice employees. FIRST TIME TRYING SOJU. Yes I got a little tipsy. I suggest the "White Peach" it's fruity and doesn't taste much like alcohol. Get a glass unless you're with a large group because it's a BIG glass 0.0 came here for lunch. Take advantage of the all you can eat. So get here with a big appetite.  They have fried veggies; yummy oysters!! And I recommend the Seaweed salad !! you'll love it ! Does not taste salty and gives the sushi that extra oomf :)

The only reason I didn't give this spot a 5... Blaring. House. And. Electronic. Music... Even on a weekday, during lunch time. I just don't get it?! I mean I can get down with some EDM, house, dub-step and whatever else they play, but it'd be nice if they can switch it up once in awhile.  On to the food. Double Screaming, Red Rock, High Roller... I mean I can keep going. So many yummy rolls. Definitely worth it to get AYCE. Just don't overdo it and look like half the people I see in there. Hunched over the table, sweating, trying to finish that last roll they regretted ordering in the first place!   Wait, that was me last time. Hahaha
Fuck this place!  I can't believe I'm actually paying to eat here. If it wasn't for my kind hearted girlfriend this place would not be getting my money. We won't be back. Played shit music too.

It was my nephew's HS Graduation and it's our first time to eat here at Oyshi Sushi. We reserved one of the party room for 17 people. The sushi and rolls were the best. It was fresh and delicious, and most important the service was quick! We will definitely return to dine here again.   FYI - Dinner all you can eat  (Sat) was $27 each. We had 3 kids (age 10 and below) and they ordered the chicken teriyaki ala carte and it was okay with the restaurant. Most All you can eat sushi restaurant won't let kids get the ala carte and instead would require to pay the full buffet price so I definitely recommend this Japanese restaurant for kids who are picky eaters

Not much time for a full review, but I visited here on the weekend after strolling the Harbourfront.  This small restaurant had intimate curtained booths and served up fresh sushi/ sashimi and a great tasting seafood Udon for a wonderful price.  I HIGHLY recommend the Sake Sashimi for those other Salmon lovers. Nothing like a slice of buttery fresh sashimi.

I went here with my Girlfriend last night, as she had wanted to revisit this place for some time, having visited herself once months ago.  I'll start off by saying I read a few reviews below and have to agree with something many have said and that is that you tend to have to wait a bit to get your orders in and then get served due to how busy the place is. My advice come early or come late ;) there open until 2 am Fridays and Saturdays.  We both got the AYCE deal; I think the bill came out to $64 for that and the two cokes. The sushi was fresh and very flavorful. The sauces were amazing. We had the simply shrimp roll (my favorite of the night), a deep fried spicy tuna roll and a few others. I tried something new for me and that was a tuna roll with scallions, which was a more fatty part of the tuna, more subtle and slightly fishier flavor that she did not enjoy, but I did. We finished off with a roll that had garlic sauce and wow that was seriously garlic flavored, so if you are not that into garlic, stay away from anything with garlic sauce. lol  The wait staff was nice, but again it was so busy they were all over the place and we tended to wait longer then I feel we or the other customers should have.  The place was ok and worth checking out if, you are in the area, but if you live across town like me it may not be worth the trip.

We aren't from Vegas so whenever we come here we always pay this place a visit since they don't have these types of AYCE sushi in Hawaii especially for that price!  Kenny was our server and he does such a good job serving us. Last year when we came to visit he was also our server and we had the same great, friendly service from him as well.   The only con I could think of was that the uni was 1 serving per person, waaaah why? I love uni! Lol anyways thanks Oyshi for your great service every time we visit!

So happy my friend brought me to this place. For an AYCE place I actually Loved everything I ordered. From uni to rib eyes n everything in between...it was delicious. Great price, food, and especially the service. Definitely will be back n this place is highly recommended!

We went with a group of 10 including 2 small kids for an early dinner at 530 on a Thursday. It was already packed. The service was very friendly but we waited over 25 minutes for our first round of AYCE. The food quality was ok but nothing to get too excited about. Prices were average. My biggest gripes were the layout- crowded floor and you have to walk through a wait station in front of the kitchen and not run into any servers to get to the restrooms...and the music. It was nightclub music- ok whatever- but it was as loud as a nightclub. The group consensus is that we probably won't go back. It wasn't a comfortable atmosphere and not worth that for the sushi.
The price was decent.  Service was great.  Sushi was the best I've had for an all you can eat place.

Honestly the only reason why it's getting two instead of one is because the inside interior and vibe is very fun. The sushi, absolutely disgusting. I don't mean to be harsh but absolutely gross. And for how much they charge for all you can eat you'd expect good sushi. The crab is fake, when we asked the waiter if it's not real crab what is it then he was stuttering and you can tell he pulled the answer out of his ass by picking random fishes that are in the fake crab. So 28$ for all you can eat and you don't even get real crab what on earth. When I got home I had the biggest stomach ache ever I had to rock myself back and forth to fall asleep because I was not feeling well at all. I am disappointed will not be back and have been spreading the word how disappointed I am.

So since we live around the block and were lazy we decided to give it another shot. Again sushi was ok nothing to brag about cooked food took forever to come! Waiter was horrible !  Won't be back for sure this time. I don't care how close this place is!!!!!

Tonight was the first time we have ever walked out of a restaurant! We walked in and there was debris on the floor. We weren't greeted or seated right away. When we were finally seated, we were given dirty menus with dripping sauce on one and both were sticky and gross to touch/look at. Menu didn't have any salmon or hamachi collar or any riceless rolls. We settled on popcorn scallops, the Iris special, a "lovers" roll, and all the nigiri on the specials board. None of which looked super appealing and not what we would normally order. There weren't very many choices. I was super skeptical bc none of the people making the food were Asian. I'm a little biased since I think Japanese should make Japanese food, Mexicans should make Mexican food, etc. All the fish was old. The rice was not fresh. The sauces were unimpressive. My hubby drew the line at the seared garlic albacore. It looked more like jerky and smelled terrible. He took one little bite and spit it out. He told the server that we were sorry but we were very unsatisfied with the quality of the food. The one good thing is that she didn't put up a fight. We left. Date night ruined. Do not go here unless you are into cooked rolls only. Even then you're better off with supermarket sushi.

I got my sushi for takeout. I ordered cucumber rolls and vegetarian futomaki. I had a bit of trouble with them falling apart but the taste was good. I was especially impressed with the futomaki, which made up for the cucumber being a bit less fresh. The staff was friendly and helpful in choosing vegetarian menu items. The wait was reasonable. It was quiet and would have been an enjoyable dine-in location, from what I experienced. I received free edamame, which was a nice touch. The price was reasonable for an a la carte menu order. I spent about $12 for twice what I needed for a meal. I will definitely return to Oyshi sushi.
The AYCE sushi is one of the best I have had. A new favorite of mine

$28 for dinner all you can eat. Ordered 2 orders (2 pieces per order) of the following: fresh scallops, super white tuna, salmon belly and unagi. Took them 45-60min to get to me. Not a lot of people to have had me wait for the small ass order I placed! Fish was chewy and rice was bland and hard/overcooked. Never again will I come here.

Understated, a bit like the restaurants that line quiet neighborhoods in Tokyo, and much like those restaurants serving homely, satisfying and affordable fare.
