The salad is obsessively fresh, the miso soup balanced, and the teriyaki hitting that sweet spot every time. If you live in the neighborhood, you can't go wrong with this place.
EJ was an amazing server! On top of everything with a positive attitude. Service was great, as well as the food!

AYCE sushi is equivalent to the happiest place on earth for me. I can't believe this was my first time here because they have so many appetizer, nigiri, and roll options. I'm seriously so impressed!   Sushi: great quality seafood. The fish to rice ratio is fair and not as generous as Sushi Neko, but the quality makes up for it. I tried the salmon, tuna, fresh scallop (A MUST), sweet shrimp, uni, oysters, and eel. Their appetizers are the best I've ever had at an AYCE sushi restaurant. I had ahi poke, shrimp tempura (crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside), and mussels. The mussels were the worse because it wasn't creamy or flavorful enough.   Desserts: AMAZING! They have more than your usual ice creams and mochi ice creams, like a variety of creme brûlées, tiramisu, etc. The green tea creme brûlée was more like a flavored whip cream in my opinion; I like mine more thick and creamy but still sweet and good nonetheless.   Service: Kenny was our server and he was fantastic. It was super busy when we came in, but he still found time to be attentive and catered to us. He made conversation, suggestions when we were hesitant and deciding on what to order, and my favorite items were from his recommendations. Thanks for not judging me when I ordered like 10 items as my first order lol.   Overall: Oyshi is on my top 5 AYCE sushi restaurants. I can't complain with great service and quality fish. I'll definitely be back!

great environment, great music (if you like techno), great food, great menu (some real good and nice signature rolls) , i took my girlfriend out there today and bill was 20.54 so prices are great, lousy service is its only downfall =/
Loved my visit tonight, Kenny was an amazing server and his customer service skills are impeccable! He definitely made my group's dinner even more enjoyable!

Love going here,  sushi is the best of all the AYCE places.  Really like how they will spice it up and add extra hot sauces when I request it.  The spicy stuff at most of the other sushi places isn't hot enough to do the trick.

For a while, my sushi squad (it's okay to laugh) were coming here weekly - yep, it's that good.   Oyshi is super clean, has a chill atmosphere and a friendly staff who are quite accomodating.   The menu is chock-full  of deliciousness - and you'll find something for everyone, even the non-adventurous. I love the nigiri here - perfect portion size. The ahi poke bowl is great, and I love that they've got it on the all you can eat menu, whereas most places will only permit one per person. We always get a ton of nigiri and a few of the skirt steaks, cuz they are a sizzling plate of yum that can't be resisted.   Chef Daniel was our absolute favorite, so you could count on us occupying a large booth in the back every Friday night. Since he has moved on, we hit this place up at least once per month - as some things have changed, which is a bummer - but it's overall still a great spot.   Room for improvement here would be the hot tea. They give you an entire pot (which is rad!) but because the tea leaves are left to steep, it's oftentimes incredibly bitter by the middle/end of the pot, which makes me sad.   You know we'll be back. Every other Friday for the rest of eternity :)

Great, fresh sushi at reasonable prices. All you can eat dinner for $26, plus free dessert to complete the meal. Only downsides to the AYCE is that 1) it doesn't include sashimi, and 2) if you don't finish everything you pay the $26 plus a charge for any remaining rolls. However, if you have one or two you that just can't handle they'll usually cut you slack. Service is decent and friendly. Overall a great hidden gem everyone should try.
This place has quality sushi at a good price and the staff is great. A hidden gem in Vegas.

I love this place. I normally get the AYCE sushi and always get my $$ worth. My favs are the Ono, Fresh scallop, Salmon and Yellowtail....heck they're all good.  Service is the bomb and i'm not sure if he's the owner or the floor manager but he's the dude in a shirt and tie, but he's a total team player. He's greeting and helping clear tables including taking orders if the waiter/waitresses are busy multi tasking. The game is always on and the atmosphere is lively and they open late. If you're craving of sushi and have a huge appetite, give them a shot.

So disappointed. Came here for the first time tonight.  The service is so sloooooow. The waitress was MIA all the time and NOT friendly at all. We would order and our food and wouldn't come to our table for so long. Don't come here before a show because you will definitely miss it.

I usually love Oyshi, but I was disappointed when I reserved the large room for a birthday dinner. While the food was amazing, it took a while for us to receive it and the service was not as good as it normally is. We had to ask for water and out check in the main room because it seemed ole our server forgot about us. I only had a group of 9. The food was amazing, but I wouldn't recommend dining in the private dining room.

Ate here for a quick bite before doing my nails next door. Ate some sushi and some seaweed salad. I have had some amazing sushi so I have yet to taste something that compares. So it was good but not something to remember. However the seaweed salad was great! They were very polite and sat us quickly because we were in a rush. Prices were good. I saw that they have all you can eat sushi. Clean environment and food service overall.
Awesome sushi! Go see Chef Ed he's awesome and make you feel at home and welcome and creates some awesome off menu sushi creations

This place used to be great but it has completely gone down the drain over the last few years. I will never come again unless the  food quality starts to improve. The rolls are 80% rice and barely any pieces of good fish. The worst part is the smell. You leave there with your hair and clothes smelling like you just hung out next to a deep fryer for an hour. They really need to fix the ventilation problem. It's too bad because it used to be a great neighborhood option

Love this place! Tried many different sushi places and no other has come close to the perfection of this place. Can be a really long wait, but well worth it. Only complaints are that club/techno music is always playing and that your clothes tends to smell like smoke. Favorite rolls are the lobster fair, atomic bomb, Kami-kaze, coco, Japanese garlic lasagna, and the Nyi roll. To go ordering is a simply easier way to go to avoid the crowds. Like to end the meal with the ever tasty berry parfait. Customer service is always friendly with a smile.

Let me just start by saying I am incredibly disappointed this used to be one of our local favorite sushi spots until tonight. We made an entire night planned around meeting here after figuring out they were open until 10:30 PM we arrived at 9:35 PM and they told us they did last call for seating and would no longer seat anyone else a full hour before they closed I am highly disappointed in our experience and will not be back simply for the fact they wasted our time and night

My husband and I, as well as my daughter and her family used to love to eat at Oyshi. I don't know if it's gone thru a recent management change or what, but we had an absolutely HORRIBLE experience last week. First, when we came into the restaurant and sat down, I noticed that the music playing was not only RAP music, but uncensored RAP. I heard the 'F' word a couple of times. When I asked the server if he could change the station he said 'It's Pandora and it's censored."  I told him I heard the 'F' word several times and he continued to argue with me. I had my two grandchildren and was horrified. Then the sushi came and it was terrible. Not sure what happened to this place but we will never go back and will tell all of our friends and family not to go there. What a shame.
This place has great fresh food, service is spotty... But if you are okay with that its a decent place to go for dinner

One of the best sushi places around. The food was delicious, and there's a wide selection of basically everything. We got Andree as our server and our group was in agreement that he actually provided one of the best service we've ever had
really good sushi restaurant for those who like to eat a lot. The sushi is fresh and really good. Its a bit pricey but worth it.

Service was good, the food was good but beware that the nigiri is alittle over filled with rice. The ratio a little big for the thin slices of fish. Other than that will be coming back for more in the future.

I love sushi and this was my first time here. All you can eat sushi? I said sign me up. I always, always try gyoza wherever I can and I wasn't disappointed here. The closest to my favorite restaurant. But unfortunately, the sushi was not as good. The spider roll was absolutely amazing but my next two rolls dynamite and catercheese left a lot to be desired. So overall good place. Nice atmosphere and attentive waitstaff. (could also order half rolls which they failed to mention right away) and decent food. I'd go again for the spider roll and gyoza
Pretty spacey sushi place. I want to say the best sushi made in third place. All you can eat is the best deal in the house.
Fresh sushi. Great setting. Highly recommend for sushi lovers.

Love coming to this place for my sushi fix.  The only complaint is the service.  Even on a slow day when there's only 4 tables filled the rest empty it takes them forever to get to you.. There's only ONE server that I actually like there.. She's fast and efficient.

Been here a few times. Service is soooooo slow here!!! They do not have enough waiters on the floor! The food is alright between 1-10, I say a 6. Again, service is sooooooo slow, that's my ONLY complaint.

I simply cannot believe in all the times I've come here I've never checked or written a review, that being said this is long overdue. We literally eat here nearly every week. Our 3 young sons have great taste & lobs family sushi night! Their Cajun albacore is fresh & has the perfect spice to it and we seriously can't get enough of it! My favorite are the Double Screaming O & Tiger rolls, but also enjoy the Love Affair, Oh My Heart & The Kamakzi! We used to always eat the Spicy Tuna Crunch but stopped only because we try to avoid eating deep fried food all together. It's worth a cheat though! Dynamite Roll is another! Quite honestly, there's not much here that we've tried that we haven't absolutely loved. The hot tea is the perfect end to your meal with the dessert options included with the AYCE! Crime brûlée (my only complaint is they keep downsizing it, it's become about 2 bite dessert...maybe it's a 100 calorie choice) the green tea tiramisu is my current favorite!! Whatever you do, get AYCE & start trying different rolls. You won't be disappointed.  And finally the chefs & wait staff...what can I say, they're phenomenal!
Incredible Sushi rolls by Chef Pedro Lozada! Best sushi I've ever had and I didn't have any raw rolls since I'm pregnant! Totally recommend this place and this chef!

I tried Oyshi on 7/6/09 on the recommendation of a friend. Everything was great! I found my server to be very friendly. She was truly a delight and she was very helpful! I had the Hot Tamale, Love Affair, and Crazy Philly rolls. All were superb especially the Love Affair. While I had more, I won't bore with a complete list.  I will come back for the all you can eat again. It was every bit as good as I was told when the place was recommended.

My first experience with sushi in Las Vegas was at the original Oyshi on Rainbow.  I decided to give this place a try tonight as it's much closer to home.  I ordered AYCE and with iced tea and tax, the cost was just under $32.  Items ordered:  Sweet shrimp Uni Agedashi tofu Miso Spanish mackerel (nigiri) Salmon belly (nigiri) Yellow tail (nigiri) Dynamite (baked in a round pan not a roll) Sibuya (deep fried 5 piece roll with no rice) Lava flow (8 piece traditional roll) Green tea tiramisu  One of the rules is you can only get one order of uni and sweet shrimp per person.  I ordered those first from the appetizer section.  I'd pass on these two items again.  The uni wasn't that great and there was nothing special about the sweet shrimp.  The miso was fairly traditional.  The three nigiri that I ordered for the second wave were just OK.      Then the best part came.  The dynamite in a pan is very good.  It's a baked crab mix with scallops, onions, mushrooms, and shrimp with a yum-yum sauce.  It's baked and topped with the sauce and sesame.  Very enjoyable.  The Sibuya is a 5 piece--no rice--deep fried roll filled with spicy tuna, salmon, cooked shrimp, and avocado topped with smelt eggs.  The topping is yum-yum and eel sauces.  This had a good spiciness to it with the spicy tuna and the deep frying gave it a good flavor.  Finally, if you like a little heat, the Lava Flow is spicy tuna and asparagus inside and topped with seared whitefish and jalapeños with added topping of Nyi sauce and flaming chili sauce.  Tasty.  For dessert, I got the green tea tiramisu--a green tea cake soaked with green tea.  A good ending.  My server was Ray and he was excellent giving me some suggestions.  Service from the sushi bar was prompt.  I was brought a new iced tea just before I finished my first glass.  With some of the spicy food, you needed a cool down.  An OK dinner.

This place is pretty great! It was about a 25 minute wait on a Friday night, so not tooooo bad. Once we were seated we were promptly attended to. The menu has a large selection, which is great but makes for difficult decisions. We will definitely be back again!

We got seated around 7 placed our order in by 7:15 and waited almost an hour and half to receive our sushi. The manager wasn't addressing the situation, other tables were also complaining about the wait time. Also the manager didn't apologize once but his employee came over to apologize.
Best sushi place in  Las Vegas!! Highly Recommend Oyshi! The service is incredible, everyone is super nice and welcoming! the food is amazing! Love it all!!

I've been going to the location on Sahara for a couple years now, but I have to be honest that the location on Rainbow IS THE BEST!!!!  Service was a amazing, food was great as always and the prices are unreal.   We recently moved to this side of town and will frequent this location often.  great job!!!!

I am SAD that I wasn't able to eat more because I went there after a night of drinking and was severely hung over. I love the prices and the fact that its all you can eat!! Tip: Remember not to leave any food or rolls left over because they make you pay for it. Also you cannot take food home so order carefully and arrive here on an empty stomach.
Just dine in with four people and they don't have oyster and uni, still charge for dinner price without those items. Very disappointed and never come back again.

Usually come here for a guaranteed good to amazing AYCE sushi experience but my most recent visit here today proved itself to be less than good let alone ok.  In short: the food and quality of it is amazing, not sub par by any means. I highly suggest their nigiri as well as their Red Dragon and Crazy Philly roll. Their ahi poke is fresh and the bed of seaweed salad it's placed in is on point.  However, the service (today at least) was below average. It's understandable if a waiter is slammed with tables, if errands for sushi bar needs to run, miscommunication with orders happen ---shit happens and waitressing is a tough job. But when you don't even bother to check your tables on the way of running food or when you're plain MIA for the duration of our longer than expected stay---It's simply no bueno. Our waiter Josh was sweet and was probably jam packed with errands but when it comes to an hr wait for the check let alone dessert orders...well hmm :/   Still love this place but maybe perhaps don't understaff?

Setting: 11:30 on a Saturday night. SW Vegas. Rumbly tummies. Not too busy sushi spot.  On a budget so I opt for a teriyaki beef bowl instead of sushi. On the go so I grab the menu and let them know it will be take out.  After approximately 1 minute and 42 seconds of looking of the menu I am ready to order. I am very decisive, a trait I value in myself. I look around for the waiter who, just a minute prior, had served my friend and me some water.   5 minutes go by. Then 10. 15. Hello?  My friend goes in search of a waiter. He says he'll be over in a moment.  Okay. He finally comes over and takes my order. It's seriously another 15 or 20 minutes for some beef teryaki to be done AND it wasn't even that good. The meat was tough and not very flavorful. I dunno if it was on purpose or not, but whoever brought us our food didn't bring the check with it. Perhaps it was a mistake on their part or perhaps they brought it over as a silent apology for the terrible service. We just walked out before they could say anything. Does that make me a terrible person? It was 45 minutes for a to go order! I wish i was decisive about leaving and going somewhere else. I know I will never decide to go there again.
Love the food , the service is good , great atmosphere, really good Japanese lasagna...
Great service and fresh sushi!!!!!!  Never fails that the freshness of the food is on point and the prices are reasonable. Family friendly. Quick service

Excellent sushi place. Food is great with a very good selection of rolls. It is an all you can eat . My favorite rolls are love affaire / dynamite roll / tiger roll / volcano.Kevin the manager is very friendly and professional. Always takes really good care of us. Try to call to book before coming because they are very busy on the week end.
one of the best AYCE sushi places...not only in vegas..but anywhere.  they don't overload you with rice on the rolls, they let the fresh fish and their creative presentations speak from themselves.

Star # 1 - All you can eat sushi!  I mean that is a star in itself  Star # 2 - $26.95 for All you can eat sushi dinner ;) Good price because I can eat that much in sushi ...EASY!  Star # 3 - I have been to other all you can sushi places in Vegas and this one has the most variety.  The side dish list is much longer than others and offers some good stuff  Star # 4 - Customer service here is great. They treat you with great courtesy and always come back to make sure you are OK.  Star # 5 - Restaurant setting.  I mean they play a little bit too much trance and should maybe mix in the some r&b, or commercial hip hop, but the ambiance is still cool.  They have modern decor, and TVs in visible areas to watch ESPN...perfect! haha!  Come here hungry and beware how much you order.   Here are some good things I like to order:  Side dishes: -Surf n Turf -Baked Mussels -Shrimp tempura -Edamame (warm and with some salt! lol) -Green Tea Ice Cream -Green Tea Mochi  Sushi rolls: -Spicy Tuna Crunch -Spider Roll

I have been going to this spot for a couple years now and the food and sushi chefs never disappoint. The last two times I have come in, the hostess has skipped my guest and I and has seated people who came in after us first. When it happen the first time I contributed it to it being busy. But when I came in Friday night, it was pretty slow. We gave our name to three different hosts that came to the podium. We even just asked to sit at the sushi bar. They needed to clean it and they would seat is is what they said. Well another couple that walked in ten min after we did came up to the podium and the girl sat them at the sushi bar first.  When we finally sat, I told the girl that this is the second time it is happen and she looked at me in disgust laughed and went back to the podium. Hungry and wanting to just hang out with my room mate, I let her finish her shift as I enjoyed yummy sushi and laughed with the chefs.

I had a horrible experience so I may have to revisit this at a later date.    We sat at the north end of the restaurant with one long table.  There was about 16-20 of us doing all you can eat.  From looking around I didn't think the decor on our end of the restaurant was complete.  The dishes were good.  I'm in love with their oyster dish.  The only problem i had was that what ever we ordered, the food went to a random spot on the table.  We were forced to share.  I have no problems sharing but let me have my cut first especially since I don't like some sushi rolls with certain ingredients in it.  Hence, that's why I don't order the whole menu.    Food is 4 stars, staff is 4 stars, service is 3 stars, price is 3 stars.  So for now, 3 stars until I revisit!

Overall everything was fine, the food was good, sushi chef Daniel was good and knowledgeable, but tell the server to shut up already.    He kept telling us that we should go to SLS's K***** and eat at his other job because the sushi and fish was so good there.  Every time he stopped by he would bring it up.  Soooo annoyinggggg.    Anyways, I did the all you can eat so I had many different types of fish while my friend ordered pork belly by recommendation of Daniel.  Everything was good and we had a little extra to take home.    I like this location a lot better than their original but lay off the annoying upsell of a different sushi establishment!  Geez.

Solid 4 stars for our first outing at Oyshi Sushi!  For a Holiday lunch in December, my family and some friends dined at the newer Oyshi Sushi on Sahara.  Our initial choice was Makino's (which isn't THAT bad) but we figure, "What the Hell?  Let's go try something new!"  Off to Oyshi it was!  On our weekend lunch the place wasn't overly busy thankfully.  Our party of 11 was seated in their more private party room towards the back of the restaurant.  Lovely décor!  Except when we looked at the HUGE mural in the party room and put it all together...it's a Japanese dude...somewhat naked!  Ha Ha Ha, but hey, at least it didn't faze us from some awesome eats.  Because we couldn't decide what to order from Oyshi's menu, the adults just ended up getting the all-you-can-eat.  And at $21 per person for lunch...it's a FRIGGIN' steal!  I mean, if you're gonna order more than one roll (which can average over $10 each easy) then this option is the way to go.  Also, if you're a sushi piggy like me it's the ONLY option!  You can guarantee each of the rolls I chose to try were in the upper price vicinity, probably around $12 per roll.    With Oyshi Sushi's all-you-can-eat menu you ALMOST get free range of the entire menu.  Most of the hot items and signature sushi rolls are available for you to order.  Only thing not on the all-you-can-eat?  Sashimi and sashimi with rice...of course.  But that's OK because there is so much to eat.  And eat we did!  I felt so bad for these folks because I just kept on ordering sushi roll after sushi roll.  With just the four folks in my family, we EASILY ordered at least 12 signature rolls!  Oinkers!  And that's not including the hot dishes we ordered of the menu!  You can see how getting the all-you-can-eat saves you a bunch of $ when you are an avid sushi eater.  I estimated our total without the all-you-can-eat option - I would have spent over $175, not including tax & tip!  Yowza!  OK, so this is just to show you some of the things we ordered off of the menu (and to show you how Fatty McGee we really are when it comes to sushi):  -Tiger Roll ($12) -Oyshi Roll ($13) -Love Affair ($13) -Dynamite Roll ($11) -Volcano ($10) -Lobster Fair ($13) -Rainbow Roll ($11) -Spider Roll ($9) -Red Dragon ($11) -Monster Roll ($14) -Premium Spider Roll ($12) -Ahi Poke ($7) -Tempura Shrimp ($7) -Yakitori Beef ($4) -Edamame ($5) -Potato Croquette ($4) -Gyoza ($5)  See what I mean??  We ordered all that (for just FOUR of us), and it doesn't include multiple orders of the same sushi roll!  Add that up right there and see the savings!  Save some money AND eat well!  How can you get any better than that!?  Quality = Good!  Sushi rolls were all made to order so they were cut fresh for us.  The fish was fresh that day, no fishy smells.  The sauces were kept on the light side which I appreciate because after a while everything starts tasting like eel sauce if you're not careful.  Sushi rolls were of a nice size as well, definitely bite size but not tiny at all in order to save them money.  Rice to fish ratio was on point and very generous.    At the end of the meal (which literally took us over TWO hours) you also get your choice of one dessert.  Only ONE you say?  Yep, and I have no problem with that.  By then you are most likely stuffed like a turkey after all that rice you've consumed.  So ending the meal with something light, like a Mochi Ice Cream, or a slice of Green Tiramisu?  No problem.  I'm already feeling bad since I think my family alone ripped you guys off!  Service for our party was great considering our party of 11 was taking up space and time.  Luckily our poor little Japanese server was up to the task of our large ordering shootout.  As a mention, parties of SIX or more are automatically charged 18% gratuity.  Boy did she earn it!  We actually tipped extra over the 18% to show how much we appreciated little her serving our entire party (seriously this dainty girl was no taller than 4 feet 11 inches).  We were eaters for sure!  Combining the other folks in our group, we easily ordered at the very least 25 sushi rolls.     Will I be back here again?  Yes, yes I will.  Oyshi!
Having lunch here with my sister and it is so yummy. Baked rolls on point, and so happy they have something besides shellfish in them. Our waiter is amazing, and he is always checking in on us.

Went here for dinner, a birthday party, and a graduation lunch and it was yummy! The waitress was nice but she did forget my drink while i sat there for 30 min thirsty while everyone had their drink! but other than that the food is DELICIOUS!!

I have to say this is the best sushi place I have ever been to and this is coming from someone that's from California! Their all you can eat appetizers are so delicious and great price! And the rolls are perfect size, amazing flavor and the service is attentive and very polite. I need one of these in California!
Omg!!! Maggots on the sushi. Health department needs to inspect this place. Restrooms is so dirty even the curtains going to hallway is so nasty stained.

Non sushi lover but loves the food here, there's so much to eat non sushi and it's delicious, I had to do the all you can eat, I couldn't get enough of their teriyaki and steak. It's a nice yet fancy feel on the inside. I will be coming again and again when I have a craving for some oriental cuisine.

Oyshi is my favorite spot for sushi in Vegas.  They are open until 2:00am to satisfy those late night sushi cravings.  They have two VIP/ private rooms for parties.  We always do the all you can eat. There are a lot of appetizer options that are included in the all you can eat.  Just be aware that they WILL charge you if you over order and have a lot leftover. So pace yourself! Each roll has a description including they ingredients used. So it is easy to avoid rolls with certain items you may not like.

IN THEIR DEFENSE, it is Christmas Eve. That is my only disclaimer. The service we received was horrendous and there is nobody to blame except the owner because evidently she was also our server. I understand it is a busy holiday evening. However, we called prior to arriving and asked if they were  busy amd whether we needed to make a reservation. We were assured that they were not busy and we could just walk in. Once we arrived, we were informed that they were tremendously busy and we must wait at the bar. We proceeded to sit next to a minor and her father at the bar (which specifically states nobody under 21 is allowed.) Thereafter, once we were seated and orders placed, we were ignored- plates never cleared (AYCE) and water not filled, despite us asking. The mere reason for giving 3 STARS is due to the Sushi Counter chef, Pedro, whom made an otherwise disappointing experience tolerable.  We will contunue to visit the Rainbow location. Merry Christmas.

Lets see All you can eat appetizers:  Might just go back to Vegas just for this: $21 dollars a person.  The appetizers comeout pretty fast.  The sushi is slower.   List of normal stuff we got, Spider Roll, Rainbow Roll, Tempura, Chicken Yakitori, and Edamame.  They have a good list of Baked Sushi too.   You can't get Sashimi but I got something just as good.  Ahi Poke.    The Sushi is made to order.  We we're full and it was really worth it.  You do have to finish most of your rice with the Sushi.      And to top it off 1 dessert.   We are definitely going to make this the go to place whenever we are in Vegas.

You know how there's good imitation crab meat and then there's bad imitation crab meat? Oyshi serves the latter. It was very disappointing.   I suggest sticking to the nigiri rolls, or the traditional sushi rolls. None of that spicy tuna stuff, or anything with cheese in it. Traditional is the way to go. We ordered two rolls that were non-traditional, and we found that to be a very bad idea. On the other hand, tuna and salmon were not fresh the day we went (salmon was more fresh, but still...). It worried me.   My favorite thing on the menu that night were the ama ebi (sweet raw shrimp). They were probably one of the freshest items on the menu. For this alone, they get another star because it was unique. I've never had this before at another restaurant.  Why did no one listen to me when I suggested Kyara for Japanese tapas instead?
Slow service. Food is subpar nowhere near top quality sushi. Wouldn't go back.  Sumo sushi 2 waaaaaaay better

My family and I went here for lunch today.  We all chose the AYCE option.  It was $21 for lunch and included almost everything on the menu (no sashimi).  My husband ate 8 rolls!  The food was fresh and came out at a nice pace - which gave us more time to relax and talk with each other.  We were not rushed and there was no time limit, like there are at AYCE places.  I don't eat fish - or seaweed - and was surprised that there were so many choices for me to do the AYCE as well - terriyaki chicken, gyoza, egg rolls, miso soup, salads, vegetarian rolls (with soy wraps), and beef plates.  I highly recommend the Grilled Beef Asparagus - thinly sliced beef wrapped around an asparagus spear and grilled with a light, sweet sauce on top.  Each AYCE lunch comes with 1 dessert - I had the chocolate creme brulee - absolutely fantastic!  Service was good.  Vangie, our waitress, worked at our pace.  She gave us time to look over the menu in full, made some very tasty suggestions, and was able to answer all our questions about ingredients and what was included.  Any time we accidentally veered off the included choices, Vangie let us know and suggested a similar item from the included choices.  She was very patient with us and really kept the food coming out while giving us our space.  If you go - ask for her.  I read some reviews where the server just didn't come back after awhile, not Vangie!  As she saw our plates emptying, she returned to ask if we wanted more, clear off used dishes, and refill beverages.  Oyshi is definately going onto our list of places to return - often and soon!

If you work late or decide to crave sushi last minute, I highly suggest you DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION. The Sahara location has a tendency to close over an hour before their closing time. This has happened to me on 3/3 occasions when I've arrived there around 9:45pm (even though their closing time is 11pm on weekdays). I'll walk in, then they'll tell me they're already cleaning so we can't eat there. Just avoid this hassle and go straight to the Rainbow location. The food there is the same and the staff at the Rainbow location is excellent!!

I'm so glad this location is open! I love Oyshi and this one is so much better than the one on rainbow! The service alone makes it a million times better. Best AYCE menu by far! Lots of options for the non sushi eaters as well (aka my boyfriend) it's still new so it's pretty slow but it's better than be neglected by servers at the one on rainbow!

Sweet! 2hr time limit for AYCE..  Too bad you'd probably need all 2 hrs of it as service here is inadequate.    The restaurant was pretty much empty with maybe 5-6 other tables with about 5 or 6 front-of-the-house staff and 2 sushi chef.  The FOH would much rather have their backs toward us and mingle amongst themselves than to help the hungry (me). Kind of funny as It felt we were sat at the table with no server or porter assigned to it.  I ordered miso soup 3 times before it finally came out.  Our water and drinks were never refilled.  Sushi took too long and they just mediocre.  It was just one thing after another making it a very unpleasant dining experience.    Only thing i have positive to say about this place is that eel sauce is extra sweet without the heaviness and they offer dessert you normally wont see at other AYCE: green tea tiramasu and creme brulee.   My friends and I just finished eating sushi here since one of them recently reside in the area and he'd mention that we should have gone to Koji sushi just down the street instead.  I'd never been there, but i couldn't agree more.

Dawn C. and I decided to try a new place today for our sushi lunch, and decided on Oyshi based on the Yelp reviews and the fact that it was close enough to my work for me to get there eat and get back in around an hour.   Oh, am I ever glad we decided to try a new place today! Oyshi is great, $21 AYCE lunch with a huge selection to choose from. We sat at the bar and had almost impeccable service. We did to request plates (they did not bring them out with the wasabi) but everyone that helped us was so pleasant and upbeat, and our drinks were refilled without us ever having to flag someone down. Our check was also brought out before we requested it, which I always appreciate when I am on my lunch break.   We started out with some edamame, which is serves warm with a sprinkling of salt. We also tried the beef wrapped asparagus because a reviewer recommended it. It was ok, but I was there to eat fish not beef... so it was on to the rolls. We tried the Red Rock, a new roll called the Sexy something-or-other, Baked Philadelphia Roll and the Japanese Lasagna. All were very tasty. Some people may be turned off by the amount of sauce put on the rolls but I personally liked it. Rolls that come with sauces on top say so on the menu so if that's not your style, just ask the sushi chef to leave it off!   For desert we had the green tea tiramisu and the berry parfait. The blueberries on the parfait were still crunchy from being frozen, and the tiramisu wasn't really as good as I had hoped. But I was so stuffed from the sushi it's probably better for my figure that the deserts weren't to die for!   I will certainly be revisiting Oyshi on another lunch break in the near future.

Since Kai by my house closed, I have been trowling my neighborhood looking for a new sushi spot.  Ventured a little outside the neighborhood to come to this place, but the reviews were so good on Yelp, I had to go and see for myself.    Very friendly staff.  Always a plus.  Really bumping on a Thursday night.  It looked like a lot of 30 somethings come here for date night.  Definitely a good atmosphere. We tried to order all of the rolls that sounded spicy because that's our thing. Everything we tried was really good, just not quite spicy enough for me.  My favorite roll was the Volcano roll.  Good value for the AYCE price of $26. Will definitely return and be sure to request extra spice.  Still haven't found anything better than Sin City for AYCE.

Hadnt been to this location yet, after I stopped going to the Rainbow location for 2 years.  Well, disappointed is all i can say. Overcooked rice, hard and dry sushi fish, overly fishy taste from uni, frozen cold amaebi fried heads... the list can go on!  You want to have a cheap $27 ayce dinner? Then this is the place.    Stay away, unless you are not picky or dont care about getting sick.

We went here for dinner last night. 4 adults and 2 kids, the service was good.   For the value of what you pay, I think it was really good. We all got to try many things on the all you can eat. Everything was good. We ordered salmon and tuna sashimi off the regular menu also and it tasted fresh and really delicious.   We got dessert too, our two friends ordered the green tea tiramisu and green tea creme brûlée, they both liked it, I got the ice cream which was also good.   We would recommend it and would go again, I'm not sure why the bad reviews from others.

For sure a new favorite spot for AYCE! The fish quality was awesome!!! Great atmosphere, upbeat music playing, but not too loud. Stefan was a great server and very knowledgeable. Used to go to Goyemon, no more!

The all you can eat is legit. The menu is full of options and they don't load their sushi with rice. The staff is great. We had Andre as our server. He knows the menu inside and out, and is very friend. Ask him for his favorites, you won't be disappointed!

Sad to say, but this restaurant has gone down in service and quality over the past few years.  I dined in here with my family for my mom's birthday. My mom was craving her beloved "love affair" roll and green tea ice cream parfait so we decided to dine in here. Sadly, we found out towards the end of our meal that they didn't even have green tea ice cream. :(  Service: It could improve a lot. Our waiter made it seem like we were just another table to wait on. It seemed like he just hated his job overall, no smiles at all. We had to remind him a few times on some missing items.   We kept getting incorrect orders brought out to us and had to reject them probably twice. We either received 2x or 1/2 of our item orders. For example we only ordered 2 orders of amaebi, we received 3 orders. No big deal. Then maybe 5 min later they brought out 3 more orders of amaebi that we rejected. We ordered 5 orders of baked mussles and we only received 3 orders of baked mussles.  I'm not sure if it was a server/kitchen mistake, but we tolerated it.  We were missing two of our rolls and mentioned it to our waiter. He even admitted that our rolls might have been dropped off to the wrong table. At this point you'd think he would try prioritizing our rolls, but no he didn't. We told him we still wanted them (since we were still hungry from waiting for all of our orders still). He warned us that it might take awhile for our food to come out because the kitchen is backed up. That's not our problem that our food got dropped off to the wrong table.   We noticed none of the employees had any sense of urgency. Two tables next to us weren't bussed for an hour.   Quality of the food: Every time my family eats AYCE Sushi, we normally use a lot of wasabi and ginger. This wasn't the case. We received a watered-down wasabi and old ginger. Their nigiri isn't the freshest. My brother loves Uni and when he tried a nibble of it, he spat it out instantly. lmao. He said that the uni texture was jelly-like and tasted very fishy. Their "love affair" roll that we came for states that they use lobster. I honestly believe the "lobster" is just a bunch of crawfish tails. However, I think their meat is good though.  We had their grilled beef asparagus and surf and turf roll, and I think those were the highlights for me.   Cleanliness: When we first arrived, we were handed our plates for our wasabi and ginger. We were given two plates that were dirty that we didn't use. So I recommend checking guys' plates! The ladies' restroom needs to be cleaned and stocked. They were out of toilet paper and there were used paper rolls/napkins everywhere. Their bathroom checklist was public and I noticed they don't keep track of their bathroom checks. I'm going to assume they check it daily and forget to sign off of it, but considering their check list is open to the public eye.. it isn't a good sight to see for other dining patrons.  I'm giving them 2 stars because our past experiences from 3 years ago were all good and we didn't have any prior issues.

We were in Vegas a few months ago when a stranger told us about this place.  I remembered the name and we had time to try it out a few days ago.  We got there at about 8pm and on a weekday so it wasn't packed.  We had the best waiters though.  Service was excellent from the get go.  The people that work there are friendly and nice.  We ordered a few rolls and some appetizers to begin with.  We just took our time eating.  We weren't in a rush.  At times, we would take breaks and the waiter/waitress would check to see if we wanted to order anything.  All the rolls were fresh and tasty.  It's AYCE but they ask that you eat everything that you order.  Everything that we ordered was delicious.  We also ordered the seaweed salad and that was very nice.  The music is loud but it is also a place with a lot of energy.  I thought it was perfect.  We had a great experience and we will be back the next time we're in Vegas.

The BEST AYCE spot in town! Fish is incredibly fresh and such a great menu! Everything about this place is a plus. Even the other families and couples eating here are friendly. I think we made friends with 3 new couples in our last gisit

Love the sushi here and the menu is great, but the past two times I've dined here, the wait to get our sushi was ridiculous. We waited over an hour for our first roll to come out, and watched people around us being served long before us, even though we placed our orders in first. I honestly think it's bc they are understaffed for such a popular establishment.
Love coming to this place especially when the server Kenny is there ! Best service ever when he's there .

Just fyi Oyshi on Sahara service fucking blows. We use to come here alot...it's always been  slow..but food good... But watching people who came in after us get the same food I ordered before me. . .is not cool. Like i got something I ordered 5 minutes ago and still waiting for shit from an hour ago..update go to tell manager, gives me a card to come back and take care of everything.  We will not come back. Expensive 80 dollar dinner we didn't even get all our food before we got pissed and left! #youlostacustomer #60minutessinceiorderthesizzlingplate #Oyshi

We used to be regulars here, but after the last 3 visits, we're finding a new spot. The food has declined and the customer service is even worse. The hostess, same one every time, literally rolls her eyes whenever someone enters and when approaching the podium, she doesn't even greet you with a welcome or anything, it's simply "how many?" And that's it. Then, after numerous of times coming here with our 1 and 2 year old, today, we are charged kids price for the all you can eat, when all the times before, each server did not even charge one cent for them since all they eat is the rice and miso soup (which tastes like salt water now.) The server we had was a woman today, Asian accent, long hair, and I don't even know her name since she never introduced herself and her name wasn't on the receipt. She was cold and couldn't even put a lid on a child's water cup right, which spilled everywhere when I picked it up. The food, although some were hits, majority were misses. The house salad tasted old, the cold tofu was room temp, the California roll was loose and not tightly rolled... Basically if you're ordering anything other than white rice and their ribeye sizzling plate, don't expect much! Overall, I am disappointed that this restaurant has declined over the 2 years we've been coming here, and no wonder for dinner on a Sunday night, there was more open tables than filled... And we still had to wait 15 mins to be seated!

The lunch specials are great deals and the food is good too.  I don't come here often as it can take a little longer than the average lunch break but it is well worth it on days when I can afford the extra time.
I wish the sashimi was AYCE but it's okay. At least the sushi is.  I'd say, go straight for the raw fish sushi xD so good.  Except on busy days. Then they just serve u fat lmao

My go-to sushi place.  The rolls are everything. Nuclear bomb, Chung hua, and the tiger roll are my favorite. The AYCE menu is delicious and extensive. I've tried plenty of sushi places in Las Vegas and this one takes the cake. I would give it more stars if I could.

Finally got the chance to sample this southwestern sushi spot.  Restaurant design: very modern. Comfortable seats everywhere, very nice lounge with its own TV, huge counters at the bar. One of the largest interiors I've seen. The only weird thing is how low the armchairs in the lounge are. Luckily, we didn't have to deal with that since we didn't fill the table.  Service: consistent pacing throughout the night. Could be because we were the lounge table, but I'll take that versus sometimes being forgotten.  Picks:  Nigiri: everything was delicious through and through, even the tuna. The spicy tuna was a bit overwhelming for my sensitive palate. Smoked salmon special here is superior to Goyemon's special. Uni is the best quality other than when I tried Kaze's AYCE sashimi lunch. There were some issues with seaweed wrappers from different pieces sticking to each other though. Oysters: no real off flavors and haven't gotten sick yet, so that's a win for me Baked mussels: solid Fried calamari: fine Lasagna roll: didn't notice much difference with the inclusion of avocado, and good quality Parfait: really, really good. Fruits and crunchy granola made me really happy. Glad I made this my limit-one-dessert-that-isn't-ice-cream-scoops choice.  Passable:  Dynamite: pretty good, but the sesame threw me off. Surf n Turf sizzling plate: beef strips and shrimp on a bed of onions and cabbage. Not bad, but not great. Hot sake: average, I suppose. Best part was that it was a Mon/Tues 2-for-1 special.  Pans:  Popcorn scallop: pretty useless. Amaebi head: brain drained. I feel like they did this as a restaurant-wide strategy to appeal to a more mainstream palate (you can tell by how they let you order yum yum sauce on the side). Would've liked all off the flavors to be there. Ice cream: while the green tea was pretty good, the vanilla was not that impressive and the texture of both had noticeable ice crystals  Overall, I enjoyed the meal with a few notable exceptions. It's worth the drive if you want a change from your normal sushi spot. I'd probably come back to explore the rolls since we didn't really plumb the depths of that extensive part of the menu.

This was my first trip to Oyshi Sushi. I had heard goid things about it, and the YELP reviews were mostly positive. The restaurant is far from upscale, and to my surprise the floor was quite dirty.   The size of the restaurant is fairly big and they really pack in the customers. The customer service eas good, but not great. The fish was very good though, and the restaurant didn t smell like fish. I would visit Oyshi again, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
Food was ok. Very poor service. Took a long time just for appetizers. Rather go to the new location on west Sahara.

Great food, great price and Nice cozy place. Love that it's all you can eat but made to order. Buffet sushi never appealed to me so this restaurant was a wonderful find. Will go anytime we are in Vegas!

This place has a great all you can eat sushi menu. Everything on the menu is included in the price except for sashimi. I've tried almost everything on the menu and i loved it. Even the hot item menus were delicious! One of my favorites since it's real close to my house. Make sure you either go early or later since dinner time can have a wait around 7ish.
We come here often for all our friends birthdays and other special occasions. All you can eat, what's not to love. Service is outstanding. I have nothing to complain about.

This is our go to spot for sushi. The sushi selection is awesome, but if you're with people who don't particularly like eating fish, they have a ton of choices to choose from. Service is really hit or miss here. The restaurant itself is really clean with modern decor.

I think that Oyshi is one of the best AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.  It is a bit of a far drive from the strip and from where I live, but it's worth it.  The AYCE prices are $21 for lunch and $26 for dinner.  The AYCE not only includes various sushi rolls, but also includes various items such as steaks, mussels, sweet shrimp, some nagiri choices, and dessert.   My Top Picks for AYCE: -Ahi Poke -Kamikaze Roll -Tiger Roll -Rainbow Roll -Rib Eye Steak (comes out sizzling on a hot plate about 6-8 oz) -Mussels (2 comes in every order) -Vanilla Berry Parfait   Oyshi also has a normal non-sushi menu such as teriyaki chicken, egg rolls, and a beef bowl, if you ever have any non-sushi diners in your group.  The service there is decent, some servers are friendly some are not.  I've never had a problem with trying to get a table here.  My only qualms with Oyshi is that they tend to play rave/techno music there that does not match the ambiance.  And they also automatically add gratuity or parties of 6 or more, when it is usually customary to add gratuity for parties of 8-9 or more.

This is one of my favorite sushi places! The oysters are my fave aside from the unique rolls they have cause of the sauce they use. "All you can eat" is well worth it here & their customer service is great. Food takes a while to come out sometimes but it depends on what you order. So worth the wait though! One of the best rolls they have is the "love affair". You'll love it cause I do. :)

Food is good, comparable to other sushi places in Vegas.   My friend came here once, and apparently the tip she left wasn't as generous as the waitress expected. We came back a few weeks later, and the same waitress had the nerve to send another girl over and ask us, "so-and-so over there wants to know why you tipped bad last time." Excuse us!? If your service sucks you're not getting a good tip. Extremely rude and unprofessional question to ask.
got the AYCE... overall is good... sashimi r not included in AYCE, and cant get half order of the rolls...

Horrible horrible horrible! Was there for my birthday today and my husband waited patiently for an hour still did not get his food. AYCE . My daughter ordered California rolls which they forgot and finally after 30 min we mentioned it. This was the worst I will never come here again. We usually go to the other location. I didn't even get my dessert because my husband was so livid, which he had every right to be, get it together Oyshi! They said the manager stepped out. How convenient... Should always have a manager at a restaurant especially with the crap service they are giving out. I always post positive on Yelp this is my second review for a bad bad place. Don't waste your time!

Wow! My aunt was not kidding when she said we needed to try Oyshi but specifically under Chef Nick! He served the freshest, tastiest dishes plated perfectly for us and was so kind and thoughtful! I'm obsessed.   Thank you Nick! Mind blown.
Always able to get a reservation when I need and food is absolutely delicious. Favorite ayce sushi restaurant by far!
The best sushi in Vegas hands down love going to this place all you can eat fine quality rolls and taste is amazing huge variety definitely recommend
Always have a great time here. Our favorite chef is Ed. (Hi, Ed! From Alyssa & Kyro) he's personable and good at what he does. The service here is always fast.

Best AYE sushi place in Vegas!!! Make sure to sit at the bar!!! You can do happy hour and half rolls. The server was great he ordered his favorites for us!!! Come with a big group so you can share....

This place was delicious! And with the all you can eat prices, it is a good deal for sushi. I went here Friday night with my boyfriend and another couple, and we all got the all you can eat deal for dinner ($26/person) and we were able to order over 10 rolls and some appetizers and sides as well. We definitely ate well over $26 worth of rolls.

Forget about the sushi restaurants on the Strip. Go here. Seriously.  Located in Enterprise, I was a little skeptical about this place because it's centered within a weird strip mall that had a veternarian's office, Dairy Queen, and a Korean nail salon nearby. Whatever. That don't mean SHIT when it comes to delicious sushi.  With a great all-you-can-eat dinner price and the craziest variety of rolls to choose from, I don't see how you would NOT enjoy your sushi-licious dinner here.  Even though we were only in Vegas for 5 days, we managed to eat here TWICE because we were like "EFF THE STRIP!" and wanted to eat to our stomachs' content without the glare of neon lights.  Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll? I dream about eating it every day for the rest of my life because that would be a DREAM COME TRUE, YOU GUYS.

Disclaimer: I came at lunch time and I've heard the time to go that is best is during dinner hours so I'll have to go back for that sometime soon. My friend and I came in for lunch and decided against our normal ayce sushi and decided to just start off with a roll each. Dragon and a spicy tuna to just keep it simple. We waited 30 minutes for our two rolls. They were not rolled well neither were the portions right. They were very difficult to eat with chop sticks due to the super loose rolling of the sushi. Because of the wait and low quality we kept our order to just one roll each. One positive was that my friend loved their Thai tea.
Great AYCE, huge menu, great staff. Can get half rolls on AYCE too, so you can have more variety
Oyshi is a great place to hang out with friends and family during lunch to check out the fun atmosphere.  If you are a fan of sashimi, then this is the place to be.

This place is the bomb if you are a big eater! Which I am not but with three teenagers in the house they get their money's worth! The tempura rolls are my favourite and my wife likes the spicy tuna roll. Service is quick and the staff is friendly. They do have rules that if you don't finish you will have to pay extra for any uneaten item. So, make sure you clean your plates!  If you are a sushi fan I would recommend Oyshi be on your list of go to restaurants.
Had dinner there tonight and it was amazing!!! Though they were busy, food was amazing! My BF and I had popcorn scallops, dynamite sushi, and red dragon! They were delicious! Definitely recommended

I'm torn.  The sushi was outstanding and the All You Can Eat menu was expansive.  The service was terrible. There were many servers there on a Monday night and the place wasn't super busy. They kept forgetting about us and not once did anyone ask if everything was ok. We did the AYCE deal and after I finished a roll it would be like, 15 minutes before anyone asked for our next order. A few times we had to pester the bus boys to get our server because they were the only staff that was coming around. I saw the server at the table next to us check on them twice before anyone came to us even once. I understand if it's crazy busy and people are ordering sushi like it's going out of style, but I kept looking up at the servers standing around at the bar doing nothing but looking confused. Maybe they didn't know who had our table, I don't know. After we were done with our dessert we just sat there for another 10-15 minutes waiting for our check. Again, we had to literally get up out of our seats to find someone.  Any time I've done AYCE at other places, even busier places like Goyemon, the service has been fine. This was bad service to the point of being extreme.  Come on Oyshi, step it up! I really really like your sushi!

This is our new favorite AYCE spot for so many reasons. The selection is fantastic. The sparkling sale is homemade (green apple is amazing) the desserts are on point and there's more than mochi. Also, they're open until 2am (Rainbow location). Amazing rolls, fresh fish, great service, nice music, and amazing appetizers. An absolute must try!

Glad to say that Oyshi Sushi definitely gave me a good first impression! Although, the reason why I took a star off because my friend and I had to wait for a long time to get our sushi, we were a little irritated. Then again, it was definitely worth the wait. Best sushi I've tasted yet! Can't wait for my second time; highly recommend this place!

I went there tonight for a take out and it took them an hour to finish my order, plus it took another 15 minutes to be bagged.  I saw my order on the counter ready for bagging, but nobody was minding it.  If I did not asked about my order, it will be just sitting there.  They also forgot to put dressing on my sashimi salad.   Hence, the 2 stars.

Yummy yummy. Great service..prices are good...warning the calamari is gross. No flavor. I love calamari but i wont ever order thei calamari ever again. I had them take ut off my bill and sent it back and i never do that. So far everything else is good. I have been there about 4 times no other complaints so far.

Ed and James sushi chefs are the kings of sushi! They made us an Ahi Tuna with wasabi and special sauce on a bed of seaweed tempura in small bites as a compliment and it was something to come back for alone. These guys are here everyday besides tues/wed nights and they make up inspired dishes on the fly. The nuclear bomb is my personal fav! This place is a local must try!!

All you can eat Oyshi Sushi.  It was good. Good quality. Anything on the menu goes.  But all the rules! One desert per person. Eat most of the rice. Limited raw oysters. Limited hand rolls, and all you can eat ..in two hours.   All for around 25 dollar a person for dinner.   I came for a bday dinner and we had a little room with dimmed lighting and trance music in the background.  Good customer service too.   It's just a little too strict to really enjoy yourself and to enjoy the company you're dining with.
I love this place. I've been coming here for a few years. The fresh wasabi is really good. My favorite is the Cajun albacore which most places don't have. Plus the deserts are more than just mochi.

I wasn't really impressed with this sushi joint. Typical AYCE format, however, the rolls didn't taste fresh. The calamari was just empty breaded rings with tentacles here and there. At the end of the night, I ended up having more gas than a Texaco station. If someone lit a match, the joint would be flammable!

I like this place not to busy when they open r 11:30am more people started coming in r 12:30pm when we were finally leaving. Great little place and sushi was so good and the service was good also. The green cold tea was OK I have had better. But all in all everything was really good. Going back again soon.
I am astonished by how friendly and knowledgeable the staff is.  I have had the most attentive and marvelous helpers. I would come back and recommend everyone come

If you like sushi you'll love this place!  This is a gem! The prices are a little more than I'm use to coming from SoCal however the sushi is very fresh! Great flavors, a good selection and the ambiance is inviting. I've been here 2x and will continue coming here. They also have some out of the box desserts, the green tea cremé brûlée is decent. I'm a brûlée geek so I hoped for something amazing it was so-so. Over all great place though!

This is our favorite sushi restaurant near our house. We even take the slightly further drive just to come here. Ayce is on point, with great quality fish, awesome servers like Stefan, and a fun environment. Wish they had a punch card!!!

Love the food always taste amazing. Only complaint is that the service is sometimes really slow. I waited nearly 30 minutes to get a simply shrimp roll when the restaurant was not busy at all. All in all ill keep come here just for the food.

My wife and I are fond of trying out new-to-us places to see if they're good and provide an alternative to our go-to place -- Oyshi Sushi is NOT one we'll ever come back to!  Not only is the sushi not "oishi" where every piece of sushi has more rice than fish, but the rice isn't even good sushi rice. It has a sweet offputting flavour that just drowns out the experience. If the goal was to stuff the patron full to lessen the AYCE experience, they have succeeded.  The service is where it really boils down to, this is Las Vegas, a place that has so many restaurants and eateries vying for patronage and sometimes the service, not the food makes or breaks it. We had to flag down servers several times to get in our orders, that is if you even get one to give you eye contact. And then the constant repetition of asking where the order is because after a server takes it doesn't , it never seems to make it to the kitchen. Whatever, if you want good sushi and a pleasant experience, Oyshi Sushi is not the place to go unless you don't mind waiting for your food forever with a sub par service.  PS. It's "all you can eat" as long as you order just one. SMH.

Love this place! In my own opinion, this is the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas! There are many options here, even if you do not like sushi. AYCE menu also included rib eye steak platters, and a variety of other item you can order in small portions. The AYCE menu also includes a dessert.

Amazing sushi I come here once a week and get all you can eat. You can pretty much get anything you want for lunch it's only $21 and it's really good food. I like coming for lunch because it's slower, this place gets pretty busy on the weekends. We like sitting at the sushi bar because you can order faster and the guys are super cool. Plus you can get half rolls. I love the house salad and they have an awesome sake martini :)
Amazing fresh sushi. I recommend the happy hour all you can eat sushi. It's worth it.

The original Oyshi is my fav sushi spot but we love out on the reservation and it's just so very far! I was very excited when this location opened! We couldn't wait to go and we were NOT disappointed!! The prices are lower- The ambiance is clean and classy- The music was 90's pop and at perfect volume- The staff were all so polite and helpful making selections. The only reason I didn't give a full 5 stars is because they don't offer half rolls. My husband doesn't like a lot of the raw rolls that I order and it's too much for me to share his baked rolls. All in all... It was delicious and we will DEFINITELY be back!!

Best All you Can Eat Sushi in Vegas! Not only do they include oysters in the deal, but the toppings are A1. The baked mussels are also a must have. We were accommodated where we wanted to be seated immediately. Our server, Stefan was super attentive, friendly and informative. Totally recommend this place.

Surprisingly good sushi on the retail level of a condo building. There is ample seating space or it's good for take out. The platters come with a ton of variety of sashimi and rolls. All the fish is very fresh, and the prices are reasonable too. Great to satisfy that sushi craving without breaking the bank.

Oyshi will always have a special place in my heart. My husband and I used to eat here when we were just friends. We would come at least once a month and hang out at the bar with David. Fast forward about a year...we finally went back to the place that brought us together.   We got here on a Saturday around 6 pm. Fairly busy but not packed. A lot of new faces, but David remembered us as well as the manager that runs the floor (not sure of his name). It felt pretty good to be remembered and it made the meal better! I cannot eat sushi right now, but everything looked fresh. My husband said it was good, but he didn't want to rub it in my face that I cannot eat raw sushi. Oyshi has always been on par with their fish and it definitely seemed that way on Saturday.   I was able to order items from the kitchen luckily since they have a wide variety of cooked items. Calamari is good with their 2 different dipping sauces and as was their gyozas. I can't remember what else I ordered, but everything was fairly good.   I will be back when I can get some real sushi into me again! Service has always been attentive and that hasn't changed. Oyshi is a winner!

I've gone a couple times with a large group of friends for a birthday and we got seated in the secluded area away from the restaurant. I felt like they also purposely forgot about us more than half the time for our orders. Or they would bring the forgotten orders that we put in 3 times as a reminder, and finally appear after 1.5 hours when we are 100% full, then try to charge us for the uneaten food.  The best items on their menu is the Lobster Love Affair and the Vegas Roll. Other than that, meh.  The service is the worst here. Good luck trying to just order for take out, they will look past you for 20 minutes until you ask them for help and even when they finally do, they will still ignore you because they have short attention spans. Mind you, I was sitting at the sushi bar with a menu in my hand and grabbed someone twice and still was not given the time of day. Never coming here again.

Strictly on service.  ate here yesterday and felt like we were very limited on the ayce,  our server kept on implying that our order was enough or "it sounds good for right now"  other than that  the guy that was cleaning up the tables and getting the dirty plates took a stack of dirty plates from another table and put it on top of OUR dirty plate on OUR table while we were eating OUR food, very convenient for the server but pretty gross for us and showed no consideration for us while we were still eating.   pretty disappointed with this oyshi location, i love their rainbow location and will probably just make the 30 minute drive out there.

The service was great! Sushi not so much.  My husband and I eat a lot of sushi and are very particular about the places we go to, so when we went to this one thinking it was going to be similar to the one on rainbow, boy were we wrong.  We always order nigiri and maybe a couple of specialty rolls and the ones we had gotten the rice tasted old and the fish was very stiff. We also ordered an eel roll and it was falling apart and overly dressed. Needless to say, we are definitely not coming back to this one and will just stick to our regular spots.

BOOM!!!! Best damn sushi joint in LV, hands down! Don't argue either....this place gets a 10. Their AYCE is ALWAYS fresh, and I dont think Ive seen or heard a compliment in the 20 times I've been here. Awesome vibe, highly reccomend.

This place is really good. Another AYCE place you can add to places to go for a good experience. Lots of fish choices, all really fresh. Pretty good specials to choose from. The service is always really quick and friendly. The rolls aren't all that great is the only small issue, but just same room for the Nigiri and the handrolls. Been several times now it's just consistently delivered.

Usually "all you can eat sushi" should be translated into "you shouldn't eat any sushi"... Happily, this place is the exception to that rule. The sushi chefs here are knowledgable, fun and skilled. The service here is fast and friendly even when this place is packed.  The sushi here wouldn't pass at the very top tier sushi restaurants in town (like nobu, shibuya etc.) but it is as good as the best normally priced sushi spots in town. Bottom line, great quality sushi and for $25 you can stuff yourself silly... Updated my review to three stars as the quality here has notably gone downhill in the last year... It's not unusual to have sushi come out cut inconsistently and sloppy. Also, service here has suffered. Hopefully push I gets its act together, but until then I'll eat somewhere else.

Love Love Love ! Great all you can eat sushi! Clean! Good atmosphere open parking . Sometimes when busy they can be a bit slow or forget and order but the staff are always friendly and get it to you. Great variety of sushi to pick from and yummy Mochi. I recommend , why not give it a try
Went here last night, food was OK. Server was great but food runner was extremely rude. Looks nice but everything else was EH. Especially for the price, I was not impressed.
Don't ever go with party of 8 or more! The service is terrible! They don't clean the table during the meal! Service is bad they have 1 waiter taking care a large party.

Very disappointed ! I came and order assorted sashimi dish which is $25, I told them that I dont like tuna and I want anything else except tuna! They told me that the chef says he cant do it ! I don't see how hard it is to replace tuna with other fishes ! Never come back !

This is a great go-to sushi spot. Love the many choices of rolls, and that they offer half rolls. Wish they had real crab, but the items I have tried are fresh. We didn't do all you can eat because a few rolls already filled us up. It's an upbeat, young crowd, and we appreciated being able to watch the football game too! We'd definitely come back when we're craving sushi!

Had dinner here with my cousin and wife for my first time, my wife's second time. At first glance it was a nice atmosphere. The service was good. We got our drinks right away. The downfall was our sushi rolls took quite awhile to get. The table next to us was seated after us and they got their food before our table did which was odd. In my opinion, the sushi rolls were ok. Nothing extravagant or didn't give me a wow factor. It wasn't plated to give a wow factor or to make you excited to eat it. Which is a plus for me. The taste was a typical sushi roll taste. Nothing exciting. Our server did give us a free sake since we were still engaged in convo well after we paid our bill, and he came out with another sake on him. Which was nice and unexpected.   Would I return? Eh I have had better sushi much closer to my house. Would I recommend? Sure. It's just another sushi place to add to the list.

I've been here a few times and the sushi was mediocre at best. The last time I was there maybe 2 years ago (and the last time I will be there) the service was just horrible. The waitress sat me in a booth with a stack of dirty dishes sitting right next to me in the booth next to me. I looked at her like she was crazy, waiting to see when she would move the soiled disgusting dishes. They stayed there my entire meal. I think I pretty much mentally tuned out after that, but my water glass was constantly empty. I drink a ton of water with my meals. Everything took forever to come and the bill, of course, took forever as well. There are too many sushi places in Vegas to come back to this one to be grossed out having to sit next to dirty dishes my ENTIRE meal.  Service is an F minus. If I were rating the food this place would get 3 stars.

I remember this being my favorite place when I was needing an after gym food sesh.  Back in high school.  It seems like it's gotten more unprofessional and not as yummy as. Before. Its a bit pricey and better looking than better tasting.  This isn't a terrible foodie place, but there are better priced and better tasting sushi joints in vegas

Ate here for the 2nd time yesterday. Service is quick and attentive. Rice to sushi ratio is a good balance. Nice variety of rolls. My favorite appetizer was hiya yakko: a cold soft tofu topped with green onions and sesame seeds in a light sauce. It was simple and refreshing. My favorite roll was the Monster: soft-shell crab, shrimp tempura, with crab mix, topped with eel and avocado. It was so big I could barely fit the whole roll in my mouth. Note, they don't add cucumber to many of their rolls. AYCE is $27 for dinner, with dessert included. Reasonable, in my opinion. Becoming my go-to spot for sushi in Southwest.

ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI and they have a wide variety for the AYCE not just strictly California Rolls like some other places. The menu contains things like sushi, beef, oysters, etc. When you order, it's appetizer/ tapas size so you're usually left ordering more, and more, and more. The food is great, pretty quality stuff.   Atmosphere is nice, pretty modernized decor, nothing fancy but classy. I like that they have private rooms for those looking to have an event celebrated there. We went there for a friend's birthday and the room that we had fit about 8 people comfortably and even had a TV in there. We were able to watch a football game. I believe that there is another room that fits more people.   Service was great, they took real good care of us and even gave the birthday boy ice cream with a candle and sang happy birthday. The times that we sit at the sushi bar, the sushi chefs chit chat with you.   When we're craving sushi and know that we're bout to consume lots of it, we go here.

BEST SUSHI BAR EVER. It was our first time there and I don't think I could ever go anywhere else again. Amazing sushi and the absolute best customer service I have ever had. Servers were very knowledgeable about promotions going on and made us feel so welcome. We did the Black Friday AYCE special and had 7 rolls (one of which the chef did half and half) and 2 orders of miso soup. Btw, be sure to get the J & B roll!!!!! We will absolutely be back soon. Great food, service, and atmosphere.
So the place is beautiful, the sushi is nice and all, but... My husband's rolls arrives after 40-50 LONG MINUTES! And he went for the "all you can eat" menu... What's that all about?!
1st timer.. Food is off the chain..  From Ahi Poke, Attomic Bomb, love affair.. I wasnt a sushi gal.  Coming back for sure for the food and service

When I went, I think they were only open for a few months. My friends really liked this joint and said I had to check it out.   The food was decent. Although we ordered salmon and got lox. Which I guess if technically salmon. Just not very Japanesey. They also didn't have negi-toro or shiso leaves or white tuna. Shiso is a very basic requirement!   Ergonomically mediocre. Like the counters are too deep ... for a sushi bar. The decor was still coming up. There was a ugly mural on the wall. Although, I did like the little pieces leading up to the bathroom, like little Basquiat post cards.   The sushi chefs were also quarreling behind the sushi bar. Our servers weren't very warm, but got the job done. They were all boys. I think half of them were from Hawai'i. Not that you have to be Japanese to know how to slice a mean sushi ... but it didn't seem these kids had much formal training. Just sayin' ...   * off the strip, non-casino

This restaurant is right in my neighborhood and very convenient. They are reasonably priced and quick with Togo and dine in orders. I often place to go orders and on one particular night as always, I ordered sushi to go and waited..... There were 4 servers standing around chit chatting behind a "wall" which was merely a beaded divider. They cussed and spoke rudely about guests in earshot of guests, like myself. I work service industry and understand that on occasions you get rude and sometime intolerable guests and need to vent but speaking poorly about a guest or anything else on your restaurant floor is immature, unprofessional and rude at best.   You're open late, have great food and are quick with service..... I suggest your team be properly coached on the importance of guest relations and the impact one sentence may have on guests in the building.
I'be coming here to oyshi since there open back in 2009 best sushi  in Vegas hands down to chef ? Ed

DO NOT EAT AT THIS PLACE...I REPEAT. DO NOT EAT HERE. SERVICE IS TERRIBLE! We walked in on a Saturday afternoon (party of 3) thinking it wasn't going to be busy since it was around 3:00 pm. We were not greeted by the 2 servers who were standing at the counter busily staring at their cash register like they had no idea what they were doing. After 5 minutes of standing around, we were finally asked how many was in our party. That same server left in which we thought she was going to get our table ready but in actuality, she disappeared. So again, after 5 mins we were asked if we have been helped. This server decides to take us to a table and then proceeds asking us what we would like to drink. She then leaves us at our table while we were under the assumption she was getting our water. NOPE! We waited for a good 10-15 mins and decided to get up and leave. Most horrible experience waiting around especially since we were starving. Never going back there ever again! We decided to go to Goyemon down the street and we had the best sushi and experience off the strip ever! So go to Goyemon instead of this dump of a restaurant!

I am spoiled as I have sushi from the west coast as a comparative.    So it's with that I begin this review.  The good. Traditional decor. Cosy restaurant.  Friendly staff. Japanese speaking sushi chefs.  Nice cold Japanese beer.  Great gallery of famous sports autographs.  You can tell I am grasping.  Miso soup not bad.  Price. Reasonable. I always compare my sushi prices. By miso soup and a California roll. This place $2 and $6. So for TO. Reasonable.  The bad.  Gyoza. Deep fried. Likely frozen. Wrong sauce (they used teriyaki!? ) Rainbow Roll. Well constructed. But. And it's a big one. Fish was not good. I did not finish.  This was a $13 roll it was generous but fish needs to be fresh.   I won't return is the bottom line. Unless I want a Cali roll and cold beer. (Generally safer option.)
Love this place!!aAll you can eat sushi and everything on the menu so delicious. Great pricing too

Considering just the food, I have to say that it's really great here. Really quality sushi here. The All You Can Eat menu also includes other dishes besides sushi, such as Calamari or Asian Skirt Steak. The food here is pretty darn great.  However.... the service here is horrible. I've been here about 6 times and it's a bad experience most of the time. I wait for up to 30 minutes for my food. One time my server forgot to put in anything that I ordered so I didn't get my food for a whole 45 minutes.  I also had to wait to be seated for 20 minutes when I could clearly see that there were about a dozen free tables.  Also, one time I went there and the server recognized me from a week before. She remembered that I didn't tip so generously the last time I was there, so when we sat down, she told us "I hope you tip more this time". I believe that was extremely rude. It ruined my appetite for the rest of the meal.

Fast service and good food, this is currently my go to Sushi place. They have a wide variety of rolls and will adjust the food in each roll as needed. I have only done the all you can eat option but with all the rolls and sashimi choices it is the best way to go.
Friend brought me here after a long wait for luggage at airport..and with the all you can eat menu hit the spot ....  nice service ..

We have been to this location several times and it has been several different Sushi places. I really enjoyed the Nuclear Bomb roll the most. All of the rolls we tried were decent. Really good place to do all you can eat. We did have trouble three times of them trying to bring us the wrong roll.
Our good friends favorite place, half way across town and the service is horrible. .......
Good little sushi spot if you live in the neighborhood.
