Best sushi place so far for AYCE! Service is fast and fish isn't dry like at sushi kaya. We went on a busy day too and the waiters and waitresses were constantly quick with delivering our dishes and putting in orders.

Food is always good. But the service has been very slow lately. Its the second time we came and it took 20-25 min for the food to come. They are usually consistent with the fast service. We decided to order just one more roll and that took almost half hour. At one point we were going to cancel the order but they eventually bought the food. I dont know if the chefs are short? But it wasnt busy at all. But we will try again since it is my favorite sushi place... The service has just been tremendously slow lately.

The Best Oyshi spot is the one on Rainbow! I mean the atmosphere and service is nice. However, I gave this place a couple of tries since this one is close to my house BUT I rather travel to go to the one on Rainbow. The sushi is not as great here as the other. I guess maybe the cooks are different? The taste is not the same. For example, the Spicy Tuna Crunch tasted terrible. I actually tasted the fish. The one at Rainbow tastes good and spicy!

The absolute best all you can eat sushi restaurant I have ever been to!!   I'm from Los Angeles but came here with my friends when we visited Vegas.  Loved it so much, that we went back the next trip after that.   They are definitely not stingy with their sushi portions and you get a lot of bang for your buck.  It's about $25 and you for sure get your money's worth at Oyshi!  Not only are the sushi AYCE but the appetizers as well!  At the end of the meal, you get a free dessert too!  I had the creme brulee which was delicious! :) It would be my pleasure to come back here again!

Came in here for the first time on a Sunday 2pm, off peak lunch hour. There were about 4 other groups eating there with 5 sushi chefs working. Our initial order took quite a while - it did not all come out at once which is understandable, but I've definitely eaten at other places that don't have as many chefs that was much faster.   Anyway, the first round was all nigiri - the first half came out great! Fish was fresh, rice portions under them were very reasonable. When the second half of the nigiri order came out.. The ENTIRE PLATE was drowned in ponzu sauce.. Gross. This is a big no-no, the rice was so drenched in this sauce that it couldn't even be picked up without the rice falling apart. For this I am docking a star.  I then decided to order some of their appetizer fresh oysters (to wash the disgusting ponzu sauce out of my mouth). They came out promptly and we're definitely fresh. They came out with a little bit of a pico de gallo type salsa on them and already had hot sauce on it.  The oysters were very clean and shucked properly - an observation I did have was that the oyster itself was almost tasteless - as in, no Oceany taste - perhaps they were farmed oysters if that's a thing.  (We paid dinner price to get in on these and the uni/sweet shrimp during lunch hour, definitely worth the extra $5pp if you eat these)  Also tried the lobster fair and spider roll - the spider roll was kind of bland and the lobster fair was a California roll with crab salad burnt on top - I would not order either one of those again.   The wife got green tea tiramisu and green tea creme brûlée. I sampled both and they were quite delicious.  Service was ok, our waitress must have ended her shift while we were half way through eating but the other servers were all willing to help.  In summary, not a bad AYCE sushi joint - but make sure you tell them to hold that ponzu sauce if it's not your thing.  Also choose your rolls carefully if you order any - I won't order rolls from there anymore but would definitely eat there again.

I usually come here if I don't feel like waiting at goyemon. Their sushi is not as fresh here but I do love their sides and baked rolls. Agedashi tofu, grilled beef asparagus, and their skirt steak are some of my favorite sides. I like their Oyshi roll, love affair, and volcano roll (ask for them to make it with the garlic yum yum). It's a cute place and usually not much of a wait. And they have great desserts. The parfait and creme brûlée are very good. Although their parfait seems to be smaller in size lately.

So far I've been here twice. Definitely a place I would recommend. Amazing customer service. They have tons of selection for there all you can eat. What I also like is that there quick on serving you what you order which is a plus!

Just ok. Definitely not the best sushi I've ever eaten and I hope that Toronto has better. I was visiting the city and had lunch there. Maki was quite dry, like it had been sitting overnight, sushi was bland. Staff was pushy and the place is cramped. I would not go back.

The best sushi place in Vegas, and it's all-you-can eat.  It's been theorized by our mother that my brother and I have tapeworms with the amount of food we devour on a daily basis. With the amount of sushi we ate tonight, this could be true. Lunch is cheaper at $21 per person but I'm sure there are less things to order. We came for the all-you-can eat dinner ($26 per person) and ordered:  - yellowtail - salmon - tuna - mackerel - uni (sea urchin) - oysters (limit 4 per person) - red rock roll - dynamite roll - favorite roll - and like, six other rolls.  The bottom line is that all the fish is fresh, the service is prompt and friendly, but the food can take a while to come out when they're busy (especially since it's an all you can eat place and there's a ton of things to make) so after your first order comes, order again immediately before you finish to insure it gets there on time.   There is a 2 hour limit for the all you can eat option but I didn't have any issues with it. Most sushi places have this rule as a safety cushion for those rude customers who don't know any better and camp out in the restaurant for hours as if it were their last meal.  The decor is industrial Asian with exposed pipes, bricks, dim lighting, and colorful murals. It's a snazzy place in an unassuming location, but I'd totally take a date here.  With tip and tax, it came out to around $65 for two and that's including drinks and after devouring half the Pacific Ocean. We will be back with the whole family.
As a AYCE sushi veteran, I can honestly say that this is one of the best I've ever had. Food and service, top notch!

I'm going to be in the minority here and state I do not like this place. They have a vast selection of rolls, which is great for that type of sushi lover...I prefer a wider variety of nigiri sushi and other items.  Our most recent visit here was a group of 8 and it was terrible. Our server was slow in taking our orders, and also kept messing up. Our orders were either incorrect in terms of quantity and selection, or they didn't arrive at all. The quality of the sushi was average. They didn't have enough teapots (we ordered hot green tea) so we had to WAIT for one to become available. Really.  They added on the automatic group tip that is typical with parties of 8+. What was suprising was that it was for 20% of the bill. We were so anxious to be done with that place, we didn't even bother bringing it up. And just to put things in perspective, our bill listed we ordered 12 items for a group of 8.  So that should tell you we were in no way high maintenance. I cannot stress how terrible the service was. This should not be acceptable, especially in a town that has a ton of sushi restaurants.  I would never go back here again, especially in a large group situation. So disappointing.

My go-to for sushi! I've tried countless other sushi restaurants of similar caliber, waiting for one to surpass this place and after years, still haven't found one. They have so many delicious rolls to choose from and don't over-do it with certain components like some other restaurants have. Quality is consistent time after time and great service. Thanks Oyshi!
Wow excellent food and service.  First time there but won't be my last.  Highly recommend.

Food is normally good but last night I waited over 20 minutes for one roll. All my stuff came out before my girlfriends. It was ridiculous also the server didn't speak that great of English. It was extremely hard to understand her and she had an attitude whenever we ordered something. I don't understand how a place can have prices that high and not have good service. It's completely unacceptable. I expect to be contacted by management with this review. I'm not impressed and I'm not happy with the service. On a side note they were playing rap and music that should not be played in a restaurant.
Update: although I initially was turned off by the discrepancy of the hours listed for yelp and the seating hours of the restaurant itself, I have to say this is my goto sushi spot in town for AYCE

Thanks Neal V-G for recommending this place!! Great place to eat before a bachelor party.  5 Star rating for sure, here's why: Came here after a 3 hour trip from Los Angeles. Arrived around 4pm, with a group of 12. Was seated promptly in the back private room. Drinks were served quickly, left us with a large jug of ice water= awesome. Waiter was very polite and patient with our large group of guys. We all ordered different rolls and shared them. Each roll was delicious. Presentation, taste and size of content to each roll was perfect. I remember getting the Rattle snake, Heart attack, Lobster fare,  shrimp tempura, miso soup, fried scallops, warm saki and calamari. Absolutely no complaints of any item ordered.  Best, made to eat, all you can eat eat (AYCE) sushi joint ever.   Caution: Do not over order!! Take your time and enjoy each item is my advice. After your first roll you will want to go berzerk and order everything on the menu, trust me just enjoy and order what you can finish. You may feel pressured by the two hour time limit, but don't worry you will have plenty of time and the food is served pretty quickly.

I pretty much had a good time the two times I went here. My favorite are their salmon dishes. Anything on their menu with salmon in it is a definite favorite. I don't know why we can only order ONE dessert out of the AYCE menu though...  The only thing that bothered me was the service. It was the slowest I've ever had, ever. (And I've been to a lot of places, not just in Vegas). If they fix their slow service, this place could definitely become my favorite place for AYCE sushi.

Overall score of one star. This review may be long but I wanted to be sure that these one-offs were not left unnoticed.   My family and I came here for dinner on Christmas Day. We called ahead and were told there was no wait. On arrival the wait was 20 minutes. Forgivingly, we decided to sit at the bar to kill time.   Low and behold: they did not have a bartender. Not only was this made noted to us, but we were told by a server  that drinks would have to be ordered when we sat down; completely fine, they seemed busy.  So we were seated in one of their private rooms. We sat  down and the menus were not spread amongst the table and placed for us to distribute amongst ourselves. In retrospect, it was a small complaint compared to the 30 total minutes we waited for our beers. Which, on delivery, the server mentioned he would be back for our order  after he brought the 22oz Sapporo bottle he forgot.  So upon his delayed return and 10 additional minutes for this bottle of beer, he attempted to again avoid taking our order. I quickly asked if we could order starters, in which he responded quickly: IF we were ready he could actually take our whole order.   We started to fire off items for our party. At this point we were just happy to be ordering. Things appeared slowly but we had to ask for the ginger and wasabi for the table after about three nigiri plates were served. It's traditional that AYCE sushi establishments either bring this with the first plate or serve it immediately after the first order is placed; this was not the case.   It was a slope from here. We had to ask a runner every time we had something missing from the table. The server wouldn't observe or offer the entire party if they needed anything else, for example: refills on beers. (Which, in my experience as a server, is key to making a great tips!) and to top it all off we were service charged as a party of 7, although their menu explicitly states 8. Luckily, it was 18% and by the end of our meal, we opted to save ourselves more time by letting it go.  They probably knew we would not be back, as on our way out the server's attempt to allay any concern was that "(he) would redeem himself the next time."  That phrase in itself made me write this review. Not only did you subliminally acknowledge the subpar service you provided but you were unwilling to listen and communicate with your diners, whilst imposing a service charge that was unwarranted. This is not only a poor reflection of service standards but the unimportance the staff perceives with poor guest experiences.  I don't recommend visiting this establishment to anyone looking for anticipatory service.

Great sushi, great service. Hostess accidentally gave our reservation away but when we pointed it out she apologized profusely and got us sat quickly. It's a great environment and great food. We have been coming here for many years and we will continue.

Had dinner with a party of three on a Sunday night in April. We were seated promptly and our drink order was taken soon after. We all had AYCE and it was delicious. I had the Red Rock Signature Roll, Snow Mountain Signature Roll and Salmon Lovers Roll. They were all delicious. I would also recommend having a refreshing Berry Parfait with Green Tea Ice Cream!

Food quality was tasty, but the rolls have too many layers of rice! Service was disappointing, the waiter delivered my drink holding the rim of my cup - gross! The menu didn't have the correct pricing, so I was over charged, when I got my bill, I questioned it and I was challenged - I pointed out their error was told "it's already in the system, I can't change it" - Bad customer service.
Went halves with a friend. Rib eye steak teriyaki was alright, but the gyudon was really good. I would give it 3.5 stars if I could.
Fish is so so. Had 5 different kinds. They all taste the same.  Im a pro at eating sashimi having been to Japan numerous time.  This place is fine for an American palette.

This place is A-OK indeed. The all-you-can eat is very enticing the first 3 times you have it but after that, I can't even imagine putting myself through that again. All-you-can eat on the menu except sashimi means you will stuffing yourself with rice at the end of the night which is not very enjoyable.  The best  deal is the kid's Ninja Meal which is what I want to eat every time I go here but I can't...They're very strict on it. I brought my nephew here last time and he was sleeping so I thought I could order this Ninja meal and take it to go for him. Well NO! "Kid's sleeping can't do it. Only when he wakes up."   Bottom line. Obviously I'd eat here. But I'm not proud of it. I feel like I'm in a bad relationship where my girlfriend is abusive and I still take it. Thank god there's plenty of fishes in the sea...

I came here for lunch yesterday. Restaurant is really small so we had to wait about 20 minutes for seats. We ended up sitting at the sushi bar. The menu was simple, consisting a mix of sushi, typical japanese entrees (eg. Terayaki chicken), these "domes" which look like dons to me and udons.   We ordered two lunch sushi specials. They came with miso soup and salad, both of which were standard ayce level quality. The sushi came and although a really large portion for the price, the quality was quite disappointing. The tempura inside my dynamite roll wasn't even crunchy anymore. From a sushi perspective, this place was probably on par with some of the cheaper ayce places (which aren't good if you don't get where I'm coming from).   The restaurant does well for itself being located south of front where there are limited choices. I wouldn't visit again but if you are in the area and crave sushi, maybe you could give it shot.
Atmosphere is nice. Umbrella lights were my wife's favorite part aside from the tree rooms. Sushi is good. Service is friendly.
They say the gems are found outside the strip and this is def a Gem for the locals. All you can eat fresh suchi and menu..... Oh man. Delicious

We went to celebrate my wife's birthday with friends and family and reserved the VIP room. We have been there before and thought the food was good and wanted to go back. I do not usually post reviews but this was by far the worst experience I had to say something. From the start our server was not very forth coming. Just him asking for our drinks was a bother to him. He could not even get through the entire table of 10 before he had to excuse himself and said he will be right back. We all looked at each other like wtf just happened?? Then when he finally took all of our drink orders he ended up forgetting one and it took forever to get him to bring that drink.   We figured we better get our order in right away since we were already afraid of what was to come. So our food started coming out and the runners that were delivering the food literally had no idea what each roll was. They came to the table and had the list of what was on their tray but didn't know which was which. So they just basically put the food on the ends of our table for us to figure out what each roll was for ourselves. This happened with each person that brought anything out to our table. It ended up A couple of us didn't even receive all of our rolls and we received a couple extra rolls that didn't even order.   This was about an hour into us being there and do you think we have received any refills on our drinks by now? One of our friends actually went to the bar and asked for a pitcher of water. Literally baffled at this point.   Needless to say at the end of the evening we asked to speak to a manager and the lady that was walking by at the moment that actually paid attention to us claimed to be the manager. We told her our concerns of the service and lack there of and how they did not know any of the food they were serving. She seemed like she had heard it before but was not willing to compensate us for our troubles. Only to offer us more dessert. No thank you.   DO NOT SIT IN THE BACK ROOM AS THEY WILL FORGET YOU ARE THERE! But also please train your people on the food you serve.   10 people that will never eat at this restaurant again!

I frequent this place. Not for the sushi.  The sushi is fresh but not super creative. I love that the all you can eat includes the appetizers which I love! The shrimp yakitori and sizzling plates keep me coming back! The service is amazing also. Jane may be the best server I've ever had.
Great sushi...All u can eat... Redrock, tigerroll, popcorn scallops and Japanese ribeye awesome!!!

My orchestra member and I came here last minute looking for a new sushi restaurant and found Oyshi. The place was slow due to the day of the week I suppose but the staff was wonderful. I recently started eating sushi so struggled what to order and Nacho, Pertro, Andy, and Roberto were more than accommodating to helping me with my decisions. My waitress Kim was quite assertive and checked in often to make sure we were pleased. Here perky personality made me smile.  Tanya was not our waitress but still checked in on us. It isn't often you find a place that the staff is friendly and keeps you laughing your entire stay. Found my new sushi addiction!! Must also add the staff is very easy on the eyes...... Did not know how to use Yelp so I used my friends account, Becky
Very good neighborhood sushi spot. I got the AYCE. Customer service was friendly. I will come back again and ag

So me and my friend wanted to do sushi for lunch. We were headed to our normal place, got there and it was closed for lunch on Sunday. Such a disappointment! We then drove a few blocks down to Oyshi Sushi. The place was very beautiful and open. Great service and sushi bar. I wasn't feeling to good on this day so I didn't get to eat as much as I wanted but I had a lobster roll that was out of this world! I'll be back!!

Great food and drinks. We didn't have the best service. They did run out of the plum wine which is my favorite but she did have recommendations for other types drinks. We ordered entree and several rolls everything tasted great.

Been going here for over a year now, after hearing that it was the LVRJ's editor's choice for Best of Las Vegas. Proximity to home was a big plus, of course!  It will likely remain my favorite, but I was incredibly embarrassed last night when bringing friends from the UK there for dinner after talking the place up so much. The service was WAY off, although the food was still excellent. They recently opened a new location on Sahara, so I'm hoping that this was just a matter of a bunch of trainees not knowing what they were doing (everyone looked new and got orders wrong, not providing place settings until after food was already served, not knowing which tables ordered what food, etc.).  Here's hoping that's all it was. I still suggest everyone give them a chance, as the actual food will not disappoint!
Love their sushi lunch special, miso soup, and house salad! Great service and prices too.

Iv'e been here several times and have brought plenty of friends and family here. Sometimes it gets a little busy but that's why you can make a reservation! Favorite sushi place by far. I live in North LV and will make the drive. The lobster affair roll is my ultimate favorite along with everyone else's. Can't wait to go back!

I have always been a fan of Oyshi Sushi as it took my sushi virginity! I wish the prices dropped to be more comparable to other sushi spots in the area but all one can do is hope. AYCE is the safest bet for a dinner out with a table for two or more. You ensure no one will need to wash dishes in the back if they get carried away with indulging. We all have those dinner friends who have the mindset of caviar budgets but the reality of dollar-value-menu wallets.   Service is usually a hit or miss. I've gotten service that has made me not want to leave. On the other hand I've experienced servers at this establishment that made me want to request take-out. (which they do offer).   The draw back for this place is they don't do half orders like other spots. It's also nowhere near the strip. Which is a catch-22. The wait can be timely depending on the day of the week. If it were closer to the strip it would be an endless wait.  Mussels, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, Oyshi Roll, and the Japanese Lasagna are my favorites!

This was my first time here I know that they have other location. I loved it here I will be coming back for my birthday because they have amazing private room it was worth the experience and the sushi was great ! Customer service was excellent .

My daughter got very ill within 30 minutes of eating sushi. Started to vomit within an hour. Is the fish fresh? Then the lights went off in the restaurant and they didn't charge for the meal. Hmmm. Not happy and need a trip to ER from her vomiting over 5 times.

Food is outstanding. Most of the time the service is good. Went one day after class and had to wait one hour for our food, but the quality of the sushi made up for it. Always go for the love affair roll. If you're going to get more than three rolls and you have a big stomach you might as well go for the all you can eat.

Oyshi was my favorite sushi location and having another location was such a great news for me! However, my experience at the Sahara location is so bad I was impelled to write this review! Tho the ambiance was nicer than the rainbow location, the customer service here is HORRIBLE! They are so slow! To make it much worse the male manager gives you a rude vibe. Boy, he needs some serious customer service training. I was gonna just ignore it thinking he might just be having a bad day, but the next few times our family came back he couldn't be more ruder(if there's such a word)   Anyway, I promised myself  I will never set foot in that location again! I love Oyshi so I will be loyal to the rainbow location only!   They just lost my business!
Spending Christmas Eve at Oyshi enjoy the amazing sushi and holiday spirit. This restaurant is always unmatched.

The only AYCE sushi I've tried in Vegas but the best AYCE sushi place I've ever been to ($22 for lunch). What I love about this place is the menu isn't limited to a certain AYCE menu. You can order anything off the menu with the exception of sashimi but that's about it. You can tell the seafood is super fresh/prepared perfectly. You can have one dessert per person per AYCE so we tried the green tea berry parfait & the green tea creme brûlée. Absolute heaven.   Service was on point with no complaints at all.   Every item we tried was delicious & we will definitely be back M-F between 3:30 - 5:30pm for 20% off AYCE Happy Hour!

I find myself at this location often because of its proximity to my office. It's a pretty decent place. I adore the friendly staff here and the ambiance. It's definitely a nice location. The fish to rice ratio is decent but not great. They tend to be a hit or miss location. I've had days where it was all on point and I've eaten till I was gonna burst because everything was perfect. Then I've had days where the rice has been purely terrible. Just hard and tasting like it's been left out for awhile. Because of this inconsistency in terms of their food quality is why I would only give them 3 stars. Great happy hour specials however. The sake deals are on point. They have the space for large groups but still the consistency is their weak spot.

BEST SUSHI BUFFET EVER.  BEST SUSHI BUFFET EVER.  B_E_S_T  S_U_S_H_I B_U_F_F_E_T E_V_E_R!!!!!!  Okay, if this obnoxious review cannot convince you to try it out, then perhaps all the other positive ones will!   Thanks to Yelp!, my friends took us here several months ago and the eight of us who went loved it! It seriously beat all the sushi-buffets I have ever been to. The sushi buffet menu is comprehensive! Every type of roll you can think of, Maki sushi, miso-soup, wakame salad(!!!), etc. etc. It even features menu items that even non-sushi lovers would enjoy -- tons of appetizers, surf and turf steak and shrimp, terayiki, tempura, etc. It comes with free tea, and a free dessert after your meal. And it's less expensive than a Vegas buffet!   Totally worth it!! I went again a second time and introduced it to a new group and it did not disappoint.   The only gripe I have is they have a rule that you have to eat most of the rice or there will be a surcharge. Only a slight bummer, but I cannot blame them. It is still a very fabulous place worth spending the $$$ you earned gambling!!!
I ate there on 4th of July and got food poisoning. I felt it was weird since the fish wasn't really cold. But now I'm spending my 4th of July on the toliet. I'm never coming back to this place.

I really like this place. $26.00 all you can eat sushi and hot entrées for dinner...and not cafeteria style where everything is already made for the taking...the food is made to order. It annoyed me that the seemingly easy to make sushi, nigiri, took the longest to be served. The rolls came like clockwork but I had to remind the waitress several times that my sake, hamachi and unagi nigiri hadn't come yet. By the way the unagi was cold and didn't taste fresh.  Living in the Bay Area, this place was a pleasant surprise in terms of quality and price. I will try again before heading back...perhaps a second chance at 4 stars. I'm assuming that there are 5 star sushi places in Vegas, but I would probably pay double the price for less food.
Amazing service! Kenny was the best! Very knowledge of the food made amazing recommendation! We will definitely be returning on a regular basis with service like Kenny! Thanks for the dope time!

It's all good, really....Me and my lady went on a Friday and had to wait 20-30mins but it was worth the wait. Got the all-you-can-eat YES!!! and everything I ordered was good.  Great place for a date...Cool music too.

Quick service! Best AYCE in town hands down The spicy tuna crunch roll, so crunchy, so spicy, so yummie. I would put that in my mouth every day.  Also the green tea crème brûleè is orgasmic. Gotta have that.

This place is Awesome!! From the atmosphere and decor to the service down to the variety of rolls, their Ayce is awesome!! I mean everything was awesome! This was my was my second time coming here and my experience was even better than the first! If u have been to a few AYCE sushi places around town you are either in a tight spot nearly in the couples  next to u convo, nearly touching elbows  or they are rushing u to hurry and turn the tables.. Not here!! I didn't feel rushed, my server gave great suggestion on things to try!! I left very satisfied and FULL! My new #1 sushi place!!!!

Went here for my birthday. IT WAS AWSOME!!! Food: 5 stars! I used to not like sushi. But I decided to give it another try, see if I'll change my mind. After our visit, I discovered MY NEWFOUND LOVE!! Sushi!!!  Price: 5 stars! Prices were reasonable. We went for their all-you-can-eat that costed about $26/person. I must say, we ate so much I think the store will go bankrupt! Jk.   Service: 5 stars!  Our server was also very nice. He always checked in on us to see if we're doing good. Very polite and quick. It seems like all of the servers there were.  Worth the time and money. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone!

This place is my favorite AYCE Sushi in Las Vegas. The quality of fish and the execution is excellent and always consistent. I go there for the Hamachi and fresh Scallop Nigiri and the Nuclear Bomb specialty roll. This is a great place for small or large groups, business or casual. This place is great for lunch, but dinner is where they shine. Check out the items exclusive to dinner only, all are excellent!

This place was a gem to find especially on Christmas Day! Andre our server was exceptional. He offered dishes of items I was craving which were crab and scallops. He did not disappoint as I ate everrrrrything.   Our waters never dipped below half and it came with lemons without asking. Desert was delish. I chose the creme brule which came with the $22 lunch menu.   Leave a review and receive a free beer on draft. Awesome ambiance, awesome service!!

First time here at Oyshi's on Sahara Blvd. thanks to a recommendation from my chiropractor.  I like the setup and the look of the place, feels comfortable, and love the menu.  I had the all you can eat sushi with loads to pick from and they also have the non-sushi menu, pretty awesome!  I don't usually see a separate area with a bar in a sushi restaurant but it's here alright! and the cocktails options look great...I will definitely try it next time ;) not today to early for that :/ hey!! don't judge it's noon/ lunch time & on a Monday ;)  A 4 star due to the flavor of the sushi, it wasn't a super wow...ur typical Vegas sushi. Nothing compares to Cali sushi:(  Service was great, cool chick w/ great eyebrows ; ) very helpful and great suggestions.  Love the in house made Creme Brûlée!  A must.   I'll be back, perhaps I'll order something different and hopefully it will wow me to a 5 star  : * Will definitely recommend it to Fam. And Friends.
One of my favorite all you can eat sushi spots in Vegas! I've only dined at the sushi bar. Chefs are amazing and will remember exactly what you order after you've gone a few times.  A++++

My husband and I decided to come over to Oyshi for a bite to eat while our car was being serviced across the street. We sat at the sushi bar and we were happily surprised to see a sushi chef we knew from another spot, years back....... so, he knew what we were looking for, we are not the typical AYCE customers...... I prefer quality to quantity!!!!! The Mu sake is one of our favorites. The perfect compliment to good sushi! So that set us off to the perfect start! I will say that if you are into the AYCE sushi.... this is probably a great spot for you, they have a huge selection of rolls, sushi, appetizers, and I was pretty impressed when I saw the final bill.  Me personally, I appreciated the selection of fresh fish and the chef guided us in the right direction every step of the way.

We love Oyshi! Originally familiar with the Southwest location, we decided to finally try the new location and as always we weren't disappointed.   We only go to AYCE - for dinner here it's $27 which honestly if you "shop around" you'll find is pretty much the same everywhere - if it's cheaper it's probably not a quality place lol   Service and food were great. Just a tip, Red Rock roll, Lobster fair and their Ribeye sizzling plates are to die for. If you're a crem brûlée fan - they have chocolate edition :) the new location is slightly larger than southwest and the decor looks great! We'll be back for our next date night.

I almost wrote this place off for the unusual amount of time I spent waiting to be seated but patience paid off.  I ordered the AYCE (All You Can Eat) lunch & had an egg roll, a spicy tuna crunch roll & a rainbow roll.  I informed my server of my food sensitivities & she assured me that I can make omissions :-) (some sushi places are funny about that)  My eggroll was ok, nothing special, but I have to say that both my sushi rolls were very tasty & fresh.  Although not totally family friendly, its a relaxed enough atmosphere that you could totally bring the kiddos.  The bathroom although small was neat & clean.  My one note is in regards to service.  The staff wasn't especially friendly nor were they cold.  A smile here or there definitely would earn another star.  That being said, a must for sushi lovers especially with the wide variety of choices on the AYCE menu.  I would definitely eat here again.
Ask for Chef Ed!  He's the best!  He'll make the best off-menu treats if you ask him, but make sure to sit at the bar.

I like this place for their salmon dons, a dome of sushi rice covered by many pieces of salmon, cut in varying thickness, but not too thick. They also offer a tuna don and spicy versions of both.  Their chicken cutlet is fantastic! After several visits, we have yet to tire of it (great every time!) It is also available in the "ebi" fry, which is a variety of 3 fried items, including shrimp.  I enjoy the miso soup, which as far as I can tell, has an added element of a sumashi broth, making it more delicious and complex in flavour (very tasty!)  They often give freebies, such as edamame or fried chicken with sweet sauce, which is always appreciated.  The enclosed areas are nice for privacy and the service ranges from efficient to slightly overwhelmed, but still cordial.  Unfortunately, parking is an issue in the area, especially after 7pm. 3.5 stars... more than A-ok, but inconvenient if you're not already in the area.
Awesome service with Kevin at the bar. Great all you can eat whole menu! Bar. Sushi. Sushi bar. Won't go anywhere else. Family friendly. Food is perfection.

Experience:  a friend invited me to lunch, and this was the spot he picked. We met one other friend who mentioned their is another location she had frequented.   Facility: The restaurant was very nice with lots of unique accents and modern decor. They had both chair and tables and half booths with chairs too. The bar is pretty small and seats around 8-10.   Service:  It was very slow when we arrived, and it seems when restaurants are really slow, they tend to forget to check on their guests. They were friendly and helped when you asked, but I felt I had to flag them down too many times from their little congregation at the hostess booth. I'd give the service a 3 star rating.    Food:  the food was good. The $22 AYCE lunch does not include the sashimi, so that was a disappointment. They also don't serve oysters, uni or sweet shrimp for lunch. We ordered calamari, veggie tempura, spicy tuna roll, gyoza, seaweed salad, mussels, Cali salmon roll, snow mountain, a few other rolls they ordered I don't remember.  A special shout out to the dynamite, which actually had a teriyaki flavor, the Tempura shrimp, the atomic bomb roll, and this fabulous cucumber salad called sumomono, which was a nice palate cleanser.   Overall:  this was a pretty good lunch. Not my fav AYCE sushi place, but nice enough where I would come back with friends again.

I'm not from Vegas but today marks my 3rd time coming here and I look forward to making it a tradition each time i'm in town. This place is awesome. It's a bit of a drive off the strip, about 10 minutes but well worth it. It has a nice ambiance perfect for a date or a night out with the girls. There were quite a bit of families there also. 26 dollars ! All you can eat. I've been to many AYCE sushi places and they always give you fewer choices and just the basic appetizers and maybe a green tea ice cream for dessert. Not this place. They have a huge selection of rolls. They are so delicious. Ummm. They have so many appetizers to choose from. If your a meat eater you will appreciate it because they offer a lot of meat dishes. Last but not least if you have room the dessert is heavenly. They have creme brulee, green tea tiramisu, berry parfaits and one other that I cannot recall.  All this for 26 bucks. It's unbelievable that you can get all this and still have great quality. The only negative thing I can say about this place is that on Friday and Saturday nights it gets busy so you may have to wait a while for them to come back and get your 2nd orders. This still doesn't deter me from giving them 5 stars because the servers are really helpful and cordial when they do come back.

We come here when we want all you can eat sushi. I love that they have so many different rolls to choose from. Everything tastes delicious every time. My 5 year old loves them too!  The service on the other hand is a hit or miss. The last time we went in it wasn't very busy, but we had to wait forever for our food! It was like they were out catching the fish as we were waiting for it.

So what makes a great sushi restaurant?  Great Service, Nice entertaining sushi chefs and most of all yummy fresh cut fish!  Sadly Oyshi had NONE of these qualities.  First of all the hostess Kassidy was the rudest restaurant host I have ever encountered. We got there at 5:45 pm on Tuesday.  There were 12 open seats at the bar and many open tables.  She said there was a wait because there were not enough servers for any more guests and the next server comes at 6pm.  So we said we would wait till 6.  At the appointed time, she escorted us to the very end of the bar where there was no visibility of the fish cases or the chefs and there were 10 empty prime seats in the center of the bar.  Really?  When we questioned her, she rudely said, "I don't make the rules, the bar for servers is split in 2"   So the rules are  give the first guests to arrive for the evening the worst possible seat????  She reluctantly moved us and stomped away in a huff.  The server was only slightly more friendly.  Oh and guess what, you can't speak to the chefs.  You have to order through the server who only comes around rarely.  We decided to order a la cart instead of all you can eat because we prefer cut fish.     Unfortunately the albacore fish was gross and mealy and we had to send it back.  My poor husband ate a couple of pieces of it and paid the price this morning.  The other fish plates were cut thick and not refined.  Most of the fish is pre-cut in the case making it dry out.  I ordered a grilled hamachi kamma, (cheek) and was told it would take 20 minutes.  Well no wonder it came out overcooked and dry because it probably only needs to broil 5 minutes.  They also covered it in masago eggs which i hate and I had ask to have them removed.  The rolls had the TINIEST cut piece of fish I've ever gotten in a roll.   I asked for seared tuna nigiri and got the wrong order.   I also ordered eel nigiri and it was grilled eel but COLD,  so they also grill that ahead of time and serve it cold,  YUCK.  Its the fresh warm juicy eel that makes it good.  The "rice" under the nigiri was I'm not sure what.  It was not whole kernels of rice but some kind of rice paste.  I could not find one kernel of rice in it.  It tasted fishy and gross like rice pulp, elmers glue and fish water mushed up.  It was not edible.    At the end of our meal, the waiting area was full but there were 6 empty tables.  The hostess takes great pride in her little power of NOT SEATING guests.  I wanted to tell them RUN!  and save your money and your tummy.  Her bad attitude definitely sets off the experience to be bad. I have no idea how this place is popular when the only decent thing we ate was the edamame.    We only went here because our favorite place had no seating from being so full on a tuesday night at 5:30 pm.  Next time we will make reservations at our normal place and spare ourselves from this bad treatment and bad food.    I see other recent bad reviews so take note people....

Walking in, the decor is chic and modern.  The music is hip lounge style music - and I swear someone has stolen my Upbeat station on Pandora.  The staff is young, friendly, and fast paced.     The food comes two ways - ALL YOU CAN EAT or ala carte. I opted for the more modest ala option as I am flying solo.  The food tastes fresh, the presentation lovely, and the delivery onto the plate quite speedy.  My only complaint about the food was that the rolls are packed very tightly...loose rolls aren't awesome.  I can understand how an AYCE would require trading speed for firmness but would rather have the firmness especially via ala carte ordering.   All in all it was a pleasant experience and I will likely return. Four out of five stars for what it is.

I've ate here a few times... We just stopped in here for my moms birthday and this was honestly the worst sushi experience I've ever had.   First off I called and was told that I couldn't make a reservation that it would be slow enough to walk in, we came into a busy restaurant and was told it would take 30 min to be seated. We love to eat sushi and loved this place but the service was Awful! I dont know if the server forgot our Order  or if the kitchen just didn't get the order. Whatever the case may be the manager handled it poorly, There was 6 of us and 5 got AYCE. After being poorly served we got charged for everything which we thought was crazy..... All in all I will never come back to this place, I loved coming here If I was able to give 0 stars I would

Adding on to Cara N.'s review.  That server was awful, he really spoiled our nice sushi dinner.  Very unprofessional yelling in the restaurant and kitchen, swearing and he has the nerve to apologize for getting loud because it was a long day for him, no excuse!  He then tries to make conversation, but we were done! I'm very surprised none of the other workers stepped in to quiet him down.  Some of the other workers laughed at his antics but I could tell they were embarrassed.

I have gotten sushi from here in the past and it's been pretty good at reasonable prices. Recently went there again and was extremely disappointed with my order. I ordered off the Sushi menu which i have done before. My total came to $8.65 which seemed reasonable for two basic sushi rolls (salmon and spicy tuna)  What I received was literally 4 bites (see photo) So disappointed! Went back in to ask the girl in front if there had been a mix up. She informed me that i ordered off the "nigiri menu"  It was the menu she handed me and said sushi on the top -_-  That being said, the two stars are for the salmon "nigiri" which was a tasty two bites, and the ponzu sauce  Definitely will not be returning to this place unless they fix the menu and stop overcharging :/

$27 for all you can eat dinner was too much to pay for my group of 5 and it wasn't worth it. We should've just ordered 1 or 2 items each and it would've been cheaper at the end. Appetizers, salads and the scallops had very small proportions. Rolls were okay, only roll we liked was the Tiger roll. It's not worth coming back, spent too much money plus service was ehh barely checked on us, always had to wave him down.
Gotta love this place. Great Food and Great service and the staff is pro. Its my go to for sushi.

Been here enough times to state that the food is very good, service is great, AYCE is tops and the place has a nice ambiance.  I highly recommend the Tiger roll, spicy tuna roll, poke salad, and the ribeye. Stay away from the cucumber salad. Too much dressing with a weird aftertaste. I think the chef just had a heavy hand that night with the dressing. My friend loves their baked mussels. I'm not a fan of mussels so none for me.  AYE includes a choice of dessert. Their berry parfait with your choice of vanilla or green tea ice cream is devine! They also have mochi and green tea tiramisu. Stay away from that green tea tiramisu...not good at all!! Other than that great place to tame a AYE sushi craving with fantastic hot dishes!

Great environment and good sushi. Definitely one of the better AYCE sushi restaurant in the Vegas area, however, there are some others with better quality fish.  My only "complaint?" They serve a high rice-to-fish ratio to fill you up faster. This is quite common with AYCE places, but there are a few places out there that load the fish and use an appropriate/smaller amount of rice.   Other than that, it is a wonderful place to eat around the Enterprise/Blue Diamond areas!!

Everything is still about the same..missing food items..long wait times for a place that's not even busy. Food/Service is still hit or miss. Great music. Bussers on point.  Not sure what the problem is,this place can rock harder. Asked for condiments to be eaten with food,server talked for 15 minutes after food came out.  Had to ask for condiments again as good got cold. This place has the potential yet consistently lacks...WHY?? Ambience is there, Food quality is there. Repolish the rest and it could happen.
Just ordered trough Postmates.  Kinda disappointed.  Terrible screaming O sauce and blah rolls.  The Yakitori was super salty and blah as well. Won't be ordering from here again.

Great service, great food best describes this place, and you cant beat the all you can eat special. When you're here try the nuclear bomb,  yellow tail sashimi,  and the screaming orgasm. I gotta give a special thanks to Vince for such great service.
sushi was good but the service was bad. we were seated over the sushi bar. the sushiman never asked us what we wanted to get. so we waited for a long time until our waitress came again to order.

Would be 0 stars if I could.. came here for lunch right by my job. Order cali roll lunch special.. never got my soup or salad.. took 25 min for me to get my rolls are you serious for cali rolls.. then says well we have to charge you alacarte because you didn't get the soup salad... wtf I don't have time to wait for the soup salad it's lunch time I have to get back to work.. now your charging me more because you can't bring a soup and salad.. I was late coming back from lunch trying to speak with a manager over them trying to charge me more:.. will never come back here again

Foods was amazing! They have a lot to offer on the "appetizers" section. I'm picky with my rolls and sushi places, but this place has plenty to select from. The Sizzling plates are a must try, especially the sweet & spicy pork. Also desert, chocolate crem brûlée is a fave!  Environment: a modern setting I would say. Music was a bit over taking. Also we sat in a booth and the tables were a bit close to each other, you can hear the whole conversation of the party next to you.  Service: ohhhh the service here is why I gave this place only 3 stars. The service is extra slow even on a easy pace night. Took about 15 min after we sat to just get our waters. Ordered our food and plates were taken off the table when we weren't even done.. I'm sure they could do better.  Other than that, wouldn't mind coming again!

This is my absolute favorite place to visit! Best sushi in town for a reasonable price. They have some creative rolls that are worth Atleast one try. My favorite is snow mountain and japanese lasagna! Only complaint is they had amazing music playing old school RnB and hip hop, but now theyve resorted to boring radio music. Kind of ruins the ambiance for me but food is good

So I have had my fair share in AYCE sushi, and I must say that the combination of the spacious restaurant, GREAT food, and good service this place is definitely one of my favorites. I went there for lunch and spent over 2 hours there and the service did not waiver, and the food was delish! This just became one of my favorite places to go for sushi! Good job OYSHI

The food was good and the price was right.  We ordered my nephew the Ninja meal which came with a house salad, miso soup, half california roll, teriyaki chicken. For my niece we ordered the Cheesy Katsu meal and that came with a house salad, miso soup, and 3 sauces on the side of katsu sauce, honey mustard, and nacho cheese and a good size of katsu. The kids meals didn't come with rice so we ordered each a bowl on the side. It was alot of food for just the kids, my boyfriend and I ended up eating the left overs and we were stuffed.. it was definetly worth $6 each for the kids meal excluding the bowls of rice.  My boyfriend had the unagi bowl which was perfect as we both shared 1 big bowl of rice unagi and grilled onions which was Delish, an order of a rainbow roll which was ok, as it didn't have avocado :(  but it still took care of my craving for sushi and a salmon handroll which was ok as I've gone to other resturaunts that pack it with salmon and the slices are big.    I like oyshi.

I have tried this place a few times and have always enjoyed it The food i think is pretty good basically like any other place I do like the music they play in the restaurant  But unfortunately i tried to order togo and ordered a few roles and steak dinner when the food arrived I was super disappointed cause i there was no wasabi or ginger  I know that this is pretty minor thing But i dont know how you can forget both those items? Had to leave the house to go get some wasabi ? Which is a real let down cause my dinner was getting cold cause i had to leave the house

I was back in Vegas for a trade show. We didn't want to wait an hour for Texas De Brazil, so my boss and a guest asked me about "that sushi place you rave about" off we went to Oyshi! My boss AND our guest are sushi snobs and all the way there they voiced their concerns. As soon as the appetizers were done and our first rolls served, they were hooked and raved about the great rolls and how they will be back themselves! Thank You Oyshi Sushi for making me a hero!
I used to work next to this place, I like their staffs, friendly n quick service, food is decently fresh.

Most locals know where to go for sushi! It's the best for carb loading after a long run! Menu is extensive that offers variety of choices for most. My fav are hot stuff like Asian skirt steak! Come for lunch or just come and fill up!

I love AYCE (all you can eat) places that have a variety of items and not just sushi.  I've been coming to this location for years. Actually my first AYCE experience was here.  I've also taken many friends here to eat who didn't like sushi because their AYCE menu is filled with so many items. It gives people a chance to ease into sushi places if it's not their favorite thing to eat.  Two items that I highly recommend are Lobster fair and Love affair. Just so darn yummy. lobster fair is a California roll with baked lobster yumminess on top. Love affair is a STR with baked crab meat yumminess on top. Both just melt in your mouth.  Also love the different desserts they have. Anything from green tea ice cream to mochi to cream brûlée. Again, so many different options.  Service is not the fastest so be patient. It's AYCE anyway so sit back and enjoy the experience.  Also, don't come during peak dinner hours on Friday and Saturday. Your wait will be long.
Fantastic selection, freshness and service! I sure wish there was a location near the East Coast. I had oysters, Poké plus the sushi for one, low all you can eat price!

I've eaten here twice now; both times were all-you-can-eat.  I absolutely loved it the first time.  The second time failed to live up to my inflated expectations.  To summarize the Oyshi experience: good sushi in a nice atmosphere with unpredictable service.  Some items come out after the appropriate amount of time while others take an inexplicably long time to arrive.

Came in solo as a traveler on a Wednesday early evening. Pretty limited clientele at the time, buy you can tell the ambience stays pretty relaxed and fun. Staff was nice, but not necessarily consistent  (few grumpy folks when I stayed at the sushi bar, but maybe more so cause I eventuality just put my headphones on).   Sushi and sashimi were both quality (sorry not a roll guy much). However, they weren't very traditional in preparation, as some sushi didn't come with the traditional automatic wasabi between rice and cut, or the brush. Not a big deal.   They offer an endless option for $32 or $37 For lunch or dinner respectfully.  I'm sure it would be worth it with the higher end, expensive rolls.   Overall, I'd definitely come again, and/or bring friends. Solid local option.

This is mainly an all you can eat sushi restaurant. The restaurant had a very pleasant and modern appearance. This location is great for large parties as there is a ton of space for it. Just keep in mind that parties larger than 8 ppl would include a service fee.   All you can eat includes an appetizer, sushi, specialty rolls and dessert for $27 (dinner price). It does not include sashimi which is standard at most AYCE restaurants. We sat at the bar which was really the best place to be. We had the opportunity to talk to Chef Daniel who made some of his recommendations and made us some sushi rolls that were off the menu.  Honestly, his creations should be part of the menu as they were unique and excellent.   The appetizer menu was very extensive with plenty of options! Every single dish we tried was fresh and very tasty. The only roll I did not like was the spider roll. It appeared the eel was fried hours before and was not very fresh. Overall, I was very happy with the atmosphere, service and the quality of the food!

I ordered a la carte, and when I first looked at the menu, I thought to myself, "The pricing is on the in-expensive side". Then the food arrived.   The cuts of fish were smaller than I am used to. So taking portion size into account, the a la carte pricing is fair. Which leads to this point: I think that part of the draw of this place is that they have an "AYCE" (All-You-Can-Eat) menu. The AYCE price is equivalent to what I paid for my a la carte meal (as described below).  As for my experience, I ordered: miso soup with clams; a California roll; tuna sushi, salmon sushi, Cajun tuna sushi, and halibut sushi. These are standard items, and I felt it would provide me with good gauge of the quality of their fish. The quality of the fish was very good.  Would I go again? Sure. But I would go for the AYCE.  BTW... the kitchen closes at 1:30am most nights (check the site for operating hours). Not bad for the suburbs.

Yelp 100 Challenge 15' * 12/100  They say you can only joke about a bad experience after a certain length of time. It's been a month since I paid over $100 for an all-you-can-eat for 2 and looking back, it taught me a few things.  My friend and I are currently on the hunt for great sushi places in town and this being the closest to our homes, we made it our first stop. I have fond memories of the previous sushi place that took up this space and for some reason, I was expecting the same quality food and service.   After having waited about 10-15 minutes for a seat in a half empty restaurant, we approached the hostesses in haste when we saw more recent customers led to a table before us. We had a young female server that busy Friday night. Famished from work, we were ready to go on a devouring spree which started with a plate of edamame. The fun began with their specialty rolls such as the red rock, red dragon, and surf 'n' turf - my favorite. The surf 'n' turf consisted of a thin slice of rib eye steak placed above the roll and a shrimp tempura tucked inside. Great combination topped with eel sauce, if I remember well.  Things went downhill from there. We should've just eaten all the sushi we wanted before getting dessert. Back then, I didn't know if 1 dessert per person was the rule of thumb for all sushi buffets but it certainly shocked us when our server gave us our check after crème brûlée. We gave over half in cash and said to charge the rest on my card but the whole amount was charged on my card and the cash was also taken in. I gave them the benefit of the doubt and thought it might have been a flimsy mistake. After getting in touch with the manager, our cash was refunded, but only after much hassle to the restaurant and ourselves.   The food quality was good but some improvement could be made to service. Might come back again.

I stopped here by chance when I was walking around searching for a restaurant for dinner.  The reviews on Yelp were good, so I went in!  What struck me is that it seems to be a family-owned/operated restaurant, which I like.  Seating was a bit tight, but cozy.  Though if you want private conversations, you may go elsewhere.  I could hear every word of the neighbors' conversation.  Service was prompt, and I ordered a small Sapporo beer to start.  I was pleasantly surprised when edamame came with it (though another reviewer said that it comes complimentary with a meal).  I ordered the sashimi dinner (20 pieces) and sadly I could not finish it all - which says a lot for me since I have an enormous appetite!  One of the fish varieties tasted a bit off to me, so I did not eat those pieces.  But all in all, everything was delicious (especially the salmon).  Dinner came with rice, miso soup, and salad.  The salad had a yummy (seemed homemade) dressing with bits of ginger in it - just the right amount and not over-powering.  I'd go back!
There is absolutely nothing to dislike about this place. Everything is made with top quality ingredients, the prices are excellent and the service is fast.

Really tasty, fresh sushi and great service.  I was ordering piecemeal from the Sushi menu and they recommended a studio/tempura combo that saved me a ton and even customized it for nigiri instead of a California roll.  Excellent value, nice atmosphere, and warm-up helpful staff.

First, I would like to say that I am not AYCE kinda gal.  I just don't eat that much (contrary to what my appearance may say) but in this case I think it was worth it.  We went for lunch so it was a $21 price.  But if you figure most of the rolls I liked cost about $10-$12 anyways, 2 rolls and you are there.  Plus it's your choice of different things from the menu, not just sushi.  But there are rules, and not EVERYTHING on the menu is part of the AYCE.  There is a bit of lag time on getting your food, so don't go running in thinking you are going to be out in 15 minutes.  But do go with the expectation of enjoying the company you went with.  Our server was great and the food was really good.

The service is okay, depends on which server you get. The first time eating here our server was great. Food came out fast & tasted good. Second time eating here our server was nice but very slow. It was a long wait for the food & by the time it came out our "crispy" rolls weren't so crispy. Eating here for the third time was just like the second. I would say the service & quality of food is inconsistent. The sushi's okay, had better else where.

We went last night for a friends birthday with a group of 15 people. Our server was apparently a sushi chef there as well as a server. He should probably give up serving and be a sushi chef because the service was terrible. His excuse at the end was that he was training two other new servers. The craziest part was there was NO manager in the whole place to correct any of the issues we had! You bet he added gratuity to the check at the end though! We all happen to work in the industry, most of us down on the strip and this wouldn't fly where we work. We all sat down and ordered all you can eat around 7:30 pm. The gap between drink service and ordering was pretty long. Ok so we can handle that I guess. When we finally were able to order food came out and half of it was missing throughout this long dragged out dinner. We were missing rolls, appetizers and soup. We mentioned it a few times but we never got it. By 9:23 we were so annoyed we asked for separate checks. Now we had told him this from the beginning. I know I'm use to producing and running up to 20 separate checks at a time and it takes me about 8 min to separate them and then another 8 to process payments. We timed it and literally did not get our check back till 10pm when we all started to head up to the front of the restaurant just so we could get out of there. No apologies, no compensation and 18% added to the checks. Food was average for what we were able to try because half of it didn't come out. Stay away from this location. They just take your money and waste your time!

I went to Oyshi for All you can eat last week. The all you can eat menu is huge!! there is so much to choose from and everything we ate was great! The atmosphere is great, the food is delicious and fresh, and the presentation if fantastic. They also play trance music - ha!  Dishes I liked: Hamachi Trio Roll Alaskan Roll Dynamite (MMM)  There was a lot more but I can't remember anymore. The only one I wasn't so keen on was the cayenne albacore (this wasn't that great).   for $26 per person for dinner, this is a great deal especially because you can easily eat more than that value!
Me and the wife love this place. The food is excellent. Service is slow at times, but the All you can eat price makes up for it.

Oyshi is the closest AYCE sushi to my house, so I've been here quite a lot. Not my favorite place, but it's a solid option. The decor is very modern and trendy. They also play EDM music and have sports showing on the flat screens near the bar. All postitives in my eyes. I always sit at the bar, so the service is good. Normally I can just order directly from the sushi chef without waiting for a waiter. That really speeds up the ordering process. I can't speak to the service when seated anywhere else in the restaurant.  One disappointing thing about Oyshi is that it doesn't offer seafood salad on the AYCE menu. That automatically prevents it from a five star review in my eyes. On the bright side, the amount of fish on the nigiri sushi is ample. Very high fish to rice ratio. I also like the variety of desserts offered. You're not limited to the usual mochi or ice cream. Oyshi also offers creme brulee and a berry parfait. The berry parfait is my usual and it's a must have.

You have to come and experience one of the best all you can eat sushi bars in Las Vegas . People I am telling you that this is quality sushi .. Not cheap crap. QUALITY .. The appetizer menu is also available for all you can eat . It's the best ! I go nowhere else when I am in Vegas for All you can eat sushi .

All you can eat sushi was great! As well as the desserts. Great customer service. Even though it was busy our server made sure that we were happy with the service provided. The music makes it fun as well. I will definitely be going back!

First time ever that I have had all you can eat sushi this style. Why doesn't New Orleans have this?? All you can eat on the menu for around $21! This deal more than filled my stomach.   We started off with the grilled beef asparagus and baked green mussel. I love the beef that wraps around the asparagus which gives it a great taste to the asparagus. The sauce on the baked green mussel is also perfect.   Overall i had  a great experience. We ordered most of the special rolls on the menu. I will definitely come back whenever I am back in town!

The food was not memorable but the service was, for all the wrong reasons: server forgot or "forgot" to put our order in, so half the table got food while the other half waited.  She did this repeatedly.  We were on a business meeting so our group didn't notice as much, but still, come on.  This was just as bad as the last time I went.  Probably will be the last time I ever go.  There are a lot of great sushi joints in this part of town.  Don't need to come back here again.  Good luck to you guys!

BS +++  I WANT SOME POKE!!!! (If you are Pinoy say it out loud lol).  Sushi for days! I can't rave about this place enough.  From the staff, to location, to the damn-bomb-food.  Legit sushi spot without the "fusion" stuff a lot of restaurants are trying to push.  If it's sushi make it sushi.  Stop changing it Vegas!! First, hats to the sushi masters for doing it right.  Amazing kitchen staff that keeps getting challenged and dishing food out.  I ordered a lot today (mainly the spicy tuna and salmon variety).  I was impress of the portion and consistency.  I will definitely come back here.  I challenge any big eater to come here.  $27 per person for dinner is a steal considering  some of these dishes will cost you $15 a roll.  The parking area is a bit packed and this place seems busy.  Come at night!  PROPS TO OUR WAITRESS!  * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage). Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

Pros: Tiger roll was tasty but not crunchy enough Cons: They do not offer half rolls on AYCE Dragon roll sucked Baked salmon was dry Sizzling chicken teriyaki dry & not enough teriyaki No crispy rice on menu No berries on the 'BERRY' parfait Crème brûlée took forever to come out Check was presented before dessert as server had forgotten we had ordered it Slow water refills  Overall poor service and mediocre food  Will not be returning to this location

I came here with some co-workers after a recommendation from a friend.  The chefs are so funny and the atmosphere is really friendly.  I tried the Red Dragon roll and the Caterpillar roll- so delicious.  The best part: their dipping sauce. I have no idea what their sauce is made out of because it's sweet and it has sesame seeds in it.  Although their AYCE was a little pricey, it's worth it.  Savor every bite when you go!

Came here on Super Bowl Sunday with some family for a late lunch (around 2pm) so it wasn't that busy. I heard good things about this place so I was eager to try. I loved the modern, spacious atmosphere inside. Our waiter (Ray) was very courteous and overall service was nothing to complain about. I went for the AYCE and was not disappointed. For nigiri I got several orders of salmon and halibut. I can't describe how fresh it all tasted. The sashimi just melted in my mouth which I can't say has happened before so I knew this place was the real deal. I also got the salmon avocado hand roll which was also quite good. The last thing I got was the Yellowtail Trio roll which also tasted very fresh and flavorful. Of course I couldn't leave without dessert so I got the green tea creme brulee. Definitely coming back to try more dishes!

The lunch specials here are amazing!! The staff is always friendly and while they're always busy it's never too long of a wait for a seat. There is not a full bar so I docked it a star, personal preference really(not a beer drinker).

First of all, I'm a sushi chef.  I had the all you can eat here. For the fish, which you should always have first, was poor quality.  I gave that a 2.   As for the rolls if you like deep fried and spicy sauce all the way I gave it a 3.5 but it gets tiring real fast.  Many of the rolls where they say soft shell crab mix, only means 95% imitation crab mixed with 5% soft shell crab.  Was horrible.  Anyway I'm pretty sure if your not a sushi advocate then this place will be just as good for you, but I'm use eating good, real good so I'll give it an average rating of 3. The server was on point though.  Had to end it off with something nice i suppose.

I've never been to a sushi buffet like this before.  Normally, places like Todai, Onami (now Tora in San Diego) have it set up where you walk up to the sushi bar and the rolls are there waiting for you to pick them up, at the same time they have a hot plate station, as well as desserts.  Oyshi is totally different due to the fact that you choose from the menu what you would like from the buffet section and it is made fresh for you to munch on.  Sushi is not the only thing part of the buffet menu, there are the small appetizer sushi's as well as tempura vegetables.  The best part are the specialty rolls, they are so freakin delicious.  I can't remember each of their names, but the cajun specialty roll, and the whatever screaming whatchamacalit are so damn good!  The ambience is pretty stylish and nice and I give them more props for playing house progressive music as we dine.  The staff is uber nice, especially since we went in a massive group that was pretty loud and would have drove most servers bonkers d bobcat.  Definitely gonna want to come here again next time I make a trip back out to visit the family in Vegas.

I love this restaurant! I've been coming here since it first opened. I've never gotten food poisoning here but if I did I wouldn't turn my back on it. Sushi is sushi. If you order sushi raw then you're taking a risk for food poisoning. It goes for any sushi restaurant because it's raw. Even if handled properly. There's always that small percent... But customer service just needs a little improvement. Overall the food is great!!!

It's not my absolute favorite sushi or AYCE sushi restaurant, but it's good and the location is wonderful. If there's an AYCE option at a sushi restaurant, I always order it because the price equals 2-3 specialty rolls. It just doesn't make sense any other way. Besides specialty rolls, I like hand rolls (tuna, salmon, yellowtail) and certain appetizers depending on my mood. I wasn't impressed with their hand rolls and although their specialty rolls are good, they're not amazing either (I've had better counterparts at other AYCE restaurants). I really like their DOUBLE SCREAMING ROLL (without cream cheese) because the special sauce makes it unique. Their desserts are really good too. I like that they offer a PARFAIT that features ice cream, fresh assorted berries, and granola. Very good. On my most recent trip, I found out I could get Green Tea ice cream rather than Vanilla and it was even more amazing. The service is good and the food is usually quick. The only thing I really hate is the restaurant's lack of appropriate venting, so you end up leaving the place smelling like the inside of a fryer.
This is a decent place for AYCE. Price is reasonable. And the fish are mostly fresh. Not the best but I would go again.

Love, love, love this place! I was first brought to Oyshi by a friend and since then, I've been back  6 times with the same friend, other friends, and my boyfriend. It is now his favorite sushi bar in Las Vegas! Service is good, fish is always fresh, desserts are tasty, and the facility is gorgeous! They also consistently play my favorite songs.

This is my go to spot for AYCE sushi. I love their green tea tiramisu cake. The AYCE price isn't bad as well. The restaurant is clean and bigger than their rainbow location. Customer service is okay, i guess it depends on how slow or busy they get. Sometimes you have to wait 5-10 minutes in the waiting area before someone even acknowledges you and hence the 3 stars. They woulda gotten 4 but I don't know if the guy was just having a bad day or what.

Got HORRIBLE food poisoning here.   So did the whole entire birthday party that I was with. Ate here on a Thursday late night, and started what felt like an exorcism that Saturday. I had to miss work on the weekend which is my money maker and it SUCKED so bad! I've never called into work or left early in 7 years and this did it for me. I've never thrown up so much throughout the whole entire night and next couple days like I did from this place. Holy crap, I will never eat sushi for as long as I live ever again. Thanks for completely ruining it for me.   Please be careful here. They obviously screwed something up. But do they care? Probably not.
Mono was,awesome!!! He really made our experience great..he suggested a sake that was,exactly wat we were looking for. Loved it! We will b back! :)

I just recently discovered Oyshi Sushi, and my first experience was at their Rainbow location. The vibe was totally urban trend, great atmosphere and the sushi was excellent and fresh.  Today we tried the Sahara location, being that it was closer to our side of town. I regret not making the drive to Rainbow.   This Sahara location is very disorganized, dirty, no hot water in the bathrooms and the quality... well I have seen better technique at my local Smith's grocery. Sushi is all about the rice first, and this place must use Uncle Ben's Minute Rice.... microwave version. Please have some leadership behind the (sushi) bar and maintain quality. It's not far to ruin the brand name and possibly turn away business from your Rainbow location.    It is night and day between this location and Rainbow. Very sad that the consistency is so far off.   I regret wasting my sushi crave today on this place..  two thumbs down.

This sushi place is both mine and my husbands #1 choice! We are both huge sushi lovers, and have tried many sushi places and this is by far the best one. We start of by getting an appetizer each and 5-6 rolls and a dessert for each and our bill always comes out to less than $60! Def worth every cent! Music is great, staff very friendly the whole atmosphere makes us keep going back! Makes it very hard to want to try a new place.
This is the best sushi ever! The sashimi, sushi or rolls are to die for! Great service and great food. This is the place to go!
So me and my friend asked for water THREE TIMES AND NO ONE WOULD GIVE US ANY.  We've been seated for about 20 minutes and literally everyone got their drinks but us.

i am a very picky person when it comes to food. everyone i come here i am pleased. every bing is made perfectly right. the all you can eat prices are very reasonable and the staff are exceptional. i will not go to any other sushi restaurant for sure. so if you're lothat's king for a great affordable all you can eat sushi restaurant, be sure to go here. :)

I was hoping for better quality sushi but unfortunately they cook the shrimp tempura in advance so it was cold in my roll. The service is good, my food came out really quick but at the sacrifice of quality. The sushi was mediocre at best, nothing to brag about or ever the need to come back.

My family is a big fan of sushi. My daughter and I can live on sushi everyday! Oyshi is a wonderful neighborhood sushi restaurant. It's not a very big place, so be prepared to wait for a table, especially at dinner time!  Oyshi is our favorite AYCE restaurant. Lunch is $22, and dinner is $27 for ages 12 and over.  Lunch $16, dinner $19 for under 12. Beverage is not included in the price. Be aware that party of 6 or more an 18% gratuity will be automatically added to the bill.  I almost always order the Miso soup. It's very light on flavor but very comforting to eat. The Fresh Oysters are very fresh, served with refreshing salsa! Only 2 pieces per person in the AYCE dinner only! At lunch they charge dinner price for them. You can order unlimited items from the appetizers. Love their Baked Oysters! Easy to pick from the shells because they are separated and halfway cut. The Shrimp Tempura is lightly covered and not grease, served with dipping sauce. My newest discovery is the Yakitori (2 skewers per order). I love the Shrimp and asparagus! Seriously, I can eat a whole plate of that! My other favorite item is the Japanese Lasagna. I make sure to order it all the time. I believe Oyshi makes them the best! Everyone's favorite is the Monster! Spider roll with shrimp tempura, topped with baked eel and avocado, with eel sauce. Bonsai: spicy tuna roll with Cajun albacore and avocado on top. Sexy: yum-yum scallop, cream cheese and crunch flakes inside, topped with eel tempura, with wasabi mango and eel sauce. My BF really likes the Crunch Scallop: Oyshi scallop, crab mix and avocado with popcorn scallops on top, with wasabi mango and eel sauce.  After eating all these food, I always wonder, how much more a person can eat? Well, we always get dessert, too! My absolute favorite is the Mango Mochi (ice cream wrapped in rice dough). The Green Tiramisu is very tempting, too! I really liked the green tea flavor in it! It's a house made tiramisu cake infused with green tea. My daughter's favorite is the Vanilla or Green tea ice cream.  Service is always very attentive! Our iced tea is always refilled!  Happy to return anytime!

Me and Jessie B. wanted to try someplace new so we ended up here. And boy were we glad we did! The service was top notch and the rolls were huge and yummy!! The price was great as well for lunch..I think it was 21 bucks! They have a full bar but we came for the sushi. And I am sure we will be back soon.

After driving by this sushi place many, many times I finally decided it was a good night for take out-i ordered a veggie roll and Alaskan roll.......very disappointed...the Alaskan roll was mainly all rice, hardly any salmon, a sliver of asparagus and a smidge of avocado.  Won't be going back
This is my favorite sushi spot!service was very good. Food was very tasteful love the whole atmosphere not over crowded drink were on point . I'll be back with friends and family

The restaurant is styled really cool, it has a few different styles but not too much going on. While having an open floor plan but still having your privacy In-between each table. Our waiter was awesome and super laid back. We got along right off the bat and he was able to tell the bartender to make a whiskey sour although It wasn't on the drink menu. The waiters name is Kenny, he was really understanding after the over servers brought out the wrong food, and forgot to bring out some of the rolls we ordered. He was willing to not include it on the bill on his behalf, with no questions or hassle making us feel really relieved that we didn't have to try and finish these extra rolls that we didn't like nor order. Don't get me wrong the food is amazing, but there are some things I'm not interested in but every time I come I'm never disappointed in what I order.

We ended up leaving without eating. Walked in and stood at the hostess area with no hostess. A server acknowledged us and then a few minutes later another server slowly came over and slowly as though she were drunk or had no idea what to do with us started gathering Menus.  She took us to the upper section where nobody was sitting.  I've had a bad experience with service here so we were weary to sit up there.
