We asked if we could sit in another section and I guess that was an inconvenience.  We ended up leaving.  They weren't friendly at all.  They were even laughing at us when we left! I don't care if the food is good! I'll never spend my money there again!

Food is always fantastic. However the floor management is very poor. It is frustrating to stand and wait at the door when only 2 seats are occupied at the bar and half the tables. Then to be sat at the bar 15 minutes later and all seats are still open. They either do not have enough servers or just poor table management. Whoever owns this restaurant needs to spend more time to see the flow of service and the dissatisfaction of the guests. Our server was very good by the way.
AYCE for the win! With some beer and good company, it'll be a great meal for any occasion.

OMG OH MY GOODNESS.... the best of the best Sushi. We have tried so many places be our best Sushi guy left us for Hawaii so we are trying to capture the same experience and let me tell you. Their Sushi is just the same the best. Made with love. Fresh as fresh can be. Atmosphere is amazing and you have to sit at the bar. The guys are great. So if you are looking for a damn good Sushi place you must try Oyshi!!! Hands Down. The only bad thing I can say as of right now they don't have Green Tea ice cream. But the food take the cake on that which I am okay on it. So be sure and try this amazing place you will love it!!!!

I loved this place. The food was excellent and the service was great. I went there with my wife and mother and 3 kids. It was the day after Mother's day since my dear wife had to work on Mother's day.  We loved pretty much every thing that we ordered. Now like all the all you can eat places in Vegas you can order sashimi but only as sushi and they make you eat everything.  Still at 25 dollars a person and 20 for kids it was well worth what we paid.  If there was one negative it was that at such a small place they still added 18% gratuity onto the bill. I would have tipped much more than that if they didn't add it.  We really loved the Lobster Fair and the Las Vegas Roll. Especially the Las Vegas since it didn't have any rice.  I do think that the staff needs better training. Although they were sweet and charming they did mess up a couple of times on the order. But we did order a lot and there were at least 3 people ordering. I guess I wouldn't have done as well as they did.

I absolutely love this place! I'm not a fan of sea food but my husband is so we come here often. He always gets the unlimited sushi and I get the sizzling steak plates! Great atmosphere and great service!

I wasn't sure what to expect and struggled with deciding to go with the all you can eat option as I'm a small girl. Well...it was a great decision! All of the rolls are amazing, particularly the Oyshi roll and then you can change it up with a sizzling plate of skirt steak or some veggie tempura. Yum!

I had ordered the sashimi dinner and a Japanese lasagna. The most disgusting sashimi I had ever tasted. If you want real good sashimi I would HIGHLY recommend Sushi Ko. THEY HAVE THE BEST SASHIMI!! Even though their prices are a bit higher than Oyshi Sushi, it is definitely worth it. And don't even get me started with the miso soup. It was so watery and had no flavor AT ALL. I had to throw most of my food away because it was that bad. Honestly a waste of my money.

My experience at Oyshi was pleasant. I thought the staff was courteous and got all of our orders right.   We had all you can eat and I enjoyed pretty much everything I ate. We ate AYCE so we had to pace ourselves or else you will get charged for wasted food.  I would start with the salad and calamari (2 dipping sauces) Some things that I really enjoyed were the Surf and Turf (good steak and grilled shrimp) dynamite roll and monster roll. For dessert I always enjoy a classic creme brûlée. The berry parfait was a berry ice cream Sundae and that was nice too. Only thing I was ehhh about for dessert was the green tea tiramisu cause it tasted like a heavier creamed cake with a very buttery taste.   Overall I thought it was a nice location with nice atmosphere. Service was fine and good was good. Would I say that is the best sushi place in town? Not quite but I am not disappointed and I would come back again.
Loving this place. I used to cone at the Rainbow location but here is even better. Sushi is great and service is quick . Will come back .

Best place to go to pig out on fresh sushi....I don't get the negative reviews,,,,,been here several times always good, never got sick,,,rather go here than thanksgiving turkey We took a friend and he was amazed that there was so much variety...I guess he played it safe before with California rolls and never had "sushi" or sashimi.  Trust my Japanese relatives being an Aryan....Try the fish collar if you want an upgrade

I went to Oyshi Sushi for a team lunch. Oyshi Sushi is a nicely decorated sushi restaurant in the downtown area. There were nine of us, but the staff was friendly and able to accommodate us. We ordered from the lunch menu.  I ordered the salmon bento box. The food was very good and the portion was very large. Everybody seems to enjoy their food.  Would we go back? Yes, because the food is good and staff is friendly.

All you can eat sushi! I'm in. Come hungry. Reasonable price. Nice staff. The baked mussels are divine. Loved the Japanese Lasagna roll. Oysters. Don't get me started. Yum. Just remember, if you can't finish it, you pay full price on it.

Oyshi!!! Arigato gozaimasu!!!!!!!!!  Best AYCE!  Super fresh!  Best service from our server, Iris!!! (Belated Happy Birthday!!!)  From beginning to end our experience exceeded my every expectations.   I love love love the sushi!!!   We will definitely come back when we are in town.
This place has some of the best sushi I've had. The prices are amazing for the quality of sushi you get. I love the staff they're so friendly and quick!

This is our go-to place for sushi. The AYCE is such a great value, especially during lunch. We love the nigiri sushi, ahi poke, shrimp tempura and their desserts. Their rolls are usually pretty good but I usually go with my husband and he's not big on rolls so it's harder to finish it on my own. The nigiri sushi allows us to order more variety. Their cocktails are also really good. They have cocktail specials during the week. They're also known for their sizzling platters.
Amazing food and service! Some of us went for the AYCE and wow! Didn't have to wait long for the food to start coming even though the places was packed. A must bust in Vegas!
Great food, I always come for their all you can eat sushi. The rolls out of this world, my go to sushi place, it does get busy sometimes though.
Quality sushi! Friendly staff and excellent service! Helpful and not too fast but very efficient!

I have visited this place a totally of 3 times and this last visit on Saturday March 11th around 7:00pm will be my last! First off I'm a manager at a retail store and customer service is a must!! So from the jump I should of know to leave and let me tell you why, it was a busy night for them obviously being a Saturday night which is totally understandable but after i proceed to put my name down,  I headed to the bathroom while in the bathroom i found myself having to listen to one of the front hostess in the bathroom on the phone cussing, crying, saying how she hates her job and the manager and so on and so on... sad part is after i came out the stall the young girl (she was the short dark hair fake lashes and could of been Mexican but look like she had some Asian in her)  just looked at me while continuing her rant. So feeling uncomfortable i went to the front to ask for the manager and just my luck she had walked up, i told her about the incident and she said she would go see the situation and figure out who the employee in the bathroom was. After that happen we were told 45min wait time which turned in to more than an hour wait again understand its busy just make sure you are telling customer the right wait times then. So as we waited to be seated the ball of sunshine aka the girl that hates her job was the one to seat us which again her attitude came out..... while she just turned from the desk and looked at me and said You can come this way with the rudest tone and attitude.. last time i checked most places call you by name or greet you by your name before taking you back to the table. But of course not her. Then as the food started coming out the quality was horrible, sushi taste old and fishy, not worth the price they are charging. So needless to say i will not be returning here anytime soon and i hope the owner or someone higher up see this because even after the manager knew the hostess had an attitude and everyone could tell she did, the manager should of pulled her aside and talked to her or sent her home especially being the first person your customers interact with, i wouldn't think that is the type of person you would want as a hostess.

Came in on a Friday afternoon with some friends for some drinks and sushi. It's January 1 and surprisingly not busy. Despite of having a few customers, we still had to wait a long time for food. On top of that I also ordered a bottle of Asahi and sake. It took them 45 min to serve drinks that suppose to be the easiest thing to do. I've eaten here before and the service was way different from what I experienced. Really disappointed in the overall outcome of dining here. I couldn't give the place a half a star for some reason so I settled with one.

As of now, we have been waiting for 2 rolls as of 15 minutes ago. I decided to write the review and time myself until it gets to my table. The food tastes great, great quality, inside looks hip. But alas, my food is taking a WHILE. I waited 5 mins to post... 20 mins total for a rattle snake and a chicken teryaki roll.
My favorite all-you-can-eat sushi in town. Delicious, fresh, and great service. Fun atmosphere. Love the sizzling plates and their tiger roll.
Came for the 2nd time and it was even better than the first. Great food and the service today was the best I've had in a sushi restaurant.  Will be back soon.
Chef ed Super sexy motherfucker... that can make a great chefs special. Great service and fresh sushi! Definitely  recommend to family and friends...

Difficult to find a decent sushi restaurant in the financial district and harbourfront.  However, Oyshi Sushi provides good service and food, in a cozy, casual setting.    I have been here for lunch with colleagues during the week and I definitely suggest making reservations as it has always been full.  Dinners usually cater to people like myself, who live in the area.   The restaurant itself is very small with traditional Japanese decor.  There are a couple curtained private booths, a few tables, and there is seating at the sushi bar.   The portions are good, and the quality of both the raw and cooked foods have not yet left me disappointed.   Happy to have found this somewhat hidden gem in my neighbourhood to satisfy my regular sushi cravings.

Such slow service! There were 6 empty tables and we waited 20 minutes just to get seated. On top of that we had to wait another 15 minutes for someone to come get our order. And when our server finally got to us, she stopped us abruptly and we didn't even finish ordering. Horrible service.

So food was decent but our server ( fat dude with a beard ) was the slowest server i ever had. I wanted to order so i called him and he said just one second, after 20 minutes i had to call him again. He even walks slow. I understand that it was busy but him not coming and walking slow makes me never want to come back here. I wish i had a different server. If anybody is reading this and coming here, make sure to avoid the table he is serving. I hope the management take action.

Went for AYCE lunch today.  $22/pp.  Was there with 6 others.  I gotta say that I have eaten AYCE in many places and in many states, and this by far is rated at the bottom of my list.  The only reason for 2 stars is good service from the waiter, and good green tea ice cream.  Sometimes the ice cream can be a turnoff too, but not here.  The fish was horribly fishy and tasted old.  I grew up on an island and know fish pretty well...this fish thumbs down.  I had tuna, salmon, octopus, albacore, and the treasure.  I had to choke it down.  Under normal circumstances, I would have 3-4 rolls, and about 10 orders of nigiri, with sides of apps.  When I arrived, I was not greeted by any staff, but was looked at by about 5 of them.  I was standing right by the "Wait to be seated" sign, and nothing.  Nothing from even the sushi chefs (who also looked right at me.)  I even had 2 staff walk in right pass me coming to work I guess.  I am told that they have another restaurant on Sahara/Tenaya.  Well sorry to say, I will not be going to either one.  If you are in the area and need sushi, go to 808 Sushi or SOHO.  Better food and better prices.
Went there for the AYCE and the food was really great. They even made something for my vegetarian girlfriend. Service was good too. Overall, had a great experience..

First time here and was good. Ayce for lunch contains a lot of items. They don't have gluten free soy sauce. I had the usual stuff and was good. Little too much rice for me. I ended up taking some off was just too much. Japanese lasagne was the best thing on the menu

Hostess had a horrible attitude. If the restaurant advertises that it is supposed to close at a certain time, they should stay true to it. My party walked in at 9:45pm when there were still about 5 tables in the restaurant. The restaurant is supposed to close at 11:00pm. The hostess with a look of disgust on her face says "we're closed" with no further explanation. Having this memory of this place will always leave a bitter taste in my mouth.  I've eaten here before and I can honestly say service is pretty bad and the food is not that amazing. The fish quality is poor and the food is far from special.  The oysters were enjoyable but are not on the AYCE menu.   SOHO on Jones is my go to Sushi spot in town! (Although it is not AYCE, the food is of high quality and they have an amazing happy hour and it always comes out to be the same price as doing AYCE for me).
Best AYCE in Vegas for low carb.  Rib eye appetizer and Sibuya not fried.  Keep them coming!!!!  Great service too and the best sushi chef Pedro!!!!

Some buddies of mine and myself came here today and we all got the AYCE. We all left pretty satisfied with what we ate.  As with any group that is doing AYCE, we got to try a lot of the menu through coordinating orders and sharing with each other. From the appetizer section, to the desserts, everything we had was pretty tastey.   Some highlights were their surf and turf roll, fried gyoza, sweet shrimp nigiri and fried heads, eel nigiri, tamago nigiri, salmon belly nigiri, cajun albacore nigiri, and their baked mussels.  The only real low points with the food was that the super white tuna wasn't that good, and each person could only have two orders of their awesome baked mussels.   The service from the staff was top notch. While it took awhile to get our food a couple of times when the restaurant got full and busy, the servers and what we assumed was the floor manager always made sure to check on our orders and help get stuff to our table. The floor manager even took our order a couple of times, cleared our table, and refilled our drinks on more than one occasion. The staff there was firing on all cylinders and was really attentive.   This was my second time coming here, and I really enjoyed the food and service again. I definetly will be coming back, and with more people. I would recommend coming to this place.

Great service and super fast. We had a raptors game to attend and they served us super fast even tho they had a few other customers.   Sushi tasted fresh and the teriyaki chicken was amazing.  I got the salmon dome(I think) and it was great. I will visit again for sure.

This little sushi treasure is not at all far from my home right down Rainbow. They have one of the largest sushi menus I have seen in Las Vegas and every roll on it is a winner in my book. It has been a while between when I went and when I am posting the review so I don't recall any specific roll names, I just know everything we ate, was excellent. The atmosphere is awesome and on the wknds they are open late. We love this place and are soon to be regulars.

Every time I come here, I leave feeling disappointed. Today was no different.   I have been here on numerous occasions because this is where my friends want to go; ok, whatever.  We always come for AYCE dinner and the wait is always really long even with reservations.   Once we are seated, it usually takes them a couple minutes to get our drinks and then a while long for our orders. We are so aware of their efficiency, or lack thereof, we would write down on a piece of paper of what we want and then just hand it to them. Kudos to us!   The food would always take forever to arrive and the hot dishes are always what come out first. I never understand that since raw fish simply needs to be sliced and plated... Unless they wanna fill us up with the cheap stuff first...? Hmmmmmmm.   And once the food arrives, they are always subpar or mediocre. Nothing ever wows my husband and I.   Overall, service is extremely slow. This should be a french japanese fusion restaurant in the sense that it's gonna be a three hour meal eating japanese food. The food is mediocre. The price is not spectacular. I would never come back if I can help it.   Oh, it's the same slowness at lunch, by the way. Most items on the menu is around $10-$12. The non sushi dishes came out first for my group today and halfway through their meal, my sushi bowl came out - mediocre yet again.   That was my last straw; I am going somewhere else.

I feel anguish writing this because we loved Oyshi so much. My kids ask for it all the time, especially their birthdays. We have been to this location at least monthly since it opened, at around $100 a pop. But in the last six months the service has gone from decent to TERRIBLE. We just waited 40 minutes after being seated to order entrees. Forgot the miso. Have you ever been so angry that you just had to leave without even getting the entree? That is right now. Just there a few weeks ago and they forgot to bring my dinner until after everyone was finished eating, and brought the miso with the freaking check. The time before that, they totally forgot my tempura vegetables side order. I don't know if they need to fire these servers, train them better or if the managers are assigning the tables in a way that makes it so that they only come to your table every 30 to 40 minutes... But something needs to change. Tl/Dr: excellent food... if they remember to take your order or bring it to you.

So we have been to Oyshi several times for different occasions. Great place to go when casual or if you want to get dressed up for date night. We love the all you can eat menu.  Many options and the mochi is the best dessert.

AYCE Sushi for $26?  Ladies nights I think is Thurs after 10PM...for $21?  How do you beat that?  Well, with good sushi of course!  The amount of items you can pick off of the AYCE menu are aawesome...  You can get oysters, poke, and all of the sushi you want...of course, Sashimi doesn't count, but hey, get it all.  I like how you can pick a lot of the sides in the AYCE menu as well, particularly the seaweed salad, and the oysters...    VERY good value, good quality food, fresh sushi, and a good atmosphere to boot.  Only thing is that service can get a little non-attentive, but they're serving everyone pretty much everything, so just make sure you check up on the many things you order.

compared to the sushi buffets in LA, ive gotta give oyshi 3 stars. the 2 things that trumps LA's sushi buffet is they serve seaweed salad and you get dessert at the end! main reason why it doesnt beat LA's sushi buffet: fish isnt as fresh and no sashimi!  what i recommend: seaweed salad, tempura, tofu appetizer, mango mochi icecream, green tea tiramisu, eel & avocado hand roll  the raw fish itself is alright, it's not that fresh...i would rate it 7/10

Went back to Oyshi last Monday and the place was packed. A Little surprised but expected knowing this place is pretty popular. Anyway, did the AYCE again, but I ordered the Kami Kaze and NYI rolls. Word of warning, these things were HUGE. I thought the AYCE portions suppose to be smaller than the regular order. If this is smaller order, I'm afraid to ask what their regular size would be. These two rolls came out near the end of our meals and we were kinda full by that time already, so trying to stuff those two rolls down was a challenge. Next time, I won't order this roll unless I have 2 or 3 people to split it with. Anyway, the reason I reduced one star on this trip is that the sushi wasn't as fresh as my previous trip there. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't exceptional fresh either. I heard from some review, not sure if it's for Oyshi or Kobe, that it might be due to the fact that fish delivery comes on Tue, Thu and Sat.
Two thumbs up. Our new go to ayce sushi place in Vegas. Best and freshest tuna. Rolls amazing!!! Creme Brule to too off great dinner. We will definitely be back!!!

My boyfriend and I tried this place recently because we were getting tired of our regular spot and we loved it! the service was quick and friendly and their AYCE menu had lots of great options. We had a few rolls, as well as oysters, a seaweed salad and tons of nigiri sushi. It was all fresh and delicious and came out promptly. I think we've found our new favorite spot! As much as we love our old place it really is hard to find a good sushi place that also gives good service but this place has both!
Food is really good the only reason why I took off one star is because there service really really sucks at times! I get so surprised if they actually are doing well.

I can't give this place a 4 or 5 because the last time my friends and I went here the service was horrible...especially coming from a certain female server. She was slow with our orders and kind of stand-offish. I understand if you are having a bad night but don't ruin it for the customer.  Other than that, the food is great and I have never had any problems with it. The all-you-can-eat price is worth it especially if you know you are going to eat more than one roll including appetizers.  The ahi poke can use a little bit more pieces of tuna instead of being drowned in daikon and seaweed but it is still good.

Great sushi spot. My husband and I have been here a couple times. The food is great. I would recommend going during lunch before the dinner rush or you'll be waiting for 30-40 mins before being seated.   Customer service from "some" servers need to be re-evaluated or re-trained being that "Las Vegas" is a number one place of customer service (personal opinion)  Other than that it's a great restaurant, definitely one in our books for a eating spot with friends.

I had a couple issues eating here. 1) if you do not want AYCE, there is no al a carte menu. 2) I told the waiter $20 cash and the rest on the card (he used my card first and gave me $9 back in cash). Overall the service was okay and our waiter was kind. He also gave us complimentary salmon with pico de gallo that the chef wanted everyone to try. The sushi we ate was not the best I have ever had. If anything it was bland. I found that there was no unique sushi rolls that would keep me coming back. The only thing I did love, however, is the green tea creme brûlée (must try!!!).

(I'm a Chef) This place was recommended to me by two people whom i will never, ever take seriously again when it comes to food.      Plus all the people that say this place is their favorite.. I feel like they are all clueless about food.. the service was ok but everything else was terrible..    Mochi- tasted like it came straight from sams club.. its filled with sugary nasty goup instead of ice cream.  Ribeye-the beef is most definitely the worst cut of beef you can buy..  indistinguishable from wal mart beef no flavor.. no fat.. terrible thick cuts.. what the hell are they serving it for.. but beef that you would use with teriyaki or take it off the menu.. its not Ribeye!  all the crab is fake.. which is typical for sushi places but this imitation crab again tasted like sams club crap..   Tuna.. i don't know what is up with that tuna but I've had a lot of sushi and this tuna tasted like it had been frozen thawed, frozen, thawed, frozen and thawed.. thats the only way i can describe the taste and texture... plus the poke..  Poke isnt really poke.. there was 3 pieces of tuna in it.. rest was seaweed, and cucumber... don't call it poke.. i love poke.. i came here because i was told the poke is great... this was not poke.. and if it was it was the worst poke I've ever had.  Service was good.. Sushi chefs were great..  food is crap.

Found this place using the Yelp mobile app (so glad I did) - they have an all-you-can-eat menu, plenty of specialty rolls, and the tempura is awesome!   Went with a big group of friends and everyone seemed to enjoy what they had. I got a spicy tuna handroll (yum) and one of the specialty tempura rolls which was also good. Service was a bit slow (hence the -1 star) but otherwise everything else was enjoyable!

been here several times. 1st time was for my 24th birthday. they dont take reservations, which was hard to plan out with 18+ people, but they were able to accommodate all of us, and the people who trickled in late. for the amount of people we had, the service was great! they even gave me a small bottle of hot sake on the house for waiting :]  the foods always been consistent every time i've come back. im not too big on the rolls (although there are a few i like). i get my fill on the hot items and appetizer items. they've added salad bowls and rice bowls as well.  favorites: poke, seaweed salad, oysters (dinner only), ribeye (its not a complete meal if i dont order at least 5 orders for myself), hamachi, salmon, and a few others.   i only rated a 4 because service is never consistent. we sat at the bar one night, and had excellent service from our server (again, the name escapes me. i should really write these down!). another time, a group of maybe 9 or 10 of us went in for lunch, and if i remember right they were short handed at the sushi bar. hot food items came out before rolls did, and half of our groups didnt come out until the end of the meal (after asking servers several times about our food. the disappointing part was the table next to us got their food way before we did, and they sat well into half of our meal).   this place is definitely a must try, if you've never been. but a regular spot? probably not. as a college student, its hard to pay $30 (including tip) for one meal as often as i'd like to. but when i do have some extra money, i will definitely be back!

Lousy service, mediocre food, dry saba, had to ask for tea 3x, no half rolls, "tip" already added into the final bill, too cold in the side room and no way to adjust.   Why did I ever come here more than once?

I'd been here about 5 times and I love the amazing all you can eat sushi they have here!  The fish is always fresh. I love their variety of  rolls,  appetizers, and dessert.  The price is decent for quality and amount of food you get. There usually is a wait I never had to wait more than 30 minutes, and I learn to go earlier or later then the rush hour times. The waiters/waitresses aren't attentive like in other reviews.  But then again, some Asians don't tip well, so I guess you don't need to tip them as much as other restaurant you normally go to.

Love it here , the fish is so fresh (surprising ) considering its in Vegas surrounded by the dessert . My friend and I are regulars and wouldn't go to any other spot   My favorite roll here is the sea urchin, ikara with quail egg and the spider roll  Price is very reasonable and well worth it for an all you can eat   Ed and Ryan are awesome !!!

They have some of the best rolls I have ever tried, but their nigiris aren't the best. Their fish probably isn't as fresh as some other places but it's still decent. Some of my favorite rolls from Oyshi are the Snow Mountain Roll & the Kamikaze Roll. Not bad for lunch for $21
Very fast service. Fair price. Great environment. Will come back

I really love this sushi place. I prefer this location over Sahara's usually, but when I came here for my 21st, I wasn't impressed with the service. Sitting at the bar, the only way they would do half rolls, some rolls I ordered didn't come and the service was slow. I will come back because it was probably an off day.
I love Oyshi, I usually go to the location off of Rainbow. The service here is a little slower than the other one and it's not as personal. But such wonderful sushi at a reasonable price of ayce.

Oyshi was one of my favorite sushi restaurants until my most recent visit. When my family, and I arrived we waited six minutes to me seated there was no host so a waiter finally came to us and asked how many where in are group. It took the waiter over ten minutes to take are order. My wife and I order all you can eat sushi, we told the waiter which rolls we wanted to eat first that order took twenty minutes to arrive at my table. When we finished that order we had to ask a bus person to hunt down are waiters to place another order of sushi. We ended up spending over two hours eating sushi not because we ate so much but because it took for ever to place orders and to receive it. The sushi is not all good as I remember it being in the past I will not be going back.

Oyshi used to be one of my favorite binge eating locales, however the last time I went was an utter letdown.   What differentiated Oyshi from other "All-you-can-eat" sushi spots was the quality of the fish. What used to be fresh, now looks and tastes old. Basically, all of the nigiri sushi was disgusting; uni being the worst.   The cooked food is still good (hence two stars instead of one), but its "All-you-can-eat SUSHI", not "All-you-can-eat-tempura-edamame-teriyaki-skewers".   Would I go back? Probably not. I'd rather spend $5 more and go to a real buffet like the M Resort. At least you know the sushi is going to be sub par there and gravitate towards the other entrees.

Hands down my favorite All You Can Eat sushi in Las Vegas. Always enjoy myself here with the friendly service and excellent rolls. The nuclear bomb roll is so delicious if you like your rolls more on the spicy side. I also love how I can finish off my meal with a Creme brûlée, which is included in the all you can eat.

ok i think i've mastered the art of the AYCE menu here now. lol  not sure why but the meal i had last night seemed to be better than my other visits. maybe because i didn't over order this time which i tend to do.  btw you may be wondering why i keep coming back here if i'm so unhappy with the service... it's because it's so close to where i stay.. and my friends like it and good company makes everything better.  so last night we started with some appetizers while we waited for a couple other friends to arrive. once they came we ordered rolls.. then continued with nigiri.. and finished off with dessert. a few appetizers were thrown in here and there.. and this strategy definitely worked.  stars of the night:  house salad: i really liked their dressing.. it was kinda a peanut ginger-y dressing. super refreshing and a decent size. it can definitely be shared  baked green mussels: not too fishy tasting and the sauce on top is super creamy and delicious  oysters: max order is 1 per person which comes with 4 oysters... tasty!   sexy roll: i believe it has fried unagi on top with yum yum scallops inside and a creamy mango sauce on top... my favorite of the night.  agedashi tofu: their version is really tasty. the tofu itself stays crisp on the outside even after its been sitting there for a few minutes.. and the sauce is perfect.. not bland at all  premium spider roll: with avocado and cream cheese and possibly unagi on top. cant remember but it was deeeelicious!  service was ok in the beginning but really began to slow down as it got busy. we were seated in the area sectioned off to the side so it was easy to forget about us.. and we sure felt forgotten at times.   as for dessert they were out of mochi the last time we were there.. this time they didnt have the strawberry. ooo my friends were super disappointed :(  tip: monday and tuesdays they have a 2 for 1 house sake special :)

Oyshi sushi is a wonderful and spacious environment to spend time with friends. Their croquette with mustard and donkatsu sauce was diving. Our server mikey is fun and very attentive. My boyfriend ordered all the spicy rolls off of the all you can eat and he reports that they are spicy and good. Great features for all you can eat which include poke and they also have buy one get one free sake! Craving sushi? Come here            It's my second time here and the food is amazing as always. The seared garlic salmon seems smaller than before but maybe it is a smaller plate. The sushi is always fresh and the sake is delicious, ayce is an amazing deal. Our server Chloe is amazing and has friendly service as well as being very attentive. I will be coming back for the delicious sushi and wonderful service.

Cool set up. Solid basic sushi rolls. I didn't try too many of the more complex options. Amigo roll was good. Tasty hamachi nigiri. Great berry vanilla dessert. Had AYCE. Will try again. Prefer Kaizen etc

Food was amazing but what really put the cherry on top was the service. Our server Stefan was great. Our drinks were never under half way, he checked on us every few minutes to see if we needed anything, and had a great attitude. For sure coming back.

I went here for all you can eat sushi for dinner. It was really good. I got the lava roll and another spicy roll that I cannot remember the name of. Since I love spicy I loved both rolls! I went with my friend and he ordered a couple rolls which I tried and they were good too. I don't remember which ones because he ordered it. I also tried sriracha sauce which was reallyyy good as well. It was $35 for all you can eat which isn't too bad. I would love to come back and try more rolls. For dessert I got mango mochi-yum yum!   I liked the location because it was right around the corner from my house-its always nice to have a sushi place nearby for when you have cravings. :)

Dinged one star because this place always seems unnecessarily busy... It's pretty annoying when you're waiting for a table when there's four or more empty tables in the joint. Food is always great--standard sushi fare. I believe it's $27 for All You Can Eat dinner, also pretty standard.

Usually me and my family come here for sushi (AYCE) and today March 22 me and my girlfriend and sister came here (which they are visiting from a different state) and the service was terrible we were here for fifteen minutes and we were not even acknowledged! Than a larger table was seated next to us and got their drinks and orders before us! We have got served different food orders that weren't ours 7 times over the course of one meal! We had 2 waiters Johnny and some other guy with Gage's who were careless servers and no one here had a good positive vibe. It took an hour for a miso soup a seaweed salad and 4 rolls to come out when it wasn't even busy. We complained than we got our check which said the drinks were voided which was nice but than she reprinted another which voided $6 instead of $3 big whoop...Don't go here I don't recommend it!

Just discovered this place thanks to a coworker. Great vibe, great food and decent prices. I have o admit I don't do all you can eat, however the deal was too good to pass up. Will definitely be back!

Overall always a good experience.  I'm always ok with coming out here every time someone suggests even though I don't live near by.  They have a good selection that is diverse.  Service is nothing to write about but I'm always satisfied that they get everything to me in a timely fashion.  If there is anything I can  say about this place is that I'm a fan and would always want to come out here if it is suggested.

Not a bad place,  food is great. And staff is helpful and professional.  I will be returning to this place in the near future.  All you can eat, is the bomb,  and for not a bad price.  My first time here but it won't be my last.

This place is the perfect example of why I stopped going to AYCE sushi bars.  Lot's of our orders never showed up and the ones that did took forever. the Quality of the food  =   . I should have known better

Love this place!  All you can eat sushi for $20, but they also have lunch specials on things like rice bowls and delicious salads!  I love that everything I eat there tastes fresh and finishes clean!    A high quality restuarant with a muted, classy feel to it :)

I've been to Oyshi a couple times and have never left satisfied! The fish quality was not all that great, the rice was too wet for my taste & the service was quite slow! Also the stools at the sushi bar were being really weird and kept sinking down for some reason.. Maybe I'll give them another try..  MAYBE ! Haha

I wish there were separate rating sections: Rolls were not as tight as they should/could be- very sloppy though taste was still outstanding and fresh. My waiter was great, attentive but not pushy nor lacking attention. However!!!!!! My biggest complaint is with the "supervisor" whom was conducting the business like the Soup Nazi from that Seinfeld episode.  Firstly, it wasn't busy at all, I have issues from the military and a long career working with criminals so I asked for a corner with a wall to my back. She immediately said "can I put you at the table in the middle".........wow!!!!!!!! Pull the sushi out of your ears and think about what I asked for. Then she proceeded to tell me once I was seated "it's ok THIs TIME since we aren't that busy, normally it wouldn't be"-  I told her frankly- "well I'm a veteran with PTSD so thank you for the exception"........ Waiter was great again btw!!!   I asked him if she was always that angry after she came in between me finishing my first round and waiting for round 2---- she asks "are you ok? You don't have food"........... now, I can see you might say she was just checking- but the way she did it, body language, tone of voice and previous interaction made me feel like I either had to have a constant stream of food coming, eating or I had to get out-   VERY UNENJOYABLE thanks to this lady!!!!!!  I always come to this location when in town, but now- I think I'll go to the one on Saraha-  much more relaxed atmosphere and don't have to feel rushed or like I can't relax and enjoy my

I've been here for lunch a handful of times just because it's nearby the office. The sushi is ok, but just ok. They tend to over-rice the nigiri and maki, which is my number one pet peeve at a la carte sushi places. It's not AYCE, I don't need to be tricked into consuming copious amounts of rice. The quality of the fish is pretty good and pretty flavourful in an ever-increasing world of bland, tasteless sushi. The service is really what sets this place apart. Friendly staff, attentive servers and fair price-lists keep this place full at lunch.

If you are a fan of the AYCE and westernized style sushi, you will really like this place.   1.  Service - 5 Stars - This place rocks with service. This is a key at the AYCE places as I think that they will automatically "pace" you with the limited staff and service. However, here, we had numerous people helping, providing us food, taking orders for additions and even the manager or owner (didn't get his name) came out to help.  Very, very nice.  2.  Ambiance - 5 Stars - I was kinda irritated as to why my pals were asking to meet way out here in the middle of where, and it was not a disappointment at all. The table set up is great, nice waiting area, very comfortable flow.  I felt very, very relaxed here and not rushed at all.....  3.  Food Quality - We ordered some real sushi like Amai Ebi with the fried shrimp heads and they were tasty. The Uni or sea Urchin was very flavorful and the texture was spot on.  Then, we had a bunch of westernized sushi that my pals ordered and while I cannot tell you what was in them and the conglomeration of sauces that hid the fish taste, I can tell you that as a food group, this stuff was pretty darn good. I wouldn't call it sushi, I would call it "chop suey sushi".  I give the food quality 4 stars.  4.  Pricing - For AYCE, the price is not bad 21 / 26 per person depending on lunch or dinner.  Many of my favorites don't qualify for AYCE, so I will be going back to clarify this as I did not pay this bill, and so I am not 100% positive. However, in reading the bill, the more traditional and higher quality stuff was not included.  I will check this as I may be wrong.  For now, I give this 4 star.  GK says, check it out!

Very disappointed with my last few to go orders here. This used to be my go to neighborhood sushi spot but sadly I won't be visiting any more. The service is decent but the sushi is just not as delicious as it used to be. My last to go order, the rolls were very heavily overloaded with rice, over cooked rice, so much that both rolls were falling apart as soon as I opened the to go box. I'm a sushi addict and I know that some places that offer AYCE overload the rolls with rice to fill you up but it's very disappointing when you are paying al a carte prices at $30 for 2 rolls and you have to pull so much rice off it and still can't enjoy it. I order to go from other places like Sawa, Ojah, Goyemon and Kyara and have never had this problem with them. Also, the shrimp tempura was mushy, the tuna didn't taste fresh... I could go on and on. Sadly wouldn't recommend Oyshi, plenty of other places to eat at.

The sushi is good for an all you can eat. The atmosphere is surprisingly comfortable. Originally I was going to give this place 4 stars, but the extras like rib eye and green tea tiramisu bumped me up to 5. The sushi is not the best, but it's pretty good, all you can eat, and only $26... Excellent value

I've been here many times and today the service was not so great! I had to remind our waiter that I had ordered something.  Food was good but ended being here for a little over 2 hours because  he always took long. Everyone else was great it was just our waiter. FYI I was upset because it wasn't that busy
The best sushi and value in Las Vegas. I highly recommend if you love great sushi and good service.

Came for a quick dinner & was craving sushi. Got seated at the bar right away. Sushi Chefs & entire staff are very friendly. I noticed they have A LOT of Chefs & restaurant staff, which is very good. We ordered some wine & raspberry sake. I liked my raspberry sake. Very fruity. We ordered the Lobster Affair (very yummy & had crunch topping), Heart Attack (spicy & decadent) & Oh my heart rolls (tasty). We truly enjoyed our food so much. We were very happy! The food came out fairly quick (than most places). The décor was really nice & modern. Overall food was great & staff were A++. This place never disappoints.

This was meh. Nothing great about it. The rolls were so small and the fish wasn't that fresh. Service was okay.. The server was getting annoyed because I said I didn't like eel sauce..which was difficult because almost every roll they have is smothered in eel sauce. Not going back

Very nice establishment kind of feels like you walking into a club to eat sushi about 30 bucks for the first 6 or so pages of the encyclopedia esque menu. They shout a loud Japanese greeting when you enter so be prepared to feel like Buddha himself with that welcoming there monster roll as well as the scallop crunch was delightful. Over all with a decent knowledge of where there fish come from and a menu that explodes off the menu  I might have found a new sushi stop here in Vegas.

This place is our go to sushi place! We have never had a bad experience here and will never stop coming here. My favorite roll is the Kamikaze roll and my fiance loves the spicy rolls. And the best part is that they have a lot of apps that my daughter cab enjoy and she sure does. Also another favorite roll is the crazy Philly which is good and crunchy. The customer service is great and I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for a great sushi place, because this one is definitely one of the best! Thanks for everything!
Great sushi. Never let's me down. Great service  Amazing sushi chefs  Looking forward to trying the Sahara location with my friend.   20% off lunch during happy hour 330-530pm

Horrible customer service, the sushi is frozen and not fresh, I asked kindly to replace the bad tuna for something else and they said I would have to pay for it, can't believe a place like this is still in business.

Sushi was okay. The rolls looked messy and the service not the best but our waitress was nice and helpful. The music was to loud and made having a conversation with my husband hard, not to mention we couldn't hear the wait staff. I would go again but not for dinner.

Love the all you can eat with a variety of options!! The staff is friendly, it's very comfortable, and I enjoy the atmosphere. The only flaw is I feel it took a long time for things to come out - but that meant I had time to digest in between rolls.. I really enjoyed the experience overall!!

This place is pretty cool! This is my second time and pretty impressed! The sushi was really good and creative and the sizzling meat dishes are off the hook! Nice vibe and for lunch the $10 special is way too much good stuff to eat!!
Very good sushi! Very fast & friendly service. Good price for all you can eat. IMHO, too many rolls with cream cheese. However, I will return! :-)

Bland tastebuds and strong stomachs: WELCOME.  I haven't had this place since the last time I got food poisoning.  But, after a good number of years, here I am. Again. With a stomach full of pain and a pocket less of money.  Waste of my time.  The service is ok.  But if the food was superb, I'd be ok with that.  The calamari tasted like batter and oil.  The sushi broke each time I picked it up.  The meat was subpar.  And everything in my insides hurt.  My girlfriend got instant diarrhea.  I'm holding myself together till I get home.  But I'm still waiting on our server to get back and pick up my check. It's been over 10 minutes.  Dislike!!!!  This place was a million times better when it first opened. Sad it's turned to this.

Yeah, the Husband and I are sushi snobs - at least we're upfront about it.  But when you're living in Vegas, the only way to go is to do AYCE, right?  After getting tons of recommendations for this place, we finally got around to seeing what the hype is all about.  All-you-can-eat dinner is $26/pp.  It was pretty busy on a Sunday night with a steady stream of customers (and large groups) coming in all night long.  Like Ned M. mentioned, the sushi rice is only okay...it could be better.  Perhaps that's what put us off already...we had to eat the rice and we weren't digging it.  We ordered lots of nigiri and found the fish to be okay too, some of it was mushy though.  As one friend mentioned, she wished the fish was a bit 'colder'.  Maybe we came on a bad night - but everyone is raving about the fish.  I'm also not too fond of 'sauce' added to my nigiri, and they added 'sauce' to a lot of my nigiri choices.    They do offer a wider selection of side items like Asian style skirt steak, ribeye steak teriyaki, etc.  And for this reason, one friend prefers coming here over other AYCE places.  I do like their version of agadashi tofu though.  Limitations on their menu include: * one order of uni and amaebi per person * limit one order of oysters on the half shell (4 pieces) per person * limit one order on desserts of creme brulee, mochi ice cream, berry parfait or green tea tiramisu (regular ice cream is AYCE though - plum, green tea, vanilla, and coffee)  Sitting at the sushi bar, service was pretty good.  The manager seemed like he was our main waiter and he was quite attentive.  We thought we were supposed to order our sushi from the sushi chef, but he asked the manager to take our sushi order instead.  He continued to take our orders throughout the night and refilled our beverages too.  There was a gap at one point where our tempura order was forgotten, had to be reordered again, and then had to be followed up on again before we got it.  I can see why this place is popular - there's definitely a mixed crowd and separate rooms for private parties.  The staff are busy and attentive and they definitely recognize the regulars.  They have a lot of rolls to choose from, something that we usually avoid.  Overall, we found Oyshi Sushi to be an average place for AYCE sushi.

Oyshi sushi came highly recommended from a buddy of mine back in Hawaii. He said the next time you're in Las Vegas you need to check out this place and that "I'll thank him later!" This place did not disappoint! This is hands-down now my favorite place for sushi here in Las Vegas!  There are ample parking in the strip mall. This is a very nice restaurant outside and inside. The restaurant is very elegant, spacious, with high ceilings. This location appears to be a new building so everything if fresh, new, clean ....  They have a very impressive array of sushi roll selections from your basic sashimi and nigiri sushi to their hand rolls and "signature" hand rolls! If you love sushi, I highly recommend ordering their signature hand rolls and other hand rolls!! Most of these selections are very exotic and unique! Nice combination and mixing of ingredients! The hand rolls were my favorites here!  Service is exceptional! They kept coming to see how we were doing, as well as making sure our drinks were topped off or didn't run low.  The next time you're in Las Vegas, take a drive away from the strip for some really fine hand-crafted sushi!  Oh, and did I forget to mention? Its all you can see for about $35! Even better! Yummy!

Okay so I've been to this location multiple times, before I had pretty bad service...however the new assistant manager was serving us this time and he was awesome. I believe he said he just got promoted to that position recently and it seems like whatever they are changing is working. The staff was super friendly and the kitchen was super fast! I went with my husband and 2 kids and we ordered all you can eat for us and for the kids we got chicken. At the end we ordered ice cream for all of us and he was so nice for no reason at all took the kids ice cream off the bill. I have absolutely not one complaint about the way they are running this restaurant and hope they continue to do so! We just had our 3rd kid and when I'm recovered we're definitely going back!
Cheap under cooked rice, bad oysters, terrible service... This isnt sushi... So disappointed. Tried 3 times just bc i live so close but the food and service gets worse and worse.
Oh yeah! My new & ONLY Sushi spot! Bomb rolls and Sashimi, excellent and friendly Chefs! I will say the waits are crazy and if you better organize that part

The sushi here was great! Really fresh. I do have another favorite sushi spot, so I do not treat myself to Oyshi as much as I'd like too, but the few times I do get over there, I definitely enjoy the rolls as well as the appetizers that are included in AYCE. I will say, that, like many AYCE sushi places, service is not the quickest. When ordering a roll, you may not get it for a while later. But it's understandable, as the place is busy. ' Overall, the sushi is pretty delicious.

LETS START OFF WITH ALL YOU CAN EAT FOR TWO HOURS!!!  Yes two hours for one of the cheapest all you can eat sushi I've seen in Las Vegas myself. Some will say that service of the sushi is a tad slow but hey you get two hours. Who likes to be rushed when eating anyways? I enjoy food so I would like to enjoy it at a nice pace thank you. If your with great company that gives some extra time for some intellectual exchange of words (conversation). Plus the two hours give enough time to let the rice settle a bit and enough time to try a good portion of the menu.  The service might be a tad slow but the workers are always pleasant. I actually feel like I'm wanted there.. not like that other Asian restaurants.. They also are very knowledgeable with the menu which leads to great sushi suggestions.  The sushi at Oyshi I say is the best I've had in Las Vegas!  I would like to suggest the RED ROCK ROLL due to the fact that it contains "Orgasm Sauce."  The sauce is rightfully named this because it will climax your taste buds into ecstasy!  Conclusion.. YES!

We thought we'd try this place instead of going to our usually sushi spot, what a mistake that was! The service is terrible, we had a server that was just wondering around like a lost puppy. Our waters were empty on several occasions and I had to ask twice how much longer it would be until we got our sushi and then was given the confused "let me go check" look. Also, we were told they only did half rolls at the bar, which makes no sense! The sushi was mediocre at best. In a town full of great places to eat, skip this one and go somewhere else.

Came here for a bday dinner..and they sat us in our own private area on the side, which was perfect.  $25 for all you can eat and that pretty much included everything on the menu besides sashimi... They had many rolls to choose from and they also had yakitori dishes(bacon wrapped asparagus, steak, chicken, shrimp, scallops), poke salads(delicious), poke bowls, oysters, mussels.. There was a great selection.  Since we had a big party, our order took some time and some got missed but the servers were more than helpful and they made sure we got everything we wanted.  After our meals they also had parfait, mochi, and tiramisu for dessert..I would definitely be coming back..Only downer is that it is pretty far from the strip if you don't have a car, its about a $30 cab ride, but if you split it, its not so bad.  After 2 hours of stuffing our faces and many bottles of sake, we left stuffed and satisfied and it only came out to $40 a person! We were expecting way more!

Snow Mountain roll is incredible! Service usually good though the wait for rolls can get long during dinner. Only complaint is the god awful music. Hip hop and EDM are all you hear. Nothing against Ludacris but he isn't really sushi music. This kills the atmosphere. Would come more often if they set a better music program.
Chirashi is good, but prettty limited on the quantity of fish,,,a few fillers.  Service at the bar was great, the guys are lively and keep a fun atmosphere.
Amazing place and amazing food me and my husband were treated like it was our anniversary.  Chef Ed is super sweet.

Tucked into the base of a condo at the foot of Yonge Street, next to another fave haunt of mine (Harbour Sports Grille), this quaint little joint delivers good quality sushi with a smile and without fuss.  Private booths, decent selection, quietly efficient service, fast take-out and most importantly well-made sushi makes this place a solid option when Your Craw's Craving The Raw.  I repeat: there is nothing fancy going on here, but it's just good.  Which is better than Not Good or Bad, and given the absolute nightmare that are some Toronto sushi joints, I'm happy to recommend this place.  And specifically: go here after a summery late-evening walk around Harbourfront - because the restaurants around Harbourfront itself are super lame, full of loud American tourists in loud Hawaiian shirts and hard to get a good table at; this place is no more than a 10 minute walk away, less pretentious and less intent on raping your wallet within an inch of its life.

Love this spot. In terms of availability of diverse food items for AYCE sushi places this place is pretty great. Sitting at the bar the chefs are friendly, and the waitstaff has always been wonderful. Been going here for years and besides them not having a punch card for AYcE, the place is great and open late!
Love the ayce order right off the menu to the chef at the bar. Been here several times and never disappointed. Not too expensive and great variety. Will be back

This place is so yummy!  My friends and I came here one day for lunch while on a trip to Vegas for our friend's birthday.  We heard from our party planner about this place that has all you can eat sushi and we were there.  There were 9 of us and the service was quick and friendly, and we definitely stayed a few hours to milk the all you can eat deal for what it was worth! Sooooo good! Definitely go! Tons and tons of choices on the menu as well!
Food is awesome here, always long waits to get in. My favorite sushi place in Vegas
This place is better then what I expected. The service was good. The sushi is good with a lot of options to choose from. The red bean moochi is soo delicious!!!

Best sushi in town for the AYCE price. Burger and Fries Roll, topped with steak and fried onions was particularly delicious, also not on the menu. Even if you're looking for a veggie roll, they've got you covered here. The surf and turf is small but served with a very good sesame sweet sauce, while the shrimp and steak are grilled to perfection. The tempura is very crunchy and it comes out very hot.

Great AYCE sushi :)   Pros: Fresh, good portions, large selection. Good dessert.    Cons: How far in on Rainbow it's located. Can be long waits-make RESERVATION! Lobster fair was not that great.  Fish without rice not option under AYCE.

Excellent quality sushi and very inexpensive. If you're looking for a good sushi place for lunch, try this place.  Service is very quick and inexpensive.  A lot of the hockey players who come to play in Toronto call this place a regular due to its proximity to the ACC.  Have never tried dinner here, only lunch.

Random nights with good friends are always a blast!  I've always said it.  Spontaneity really makes the activity better!  So when I was invited last minute for a sushi dinner, I knew it was going to be fun.  We settled on a place one of us raved about.  I've been to Soyo restaurant many times but never Oyshi.  Time to Yelp!  The only down side of this place is the location.  I live across town from here.  Oyshi is in a really cool strip mall in my opinion.  First, you have one of my favorite Korean joints.  Now you have my favorite fried rice joint, Rice Trax.  This location, although far, will be frequented a lot.  Although the wait was super long, the restaurant is pretty cool.  Love the concrete floors, the wood accents in the front and the half table chairs, half booth options for seating.  Our service was pretty good.  Multiple servers came by our table at most times.  It was enjoyable.   For dinner at a sushi joint in Vegas, the ONLY way to go is to get the AYCE special (All You Can Eat).  This place charges a $26 price tag.  The one thing that threw me for a loop were the rules involved.  I've never seen a place have all their rules listed on their menu.  With this dinner, you can literally order anything off the menu.  Granted, there are a few items that limit one per person, but you have access to everything.  My recommendations to get the most out of your AYCE is to stick to non-rice dishes.  I know, I know, it's a sushi joint, but trust me.  You can eat so much more if you stick to the protein.  For dinner, here's what I got, grouped in categories:  Things I loved: Seaweed Salad (with sesame seeds), Fresh Oysters (with ponzu sauce, green onions and hot sauce), Baked Mussels (topped with yum yum sauce and ponzu), Miso Soup (always a hit), Shrimp Tempura (lightly breaded), chicken yakitori (2 skewers with dark meat chicken and yakitori sauce),   Things I liked but kind of disappointed with: Ahi Poke - Bowl filled with seaweed salad, shredded cucumbers and onions on the top, was small chunks of tuna with a little sesame seeds.  Kind of a disappointment.  I understand that tuna is expensive, but the dish was 75% salad and 25% tuna, which should have been the star of the show.   Things that were questionable:  Yellowtail or hamachi nigiri - If there's any rice dish I get, it's nigiri because of the small portions. The yellowtail is usually my favorite fish, however, this specific yellowtail was a little discolored and questionable to me.  I took a bite and ended up finishing the dish but it didn't taste like what I'm used to.  Make sure it's fresh!  All in all, this place is actually good.  I'm definitely coming back for another AYCE session.  The place is still convenient and the staff is nice.  If you're looking for a good sushi joint on the SW side of Vegas, for sure check them out!
Favorite Location even though I live closer to the location. Great fast service! With Awesome friendly staff! Last but But Not Least the Best Sushi Ever!!!!!

Went on a Sunday night about 8:30pm.  Tried to go to Sushi Goymon first but there was a 2 hour wait, so decided to venture over to Oyshi Sushi.    When we arrived the place was half full, but still seemed overwhelmed, dirty dishes piled on empty tables with hostess clearing tables, waited about 5 minutes before she was able to seat us.  Not a big problem, but should've taken it as a sign of things to come.    We ordered some hot tea which came luke warm which got us off to a bad start.  The sushi, dragon rolls, caterpillar roll, tuna, were all fine, but took about 20 minutes to arrive.  We also ordered salads which came AFTER yes after the sushi about 30 minutes later.  When I mentioned this to the waiter, he simply said that we have two different kitchens and we bring things when they are ready.    Overall, it sushi was ok, probably 3 stars, but service was lacking so minus a star.  Probably would not go back.

The service is absolutely terrible and the wait time is reallllllly inconvenient because the staff are so unorganized. I literally walked in and waited at the podium for 15 minutes, and servers were just staring at me and I was like HELLO WILL ANYONE HELP ME? There was also tons of tables like 10+ and they still made me wait 30 minutes... for what?! The staff were just chatting, hiding behind the podium right by the kitchen. They also don't take reservations at the weirdest times. The hostesses are sooooo rude here and will ignore you unless you ask them for an update.  The staff spent more time cleaning the tables while there. There were probably 30 people waiting outside, because when I was seated there was 5 empty tables around me! The rolls are just okay, but their fish/sashimi was good, even though the servers DIDN'T KNOW WHAT THEY WERE???? How do you confuse a white fish with octopus ?! Their prices for AYCE are pretty standard, not too cheap or expensive. The quality of the food is pretty good.  The interior of the restaurant is gorgeous of course and very roomy. They also have an incredible sake selection ranging from hot-cold, fruity-to house.
Chef Ed was so sexy and funny! He made sure my service was prefect! Chef Ed provided us with amazing recommendations! He was definitely fun to talk with.

Bad food, rude server, dishonest practice. Most rolls taste the same as they covered everything with mayo. Oysters are sandy and not fresh, menu says you can order 2 per person but our party was restricted to one by the server. Only about 75% of the food we order showed up. The service was bad, waiting for water refill is at lease 30 mins. The worst of all, original check showed up on our table did not have 18% tips, but they charged on the credit card. When you sign the credit card slip, the slip says "pre tip" and asking you to tip again. I don't think anyone is managing the place as the busboy drop the dirty dish box on the floor, kicking the box across the dinning area. The wall painting was not family friendly. A man initiating sex to a woman who's butt is hanging out.

The wait was a little long when it appeared that there was many open tables. The service was friendly and fast.   The sushi was amazing, and the all you can eat was such s value!!  I highly recommend this place, and I'll be back.

One of my favorite AYCE sushi hot spots in town. The food is affordable and delicious. I recommend starting off your meal with the surf&turf, tempura shrimp and the special albacore toro with truffle sauce. For rolls my favorites are the heart attack, Japanese lasagna and the rainbow roll.

Ah, yes. The "newer" Oyshi. Essentially the same restaurant, but bigger--yet, somehow, not -quite- as tasty as the original location!   Ambiance: 4 - The epitome of comfort: Tables that are far away from each other, enough to spread out your leg and arm span so that you won't hit another person. But still, not far away enough that you can't hear the conversations of the table next to you!   Spacious with more tables and semi-dimly lit, this Oyshi seems to have a bit more romantic lighting, if you will. Don't worry! You can still see your menu!!   Service: 5 - Our table service was fast, friendly, attentive. The restaurant wasn't busy at all, so they were really able to cater!   Food: 3 - Just like their other location, they also offer AYCE and the choice of one of their specialty desserts!   I'm usually a huge fan of their food, but the quality of the rolls were just not as good as the original location! When the taste is up to speed, most likely I'll go back, but for now, I'll drive the longer drive to the first location.  However, if you do like this location and are looking for a roll to try, I recommend the Love Affair & the dessert is -always- worth a try! Also, if you like fresh oyster, theirs is delicious :)

I have always enjoyed Oyshi, ever since it opened years ago, I've been a huge fan! It was the first AYCE sushi place I had ever been to. And after all this time, they still serve up pretty yummy eats!  AMBIANCE: 3 - The space is intimate, but at the same time, still pretty well lit. Usually has a good amount of people inside, I recommend calling in advance, especially with a big party.  SERVICE: 4 - Service is okay, especially when you call in a big party reservation; everything came out fast and hot for our bday party celebration! It's also pretty fast seated at the bar.  when you're not at the "party tables", regular service is a bit slow! I really hope they get better, but it's been that way for a while. Also, they charged full price for a kid under 10! Say whaa?!   FOOD: 4 - I have a like/love relationship with the food. So I'll just tell you my absolute favorite dishes to order: Love Affair, Fresh Oysters, Baked Mussels, Japanese Lasagna Roll, Vegas Roll, Garlic Tuna nigiri, Oyshi Roll, Strawberry Mochi, Green Tea Ice Cream, and the Ahi Poke :) All delish and some of the best sushi around. Though, not a huge fan of all of the nigiri that they serve.  Oyshi is always a fun time for me, so I hope that everyone that has a big reservation or sits at the bar feels the same way as well!
Not a sushi eater but love love the chicken teriyaki the service and atmosphere is just right, server was on top of her game for a gathering of 11 people awesome service.

Went here for the AYCE Sushi, and it was simply BOMB.COM.  End of story.   Ok, I'll tell you more. They have more than just sushi on the menu - great steak, delicious fresh oysters, and best of all GREAT SERVICE!! They didn't rush us, the sushi came out in a timely manner, but not all at once so we didn't get overwhelmed.  Did I mention the amazing service?? Cause it really was! I swear with all of the AYCE sushi places around Vegas, the menu doesn't vary too much, so the service really will determine if I come back to a place or not.   And I will be BACK!! Thanks for a great experience, and obviously a full tummy :)

I found this place perusing Yelp sometime back in 2010. AYCE lunch $21, dinner $26 which is comparable to similar places. Ive come here about 2-3 times a month for the past 2yrs plus. Always do AYCE. The main thing that got me as a repeat customer is their service(at least in my experiences) is considerably better than most sushi places Ive visited. I counted and cant even believe Ive tried 12 different AYCE sushi spots in Vegas to date. Im not a big fan of the traditional sushi, more into the creative and many rolls that these places sell. I like to say Im more into the 'americanized' type of sushi and have been able to convince friends who dont even eat raw fish to try it with me and most liked it. So you can take what you want from my review based on that. This place does get very busy at dinner with sometimes long waits to be seated so I try to frequent at lunch. Service can take longer at times. I typically like to sit at the bar when I sushi. I have experienced faster service that way usually, so now I lean towards sitting at the bar. The ambiance, decor and music targets the more younger demographic. Some items I favor are the seared salmon nigiri, cajun albacore nigiri, tiger roll, double screaming orgasm, heart attack, ian special, chung hua, kamikaze & surf n turf roll. At every AYCE I go for green tea ice cream and hamachi kama(not on AYCE here) if its available. They do also have brulees, mochi ice cream and parfaits for dessert. All desserts are limited to 1 per cept for ice cream. Dinner AYCE limits are 1 uni, 1 ama ebi and 2 raw oysters which is similar to most AYCEs. Theres a list of appetizers which I will order from ocassionally but I concentrate more on the sushi and green tea ice cream. :) Is it the freshest and highest quality seafood? No. Its decent. It does say theres a time limit of, 90min I believe? Dont remember exactly atm since its never come into play. Ive never been rushed even tho I know I have passed the time limit before, or things like being reminded repeatedly on leftover charges. I realize this may not be everybodys cup of tea but for food and service Ive gotten here, I think you definitely get your moneys worth.

I have been a regular between both locations for over 4yrs now and bring everyone i know who craves sushi here. Came to the Sahara location tonight with some friends visiting from Hawaii. One of them dropped their $1k casino chip on the ground. He didnt even realize it until i got a call later from Kevin, the manager, saying one of his workers turned it in to him. Thats just the great type of people who work here. Another good reason to come to Oyshi. Not that i needed it lol. But our visit tonight is definitely worth mentioning.
Always come here for the lunch specials. Staff is always friendly and attentive.  Will be back here again soon I'm sure lol

Why so fancy?!  So my wife and I were driving one day, trying to figure out how we can top off our empty stomachs when we saw this gem from the streets. Located in a plaza on Sahara off of Teneya, this spot had a clean look to it. Plenty of parking. Walked inside and almost felt as if I was under dressed. This place is Fancy. Greeted as we entered, we were shown to our table in record timing. Well, for a sushi restaurant. Very spacious, great modern decor, and plenty of seating. Well lit, with just the right amount of volume on the music.   Our server was great and gave us the full run through of the menu and drinks. No empty glasses here baby. Food came as fast as we ordered them. Well, at least from what I remember. Here's the rundown of what we ordered.  What ordered: Miso soup Ahi poke Calamari Baked mussel  Shrimp tempura Sizzling beef Beef asparagus   Nigiri: Tuna  Garlic Tuna Salmon Albacore Garlic albacore Yellowtail Ikura Uzura - quail egg Masago - smelt egg Tamago - sweet egg  Know what? We cleaned our plates. Yes we did. The fish is fresh. A bit light on flavor for the mussels, but amazing taste for the sizzling beef. Since I'm accessing long term memory and my   hippocampus isn't cooperating, I'll have to keep it short. (Note to self, write review within a week of visiting business).  This place is well worth the drive. Perfect for that elegant date, without the outrageous prices and AYCE bustle. We shall see you again FANCY!
Oyshi is the best, have never had something I didn't like - they have something for everyone

Excellent sushi - terribly slow service, every time. Most of the time when we go, there are maybe 2-3 tables of people and yet the service is the slowest service of any restaurant I have ever been to. There are always many staff members walking around, looking busy, so they don't seem understaffed. Had this same problem at the other location, too, so it must be a training thing.We will continue to go back, because the sushi is delicious, but I wouldn't suggest coming here if you have an appointment or need to be somewhere on time. Even getting our waters refilled is almost impossible. We're going to attempt carry out here tonight - we'll see how that goes!

Arrived last meeting my friends at this sushi place. So the waiter didn't realize that I got there and sat for awhile talking to my friends. Once the waiter got there, he was pleasant and attended to the table. Fresh selection of fish and very creative rolls. I would dine there again.

It was a great place to eat. It was really quiet and nice on the inside. The sushi rolls were satisfying and they have better appetizer selections than most places I've ever been to eat sushi. The waiter was very prompt and nice. She really knew the menu very well and she was patient. You know how some waiters/waitresses can be when it's your first time at their establishment? They can be seemingly impatient and rude because they want you to hurry up and order. Not this place. She knew it was our first time, so she suggested awesome rolls and gave us plenty of time to figure out what we wanted. No rush. I would suggest going on a weekday. Some All you can eat sushi places have a timer set in place for how long you can sit there and enjoy your food.

Before you step into this restaurant, think again. There is a great five star restaurant next to it call soyo, you sure you wanna eat here?? Granted its a different type of restaurant but still, its money well spent if you spend $ 50 for two in soyo than here.  The reason why I am so harsh on this place. Well, sushi are just amazingly stupid. There is no artform whatsoever, sushi are art, even though you are an ayce restaurant. Its a reflection of the sushi chef how the presentation of the sushi went.   This restaurant make all sushi look like california roll and to boot if you look at all the rolls it full of slimy crabmeat with mayonaisse combination to make you full right away.   Sure, they do have other appetisers on the menu or dessert included, but there are lots of other japanese ayce around las vegas that offer the same things.   All this yelper that commented how great this restaurant is must never really eat in a proper japanese restaurant. Service are ok but honestly this one is a one and done for me.  You can try and then pm me afterward, I will probably just say "see I told you so"

Wow! The service and wait time is extremely slow tonight. So slow that I'm on my phone more than ever at a sit-down dinner. It's so slow that I have the time to check-in here on yelp and write this long review. As I'm writing this it has been 10 since my last order came out.  In between orders we've had our coke refilled like 3 times. I'm waiting for the last order to come out. I'm not even full... At this point I just want to leave.

Consistently consistent!  I have been coming here for at least 3 years now and still continue to bring out of town guests here.  We have had wonderful service whether we were dining for two or a table of 14.  Some of my local friends, who moved out of town still request Oyshi for their sushi cravings.    Now onto the food.  For $26 (dinner) AYCE, you get beyond your money's worth.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, rolls, nigiri, and dessert. (Of course, sashimi is NOT included).  Some of my favorites include: Appetizers: oysters, mussels, rib eye, surf & turf, dynamite Rolls: Ian special, double screaming & love affair Nigiri: SUPER WHITE TUNA!, hamachi (yellowtail) & salmon Dessert: creme brule & green tea ice cream parfait.  The overall restaurant has a great vibe, good energy/music, and attentive staff.  The last time we went here was a table of 14 and all of orders came out correct and in a timely manner.  Our server's name was Pink and she took wonderful care of us!
Oyshi has been my favorite since I first went ! Love it's AYCE and sit at the bar with Chef Ed!! He is the best ! (:

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 35/100***  I have been to this location about 4 times total, service was never really extraordinary but it wasn't quite as disorganized as it was last Saturday. They had us sit in a private area because we were a party of 15, and I don't know if it was due to that fact but the total experience was dampen by their lack of organization when it came to ordering and getting our food.   We all got the AYCE, so that right there was already less of a headache or so I thought. We even helped out by writing our orders on the napkins. That part was a cinch but when it came to actually receiving our orders, it was a mess. First, the dishes came out one at a time and then later on we were told that they were putting orders together in one plate: the tempura for example, which had we known, wouldn't have been a problem and could've just passed it around. Instead, people were waiting for their orders to arrive only to find out it was already given to the end of the table. We didn't want to keep ordering as we weren't aware if they were just backed up or totally forgotten. We were finally told towards the middle of the meal what they were doing, when half of the party was agitated already. Don't mess with hungry Filipinos LOL.     The food is just OK, quality is nowhere as good as some of our preferred sushi places, it's AYCE I know, but I've been to other AYCE places where their nigiri's taste so much better and fresher. Now their green tea crème brulee is in a league of its own, I could eat about 5 of those suckers lol, it might be the only reason for me to come back hahaha oh and the unlimited ice cream.
Wonderful Sushi!!! Did not expect to find this in the desert!! All the fish was fresh and oh so good!!!! Wish I took pics of all the food!! I had my sushi craving filled!!!!
Simply the BEST!!...there fast & customer service rocks!!...would recommend to anyone!

Its not Nobu. Its not Yellowtail.  It does not compare to the top quality sushi I get back in Hawaii BUT you can have an entire meal for the price of just two pieces of sushi at the other places.    $21 for lunch.  $26 for dinner.  All you can eat (with some exclusions).  The food is good and well seasoned.  Fish is reasonably fresh.  Rolls are creative and good eats.  Excellent interpretation of classic sushi dishes.  The ambiance is a little weird (nightclub meets strip mall Japanese sushi joint) but who cares.  The food and service are good and the price is right.

Competition in the Las Vegas AYCE (All You Can Eat) scene is fierce, one of the most recent causalities is Sushi On Rainbow on the Westside of Chinatown.  It's somewhat hard to standout in such a crowded field.  Generally, I like to categorize them in which part of town they are in.  One of my "must go" places have been added in the Southwest section in Las Vegas.
