Oyshi Sushi won't have the premium quality sushi, expect the fish to be previously frozen but still is not bad, the rice to fish ratio is more fish than rice, the rolls are not too over sauced, the salmon roe and flying fish eggs to be plentiful.  Customer service is excellent and attentive, they will stop by frequently to check if you want more orders.  Several notes:  They charge for green tea, so don't be surprised to tacked on a few more dollars for this.  The prices are in line with other AYCE restaurants, just a few dollars above $20 for lunch and around $26 for dinner.  Pass on the green tea creme brulee and green tea ice cream, barely any hints of green tea at all.

Another AYCE sushi joint in Vegas.  I swear there are one in every two blocks.  Bigger than most, this place is usually busy at night but very chill during earlier hours like  most places.  But when it's busy, it's really busy which leads to service sucking!  But overall the atmosphere inside is pretty good and seats up large group of people which is good for birthday dinners or just a bunch of friends coming from out of town.  All you can eat I believe was $25 for dinner.  I'm just gonna point out what I like and usually order. Baked mussels, dynamite roll, volcano roll, nigiri is not as tasty here, oysters are the best I've had in Vegas but unfortunately only 4 per person so get your friends to order it as well even if they don't eat it so you can have it, surf and turf (highly recommended), and for dessert the fruit parfait.   This is not a quiet place for dinner so bad idea for a date if you plan on having a meal with a quiet conversation.  People come here often with their kids and big groups of people, which shouldn't surprise you are very loud.  This place is a hit or miss but fortunately I'm patient when it comes to bad service when it's excusable because of how busy this place can be at times.

Been here a few times and I must say, I like it here. We usually get the AYCE. The menu has a good variety and includes dessert. The sushi is decent to good. There's a board with specials as well so don't forget to check that out.   Oyshi offers the usual Japanese fare from sushi to specialty rolls, appetizers and other small plates. Some of the sushi have options of preparing. ie. you can have your albacore regular, seared, seared with garlic, etc. Same goes for the salmon and yellowtail and a few other fish on the menu.   I really like the yakitori, baked mussels, sushi options and desserts.   This location is way off the strip. It's worth a try if you like AYCE. They also accept reservations.

This place is a joke. Subpar service and rubbery old fish that smells. Had AYCE and only had 2 orders worth a total of 10 bucks but STILL charged 23 dollars cause all they can do is give me a 20 percent discount. Manager wasn't even present so I had them call her. Her excuse was that it was busy and almost closing. That should not be an excuse and it is a piss poor excuse at that. We were there 2 hours before closing. They had us WAIT about 30 mins before they were able to get back to us. AVOID THIS PLACE and you have been warned.

What can I say? All-you-can-eat sushi is always awesome! The plus is its all-you-can-eat sushi PLUS all-you-can-eat appetizers like kobe beef, tempura, oysters, mussels, etc.  Also you can have a choice of 1 out of 4 mini desserts.  After an all-you-can-eat fest one night here at Oyshi, my friends and I left full and very happy. :D

I brought my mom to eat sushi, since we both love it. We did our usual order of all you can eat. They start you off with an appetizer then your rolls. After 30 minutes of waiting, only 1 of the 2 appetizers and 3 of the 4 rolls we ordered arrived. We ate everything quickly since we were hungry and wanted to order more rolls. For the second order, we asked for 4 more rolls and again, only 3 of the 4 came to the table. We kept asking, when are the other rolls and appetizer coming? All they said was "well let them know". Finally, dessert time came and they were all out of everything green tea, so we settled for a strawberry mochi instead. We left without getting our appetizer and 2 of our rolls. I still paid $28 each. Wouldn't come here again.
This place has been solid in the past- since all the new managers have come in the service is not as good- food still remains above average.

Went to dinner there tonight with another couple. Sushi was mediocre. Service was horrible! Server accidentally spilled water on the table ended up in my lap and my husbands. The server was in no rush to clean it up. Water was everywhere. He uttered an "sorry about that" then ignored our table after that. Never came back to check on us. Brought the check to us- Sat it on the table and then said "do u want dessert?" I would think that after knocking water all over the table, which resulted in water all over my husbands pants. He would of been sincere about his apology. Maybe even offered a free mochi?  Prior to that, I had to ask THREE times for napkins while we were eating. Previous expierence there has been great! The four of us, Will never return.
Best Sushi in Vegas! $21 All you can eat lunch, $26 dinner. Clean restaurant with cordial staff.  They offer more rolls that any spot I've been and the quality of fish is top notch.

I really liked it here, but I came today with my brother and sister in law. HORRIBLE. HORRIBLE. The amaebi was literally spoiled and the oysters cannot even be classified as oysters. I understand if the food is not good, it is not the servers' fault. But lack of service when the place is not really busy is their own thing. My sister in law's soda glass was literally empty for a good 15 minutes. No servers are walking around, checking on us. We had to practically beg for the attention of the servers. We feel sick due to the food, but the service was just literally lagging. I will not come again. Sorry, Oyshi.

I absolutely loved my experience here!  I was reading the other reviews that had bad ratings and most of it came from bad service and about waiting too long. Well first of all, you gotta come early! You can't just be walkin in like you own the place. If it's busy don't expect to be waited on hand a foot. C'mon give these guys a break! They do their best to accommodate the guest they have. I mean, would you be able to handle 6-8 parties yourself? (Unless you're and server than ok. Haha) But nonetheless, they continuously checked up on us and I think that's all we can ask for.   I'm gonna keep this short and sweet. Besides the outstanding service, if you love sushi, Just come here. It's sooo good and During lunch too cause it's cheaper! Hahah Enjoy!

4 words: All you can eat. That's the way to go. Being that I'm not from here, I was surprised at how fresh the sushi was. But it was! We ordered way too much but somehow found a way to finish it all. I would definitely come back.

The 5 star is for our server. She was really really nice and patient when we didn't know what to order. She did recommend some rolls and they were good. Would definitely come back but maybe with a bigger group so we can taste more rolls. The food was good I did have my very first raw sushi roll which I'm proud of all thanks to our server :)

Went here last night. The food was pretty good, and the atmosphere was great. I do wish they would update the menu because there are things listed that they no longer serve. Only other complaint would be for them to be a little more attentive. My friend didn't get the rolls that she ordered while everyone else had food so we had to ask for them again and then it took forever for our checks to be picked up and cleared out.

I used to HATE this place!  Many visits a couple years ago...all with slow service, room temperature nigiri, etc.  This was actually one of the only places that I told people NOT to go to for sushi....and never understood why others liked it so much.  A VERY reluctant lunch stop proved to be a much better experience this time around!  A few highlights :  Sea Scallops were awesome! Super fresh, buttery texture...melt in your mouth!   Sake was very fresh today! Beautiful cuts of salmon....the Sake in Yuzu was very good as well, and not overpowering like yuzu can be sometimes.  The Ika with Mint. I really enjoyed this combination...and it was noticeably less chewy than most.   Ahi. Fresh, but another odd cut...the darker area was a bit tougher...should have been removed by the chef.  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oyshi-sushi-las-vegas?select=UnVcwLiUog_Lmr-ZkUaKwQ#UnVcwLiUog_Lmr-ZkUaKwQ  Unagi. Nice crispy edges...good flavor!   Ahi Poke. Tuna was fresh, and the seaweed salad was good too!  Sunomono. I liked their version here...thin cuts versus the larger circular cuts most use. The ginger sauce was good too.  Green Tea Creme Brulee. Delicious! Lots of tea flavor here   Service was fairly quick, considering their tables were mostly full.  I would come back again now if I was already on this side of town :P
Kenny Lee was a very good and friendly server, made the experience great. Hope you get him as your server!!
Tried the AYCE for lunch. Hated that they put so much imitation krab mix in almost every roll. Gross.
I love this place! Our food was so good and the service was great!!! Will definitely continue to dine here!

Sigh. We were *really* looking forward to this after all the stellar reviews. I've been to Vegas many times and always thought the best sushi would be at some swank place on The Strip, but Yelp claimed otherwise.  The good: The food was, overall, fine. We didn't do All You Can Eat because my wife wanted two orders of sashimi (salmon and hamachi). Both were excellent. Nice large meaty pieces, well trimmed, nicely presented. We had two rolls each, which were fine but nothing special. I also had two orders of nigiri.  The bad: We arrived around 2pm on a Sunday afternoon. The restaurant was MAYBE half full. It more than half hour before our first piece of food came out. It was 40 minutes before I saw any of my order. The (nice) server came by at 30 minutes and offered us free miso soup to help pass the time. Meanwhile we watched every other table in the place get multiple orders of sushi delivered. Completely unimpressed, and cost them several stars.  Other issues: I asked if they had aji bones they could deep fry, and the server went off to find out but never came back to tell me yes or no. My aji nigiri had the tiniest pieces of aji I've ever eaten on top. It tasted fine, but they amounted to table scraps, not at all like the beautiful pieces of sashimi my wife got.

Who ever was my sushi chef tonight didn't really do a great job on my shrimp tempura roll.  It was soggy and the crunch wasn't there.  I ordered two in case maybe there was a mistake on how it was made the first time.  The second was as soggy, if not, more.  The flavor was there, just the texture was not correct.  I normally come here with my cousins when we feel like sushi and in the past the sushi has always been top notch.  But tonight, I think the chef was probably in a bad mood, hence the mediocre sushi.   I also ordered a sashimi salad.  It's also not so great here.  I've had it better in other restaurants.  Oh well, maybe next time I try it might be better.  As long as the sushi chef I had tonight isn't the same as the next time.

Not bad but there's many better options.   The good: All the rolls we ordered were good and average price. The menu has a variety. The manager is present and checks on tables. The place is clean. Fish didn't taste like imitation but the rice wasn't great. The server and manager were friendly. They do let you customize a little (they took off the wasabi mango sauce for us).   The bad: Service was very slow. It was a Saturday afternoon and it wasnt packed...maybe short staffed?? The waitress may have been new (not sure). The manager did come over but it was hard to get his attention and our servers attention when we wanted to order. We had all you can eat ($27) and got about 5 rolls between the two of us plus two appetizers. The pink plastic flower stickers cheapen the decor. Seats were really uncomfortable!!

Why three stars? Here's why.... First let me say that for a not so busy Saturday afternoon it took fifteen minutes for me and my boyfriend to be seated. It took another fifteen minutes on top of that for the waitress to take our order and another twenty minutes for us to get our sushi. I have heard of oyshi being one of the best sushi places in town, and while the sushi is good and tasty, in order for a restaurant (in my opinion) to have five worthy deserving stars the service needs to be as good as the food. That's minus star number one.   And!.... You would think for an 'all you can eat' everything in the all you can eat section is all you can eat, right? Including the dessert? Well, I think not (not here at oyshi at least.) The dessert here is one per person only. Which technically isn't all you can eat. So it's basically all you can eat sushi, but not dessert. Haha. That would minus star number two.   Now, on to the three yummy stars! When the sushi finally came, it was yum-O! With a capital last letter screaming O! The cajun albacore (thanks to a friend who recommended it at another sushi place) has become one of my favorites next to unagi. It's really full of flavor and I love how the center of attention goes to the fish, not the rice at the bottom. That gives plus one star.  The atmosphere in this restaurant is laid back. Both my boyfriend and I are laid back so the mood of the place set the mood for a relaxing time which is always much needed after a long busy week. Even their cutesy plate mats had designs of cutesy fonts and cutesy flowers. Haha. Guess what? Yes! You guessed it, another star for oyshi.  Freshness in sushi is another thing I look for. And boy oh boy does oyshi serve it fresh. As fresh as the prince of bel-air. We had the 'love affair' which everyone kept yelping about. It's the kind of affair that makes you feel guilty because you think you are cheating on your significant other. Oh yea, it's that's good! Total of three stars for this modern looking sushi spot.  I don't know if I'd come back though partly because of the service and partly because of my ever so longing for eating a lot of desserts. Well, I wouldn't say I don't know but maybe. Maybe the service is better than what we experienced in a different time or day. Maybe. A-ok review by me, but read other peoples reviews of this place. You may have a change of heart unlike me. =P

Very nice and spacious compared to rainbow location. Ok so here i go with the review. Its exactly what you expect from the other location unfortunately. I'm just really surprised that by now they would have their Sh*t together. So when you order your dishes here you would think you get them in the order you order them but you don't. they would even try to rush you when you eat here because theres so much staff everyone takes your order.

When pressed for their favorite AYCE sushi place, most Vegas locals can name at least one. Oyshi on Rainbow is mine.   I've been here for lunch and dinner, by myself and on dates. Most often, my roommates and I just roll up after one of us so much as mentions sushi.  The food is delicious and extremely fresh. I'm from New York where all-you-can-eat sushi is unheard of--and would be pretty suss if you did hear of it. Less than $30 for seafood? What, was it fished out of Hudson River?  Sashimi platters are the only thing on the menu that isn't AYCE. Dessert, however, is. I highly recommend their chocolate creme brûlée! For apps, you must try their Ahi Poke.  I'm partial to their Shrimp Tempura hand rolls, which I can, and have, eaten 3-4 of in one sitting. Other favorites include: Kami-Kaze, Oh My Heart, and Lobster Fair. If you like nigiri, you should check the chalkboard when you come in for the daily specials.   Pro Tip: If you sit at the bar, you can order half-rolls! It's a great way to try more rolls if you're like me and have limited tummy space, but eyes bigger than your stomach.

Came here for the first time last night for a Bday.  We had a big group but we were very well accommodated.   The restaurant was very busy but the service was able to handle it.  Our drinks and food are coming out without us having to wait and it was very enjoyable.  I really enjoyed a couple of the rolls and the Uni.  The uni is very well priced at $6 for two pieces which is a little low compared to other sushi bars.   I recommend this place to all sushi lovers...   sorry no pics, I didn't think about it til the food was gone.

Pretty amazing. I was a little nervous going to a place that does all you can eat sushi, but wow it was great!  You could order anything you wanted except sashimi. Big rolls and cuts of fresh fish. Yes I stuffed myself to the gills with some of the best creative rolls I've ever seen, and walked out of that place with a $52 bill for 2 people. When income back to Vegas I will run to this place!!
Sushi bar awesome... Rolls come fast taste great and you can order half rolls... But you do have to flag them down for your drink refills... But worth the yummy roll o my heart is my favorite!

Ordered 6 plates and enjoyed everything. Ordered 3 more and was thoroughly satisfied. The "sexy" is very delicious. The "heart attack" is good if you love spicy. Japanese lasagna is always a tasty selection. If you want tangy mustard go for the  "high roller". The service was quick at first then slowed down mid way. Gave us time to chat with the party and food to settle.  27 an adult for AYCE at the time we went. Excellent place.

This is my new favorite ayce sushi. Their menu is very large. Everything we ordered was amazing. Waiters were very fast and friendly. Best service in vegas. I have been to many ayce sushi in vegas and this place is the best by far!! Already my 2nd time here within a week.

This place isn't my favorite sushi establishment.  The food isn't presented well, and my server is never around. I've been to the location on Sahara, and also this one on Rainbow. Didn't like the sushi quality or how the rolls were made. Table was sticky, which I didn't like. It made my dining experience uncomfortable.  Pros: AYCE is decently priced Short wait time to be seated Parking is easy to find Dessert was delicious Half order rolls, and hand cut options available  Cons: Tables are small Tables are sticky Service takes a long time after placing orders Seafood quality is below good Imitation crab is used Charged for extra for leftovers Music is outdated No wifi  Overall: I not fond of this sushi spot. The food is decent although the service lacked and so did the cleanliness of the establish at both locations. Bang for your buck isn't too satisfying. The dessert was good! Best part of the meal. 2/5 stars on my rating scale.

Sounded good, looked good, good to know there's an all-you-can-eat sushi option nearby. Went in and sat down, then noticed they're playing some pretty inappropriate music complete with explicit lyrics... not trying to sit through that while I eat. Sorry, had to get up and leave. Thanks anyway!

I would have to agree with the other reviewers that this place is really decent. I am not a raw fish fan, so AYCE was used up on a lot of cooked items that were all fantastic. The service was extremely friendly from our initial greeting to our exit. The location is very large with a modern appeal, and very clean.  The server was a very friendly and provided great service -- I think her name was Jamee...

I came here with 3 of my friends and we all got the AYCE sushi.  This was my first time trying sushi and I really enjoyed it.  The atmosphere was great, decent background music.  My friends had been there numerous time before so the did all the ordering. Our waiter was very friendly and the service was prompt.  I loved the " Love Affair" it was delicious.  I will definitely be returning to try more of the menu.
I come here a lot with bae. I love it. Monster roll is really good.  They also give free beer if you review on yelp!
Nice all you can eat menu...watch out for the Oysters not so good at room temp!!

We absolutely love Oyshi sushi! We would come here every meal of every day if we had the money to spend. They have amazing appetizers from calamari to scallops to fresh oysters. My favorite roll is the lobster fair! And everything is such high quality. All the nigiri is amazing especially the Cajun and garlic albacore. The fish isn't fishy and the rice doesn't taste like vinegar like some lower quality places! The music is always so good it's usually like a mix between 90s and current R and B and hip hop music. All the staff is so great as well, we've never had a bad experience. Definitely our favorite place in town.
So good! Great service from Kenny.  AYCE is so worth it just try all the rolls first so you have room for all of them.  Come in before 6 pm to avoid the crowd :).  Green tea tiramisu is pretty good.

Went again yesterday with a group of 7. It seems as if the service gets worse, which is a shame because the food is still great. After we placed our first orders, it took almost 25 minutes for the first items to come out. Again, this waiter forgot a handful of our items and we had to remind him multiple times. One of my friends was really upset because he ordered 5 things from the menu in the beginning and it took 45 minutes for them to bring out just one! Like I said, the food was still great but having to wait what seems forever for your plates ruins the whole experience. They state you have a 2 hour limit, but what's the point if you are waiting for your food for more than half that time?  On a plus side, they did add new items to their AYCE menu; more rolls, salads, and rice bowls. I tried most of the new rolls and they were fantastic!  This isn't a go-to place for me  anymore but it will be if the services quality catches up to the food on my next couple of visits.

Love this place! It's so close to my house too which is a plus. I always get shrimp tempura rolls at sushi restaurants, and here they have a whole shrimp tempura roll section on the menu, with different toppings, sauces, meats, etc. Thumbs up!

My fiancé and I love Oyshi. The fish taste fresh and they have a great menu! Good service, just don't expect to get a table without a reservation most nights of the week. It will be about an hour wait.

Didn't get a chance to eat here but felt like I would add a similar review I read.    Tried to come on Saturday night at 12:50, place says it closes at 2am.  Walk in and they have already done last call and are closing.  I understand it's slow, but I'm not the first this has happened to...change your posted hours to 1am.  Then no harm done.

I would rate them 5 star if this prob didn't happen. But at the end going on dessert you are only allowed to order one (as in just one piece) dessert. I'm a dessert person, so if you are too, I don't recommend this place. Too much rule when it comes to eating all you can eat. Where can you see all you can eat but only allow you to eat one piece of dessert per person from the entire dessert menu?? They taking time on serving your food too and leave you one napkin and you have to ask for extra. This is my first and will be the last time eating here.

OMG I was blown away at how delicious this all you can eat sushi was I ate so much food I'm glad I wore stretchy pants. I can't wait to visit Vegas again so I can come back to this spot. Totally worth the wait.
The food is great, the service is great. Always a good experience when we go. They definitely know our faces and are always welcoming us back. We only get the AYCE and it's always a great experience.

Went to a nice lunch with a vendor.  My favorite foods were the garlic tuna, salmon belly and yellowtail trio.  Other than that, service was slower though the staff did their best.  Not my favorite, but good enough.  Since it is close to where my job is, there might be future plans to have lunch there....lol.
Love the service and the sushi. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the extensive sushi menu.

I've been wanting to try some other sushi spots for a while now, and when some friends from out of town flew in this week, another friend organized a dinner outing here.  Really, the food was "meh."   They have a lot of options for all you can eat, and there were three dishes that were absolutely awesome: The fresh scallop, the amaebi (with the heads!), and the gyoza.   Everything else that we ordered was just ok.  A little bland where there should have been more flavor.  The worst part about the evening though, was the service.   While it was super polite and friendly, it was SO slow!  We were there for 2 hours, no joke.   My fiance and I always order in rounds, so we'll do a few orders of several different nigiri options, and by the time we're done with the first one, we'll order more.   We didn't receive several items, and had to go find a server to come back for our second round of orders.    I had thought, briefly, that I'd be willing to come back to give it another go, but realistically...even the slow service at Sumo was better than this place.    I might go back again, but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way for it, especially when the spots I frequent have better fish.

I've been to the other Oyshi location, on Rainbow, a handful of times when a friend is in town...its her favorite sushi spot.  Saturday night was the first time I'd been to this location, and I'd definitely return again.  For starters, we were there with a rather large group, about 13 people for a birthday party.  We were seated in the far corner of the restaurant, in a private nook.  It was a really nice section.  I like the look of this location better than the other one...to me, its brighter, and seems a little less run down.  The server we had, I want to say he said that his name was Kenny?  I think it said "Golden" on his nametag..., anyway, he was spectacular.   Funny, friendly, triple checked on our orders.  He was really on it.    We were given a couple of "specialties" after we let Kenny know we were all having AYCE.  They brought out a ceviche, which I sadly, could not eat. (Avocado Allergy) Everyone else said it was delicious though.  They also brought out a Super White sashimi with a fried jalepeno on it, with an orgasm sauce (not sure if that's what they call it here, but that's what it was.).  This was really tasty. Super white is my favorite anyway, and the jalepeno was sweet with a nice kick.    As always, my husband and I ordered nigiri.   Most of what we ordered was pretty standard, but there were a couple standouts for me:  1.  The squid.  I've never eaten raw squid before; only grilled or fried.  I was anticipating a firm texture, like tako (octopus), but it was tender and delicious.  This was served with a piece of mint under the fish.  The flavor combination was out of this world.  A definite must have.  2. The Super White.  Tender.  Buttery.  Delicate... Pro tip:  Order the fresh wasabi and put some on this. (put some on everything you eat, but this one especially.)  HOLY flavor punch, Batman!  3. The halibut.  Incredible.  I've had halibut a few times, but this one was exceptional.  We really had a good experience here.  The reasons I'm only giving three stars are:  1.  They missed a few pieces of our orders.  Not a huge deal...but I REALLY wanted those oysters, and we didn't really have the opportunity to ask for them, since we ordered those towards the end of the meal, and our server was trying to get a bunch of separate checks organized.  2.  They charge for fresh wasabi.  One of my favorite spots does not charge extra for it, so this was a bummer.  We still got it, because a friend ordered it for us.  Its kind of a bummer to have your dinner budgeted and realize something you really love costs extra, when it doesn't at other places. Now that I know, if we return, we'll be better prepared.  3.  Their hot sake is bloody expensive.  $8 for a large hot house sake?  I'm used to paying $3-5 for a large bottle.   4.  At the end of the night, 3 drinks were brought out and only given to the front half of the table.  First of all...if you're only bringing 3 for us to share (since we didn't ask for them and were not charged for them)...you should probably do one for each section of the table so everyone can share a little bit of one.  Also, the drink was not made well.  It was a Moscow Mule, which is one of my favorites, and it was just not good.  WAY too much mint, not enough lime.   5.  My creme brulee was given to someone at the head of the table instead of me, so I got a half eaten creme brulee at the end of my meal.  (yes, part of that was the fault of the people I dined with, for not asking who ordered it...but if you wrote it down correctly, you should have just brought it to me.)    So...a good experience.  Service was MUCH better than the other location.  Other than the creme brulee thing, and missing my oysters, our server was really good.  People make mistakes, I'm not mad about it...but it does need to be stated.    The food was standard, but again...better than the other location.    I'd definitely come back.  It won't be my first choice, but I won't avoid it either.

Talk about #yummy sushi this place is really good. We dropped in on a Friday afternoon for lunch...all you can eat of course.  It was actually pretty busy for 2PM. Still the sushi was fresh and the service was impeccable!  We never waited more than 7 mins for our next round of sushi orders. We sat at the bar and I think our chef was listening to our discussions over which rolls to get lol by the time we put in our order he was sliding 2 rolls to us!!  Our favorites were the: Snow Mountain, Love Affair, Lobster Affair, Chung Hua and Sibuya. We tried maybe 11 different rolls, poke and nigri.  Awesome place! !!

A little disappointed considering all the great reviews. I will have to give them another try sometime on someone else's dime.   It's your typical AYCE pricing & rules (literally had a rule menu!!)   First off, came here with 5 people for bday dinner with an expected group of 10, they wouldn't let us sit at our table (which was already reserved and waiting patiently for us) until our entire group arrived.   Finally!!! Were seated. No sever. No water, no edamame. Just a bunch of hungry thirsty bums still waiting.   It took forever to get water and edamame. The menu was extensive but boring. Most of the combo rolls seemed similar to other combo rolls minus or add one insignificant ingredient. I did very much enjoy the pork belly.   Even my Sapporo beer experience was ruined but my non-chilled glass. Did I mention I thought I was at a club with the music blasting techno? Geezus. Overall, it sucked.

If you have a  Sushi craving stop here and squash it.  Its like $26 for all you can eat.  You have to finish everything you order, but man we eat so much Sushi I will not need to see Sushi for the rest of the year... Well maybe in a month or 2 I could enjoy some Sushi again.  Eveything tasted great and we all enjoyed it.  A party of 15 and everyone liked the place so I will be back :)

Oyshi is my go to ayce, they are always consistent with quality, taste and service.  I always get Monster roll, tiger roll, NYI roll, sibuya, Love affair, surf&turf app, beef asparagus app, gyoza, uni, ikura, unagi, and usually try some specials, The green tea creme brulee and tiramisu are very good, and I'm not usually a dessert person.  These guys are always on point! I love Oyshi Sushi!
Not only was the food fantastic but the waiter was amazing!!! And the owner actually bussed our table and spoke to us about our experience! Hands down the best!!!

AYCE, it's amazing. And worth it. The rolls are delish and you'll find many that you'll want to try.  Our entire table got the AYCE and shared multiple rolls so we got to try many on the menu and fell in love with a few. The baked mussels are delicious, and the traditional rolls you can ever go wrong with. From the baked rolls- have the 'Love Affair', you'll thank me later...

I enjoy coming to Oyshi on a regular basis. The food here is good and pricing is fair for their AYCE. Sometimes I do catch them on an "off" day and their salmon is not as fresh tasting as I would like it. But what I'll do is order their yumyum overload rolls (any of the big ones). As for their desserts, I think they're ok. Nothing too spectacular. I'd recommend coming here for the consistently good AYCE. Be sure to come with an appetite!

My husband and I have been to a few sushi bars in Vegas and this is by far the best one we have been to so far.  If you can, get the bar seats.  They are best in the house and the chefs are all really great
The All you can eat sushi here is the best in town. Although they have no sashimi, they make up  by giving the freshest fish with small rice. And the sushi rice here is very good.

I've been here dozens of times. I was disheartened to read some of the more recent reviews saying that things had gone downhill. Hoping they were wrong, I came here for lunch and was not disappointed in the least. Service was great, food was brought out quickly and everything was delicious. Oyshi is still on my list of sushi restaurants to frequent.

Tonight we had a birthday dinner with co workers at Oyshi sushi and my review goes like this. 1-10 score  Service 7 Food 8  Atmosphere 8   Now why did I place a 7 and not a 10 possibly because it took approx 20 minutes until I received my water.  Food was good and fresh, a little thick on rice but expected because it's Ayce
Udon broth was terrible  Basic California roll - have cucumber in it :(  Tempura was cooked properly   Ok atmosphere

I love their all you can eat sushi here... I wish they would put one in southern cali because this is THE restaurant to go to.  No matter what you order it is delicious and you can eat as much as you can of it!

Okay so I just left this place about 20 minutes ago. Its okay. The fish was fresh and the service was excellent. The place is nice a bit Japo and a trendy feel to it as well. I could do without the techno music. The one thing i did not really care for was some of the pieces were pretty bland. Although fresh it could of use some kind of sauce on them to bring out flavors. If I go again I will be sure to re-post :)

Our Favorite all u can eat sushi spot for lunch 20$ dinner 25$ I mean that's a good deal when u consider 2 rolls would be about 26$ alone. They always have a big selection of sushi rolls and appetizers. Including yellowtail and surf and turf grilled rib eye and shrimp!    For fresh sushi hit this spot

Some of the best sushi I've ever had. It's fresh and tastes great. I've had a lot of sushi and this place is in my top 3 spots. The service is great - Andre rocks!!! The Sahara location never has a wait either!! Watch out the rainbow location always has a wait. Especially on the weekend
My boyfriend and I come here once a week. Best sushi ever!!! And of course can't forget the great service, Odi is our favorite!
I haven't been here in a while , but i just came back when i was visiting las vegas and the service was great and the food was great still , imo its one of my favorite ayce places

Good food. Good atmosphere but not enough staff. The waitress is always running around and never around when needed. I come here for the AYCE and it's worth the price just wish they didn't have 1-2 servers for the what seems like the whole restaurant! Most of your wait is due to your server never available to put in your refills. Plan on being here a few hours waiting for service and then food!

I ate here with my family and I enjoyed it. The people here are great! The food is good. They have a lot of varieties to choose from. From sushi to Japanese food they have it. Plan on making this one of my favorite sushi bars to eat at.

My favorite sushi place!! The all you can eat has so many options, and is the best in town for cooked/fried/baked rolls in my opinion! The AYCE also has great options like surf and turf and tempura for those who are not too crazy about the rolls. Food is always fresh, staff is always friendly. Been going here for years, and it's still my favorite in town!

We were looking for a place to eat near the ACC when we stumbled across this place. Super friendly staff, fast service, good food and good value. The sashimi is decently proportioned, the rolls are massive and delicious and we were given edamame for free. I would definitely come back here again.

It's good for AYCE sushi. You won't be disappointed. Plenty of room, nice decor, and wide menu. My disappointment is no half orders on sushi like other places. Limited to certain order amounts on certain items. Rib eye was a overlooked and tough. Order it rare to medium rare. They didn't ask so I guess that's my fault. Extra charge for tea. Worth a try but I probably won't be back. Our server Toni was great.

Very bad service, nasty food, don't waste your money We had birthday party of 10 AYCE  Oysters ware so old and with salsa on top come on  Sweet shrimp was old taste, we tried several  rolls rice was nasty  Only Miso soup tastes good the rest we couldn't even finish   Server was so slow and didn't bring everything we ordered,   Sorry for my English

On a Wednesday evening, we had 2 AYCE dinners for ~60.   - Accommodative. They changed the channel for the olympics for us :) - Get the oysters. small but packed with flavor. beware! rocks with the oysters? too fresh :/. LOL - Calamari was a bit too oily. no flavor - Get the baked green mussels. they even cut it in half for you :) - big pieces of yellow tail and salmon for the nigiri :) - The monster roll is deceiving. it's not all soft shell crab. sad that they only use the legs. Ends are shrimp tempura.   - LOVED the salmon skin roll. more skin than salmon means more crunchy :) - the NYI roll barely has soft shell crab. even smaller legs!!! :( - Nuclear roll had a bit too much cream cheese. :/ - Yellow tail trio was a bit too tangy. small pieces of yellow tail - you only get ONE DESSERT! FAIL... - Mango mochi was average. they put a toothpick in it with the plastic on. LOL - Parfait was delicious. but needs more granola. i think the berries and strawberry pieces are frozen. - Although it may sound picky, overall it was pretty delicious or OISHI :)

Had dinner here tonight around 6:15. There was quite a line of people but we got seated within 20 minutes, which was great.  First of all, walking inside the restaurant, there was a strong scent of frying oil. I assume the ventilation inside is not strong enough. I've been to KFC and Popeyes without smelling that much oil frying.  We told the hostess our party had 4 people, when she walked us to the table, she took away a setting and set the table for 3, I didn't understand why she did that. So we asked a server to get us another setting, I'm not sure if he didn't hear us or if he was confused because we had to point out what a "table setting" was before he went to get it.  We didn't do the AYCE, just a few menu items: Unagi & Avocado Roll: The sushi roll was made badly, the rice was falling apart and there was a lot of avocado, barely any eel and smothered in way too much sauce. Donburi: Donburi is a combo of thin sliced beef (that is NOT all lean meat), egg, onions over rice with sauce in it. The one we got was dry, barely any sauce until you hit way bottom. The beef used was all lean and definitely not thinly sliced. Kids Popcorn Chicken & Teriyaki Chicken meals: The popcorn chicken was overcooked. They definitely fried it for too long. It was dry and some pieces had a burnt taste. My son ate a few pieces and said he didn't like it. The Teriyaki chicken was also overcooked. The chicken was hard to chew.  Service: We saw a lot of servers walking around, but it didn't look like they were doing anything productive. Only the manager (we assume, he was well dressed not in server type uniform) came by multiple times to see if our table was doing OK. Otherwise, the server would come by drop off food and disappear before we can even ask for anything.  Maybe, we'll give it another try in the future, but for now, it was not the dinner we expected to have.
My favorite Sushi place! The food is delicious and the service is friendly. Its always busy which gives it an upbeat feel. NYI Roll is the Best!

This was one of my first times having AYCE sushi on the west coast! Oyshi was perfect! The wait on a Sunday night wasn't too long. We had waited about 10 mins and we were seated at a table right away. The menu here is vast and close to endless. Definitely many options for the different types of eaters in your party!  Some of my favorites were the oysters, the steak, the veggie and shrimp tempura, and most of the sushis we ordered. It was all you can eat so we had many on our table.   Sad you can only have 1 dessert per person but I enjoyed my berry parfait. Great deal for all you can eat here!
Very good all you can eat sushi options. The monthly specials were exceptional all be it the salmon belt was average at best.  I would recommend this place and will come back again

My husband and I have been going to the Oyshi Sushi restaurant off of Sahara for YEARS, but it's such a far drive for us and the service at that one is often TERRIBLE. A friend recently told us there was an Oyshi off of Rainbow Blvd just 15 minutes from our house so we knew we had to go ASAP. When we walked in there was a line at the host stand and the hostess had all of us sat within 5 minutes. We chose to sit at the bar and do AYCE. Our server was Mono and he was the BEST service we've ever had at an Oyshi restaurant! I cannot speak highly enough of his attention to detail. Thank you Mono! We will be back to this location and request you if you're working.

THERE IS A SECOND LOCATION WITH MUCH BETTER SERVICE AT 7775 S. RAINBOW BLVD! Read my other review, go there instead if you can. Same great taste without the terrible service!  This is the only Sushi place I come to. I've tried a lot of sushi places in Las Vegas, but it's hard to find a place that tastes like it's right on the coast. I'm very picky about quality when it comes to sushi, it's not like a burger where you can deal with it being mediocre. I started coming to this place about three years ago when it was operating under another name, but it's always had the same great quality and taste.   One thing I will say I did not like before was the service. It seemed like they didn't assign a server to your table, so you would just have all these confused servers asking you what you wanted, or needed, and having your order come out with occasional mistakes, and the constant interruption of people not knowing when you were last checked on. It's gotten much better over the years and I can see business has picked up a lot.    I always tell my friends from out of town to try this place instead of somewhere on the strip which costs 3x as much.    To whom it may concern: keep up the great work in the kitchen, and focus on a more personalized floor experience. We don't want to have 5 servers for our table, just one really good one. Thanks for all the great food, we'll be seeing you.

Wonderful restaurant!!! My new favorite sushi place in Vegas. Not only is it in "my neck of the woods"--SW Las Vegas, but it serves wonderful sushi and hot meals, has incredible service and inviting, fun atmosphere. Oyshi does not disappoint, and I have been to most sushi places in town. The fish is always incredibly fresh and delicisous and hot foods and rolls are creative and very tasty. The presentation is top notch too, especially for the price. That's right, the price is on the low side for "all you can eat" sushi as compared to other neighborhood sushi places in town; Big flat screen televisions, always running mini fountains and modern decor add to the wonderful, fun, yet inviting atmosphere. Servers all speak English and are knoweledgeable about all of the dishes and make great recommendations!!! I love this sushi restaurant and have frequented it about twice a month, if not more often. Oyshi in Japanese means "delicious" and this restaurant surely lives up to its name in every sense of the word. Highly recommended.

THIS BUFFET IS HEAVEN!  Everytime I visit Vegas I will have to visit Oyshi. I live in Chicago and basically Oyshi's sushi buffet kicks all the other sushi buffet's butts in Chicago. Oyshi has a very contempory & modern decor to it, with a cool geisha painting on one of the huge walls.   My dinner at Oyshi was so fast, I couldn't even comprehend the food I ate. For starters - the mussels are a MUST and so is the ahi poke which is very fresh tuna.   Their sushi selection on the menu is so vast you don't even know what to order. If I had to pick only one sushi roll from the menu it would have to be the volcano roll.  The price is definitely worth this buffet which is around $26.

I'm a fan and a regular but sometimes the service is hit or miss. Sitting at the bar is fine, but a couple of times finding your waiter\waitress when you're sitting at a table is ridiculous.  With that said, AYCE sushi is not as amazing as "regular" sushi places (i.e. Sushi Fever, I love Sushi, Sushi Loca, etc) but Oyshi is always consistent when it comes to quality and quantity. Definitely worth a trip if you're looking for good AYCE sushi.

There isn't anything special about this all you can eat sushi joint compared to the other but I'll highlight some details.   They have happy hour Monday-Friday from 3:30-5:30 pm which is 20% off. Lunch is 22$ and dinner is 27$. The main detail I noticed on the menu that differs between the two is that dinner include one order of uni and other dishes... also all you can eat does not include sashimi too. Similarly to other ayce sushi place you can not share but it seems they allow some people in the same parties to not participate in the ayce options.  The staff is friendly and we came as a group so our order was completed slowly... it seems during the lunch time they only have two sushi chefs which cause the slowness but other sushi places seem that way too.   Wasn't too busy with us as a table and two other table being used. The environment is clean and the bathroom is well maintained.

This place was great.  Great food.  Great Staff.  The thing that impressed me most was how they treated my family.  I went with a friend and their kids so we had a lot of kids, some very small.  They treated them extremely well, explained the parts of sushi ordering culture we weren't familiar with, and were super attentive and patient.  This is how a restaurant should be.
Oyshi is the spot! Good ambiance and great service. Stefan was friendly and informative, & made it more fun. The energy here is great. Definitely a must try!

Absolutely one of our favorite spots in town. So glad that they opened another location. Seems to be far more spacious than the Rainbow location. We went last night (Saturday) for dinner and there was no wait. You know how rare this is if you've ever been to the original.  Food was awesome as usual. Tastes so fresh. Every time I take someone new I love when it hits them that "ohhh.... so THIS is what good sushi tastes like!" Took full advantage of the AYCE offer. From the spicy heart attack, to the savory dynamite... it's all good.   Get there soon... before it becomes as popular as the first locations and you find yourself waiting an hour plus to be seated.

I brought a friend of mine to this, my favorite sushi restaurant, and I could not have asked for a better experience. Although we had to wait 30+ min to be seated, everything was great once we got to our table. Here is a recap:  Service: Awesome! Our waitress was friendly and checked back with us often. Our food arrived quickly at our table (even faster than the times when they were less busy and I sat at the bar), and we were made to feel comfortable by the staff.  Food: Better than ever. All of our rolls were presented with delicacy and tasted great. Even though the place was packed, I felt like the chefs really took the time to prepare the best rolls for us, and yet did not take forever to make our orders.  Quick tip: Do yourself a favor and try the heart attack and the amigo roll. They are out of this world!

This place is right down the street from my house so I have been here several times. I usually sit at the bar as it is quiet and I enjoy watching them make the rolls. The wait staff is friendly and quite quick, however I notice that when it gets busy some orders are forgotten about, needing to re-submit them. But alas, the food is very good, and being so close, I will definitely come back many more times.

Sushi was delicious and they had a ton of variety on the menu. AYCE is always the best route to go because it opens up the entire menu for you. Waitress was nice but we didn't see too much of her besides when she delivered our rolls. We had to ask for refills on our drinks because she want checking up on us. Food made up for the lack of customer service. Good stuff!

We made reservations for a party of 15 we didn't have to wait.  That part was great, as far as ordering and getting the food timely and accurately that is a different story.  I think it was because we had too many orders or something.  We had a group of people that loved to eat.  We order things that went to the table next to us they were a big party as well.  I heard our our screaming went to them because they didn't know what was ordered and they said okay we'll take it.  The food was okay not as good as I remember and I like another place that we go to better. . After to night experience it confirms that I wouldn't go there.   The following I found 1 star: Oysters (they taste really bad not fresh' and needed lemon) Adegashi tofu (they give you one and it is now sweet or yummy.   The decent but small pieces: Fresh scallop Eel Fried scallops  the fried scallops was small size but tasted yummy.  Why not isn't everything fried best?  The rib eye steak was ok but some of it was just too well done so it was tough.   The surf and turf is better with the rib eye and two shrimps. It comes in a sizzling platter,  Poke was like two little bites.  Photos of this was way generous then   The favs for the night: Garlic tuna Albacore Salmon belly Octopus Uni was low grade Sweet shrimp eh. We got a bunch of other rolls but really it is the atmosphere here that attract people imo. The nigiri sushi was the best.   The ice cream was out of mochi, the cream brûlée was in a small little ramekin.  They only allow one dessert order why is that so small?  The parfait on the other hand is like a shake glass and large.

The food started yummy and plentiful the server Ryan was good.  We ordered the rib eye steak the first was plentiful then the second was less and the third round was more like where's the beef.  The Nigiri sushi was yummy.  See my photos.  The shrimp tempuras was hot I liked the red dragon.   Our food didn't come timely everyone was done with their dessert while I still waited for the Crete brûlée.  Our server came to give us the check and I had to tell him we did not get the Crete brûlée.

Discovered a few more favorites: -NYI roll -banzai roll -uni nigiri (be warned, some of the pieces were darker so I'm guessing they have a mixture between premium and select ca grades)  I guess I'll update this place with 5 stars because it seems to already have secured its spot in our vegas regimen. We even sit at the same table every time too (the big semiprivate one that's behind noren on the right side of the restaurant with the cool mural). As always, we ate til our hearts content. Food comes out reasonably timed and prompt for the most part and service is never lacking.

I went here for lunch for the first time 5/5/16.... I will be going back ASAP. Because my time was short I just had Tempura Udon soup... it was fabulous and large enough that I took left overs. The lunch menu has a ton of items, the prices are good. The decor is wonderful, the server was nice and I got back to work on time. I will be back

Okay, went there for lunch with few of my co-workers, we flew in from los angeles for the all you can eat sushi work for the airlines so this is easy.  The sushi was a hit and miss, some of the rolls were good and some were not. The nigiri sushi was also a hit and miss.  Most of the fish seemed fresh, some seemed like it just came from the freezer and thawed.    The selection was great you had  a lot of choices in terms of rolls and appetizers  1. when we got there the place was empty except a few couples, but why did the sushi take so long to get, no lie it took like 20 minutes for our first order which didnt make any sense to me.  2. the side orders (appetizers came out really quick. i really believe you can make a meal out of the sides alone. they were really good. like the Asian skirt steak.  3. would i go back and try again , ya i would give it one more try.

An extensive AYCE menu at a low price. Especially for this area. Lunch for two with a bottle of sake came to a little over $60 before tip.   Oyshi is one of the only places that uses lobster in their dishes. I wish it was a little more distinguishable though. Mixed in with the diced crab stick, it is difficult to taste the natural sweetness of the lobster. I am not a huge mayo fan either, but did not dislike any of the dishes because of it. The fact that it was not mixed with half a jar made it bearable.  The rice is the most important part of the sushi. Even though we were there early, the rice was cooked off early enough to let it properly cool. There is nothing worse than warm fish and rice that falls apart when picked up.   The nigiri list is smaller than some of the other sushi joints, but the items we got were all fresh.
Don't come here if you are starving. Get here during lunch time to eat for dinner. The service is so slow. We've been waiting over 50 mins for 4 rolls.

This is my all time favorite all you can eat sushi place in Las Vegas. I've been coming here since right after I moved here when they were pretty new, in early 2008. I am pretty much obsessed with some of their rolls, my favorites are Full Moon, Lava Flow, Nyi, Red Rock, and Treasure, but I honestly haven't tried anything I don't like. The nigiri it's always delicious, and I also definitely recommend the Vanilla Berry Parfait for dessert. I am disappointed that they stopped carrying "white tuna" aka Escolar, but that seems to be city-wide. The private rooms are great for larger groups, I'd suggest making a reservation ahead of time for those. They have plenty of beer, wine, and sake, and the best part is that Oyshi is open until 3am! Best AYCE sushi in Vegas!

Oyshi is one of my favorite ayce restaurant. The food there is very good.  I used to be a very loyal customer even though the service, which is very slow. The first round comes pretty much fast but if you reorder, it comes very very slow , so slow that you want to leave the place. I still wanted to give them 4 stars because it is very cheap with a very good food quality. If the service were better, they would deserve 5 stars.

Oyshi is our go-to spot for AYCE sushi.  Everyone that works here is super cool and most nights the service is quick, unless they're slammed.  The variety of rolls is good  and they are generous with their sauces, which makes it for me.  They don't offer sashimi on the AYCE menu, but not many places do.  All of their hot dishes are yummy too!  They have specials that are written on the dry erase board on the wall behind the sushi bar.  We like to start with the Salmon Lover's Roll and I like to end on the sweet & cheesy Japanese Lasagna.  It's so close to my house I could walk there, but there's no way that I would be able to walk home!

Their service kinda sucks, but the food is excellent.  I always do the AYCE and usually got for the Bonsai Roll, ahi poke, gyoza, miso soup, grilled beef asparagus and some sushi (garlic tuna, cajun albacore)  YUM!!

Being a Vegas local, I hear the buzz about Oyshi ALOT. It's been a successful sushi business for a few years now. My first visit was a couple of years ago but it wasn't that memorable to me, but two Thursdays ago, it was VERY  memorable.  But not in a good way.  I understand that a restaurant doesn't really decide when it's busy or not. But when I went two weeks ago on a Thursday for dinner, I really didn't expect the amount of neglect that my party of three received. We all ordered off of the AYCE menu and some dishes from the kitchen.   In the duration of 30 minutes, we got nothing from the kitchen except miso soup. When we asked our server, he just nonchalantly shrugged and said it was a busy night. Barely saw him after that and just felt like he was avoiding our table.   When we did get our nigiri and rolls, I really did wish it could've been SO MUCH BETTER to redeem the time that we wasted. There was so much rice in our sushi that it might've been better to just serve a bowl of rice. I understand that you're not supposed to discard the rice but I'm not paying for the rice, I'm under the impression that I'm paying for the sushi.  That night, we ordered dessert but we didn't have energy to waste another 20 minutes. We just left.  I really wanted to like this place after my very first encounter years ago wasn't that impressive. But seems like this restaurant has proved that first impressions always last.

To all my fellow sushi lovers. Listen to the reviews that say the sushi is mediocre. Nice restaraunt nice staff but for the sushi I won't be back to this place. Hope you guys listen and don't do what I did and find out on your own.

Our first time tonight, and the reviews we read on Yelp did not disappoint. It was a very clean environment the temperature was nice and chill so you know the sushi was good. Me and my wife both like the fact that they had specialty cuts of fish such as konch shell fish, salmon belly, halibut fin, and even scallop raw. Our server was very helpful and guiding us through the menu and even helping us learn how to drink a sake bomb. We sat at the bar and cook was very helpful. Recommending cuts of fish that he thought we might enjoy. And even stearing us in the right direction for dessert. The price was only a few dollars more than where we used to go as regulars, but here we felt that we were treated nicer and also got fresher fish for our money. If you make a trek to this location, be sure to sit next to Pete at the bar. The guy knows his way around the sushi bar and is very entertaining with his blow torch when he is searing items. Definitely worth the extra dollars if you're going to spend the money on sushi anyways.  ***edit***  After multiple trips and somewheres in 100's of lbs of fish consumed we are still incredibly happy with this establishment.

Hands down, the food is amazing!   That's why we come here, but you have to come at odd hours because the servers suck whether you sit at the bar or in the restaurant.   If you come when they are busy, the service is a D at best.  They act like their head is in the clouds.    But for food, love the atomic bomb, love affair,  dynamite roll, etc.  I could keep going and love the all you can eat.  They just need help with how to be a good food server.

I love this place ! I am a Sushi fanatic, and quite picky about my Sushi, when my son and I went to Oyshi, we were quite impressed with the friendly staff, the fast service, and the fresh Sushi ! This place is 5 stars to me and I will continue to recommend them to all my friends ! They are really busy so be prepared to wait a bit, but well worth it ! Kellyann

01.07.12  Preface: This review had been shortened & edited from an 8-page thesis which I will someday publish as "Can Fresh Sushi be Found in the Middle of the Desert?"  POSITIVE:  * My 18 y.o. niece (Las Vegas native) recommended this sushi restaurant. "Uncle, this place is the BOMB!" * Off the L.V. Strip  NEGATIVE: * Host not attentive to the waiting guests (first time I've ever seen a restaurant host partake in drinking with guests during a work shift). * Waitress/Server never there when we needed her - asking if we needed anything every 90 seconds the last 15 minutes of our stay. * Food seemed like it sat too long before reaching the table.  * Beer not chilled enough. (maybe it sat out too long before being served as well). * Water glasses were never serviced nor were we asked if we wanted anything else to drink. * The time waiting to be seated succeeded the time spent eating at the table * Overpriced less than average fare for an over-rated joint.  Will I return? Sure...if I sit at the sushi bar & someone else pays.  Truth! deez® out.

Loved this place!!! I ventured here, because it is quite a distance from my abode. I was not disappointed in the least and plan on making the trek regularly in the future. The combination of rolls and appetizers on their AYCE menu is vast. They have the cooked rolls with mayo and crab and crunch that my sister loves and they also have the poke and Cajun albacore that I adore. Service was impeccable and the lunch price at $21 is totally worth it. My nephew ate for $14 AYCE. This is definitely one of my fave AYCE places in town!

I was happy this location opened, it's so much closer than driving all the way to rainbow and 215. Sushi chef Daniel is amazing with his creations. The friendliness of all the staff is quite remarkable. The fish is always fresh and they're quick to make recommendations. The spacious room is huge and gets filled quickly on a weekend night but it's worth the wait.

I've been coming here for years for the all you can eat and I think it's one of the best... I like that you can order half rolls at the bar so you can try more rolls . They always have good music and a great ambiance!

This is my 3rd visit to Oishi Sushi here in Vegas over last 5 years or so. One of the high-fluting sushi places in 5 star hotels I have stayed come close to the friendly service (EJ is an excellent server!) and variety of excellent dishes! I will return here for sure in my future trips to Vegas!
Food was good except for the EGG roll it had a funky taste. But our server EJ gave as excellent service we are happy customers .
Mikey our server for tonight has been really pleasant and on top our orders good food + good customer service = A 5 Star review.

Love this place! Great sushi and nice environment. I used to go to the Oyshi on south rainbow and they are awesome too. This location is closer to me. Sit at the sushi bar and you get to order half rolls!!

3.5 stars for this joint. I go here frequently. Every time I open the menu I search for a new roll to try and I end up confused and indifferent to my selection. I'm not a huge fan of cream cheese or eel in my rolls. Oddly, these two items (but mainly the cream cheese) makes it hard for me to find one that sound appealing without modification. It's a large menu but I can never seem to find a roll that sounds 'amazing' as written.   They offer all you can eat which is great for big eaters. We typically order a couple rolls, some baked mussels, a few hot sakes, and mochi. Each time the server has comped off one or more of the smaller items because we were paying the regular prices so it always comes out to about the same cost as if we had done all you can eat.  Service can be spotty but if you're not in a rush it's a nice spot to grub on some sushi basics.
Good location but Low quality of sushi and terrible service! The service here is super slow! and server forgot your order such a terrible experience.

Oyshi is the hands down BEST sushi in Vegas! Both Rainbow and Sahara locations are fab. All-You-Can-Eat includes all sushi, rolls, appetizers and even a dessert :) Super cool atmosphere always with good/electronic music, sweet waitresses, bad ass sushi chefs and the sushi is oh so delicious. Tell the sushi chef what you like and have him whip you up something special :)
My favorite sushi in Vegas! Here with Sidney Eileen
They take too long to bring out food for AYCE and the rice seems like its old. They didn't take our order for a long time. I didn't get my last order. Dessert took forever to come out also.

Will not return. All you can eat at its WORST!! stay away. they have no idea about cleaning in this place. Check out they're recent health inspections no wonder we got sick!!! http://www.southernnevadahealthdistrict.org/restaurants/inspections.php

So my friend took me to this place after a tiring day back from Grand Canyon.  Service: from the moment we walked in, we were greeted by great customer service. Throughout our experience here, they were attentive, service was fast and amazing.  Food: Wasn't "blown away" by the food but it was pretty decent. The quality and preparation was awesome and some exceeded expectations. For example, the oysters were very clean and served just right! (And this is coming from the guy who doesn't like raw oysters) The sea urchin sushi was superb too. I was too hesitant that it would be too raw and gooey but it was rich creamy like half boiled egg yolk. Try the surf and turf too because the meat wasn't a brush off. It was soft and juicy, for the price that was paid for it, it definitely stands out. All the sushi and the rolls, had great rice to ingredient ratios as well so you don't have to worry about getting too much rice and not enough seafood.  Overall I'd give this a 3.5-4 Star experience!

Had to give my two cents given all the overblown reviews this place has. Don't get me wrong the sushi was not bad - the albacore was tasty even though it was warm. Two of the rolls were ok, not delicious, but good. What this place needs to step up in is on service. Staff friendly but not as attentive as they could've been. I never received my Sapporo and was billed for it (I didn't pay for it).I imagine the trick is ordering the AYCE. The table next to us had it and received regular service, in fact, their water glasses were filled while ours were left empty. Place is not worth the lengthy drive from the strip.

Tried their AYCE. ($22 for lunch)  Pros: All sushi and appetizer were very delicious.  Service was great.  Loved their interior design.   Cons: Sunomono supposed be a vinaigrette salad, but, their sunomono was different... (shredded cucumber with creamy sesame sauce???) Hot tea wasn't free, but, you get a teapot.  Definitely be back.

the service egain one sushi chef for the whoole restaurant, extra slow service,in other words bad service, we never went back, n not to organise, the sushi guy dress in adidas shirt n terrible hat, not drss properly to his job, thanks

Omfg!   Everything from the wasabi to the rolls was FANTASTIC.   The sizes are cut appropriately small so you can thoroughly enjoy an AYCE experience.   Definitely will come here again on date nite with my wife.

We had an 8:30 reservation. We were seated about 9. Our waiter was ridiculously rude. My husband isn't a sushi person and this annoyed the waiter to no end. Service was very slow. Sushi was just OK. I wouldn't eat here again free. We went with two young men. They could have eaten more but the service was so slow we gave up and left. Also, the music is way too loud for the inadequate sound system they have.

If I could give zero stars I would. Came here for dinner. When I checked in the lady told me it would be 20-30 minutes. After an hour and a half passed we finally are seated. It took 15 minutes to get a waitress over. We put our drinks and food in... 45 minutes later.. still had not received our food. We brought the matter up to the manager and he said if we didn't like it we knew where the door is. I am very disappointed. I will be calling the higher ups of the restaurant and will never be back. Thanks for nothing

My family went here last night...as we go pretty often at least 2-3 times a month.  Hunby and I were so sick after eating here last night.  We were told that the chefs were behind, we waited 20 min for a seat, not even half the seats were filled.  The food tasted off...but since you have to pay for what you don't eat, my husband ate his knowing it wasn't quite right.  My son and I don't eat sushi, but the only thing my husband and I had that my son did not have was rice.  We were both so sick upon arriving home.  My husband said the kamakazi (spelling??) and tuna tasted funny but he ate it anyway.  Not sure we would eat here again.

Delicious! Finally, a reasonably priced all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant that doesn't sacrifice quality. The portions on individual rolls might be smaller than you expect, so don't be shy about getting AYCE! Best in class.

Very good as far as ayce goes. They really have some quality rolls. I think I've had some better starters/appetizers at other ayce sushi spots but as far as rolls they are solid. My only drawback is the last few times I have been in this restaurant there have been lots of flies buzzing around for some reason. The food still tastes good but flies ruined our last few experiences landing on our table and even our sushi. We haven't been back since.

Always hard for me to comment on how the quality of AYCE sushi is to another, considering this would only be my second one. I've never been a fan of raw anything, so I usually stay away from places where sushi is the main dish.  I'm trying though!   I've graduated and have been eating sushi (cooked of course) here and there.   Back to my review! Wait time on a Saturday was little to none, which was absolutely amaze balls. A group of 6 of us came to eat, and we're immediately seated. Our server Game, was so sweet. He was quick to respond and had are orders coming out. He was apologetic at the end when some desserts were not available.  Great time, good corner table and constant refills on point.   We ordered: Rock and roll  Veggie tempura  Quail egg Caterpillar roll  Coco Monster  Ahi poke Dynamite roll  App dynamite  Calamari  Red dragon  Hawaiian  Crazy Cali  Tiger roll Green tea = wtf Parfait  Choco creme brule

Consistently good food and consistently bad service.. what can I say I am torn.  They have a great menu of rolls, decent ayce prices, their ahi poke is on point, but on the other hand I have had too many bad service experiences from them to count.. For that I would say there is better in Vegas and its worth looking for.

Toronto's got sushi covered top to bottom. Meaning, we have some of the best you can get for your money, and also some of the worst. Oyshi Sushi sits right in the middle of that scale and thats just fine. A nicely furnished little unit with friendly staff that offers a pretty standard menu but all at a fair price. If you have a craving for sushi, there's plenty of places you can hit if your looking to withdraw your daily cash limit from the ATM to be fed. However, there's places like Oyshi that has prices on the cheaper side, but maintains pretty good quality. Usually sushi places I've been to that offer sushi at these prices have been regrettable decisions. Oyshi is middle of the pack and is absolutely worth a visit if you have a sushi craving and aren't looking to pay for your meal with your most recent paycheque. After a long walk on the harbourfont or a visit to center island, its a nice quiet place to decompress.   The tuna rice dome is particularity yummy.

Waste of $45. Was just flavorless and proper sauces were not given.  SMITHS market woulda been better, fresher and cold!  The fish was room temp and then on my one fried roll the outside was so gummy.  I just followed my gut intuition and go to the SMITHS market next time!  :(
Decent all ypu can eat sushi place. Close to my house so you cant beat that I can almost walk it.

Extensive menu, fast service, and delicious food. This place is an absolutely amazing choice for good sushi. The Oyshi on Rainbow was always my go to before, but I am so glad that they opened up a second location that is more convenient for me. The garlic albacore is a must.

I've been to this sushi place 3 times.. My first two experiences here were alright.. The all you can eat is at a reasonable price and the rolls were ok. But the third time I came in was this last week.. I was very disappointed.. First it took them forever to seat us and there wasn't a lot of people.. There was no one in line and they only had a few people in the restaurant. Then all around our service was bad. Our waitress took a long time to take our orders and once we were done with a dish multiple waiters and bussers would walk by and they still wouldn't take away our dirty plates.. Eventually the dishes just piled up. Even when they brought new rolls out they wouldn't take our plates away.. Then to top off a bad experience the sushi was subpar if that. We could tell the fish was previously frozen so it took away the flavor of the fish. I was very disappointed.. The whole experience was bad.

(4.5 stars)  My trip to Vegas would not be complete without a visit to Oyshi Sushi. Though it's off strip, I'm lucky my best friend lives close enough so we can make a trip every time I'm there.   My last visit was the first time I've done their All You Can Eat deal, and for $26, it was WELL WORTH IT! The only things it DOESN'T include are the Chef's Special Sashimi, so all your appetizers, salads, specialty rolls and desserts are included. My friends and I went all out and ordered several to share of every course. Oysters were delicious and baked mussels (while too much mayo sauce) was to die for. Tempura dishes are nice and crispy and not too soggy or heavy. My favorite salad is their ahi poke on top of seaweed salad - YUM! We shared 6 specialty rolls that were all delicious in their own ways. Again their specialty "yum yum" sauce is "yum yum", but in small amounts. The mochi ice cream is like the type you buy at the store, but again, it's all part of the deal so might as well indulge! We also got a bottle of lychee flavored cold sake that was decently priced and balanced the sweet:alcohol ratio perfectly.  Service is good: unless its super busy, the wait staff always comes up to check on your group, make sure your water is filled, etc. As with any sushi place, baked rolls will take longer, so be patient! They did forget one of our orders at one point, but since we were eating so much, it gave us time to digest.  If you can make the trip out with a group who enjoys sharing specialty rolls and can throw down in eating, Oyshi is the place to go!

Never written a review before but this was just ridiculous.. Had been to this location multiple times and always had pretty good service. On a Wednesday night we did AYCE we were here for over 2 1/2 hours because of absolutely awful service(I actually took a 15-20min nap at the table and still nothing had changed)! Multiple times we waited over an hour for food, the times we got food it was the food runner throwing random stuff we didn't want or order and she would ignore us and run off before we could say anything. Table was never cleared until almost 2 hours in. Had to get up at times and get someone to help us so we could get refills on water or put in an order for more food we would have to wait forever for. Then after all this the manager didn't even care! Just said sorry very unapologetically and had to almost argue to get a discount on the meal that we most definitely deserved. Very disappointing. I had always liked this place and now I don't know if I will ever eat here again because of this experience which sucks because the food is always good :/

Agree with several who have commented already, the service was horrible at best. The waitress barely looked at us when she spoke, kept calling my wife and I "you guys" and did not listen to our answers when she asked a question. Also no half rolls disappointing. No comparison to Yama Sushi or a couple of other places that we often frequent. Would not recommend the all you can eat as with opinion is not a good value at this restaurant. Perhaps if sitting at the Sushi bar the service would be better.  Might add; have had the pleasure of enjoying Sushi around the world, not just various locations in the US and VEGAS in particular. Doesn't make me an expert by any means, but perhaps a little more adept on determining what I expect. Whether it be Japan, Korea, Europe, Guam, Hawaii, Taiwan, or here in the US, service is service and quality is the same expectation regardless. If a restaurant wants to be great, they have to be consistent.

So yesterday for a late lunch/early dinner my friends wanted to try a new sushi place. He was going to drive so I said sure wherever you want to go. He and our other friend heard good things about this place. We arrive and it turns out our other friend has been here once but forgot (haha hope this isn't bad news).   Turns out it was really good. I like the decor of the place and the music playing makes it feel kind of clubby haah. Our waitress was nice to let us switch from the table to the bar so we could get our orders in faster. We all stuffed our faces full of sushi. Large selection of sushi to choose from so you should find something you like. Since the day I had some cream cheese in sushi I am a fan so when I saw it on the menu I had to try everyone that had cream cheese haha. For dessert which I gave to my friend I had the strawberry mochi. He had the green tea ice cream.  I give it 3 stars. I love the sushi and the guys were friendly making the sushi and the waitress was friendly too. It's far for me but if in the area it is the place I would stop at.

We were seated right away. Waiter was friendly and always kept our drinks filled. The food also kept coming out pretty quick. It was also very good too. Definitely one of our favorite sushi spots. And surf & turf on the all you can eat menu too?!

A few other people have already complained about the service  Not sure our server's name, maybe it was also Kevin, maybe not.  Considering every place we went in Vegas was wonderful and the service incredibly good, it was quite a contrast that the service at Oyshi was so poor.  I didn't like the server because his language and behavior was like high school kid.  I understand a $50 meal for two isn't luxury, but it isn't cheap.  Also we tried to wave at him 3-4 times and he wouldn't acknowledge we were there.  It takes the fun out of going to a buffet.  I wonder if management does this on purpose so people don't eat too much.  We eventually changed servers, but I felt like they didn't care that much.  In my whole life, I've never felt angry at a restaurant.  Honestly, I get more polite and better service at McDonald's.  At times the server was just talking to his friends, the cook about girls.  We felt uncomfortable at this place and just left after a few dishes.  It was a waste of money and no one likes to do that.  Food is fine for this kind of thing so no complaints there.  But it's important for customer to feel comfortable at a restaurant.  Do not go here.  Literally every other worker and server and person in Vegas we met was awesome, had a wonderful time.  But this restaurant was a bad experience.
Excellent quick Service to my party of 15, everything was great from food to customer service, Thanks to my Server Mono!
Eveytime I go here it is excellent. I never had anything bad here. Got to go early cause this place gets packed.

Been going here many, many years since it opened. Still one of the best AYCE places in SW Las Vegas. Clean establish, fast & friendly service. Good quality. I just wished they didn't give so much rice with their sushi pieces.
